Amid the applause, Li Xuelian smiled faintly and continued, "In this moment filled with creativity and inspiration, we gather together..."

Listening to Li Xuelian's speech, Zhang Yu let out a bored yawn, wondering if he should just take this time to do his breathing exercises.

Suddenly, a thought flickered in his mind. He had been getting more and more diligent in his cultivation lately, and he wasn't sure if it was the power of the ritual forcing a new habit or the subtle influence of this world and its society.

Fortunately, Li Xuelian’s speech was not long. Just as Zhang Yu was pondering, she had already moved on to the topic that most interested the many talented young cultivators present.

"For the past few years, my father has been seeking a disciple to inherit his legacy and pass on his lifetime of martial arts and Daoist techniques."

"Unfortunately, his standards are quite high, and despite searching for many years, he has yet to find a disciple who truly meets his requirements."

"Thus, he personally painted this Celestial Paragon’s Martial Demonstration Scroll and concealed a set of martial arts within it."

"If any young hero under the age of twenty can master the martial art within, my father is willing to take them as his disciple and spare no effort in cultivating them until they can enter a top university."

"However, this painting contains a trace of the martial will left by my father. Viewing it will subject you to the impact of this will, and there is a danger of damaging your Dao heart."

"During the comprehension process that follows, please act within your limits to avoid being injured by the martial will within..."

Following her introduction, Li Xuelian slowly drew back the curtain, revealing the Celestial Paragon’s Martial Demonstration Scroll behind it.

Within a frame more than two meters tall, a blurry human figure slowly emerged.

_This is a painting by a Golden Core expert?_

Zhang Yu stared at the scroll, feeling it looked like a simple human shape scribbled carelessly, no better than something a primary school student might draw.

Just as Zhang Yu was thinking this, someone shouted, "A masterpiece!"

"This painting is so vibrant and full of life, the brushwork is exquisite! True Monarch Xinghuo's artistry is truly at its peak, putting our generation to shame."

Someone else quickly chimed in with flattery, "It’s too beautiful! The painting appears simple, yet it hides a profound artistic conception. The more you look, the more endlessly fascinating it becomes."

As more and more people began to praise the Celestial Paragon’s Martial Demonstration Scroll, Li Xuelian couldn't help but cough, interrupting everyone.

Then she explained, "Everyone, to prevent this painting from unintentionally harming anyone, my father placed an additional subtlety upon it. Only when you are within five meters can you see its true content, but you will also be affected by the martial will within."

"Any young heroes who wish to comprehend it, please step forward to view the painting."

Hearing Li Xuelian's words, the few who had just been boasting immediately flushed red and fell awkwardly silent.

However, someone had already taken the lead and walked toward the Celestial Paragon’s Martial Demonstration Scroll. It was Lian Tianji from Purple Cloud High School, who had just been speaking with the 'funerary urn.'

"Haha, allow me, Lian Tianji, to see just what's so profound about this Celestial Paragon’s Martial Demonstration Scroll."

Laughing, Lian Tianji strode briskly toward the scroll.

Qian Shen’s eyes flickered as he watched this scene.

_That's Lian Tianji from Purple Cloud High School, a formidable person who scored 670 on last month's exam. He is one of the opponents I plan to challenge after I defeat Bai Zhenzhen._

As Lian Tianji walked step by step toward the Celestial Paragon’s Martial Demonstration Scroll, the figure in the painting grew increasingly clear in his eyes, seemingly revealing a middle-aged man slowly demonstrating a profound set of martial arts.

Lian Tianji's mind was gradually drawn in, until finally, he saw the man in the painting throw a sudden punch at him from across the void.

Thump!

A muffled sound seemed to echo in the air.

Lian Tianji stopped abruptly in his tracks, his eyes wide with fury as he stared fixedly at the Celestial Paragon’s Martial Demonstration Scroll.

Seeing him standing there, frozen and motionless, the crowd assumed Lian Tianji had become immersed in the scroll, comprehending the mysterious martial art within.

Not far away, however, Li Xuelian explained calmly, "In order to select a disciple with a resilient will and an extraordinary spirit... when comprehending the Celestial Paragon’s Martial Demonstration Scroll, the observer will come face to face with the terror in their own heart."

"Only by steeling one's spirit and conquering inner weakness can one comprehend the mysteries within the painting."

Hearing this, the crowd was once again astonished, looking curiously at the motionless Lian Tianji, wondering what exactly he was seeing.

At this very moment, in Lian Tianji's eyes, the world had changed. He had unknowingly returned to his classroom, as if the art exhibition, Li Xuelian, and the Celestial Paragon’s Martial Demonstration Scroll... were all forgotten.

And the class advisor was at the podium, announcing the results of the last monthly exam.

But starting from first place, he never heard his own name.

He wasn't in the top 10...

He wasn't in the top 20...

Still not in the top 50...

As the announced scores grew lower and lower, Lian Tianji's heart grew tighter with anxiety...

At the exhibition, looking at Lian Tianji still comprehending the scroll, Li Xuelian said, "The Celestial Paragon’s Martial Demonstration Scroll can be comprehended by multiple people at once. Are there any other young heroes interested? Please come before the painting."

Qian Shen exchanged a glance with a few classmates around him, and they all walked toward the scroll together.

At the same time, other youths who had come to comprehend the Celestial Paragon’s Martial Demonstration Scroll went forward one after another.

Zhang Yu looked at Zhou Tianyi beside him and asked curiously, "You're not going to give it a try?"

Zhou Tianyi chuckled and shrugged, "I'm just here to watch the show. I'd rather not go up there and embarrass myself."

Zhang Yu then turned to Bai Zhenzhen and asked, "What about you? You're not going either?"

Bai Zhenzhen glanced toward the Celestial Paragon’s Martial Demonstration Scroll and said flatly, "I'm still hesitating."

Zhang Yu asked curiously, "Hesitating about what?"

Bai Zhenzhen replied, "I don't want to find myself a master."

_Becoming a disciple will definitely involve signing a contract with that True Monarch Xinghuo,_ she thought inwardly, _some kind of indenture._

Bai Zhenzhen sighed internally, _Forget everything else... just choosing which university and what major would probably be under his control. I'd also rack up a mountain of debt, and who knows how they calculate the interest..._

Hearing Bai Zhenzhen's hesitation, Zhang Yu immediately said, "Then just don't master this martial art, and you won't have to become True Monarch Xinghuo's disciple."

Zhang Yu looked toward the scroll with a slight smile and said, "A martial art left behind by a Golden Core True Monarch, even one for the Qi Refinement stage, would cost us at least tens of thousands to buy the usage rights for, right? Why pass up a chance to learn a martial art for free?"

"If you don't want to be True Monarch Xinghuo's disciple, then at worst, just don't master the art today."

Nearby, Zhao Tianxing heard this and secretly curled his lip, thinking that Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen were each more arrogant than the last. At the same time, he took a few steps away, afraid that someone might look over and mistake him for the same kind of arrogant, ignorant fool.

Bai Zhenzhen looked at Zhang Yu speechlessly.

_To have pushed Yu-boy into this kind of mental state... just how vicious are the collectors from those small loan platforms?_

Zhou Tianyi smiled, "That makes sense. It doesn't cost anything to try and comprehend it anyway. Why don't we all give it a shot together?"

Zhao Tianxing, however, refused Zhang Yu and Zhou Tianyi's suggestion. Just the thought of himself in a security guard or waiter's uniform, comprehending the Celestial Paragon’s Martial Demonstration Scroll under the watchful eyes of the crowd, was too humiliating.

But watching Zhang Yu's back as he walked forward, he suddenly felt a sliver of admiration for the other's thick skin.

Just then, the walkie-talkie on Zhao Tianxing's waist crackled to life.

The security captain yelled, "What are you guys doing? You're security! Who told him he could abandon his post to comprehend the scroll? Get him back here, now!"

Sweating under the verbal assault, Zhao Tianxing hurriedly shouted as he ran forward, trying to pull Zhang Yu back.

But as Zhao Tianxing drew closer to the Celestial Paragon’s Martial Demonstration Scroll, the figure within it grew clearer, and waves of laughter drifted from all around.

Zhao Tianxing turned his head to see that everyone at the exhibition was looking at him, pointing and commenting, mocking him for overreaching, a mere security guard daring to comprehend the scroll.

Amid the countless jeers, Zhao Tianxing slowly came to a halt, frozen in embarrassment. He touched his head, then scratched his ear, utterly at a loss for how to even stand.

Meanwhile, as Zhang Yu's group of three approached the Celestial Paragon’s Martial Demonstration Scroll, the blurry figure within gradually sharpened, transforming into a middle-aged man with a resolute face, who finally threw a punch at them from across the void.

Bai Zhenzhen's vision went dark, and her phone began to vibrate manically.

She picked it up and saw it was a collections message from a loan platform.

"Regarding your overdue 'Owe-It' loan, due to multiple failed collection attempts, the situation is severe. Please settle your payment within three days of receiving this message. If you remain overdue, we will proceed according to relevant laws..."

"Continued delinquency will result in a background check on your location..."

"Deadbeat, you've lost all face over this little bit of money. How about your whole family helps you by collecting bottles..."

More and more collection messages appeared, their content growing increasingly unrestrained, shifting from simple reminders to all-encompassing insults, curses, and threats...

Staring at the endless stream of messages on her phone, Bai Zhenzhen broke out in a cold sweat, her entire body tensed, until her phone's ringtone also began to sound.

But as she watched the phone ring incessantly, Bai Zhenzhen didn't dare to answer.

Yet even though she did nothing, the phone answered itself.

To her horror, a cold male voice emanated from the phone.

"Due to credit fraud and failure to pay, you have committed a serious breach of contract. We have locked onto your position via the Heavenly Net system. If the debt is not settled within three days, a lightning tribulation will descend..."

A low rumble of thunder sounded.

Bai Zhenzhen shot her head up and saw the faint flicker of lightning in the sky above.

(End of chapter)

# Chapter 19: Terror and the Dao Heart

"645… 644… 639…"

The figures of his classmates appeared one by one before Qian Shen. He couldn't make out their forms, but he could clearly see the scores displayed above their heads.

"680, 690, 660…"

The score displayed above each person's head was so impossibly high, so brilliant, that it made Qian Shen feel utterly inadequate.

He felt so pathetic standing before his classmates, as insignificant as a common thug.

"Standing among these people, I'm no better than a bag of wet trash."

"With a paltry score of just over 600, I don't deserve to be here, let alone speak to them or even get near them…"

In his eyes, the scores above his classmates’ heads climbed ceaselessly as their figures stretched upward, transforming them into giants towering among the clouds. Soon, he could only see their legs, unable to even make out their faces.

…

Meanwhile, on the other side of the art exhibition, Li Xingyu of Mount Mang High School's drone carved an arc through the air, then slowly flew toward the Celestial Paragon’s Martial Demonstration Scroll.

But in the next instant, with a sharp crackle, the drone seemed to malfunction, spiraling erratically to the ground.

"The soul cultivator students from Mount Mang High School are already bound by contracts, so they shouldn't bother joining the fray."

Li Xuelian murmured softly, then withdrew her gaze from the drone and turned her attention back to the other students.

"It's a shame that nearly all the students trying their luck at this exhibition are first-years. To master the martial arts on the Celestial Paragon’s Martial Demonstration Scroll, second and third-year students would have a much better chance."

"But it’s understandable… The top students from the second and third years either don't meet the age requirement or are already under contract, so they wouldn't be looking for a new master."

Just then, shimmering with golden light, the Songyang City Director of the Immortal Resonance Group approached Li Xuelian's side and said with a smile.

"This Celestial Paragon’s Martial Demonstration Scroll is truly worthy of being personally painted by True Monarch Xinghuo. It is exceptionally profound, but I wonder what exactly it is intended to test?"

Li Xuelian did not answer his question directly, stating instead, "The first trial of the Celestial Paragon’s Martial Demonstration Scroll tests the Dao heart."

"Those who cannot withstand it are often forcibly repelled, and may even be left with a flaw in their Dao heart."

…

Feeling the scornful and mocking gazes of countless people around him, Zhao Tianxing couldn't help but retreat again and again, moving away from the effective range of the Celestial Paragon’s Martial Demonstration Scroll.

When he came to his senses and took in his surroundings, he realized that the feeling of the 'entire crowd watching' and the 'scornful glares' were merely effects of the Celestial Paragon’s Martial Demonstration Scroll.

At this thought, realizing he had utterly failed the scroll's test, his face flushed crimson and he hurried away, afraid that someone might notice him, a security guard, making a fool of himself.

…

At the exhibition, Li Xuelian continued, "Passing this first trial naturally has the effect of tempering one's Dao heart."

"As for the Dao heart level, the vast majority of us cultivators rely on cultivation techniques to raise it."

"And different cultivation techniques require different mindsets to be compatible."

"Take the ancient god-worshipping techniques, for instance; the practitioner must be incomparably devout and possess absolute faith in the deity. The more fervent their belief, the more effective the technique."

"Or consider Purple Cloud High School's Heavenly Diligence Art, which requires a practitioner to engage in ascetic training to the extreme, integrating that hardship into their very instincts to achieve maximum efficacy."

"Take also the introductory Basic Heart Tempering Art for high schoolers, which seeks a calm and focused spirit. It requires a mindset of silent perseverance, like water dripping through stone, to be effective."

"There are countless cultivation techniques to elevate the Dao heart, some profound and some basic, but the key is whether the practitioner possesses a mindset compatible with the technique."

"But thoughts are difficult to fathom. How a person truly thinks, whether they are genuinely in sync with their cultivation technique—forget outsiders, sometimes even they themselves cannot say for certain."

"Fortunately, the stronger the Dao heart, the stronger one's willpower. Thus, measuring the strength of one's willpower to determine their Dao heart level and test the efficacy of their cultivation technique has become the simplest method."

"But the Celestial Paragon’s Martial Demonstration Scroll does not simply test the strength of one's willpower to ascertain the strength of their Dao heart."

"The scroll targets the terror within one's heart, striking directly at the soul's weaknesses and giving no opportunity to resist with cultivation techniques; it tests their most primal reaction."

"When faced with a weakness of the soul, one can only pass by promptly adjusting their mindset to overcome that inner flaw."

The Immortal Resonance Group Director's eyes lit up.

"I understand," he said. "Senior Xinghuo wants a disciple with a flexible mind? Someone who, while practicing a god-worshipping art, could switch which god they worship, and while practicing the Heavenly Diligence Art, could be just as competitive in their asceticism as they are in 'lying flat'?"

Li Xuelian nodded. "There are countless cultivation techniques, and it is good for one's mindset to be compatible with them. But only those who can constantly adjust their thinking to adapt to changing environments and different techniques—unbound by any single art—are true geniuses."

"This is especially true as the world develops at an ever-increasing pace. The Ten Great Sects influence every facet of society, and the whole of Kunxu is undergoing drastic changes. It is unacceptable for one’s mindset to fail to adapt in time."

"For example, in this day and age, exams and scores are indispensable for anyone who wishes to walk the path of cultivation. They have long been integrated into the life of every practitioner."

"Consequently, an obsession with exams and scores has naturally become a part of the modern cultivator's mindset."

"Having excellent scores and a fixation on them can strengthen a top student's will, which in turn makes it easier to raise their Dao heart level."

"But this, in turn, is also a weakness of the spirit. There is always someone better, a higher mountain to climb; a momentary lead does not guarantee you will lead forever. Many top students are as confident when their ranking is high as they are insecure when it falls."

"To overcome this spiritual weakness, a practitioner must be able to promptly and flexibly adapt their thinking; this is the key to passing the trial."

"For instance, a previous student in the scroll's trial repeatedly experienced receiving low exam scores until he finally overcame his fear of them, honing a kind of wishful-thinking mindset."

…

Lian Tianji listened as the teacher on the platform announced the results, then suddenly burst out laughing.

"Hahahaha, since I've already become the worst student in last place, I might as well start over from scratch."

"From this day forward, I am the most useless, the slacker with the absolute worst grades."

"But even as a slacker, I have the chance to surpass every single one of you and claim the top spot."

"I will become number one in our year!"

As he conquered the terror in his heart, he felt as if he had returned to the exhibition, the Celestial Paragon’s Martial Demonstration Scroll before him growing clearer.

…

Li Xuelian continued, "Kunxu has thirty-six levels above ground and eighteen below, each a world in itself. Whether mortal or immortal, everyone is divided into a strict hierarchy. This class system is ingrained in the very bones of every cultivator, influencing the depths of their thoughts."

"There was once a student who, within the scroll's trial, experienced endless oppression from countless others and ultimately developed a 'lying flat' mindset."

…

Qian Shen watched as the giants, their scores far surpassing his own, rose from the earth, growing taller and taller until their faces became impossible to discern.

Only the scores above the giants' heads continued to grow, emitting a dazzling radiance.

He tried to keep up with them, but it was utterly useless.

As the giants grew to ever more absurd heights and their scores climbed, his anxiety turned to fear, his fear to despair, and finally, despair faded into numbness.

He collapsed onto the ground, no longer looking at the giants' figures.

"Fine, then."

"I just won't chase them anymore."

"As long as I can cultivate, that's enough. Even if I can't compare to anyone else… as long as I can cultivate, that's all that matters."

As if waking from a long dream, Qian Shen, still lying on the ground, opened his eyes. He looked at the exhibition hall and the Martial Ascension Scroll before him, a glimmer of understanding in his gaze.

…

At the exhibition, the Songyang City Director of the Immortal Resonance Group listened to Li Xuelian's analysis and agreed. 

"Changes in mindset are inextricably linked to the influence of the times."

He ventured a guess, "Given that everyone in modern society relies on loans, I imagine that would also be reflected in the scroll's trial, wouldn't it?"

"Correct," Li Xuelian said with a nod. "There was once a student who, in the scroll's test, faced the terror of repaying her debts on the path to immortality. In the end, she developed a 'deadbeat' mindset."

…

Watching the debt-collecting heavenly lightning brewing in the sky, Bai Zhenzhen squatted down, her face a mask of terror.

"Wait! I'll pay it back!"

"I'll pay it back, alright!"

"Don't strike me!"

She quickly opened her phone to check her accounts, wanting to see just how much she owed and how much she could possibly repay.

"Eight hundred thousand?!"

Opening the first lending app, Bai Zhenzhen's heart sank.

The 1.2 million she owed on the second platform made cold sweat stream down her back.

Two million… five million… eight million…

As the total debt she calculated in her mind continued to swell, the hand holding her phone gradually fell limp at her side.

A full eight million in debt—for a high school student, such a staggering sum would either lead to a complete breakdown, or…

Bai Zhenzhen suddenly threw herself onto the ground, looked up at the lightning, and bellowed, "If you've got the guts, then strike me dead!"

"Strike me dead, and your eight million goes up in smoke."

Seeing that the lightning still hadn't fallen, Bai Zhenzhen continued, "Either you strike me dead, and the eight million vanishes into thin air."

"Or you can find me some work, and I'll pay you back once I've earned the money."

As the heavenly lightning gradually dissipated, the Celestial Paragon’s Martial Demonstration Scroll reappeared before Bai Zhenzhen's eyes.

As she watched the figure within it practice martial arts, Bai Zhenzhen felt a sense of enlightenment.

…

Back at the exhibition, Li Xuelian remarked with a sigh, "But whether it's wishful thinking, lying flat, or being a deadbeat, these are merely mental states used to counteract immense pressure. While they can temper one's will and Dao heart, their future ultimately depends on the path they walk in reality."

"After all, this is only the first trial of the Celestial Paragon’s Martial Demonstration Scroll—merely a threshold."

She recalled when she was in high school, and her father had also tested her Dao heart.

Back then, her greatest fear had been her own father. In the trial, she had been brutally oppressed by him until she finally rose up in resistance, establishing a mindset of 'explosive filial piety.' After waking, she fiercely 'looted the old boss's gold,' and her cultivation advanced by leaps and bounds.

Not long after, however, the pressures from all aspects of society, along with her father's every action, led her to once again feel admiration and respect for him.

The Songyang City Director of the Immortal Resonance Group, standing beside her, nodded slightly, knowing she was right; the effects of such a Dao heart trial were only temporary.

After all, a person's thoughts are constantly changing; how could the fleeting influence of a Dao heart trial withstand the long-lasting impact of the real world and society at large?

Li Xuelian continued, "After passing the first trial and overcoming the inner terror, the true comprehension begins."

"And after passing the comprehension trial, whether one can ultimately master the art is another matter entirely."

The Director nodded, understanding now that overcoming terror, comprehending the scroll, and mastering the martial art were the three stages to understanding the Celestial Paragon’s Martial Demonstration Scroll.

"Then among those present, how many do you think can succeed?"

Li Xuelian glanced over the many students present and shook her head. "I fear we will be lucky to find even one."

…

As the figure on the Celestial Paragon’s Martial Demonstration Scroll gradually came into focus, and as he watched it begin to perform a set of fist techniques, Zhang Yu suddenly felt a chill rise in his heart.

"Please abide by the ritual’s agreement. Strive to complete the wish. Do not deliberately slack off or delay. 10."

Zhang Yu paused, stunned. "Wait… aren't I striving to comprehend the Martial Ascension Scroll right now? Isn't that part of studying hard to get into a good university?"

But the chill could not communicate with him; it simply continued its countdown.

"Please abide by the ritual’s agreement. Strive to complete the wish. Do not deliberately slack off or delay. 9."

"Please abide by the ritual’s agreement. Strive to complete the wish. Do not deliberately slack off or delay. 8."

Left with no choice, Zhang Yu could only sit down and try a breathing exercise with spiritual energy to see if it would stop the countdown.

As he began the breathing exercise, the chill gradually faded, and the countdown stopped.

*This moron...*

Just as Zhang Yu was performing his breathing exercise while inwardly cursing the ritual's power, another surge of cold washed over him.

"Please abide by the ritual's terms. Strive to complete your wish. Do not deliberately slack off or delay. 10."

Hearing this new countdown, Zhang Yu was utterly shocked.

"Wait… I am trying to cultivate."

"Why is it counting down again?"

*What's wrong with this idiotic ritual?*

Zhang Yu stopped his breathing exercise to test his theory, only to find that the surging chill and the countdown didn't disappear. Instead, a new wave of cold and another countdown began.

Hearing two countdowns ringing out in his head, taking turns to count down, Zhang Yu finally understood what was happening.

"Two countdowns?"

*Is one of them fake?*

(End of Chapter)

# Chapter 20: Insight

Two identical chills, two identical countdowns. After several attempts, Zhang Yu discovered that the two streams of ritual power were compelling him in different directions.

One of them would stop its countdown the moment he performed his breathing exercises to absorb spiritual energy.

The other would stop its countdown only after he began to study the Celestial Paragon’s Martial Demonstration Scroll.

Zhang Yu instantly grew more certain of one thing: one of the two countdowns was a fabrication.

*It must be an effect of the Celestial Paragon’s Martial Demonstration Scroll.*

*Face the terror in my heart… so it's reproducing the pressure the ritual power exerts on me?*

*I never expected that the ritual power reproduced by the Celestial Paragon’s Martial Demonstration Scroll would contradict the real one affecting me.*

But of the two streams of ritual power, which one was fake?

*Is it the one that stops counting down when I perform my breathing exercises?*

*Or is it the one that stops when I study the Celestial Paragon’s Martial Demonstration Scroll?*

Zhang Yu was more inclined to believe it was the latter, yet he couldn't make the decision lightly.

The price for choosing wrong was death.

*Which one do I choose?*

Listening to the ever-shifting countdown in his mind, Zhang Yu’s thoughts were a tangled mess, and he remained unable to decide.

*If I can't choose, then I simply won't.*

His gaze hardened as he came to a resolution.

"I'll just treat both countdowns as real."

Zhang Yu immediately sat down cross-legged and began circulating the Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method, performing the breathing exercises to draw in the spiritual energy of the world around him.

As the countdown in his mind ticked away, from ten to five and then to three, Zhang Yu stood up once more, turned back toward the Celestial Paragon’s Martial Demonstration Scroll, and attempted to comprehend the martial art it contained.

In this way, driven by the pressure of two separate countdowns, Zhang Yu alternated between practicing the Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method and studying the Celestial Paragon’s Martial Demonstration Scroll, progressing in both pursuits.

At the same time, others at the art exhibition gradually began to notice Zhang Yu's odd behavior.

The Songyang City Director of the Immortal Resonance Group watched Zhang Yu with curiosity, remarking, "This young man is performing breathing exercises one moment and standing up to study martial arts the next. What on earth has he seen?"

Beside him, Li Xuelian also cast her gaze toward Zhang Yu and commented thoughtfully, "It almost looks as if someone is forcing him to perform those breathing exercises."

"Perhaps it stems from a fear of a certain teacher in his life."

Just then, they saw Zhang Yu change his movements again. He was no longer performing breathing exercises but had begun practicing the Thirty-Six Body-Strengthening Forms.

It turned out that Zhang Yu had come to a sudden realization: the countdown that paused when he did his breathing exercises might not have been compelling him to cultivate at its core, but rather forcing him down the conventional path of studying, training, preparing for university exams, and eventually, working for a living.

So, he decided to try practicing his martial arts while simultaneously observing the Celestial Paragon’s Martial Demonstration Scroll.

His Thirty-Six Body-Strengthening Forms had long since become muscle memory anyway. If he could practice them while studying the scroll, he could devote the majority of his attention to the latter.

After all, his primary goal at the moment was to comprehend the martial arts depicted on the Celestial Paragon’s Martial Demonstration Scroll.

After this attempt proved successful, he began to feel that practicing and studying at the same time was still a bit cumbersome, so he simply took out his phone and tried browsing his school textbooks while looking at the scroll.

When he found that looking at his textbooks also worked, he put the audio of the material on speaker, listening to the content while he continued to study the Celestial Paragon’s Martial Demonstration Scroll.

...

Watching Zhang Yu alternate between breathing exercises, martial practice, and academic study, Li Xuelian sighed with genuine feeling.

"This child must have an incredibly strict teacher, one who has pushed him relentlessly, to the point of becoming a figure of immense terror in his heart."

"Now, we shall see if he can achieve a mental breakthrough under all this pressure…"

But before Li Xuelian could finish her sentence, Zhang Yu suddenly walked away from the Celestial Paragon’s Martial Demonstration Scroll, went straight to the buffet table, and returned with a large plate of seafood, which he began to eat while continuing his study of the scroll.

It had occurred to him that eating was also something the ritual was unlikely to prevent.

Li Xuelian watched this unfold with a hint of surprise.

"Oh? Such a swift breakthrough. Under layers of oppression, he's adopted a mindset of rebellious indolence? Only then can one truly face the terror in their heart and continue to comprehend the martial arts within the scroll."

"Perhaps he himself hasn't even realized it, but he has unconsciously conquered his inner fear and passed this trial of the Martial Ascension Scroll; his actions are now completely natural."

Seeing a security guard about to step forward and stop Zhang Yu, Li Xuelian waved him away. She was now quite curious to see just how much Zhang Yu could comprehend from the scroll.

As he ate lobster and gazed at the Martial Ascension Scroll, Zhang Yu could now gradually make out the martial art the figure was performing.

*It looks like a set of fist techniques?*

The fist technique itself wasn't complex, and Zhang Yu had a rough idea of it after watching a few times, but when he checked his Feathered Tome, he saw that nothing had changed. He clearly hadn't truly learned the art, let alone mastered it.

Based on his experience with Basic High School Swordplay and the Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method, a martial art like this should have appeared as Level 0 on his Feathered Tome after a single viewing.

*What did I do wrong?*

Just then, Lian Tianji let out a great laugh, his face brimming with confidence as he declared, "I have fully comprehended the martial arts within. It is, as I thought, an exquisite palm technique."

Before his words had even faded, Qian Shen, who was standing nearby, spoke up.

"What palm technique? It's clearly a leg technique."

Ordinarily, Qian Shen, with his total score of 600, would never dare to speak so loudly in front of someone with a score of 670.

But having just had his Dao heart tempered by the Celestial Paragon’s Martial Demonstration Scroll, Qian Shen's courage was at its absolute peak.

Their exchange quickly drew disagreement from others.

Someone argued, "No, no, the art hidden in the scroll is obviously a saber technique."

Another began to mock them all indiscriminately, "A bunch of blind fools. It's plainly a finger technique."

Bai Zhenzhen furrowed her brow slightly; what she saw was a form of sword art.

Evidently, while Zhang Yu had been eating and studying, more and more students had completed their own comprehension of the scroll.

Listening to the discussion, Lian Tianji simply turned his gaze to Li Xuelian and asked, "Ms. Li, what kind of martial art is actually hidden within this scroll?"

Seeing that everyone was now looking at her, Li Xuelian merely smiled.

"As for the specific martial art, I have no comment."

"However, I will offer you all a reminder: the Martial Ascension Scroll holds its own mysteries. If anyone here masters the art within it, the scroll itself will provide a clear indication."

The crowd understood. This meant that if someone managed to master the martial art from the scroll, the scroll would display some kind of sign.

With this in mind, Lian Tianji took the lead without a second thought.

As a student from Purple Cloud High School, Lian Tianji already possessed the absolute confidence of a prodigy.

After the trial he had just endured, that confidence had swelled to its absolute peak. The moment he moved, he began to perform the palm technique he had just comprehended from the scroll.

As his hands moved, the sound of rushing wind and cracking thunder echoed, while a surging power and killing intent erupted from his body, threatening to blast the entire exhibition hall apart.

From a distance, Zhao Tianxing had been watching the events unfold. Seeing this display, he was struck with awe.

*Such high physical strength, and what a terrifying palm technique. This is a deadly martial art designed for combat.*

However, while Lian Tianji's physical strength was impressive for a first-year student, many cultivators present had long since graduated high school. They were more astonished by the sheer proficiency with which he executed the art.

One of them marveled internally, *Is that really the palm technique he just learned from the scroll? Every move is so polished. The top student from Purple Cloud High School is truly a genius among geniuses.*

But when Lian Tianji finished performing the entire set of palm techniques, the Celestial Paragon’s Martial Demonstration Scroll remained utterly still, showing no reaction whatsoever.

"How is that possible?" Lian Tianji said in disbelief. "I've clearly mastered the art from the scroll. How could it not work?"

Qian Shen chuckled and stepped forward, coming to stand before Lian Tianji.

"I told you, it's a leg technique."

He then began to perform the martial art he had comprehended from the scroll. Although he lacked Lian Tianji’s fluid grace, his execution of the moves was already second nature.

Watching this, Bai Zhenzhen’s brows furrowed once more.

*Is this a body tempering art? Specifically for training the legs.*

Yet, when Qian Shen finished his final move, the Celestial Paragon’s Martial Demonstration Scroll was still motionless, showing no change at all.

"How can that be?"

Echoing Lian Tianji's words, Qian Shen stared at the scroll in equal disbelief.

Following him, a steady stream of students came forward to demonstrate the martial arts they had comprehended.

Including Lian Tianji and Qian Shen, twelve students in total demonstrated nine different sets of martial arts: fist, palm, leg, finger, claw, saber, sword, spear, and staff.

Three of the students had comprehended arts that were identical to what others had shown.

But even after this series of demonstrations, not a single person managed to elicit a reaction from the Celestial Paragon’s Martial Demonstration Scroll.

Lian Tianji couldn't stop himself from turning to Li Xuelian again.

"Ms. Li, with so many of us, has truly not one person succeeded?"

Li Xuelian didn't reply, only shaking her head slightly, a hint of disappointment in her eyes.

At that moment, Bai Zhenzhen slowly walked forward. Under the watchful eyes of the crowd, she used her fingers as a sword and began to perform a set of sword techniques.

Although the swordplay possessed a peerless sharpness and Bai Zhenzhen’s every move was masterful, the onlookers lost interest after a few glances.

After all, two others had already demonstrated sword techniques without provoking any change in the scroll.

But to their surprise, after finishing the swordplay, Bai Zhenzhen’s style abruptly shifted. Using her hand as a saber, she began to perform a saber technique.

Then came a fist technique, a palm technique, a leg technique…

Zhao Tianxing exclaimed in shock, "Did Bai Zhenzhen learn all the martial arts everyone just demonstrated?"

Lian Tianji frowned as he watched.

*To be able to replicate everyone’s martial arts after seeing them only once, and in such a short time… which top-tier high school is this woman from?*

Watching Bai Zhenzhen execute each move as if it had been forged through years of arduous practice, Qian Shen's mind reeled.

On the one hand, he was stunned that Bai Zhenzhen could perform all nine martial arts. On the other, a question kept surfacing in his mind.

*If she performs all nine arts that everyone comprehended, could it actually work?*

Just then, under the astonished gazes of the crowd, the man in the Celestial Paragon’s Martial Demonstration Scroll moved. He turned to look at Bai Zhenzhen with a smile in his eyes, and two words materialized on the scroll.

Not bad.

(End of Chapter)

# Chapter 21: Martial Ascension Heart-Tempering

Seeing these words, the many students present were startled, assuming Bai Zhenzhen had succeeded.

But then Li Xuelian sighed, looked toward Bai Zhenzhen, and said, "To be able, on your own, to learn the forms of these nine martial arts in such a short time, your innate talent is already one in ten thousand."

"It is only a pity that you still fall a little short of my father's requirements."

Hearing this, some of the students present breathed a sigh of relief, while others were secretly astonished.

Zhao Tianxing thought, *She still didn't meet the requirements? Just what kind of ridiculously talented disciple is this True Monarch Xinghuo looking for?*

Bai Zhenzhen, on the other hand, secretly let out a breath of relief.

She hadn't expected to trigger a change in the Martial Ascension Scroll with a single attempt and had thought the matter settled. In a flash of panic, she had been on the verge of speaking up to refuse True Monarch Xinghuo’s offer of discipleship.

*Good thing I didn't say anything, or that would have been a huge loss of face. I knew something still seemed to be missing.*

After Bai Zhenzhen's attempt, a few others went forward to try performing the nine sets of martial arts, but none of them could trigger a change in the Celestial Paragon’s Martial Demonstration Scroll.

Conversely, Lian Tianji, who had been brimming with confidence, was slow to go up and try again, seemingly pondering the reason for Bai Zhenzhen's failure and what it was they were still lacking.

For a time, the entire venue fell silent; imperceptibly, no one was going up to try anymore.

Just as Li Xuelian was lamenting that this was the end of it, she saw Zhang Yu walk up, holding his phone.

"Oh?" Li Xuelian's interest was suddenly piqued. She thought, *After seeing so many people fail, he still has the confidence to go up. It seems he has some kind of assurance.*

But the next moment, she could not help but frown.

Because Zhang Yu had actually started playing a video on his phone, practicing the martial arts by copying Bai Zhenzhen's image in the video.

Evidently, he had just recorded Bai Zhenzhen's performance.

And seeing Zhang Yu following the video, executing the forms move by clumsy move, Li Xuelian’s brow furrowed even deeper.

It was obvious that aside from the fist technique he had comprehended himself, Zhang Yu was quite unfamiliar with the other eight martial arts. Although he was now mimicking Bai Zhenzhen’s movements from the video, it only served to highlight the chasm in their respective understandings of the eight arts' forms.

From a distance, Zhao Tianxing watched Zhang Yu in his security guard uniform, imitating Bai Zhenzhen's movements in a clumsy display under everyone's gaze, and felt his scalp tingle, cringing so hard his toes could have carved out a three-bedroom apartment.

Just by watching, he could feel that the crowd's gazes toward Zhang Yu were filled with contempt and mockery. He couldn't imagine what the person actually standing in that spot, doing that very thing, must be feeling.

*Stop it, Zhang Yu!*

Zhao Tianxing could no longer bear to watch, shouting only in his heart.

*This is too humiliating! You're already being seen as a clown!*

Zhang Yu naturally could not hear Zhao Tianxing's thoughts, nor did he care what the people in the exhibition hall now thought of him.

He just earnestly, move by move, performed each of the nine martial arts in accordance with Bai Zhenzhen's actions in the video.

And as he executed the final move, countless streams of experience and sensation suddenly flooded his mind, instantly giving Zhang Yu a different understanding of the Celestial Paragon’s Martial Demonstration Scroll, as if he had practiced it tens of thousands of times.

At this moment, the forms of the nine martial arts gradually faded from his mind, replaced by nine different intents, faintly looming within his consciousness.

At this moment, Zhang Yu abruptly understood that the nine martial arts on the Celestial Paragon’s Martial Demonstration Scroll emphasized intent, not form.

What a cultivator needed to do was to contemplate the artistic conception within each and every move while practicing the martial art.

The killing intent to shatter an army of thousands, the fighting spirit that would not regret nine deaths, the imposing aura to forge ever forward... the nine martial arts cultivated martial will, and through it, fortified one's Dao heart.

"This isn't a martial art for combat or body tempering, but one that uses martial will to temper the Dao heart."

This was a martial heart technique used to raise the level of one's Dao heart!

Martial will was the collective term the Ten Great Sects had settled on for the martial powers of sword intent, fist intent, saber intent, and the like.

The most fundamental function of martial will was to strengthen the spirit and solidify one's own will, thereby raising a cultivator's Dao heart level.

And for a Golden Core expert like True Monarch Xinghuo, his martial will could even be left within a painting to influence the minds and spirits of others.

At the same time, the aura around Zhang Yu underwent a powerful transformation.

Killing intent, fighting spirit, imposing aura, valor... one after another, incredibly potent qualities emerged from within him, seeming as though they would coalesce into his martial will in a single breath.

Simultaneously, the man on the Celestial Paragon’s Martial Demonstration Scroll grew clearer and clearer, even gradually taking on vivid colors, as if transforming into a real person who was staring intently at the changes in Zhang Yu.

The onlookers who noticed this were also stunned. This was undoubtedly the most significant reaction from the Celestial Paragon’s Martial Demonstration Scroll all day.

Lian Tianji, Qian Shen, Bai Zhenzhen... all of them stared intently at Zhang Yu, and they all sensed the change in him as the same incredible thought rose in their minds.

"Is he really going to succeed?"

But in the next instant, the change occurring in Zhang Yu was abruptly cut short, and the martial will that had seemed on the verge of condensing a moment ago dissipated into nothing.

"What a pity, what a pity," a line of text appeared on the painting. "A talent of celestial caliber, yet one move short."

Zhang Yu’s face, however, showed no surprise.

Martial Ascension Heart-Tempering Art Level 0 (1/1, 8.3/8 mana, 0.85/0.8 physical strength, 1/3 Dao heart)

On the Feathered Tome, a martial art called the Martial Ascension Heart-Tempering Art had appeared.

This was the martial art that finally manifested on the Feathered Tome after Zhang Yu had repeatedly studied the Celestial Paragon’s Martial Demonstration Scroll, carefully observed the performances of the many students, and recorded Bai Zhenzhen’s video for repeated contemplation.

And unlike the martial arts Zhang Yu had learned before, this Martial Ascension Heart-Tempering Art had requirements for mana, physical strength, and Dao heart.

"Besides having to practice all the forms like the fist, palm, and leg arts, it also requires 8 mana, a physical strength of 0.8, and a level 3 Dao heart."

"I already meet the other requirements, but this level 3 Dao heart..."

Zhang Yu's own Dao heart was only level 1.

Attempting it as he did, he was, as expected, stuck at the final step.

"This Martial Ascension Heart-Tempering Art, it seems for now, is a martial art meant for after reaching a level 3 Dao heart, used to condense martial will, fortify the mind with that martial will, and temper the Dao heart."

*Such a high requirement of a level 3 Dao heart… is that even achievable for a first-year high school student only three months into the school year?*

Li Xuelian looked at the failed Zhang Yu, her eyes glittering with an extraordinary light.

Her original plan flashed through her mind. She had never expected any of the first-year high school students present to succeed.

"According to the file the security company just sent over, this person is Zhang Yu, a first-year student at Songyang High School."

"For him to have reached this stage, he can truly be called a talent of celestial caliber."

Recalling Zhang Yu's performance, she sighed inwardly.

*Impressive. I almost misjudged him completely.*

*His forms looked stiff, every punch and kick was clumsy, yet he was ultimately able to comprehend the intent contained within.*

*This shows that he prioritizes intent over form and saw the true mystery of the Martial Ascension Heart-Tempering Art early on.*

*Excellent, excellent. Father can add another fine disciple to his tutelage.*

In truth, as soon as Li Xuelian had checked the information of the participants, she had felt that it was unlikely anyone would succeed in this test.

After all, any students who could master the martial art within the Celestial Paragon’s Martial Demonstration Scroll on the spot would either be from a prominent family or already be a second or third-year who had long been signed to a contract. It was highly unlikely they would come seeking to become True Monarch Xinghuo's disciple.

The possibility of finding a genius who could master the Martial Ascension Heart-Tempering Art on the spot was exceedingly small to begin with.

But that did not mean no one could be accepted as her father's disciple.

If, among the first-year students present, someone could withstand the impact of the martial will, learn all the forms on the spot, and comprehend the mystery of martial will from it, then even if they could not ultimately master the art, they were definitely a genius of exceptional talent.

If such an individual were to come a year later, they would certainly be able to master the Martial Ascension Heart-Tempering Art, which would also meet her father's requirements; finding them now was like discovering them a year early, before they had fully developed and been signed to a contract.

She believed her father would absolutely be willing to accept such an outstanding disciple.

In that case, the fact that this first-year student couldn't master the Martial Ascension Heart-Tempering Art was not a flaw, but rather an advantage that would allow Li Xuelian to negotiate a slightly lower price when it came time to sign the contract.

At this thought, she was already smiling toward Zhang Yu.

"This student, although you were unable to truly master the Martial Ascension Heart-Tempering Art, you have already perceived its mysteries. Mastering this art is merely a matter of time for you."

"I will ask my father shortly to see if he is willing to accept you as his disciple."

Hearing this, the crowd was once again thrown into an uproar.

Lian Tianji looked in Zhang Yu's direction, took out his phone, and secretly snapped a picture of him. He needed to find out just where this formidable security guard had appeared from.

Qian Shen stared at Zhang Yu in disbelief, screaming internally, *Impossible! How can someone with a score of 550 be taken as a disciple by a Golden Core True Monarch? I must be dreaming! Is the Celestial Paragon’s Martial Demonstration Scroll still testing me?*

Bai Zhenzhen: *Is Yu-boy… using a cheat code?*

Discovering that her good brother, who was once her inferior in every way and mired in debt alongside her, had suddenly soared into the heavens, Bai Zhenzhen felt an immediate sense of unease.

*Ah, Yu-boy, it’s not that I don’t wish you well. If you had ranked in the top ten, or the top five, better than before but still below me, then this brother would have certainly wished you all the best.*

*Who told you to suppress all the heroes and even surpass me?*

However, watching the surrounding people approach Zhang Yu to get on his good side, Bai Zhenzhen thought to herself, *After Zhang Yu signs with a Golden Core True Monarch, he'll definitely be able to attract a lot of investors. When that time comes, I have to fleece him for all he's worth and borrow money from him.*

But the next moment, her thoughts shifted, and she frowned. 

*But with half his cultivation base taken away and having been let go by one of the great sects, he has no resources and no backing. If Zhang Yu really becomes his disciple, he'll be a workhorse for the rest of his life.*

*Forget it, forget it. For the sake of our brotherhood, I should probably give him a reminder. Can't let him be dazzled by the words 'Golden Core.' I have to tell him to refuse the offer.*

Elsewhere, Zhao Tianxing’s eyes were wide, his mind a complete blank. But he soon recalled how he had tried to persuade Zhang Yu and was struck by a wave of embarrassment. 

*So humiliating.*

*He’s a true genius. When I was saying all those things to him, he must have thought I was a clown.*

Just as Bai Zhenzhen started walking toward Zhang Yu, many other students also began to crowd around.

Some wanted to add Zhang Yu's contact information, some wanted to ask him about the mysteries of the Celestial Paragon’s Martial Demonstration Scroll, and still others wanted to take a picture with him.

Meanwhile, Li Xuelian had already stepped to the side and was calling her father.

"Dad, I've found a good prospect here in Songyang City..."

(End of Chapter)

# Chapter 22: The Contract

After Li Xuelian finished explaining Zhang Yu’s situation, a light laugh came from the other end of the line.

"He is indeed impressive, but there's no need to take him on."

Li Xuelian asked in confusion, "Why not?"

True Monarch Xinghuo burst into laughter, his voice filled with delight.

"I've already found a true genius."

"Also a first-year, and it only took him half an hour to master the Martial Ascension Heart-Tempering Art."

"And he isn't bound by any contracts."

At this, True Monarch Xinghuo couldn't help but laugh heartily again.

Li Xuelian said in surprise, "A prodigy like that actually exists?"

True Monarch Xinghuo chuckled. "I've told you before, the first layer of Kunxu has never been short on geniuses, only on people to invest in them."

"Think of the top scorers in each subject of the annual college entrance exams, not to mention the overall champion; you know how astonishingly brilliant those individuals are."

"But geniuses of that caliber appear by the handful every year on Kunxu's first layer, along with a whole crowd not far behind them, cropping up year after year like an endless field of chives."

"There are simply too many geniuses out there. In the past, I just never found them, always getting beaten to the punch by others, but now, I've finally managed to be one step ahead."

Li Xuelian glanced in Zhang Yu’s direction with a hint of regret and asked, "Shouldn't we sign this Zhang Yu as well?"

True Monarch Xinghuo replied, "Forget it. From now on, our family's resources will be invested in the true genius; let's not divide our focus."

...

In the conference room adjacent to the art exhibition.

Li Xuelian looked at Zhang Yu with a deeply apologetic expression.

"I'm sorry, my fellow student, but my father has other urgent matters to attend to and will likely be unable to take you as his disciple for the time being."

She continued with utmost sincerity, "However, you can use the Martial Ascension Heart-Tempering Art freely from now on. I'll personally grant you the rights to its use."

Li Xuelian's eyes were filled with admiration as she looked at him.

"Finally, I would like to give you ten thousand yuan as a personal gift."

"Don't be so quick to refuse; this gift stems purely from my admiration for your talent."

"I hope that by the next time we meet, you will have been accepted into a prestigious university."

"Oh, and one more thing. Regarding the videos you recorded, they involve the distribution rights for the Martial Ascension Heart-Tempering Art, so I'll need you to delete them..."

A moment later, as she watched Zhang Yu’s departing figure, the smile on Li Xuelian's face slowly faded.

Even though True Monarch Xinghuo didn't intend to take him as a disciple, Li Xuelian had no intention of making an enemy of such a talented young man.

After all, granting the usage rights to the Martial Ascension Heart-Tempering Art and giving away ten thousand yuan were trivial matters for her.

She couldn't even remember how many times she had made similar small gestures to gifted youngsters.

The vast majority of them, however, ultimately faded into mediocrity and were long forgotten.

After settling this matter, Li Xuelian met with a few more important guests before eagerly seeking out her father.

She was incredibly curious about the peerless genius True Monarch Xinghuo had mentioned.

...

Meanwhile, at the art exhibition which had not yet formally concluded.

Bai Zhenzhen watched Zhang Yu emerge from the conference room and asked, "How did it go? Did you turn down True Monarch Xinghuo? Li Xuelian didn't give you a hard time, did she?"

Zhang Yu, recalling Li Xuelian’s admiring expression, shook his head.

"She didn't give me a hard time at all."

"Before I could even say a word, she rejected me first, saying True Monarch Xinghuo had other urgent business..."

"She did give me an extra 10,000 yuan at the end, though."

Hearing this, Bai Zhenzhen pursed her lips.

"A standard excuse."

"Maybe she looked into your background and found you weren't so great after all."

"Like your monthly exam scores are terrible, you have no sterilization record, your muscle development is poor, and you're drowning in debt..."

Zhang Yu pursed his lips as he listened to her.

"Zhen, you lost and you're still not over it, so now you're resorting to personal attacks?"

Seeing Zhang Yu's smug expression, Bai Zhenzhen couldn't resist grabbing his shoulder and demanding, "Are you going to tell me what kind of cheat you're using or not?"

"Tell me, did you borrow money to bribe the staff so you could study the Martial Ascension Scroll beforehand?"

Zhang Yu chuckled at the sight of Bai Zhenzhen's face, contorted with jealousy.

_Keep it up, Zhen. Watching the pathetic displays of you weaklings after your defeat is my new favorite pastime._

As the two were talking, Qian Shen approached from a short distance away.

He looked at Zhang Yu with a grave expression and asked, "Do you intentionally do poorly on your exams?"

The trial of the Celestial Paragon’s Martial Demonstration Scroll had prepared Qian Shen to face other high-scorers.

But for a low-scorer to outperform him was something he found utterly shocking.

Seeing Zhang Yu shake his head in denial, Qian Shen said resentfully, "Impossible. If you weren't throwing your exams, why is there such a mismatch between your talent and your scores?"

"Hmm?" Zhang Yu thought for a moment before replying, "Exams can't possibly reveal a person's full potential..."

But Qian Shen cut him off, exclaiming agitatedly, "Impossible!"

"The college entrance exam and the six major high school subjects were established by the Ten Great Sects as a system specifically for evaluating students. It has been verified and adjusted by countless experts and powerful individuals, making it the most optimal, scientific, and Immortal Dao-aligned system for assessing a person!"

"Every subject, every single point, perfectly reflects the comprehensive differences between individuals, including bloodline superiority, regional backwardness, and evolutionary incompletion..."

Looking at Qian Shen’s incredibly earnest expression, Zhang Yu realized he had misjudged the guy.

_This guy isn't just a simple score snob. He's evolved from score discrimination to bloodline, regional, and even racial discrimination. He's become a believer in a score-based caste system._

In essence, according to Qian Shen, high scores meant you were amazing, an elite, someone entitled to feel superior and confident, while low scores meant you were worthless trash.

This was the worldview he had built over many years, the very source of his confidence as a top student, and arguably the unspoken rule in all key high schools.

"Hmph. If you won't admit it, fine."

"But I will report what happened here to the school. I expect you to show your true abilities on the next monthly exam and not score an evolutionarily incomplete 550 again."

Watching Qian Shen walk away, Zhang Yu felt as if he had just been insulted, yet at the same time, not.

Bai Zhenzhen, however, nodded thoughtfully.

"Amidst all that nonsense, there was one thing you should actually pay attention to."

"The school will definitely find out what happened here, and when they do, they'll probably approach you with a contract."

"A contract?" Zhang Yu looked at Zhen curiously. He had heard vague mentions of this before, but the details had always been hazy.

Bai Zhenzhen explained, "You know, not everyone in high school is as wealthy as Qian Shen's family."

"For many talented students who are poor but have good grades, they need investors."

"The school itself is one such investor."

"Typically, at the beginning of the second year, the school selects a group of outstanding students based on their first-year performance and grades, then signs contracts and invests in them."

"Of course, for a small number of exceptionally brilliant students, the school will approach them during their first year to prevent others from signing them first."

At this, Bai Zhenzhen puffed out her chest.

"Like me, for example."

Zhang Yu asked, "How come you never told me about this?"

Bai Zhenzhen shot him a look, as if to say, _Have you forgotten what a sorry state you used to be in?_

Bai Zhenzhen continued, "Given your performance here, the school will definitely approach you about a contract. As for whether you should sign it..."

Seeing the conflicted look on her face, Zhang Yu asked, "Is it that difficult of a choice?"

Bai Zhenzhen sighed. "It's not necessarily difficult. The choice is actually quite clear depending on your personal situation."

"The hard part is knowing whether your perception of yourself is accurate."

She looked at Zhang Yu seriously and asked, "For instance, what cheat did you use to comprehend the Celestial Paragon’s Martial Demonstration Scroll this time?"

But halfway through her sentence, she waved her hand. "Never mind. We're close, so we don't ask about each other's secrets. You don't have to tell me."

"In any case, if you're absolutely confident you can get into one of the ten top-tier universities, then don't sign this contract."

"On the other hand, if you aren't sure you can make it into the Ten Greats and would be happy with a regular university, then you should sign the contract as long as the terms aren't too exploitative."

Zhang Yu grew thoughtful upon hearing this and asked a few more questions about the school and the contract details.

After they had been talking for a little while, someone else approached Zhang Yu—a charming young woman.

"Hi there. You were really cool earlier. Can I get your contact info?"

Similar things had happened several times since he comprehended the Celestial Paragon’s Martial Demonstration Scroll. Even Lian Tianji from Purple Cloud High School had asked for his contact details.

Zhang Yu was gradually getting used to it. He sighed internally and added her contact.

"Heh, even beautiful girls are approaching me now?"

Zhang Yu asked, "Which school are you from?"

She replied, "I'm Wu Qingqing, from the honors class at the Saintess Academy."

Zhang Yu's expression instantly froze. In the world of Kunxu, someone who looked like a man wasn't necessarily one, but a student from the honors class of an all-girls academy... had to have been a man previously.

Wu Qingqing seemed to notice the change in his expression and smiled faintly.

"Oh? You're quite old-fashioned, aren't you? Do you think our class is just full of people who gamed the system to get into an key high school, but whose actual scores are a complete mess?"

"Let me tell you, the top students in my class are no worse than you, as you'll see in the next city-wide exam."

Zhang Yu speechlessly watched her walk away.

_No, that's not what I was thinking about at all._

_Kunxu... in this blasted place, even transgender people are judged first and foremost by their scores._

"Congratulations," Zhou Tianyi said, walking over from the side. "Did you sign a contract with the Golden Core True Monarch?"

Zhang Yu looked at Zhou Tianyi and suddenly recalled that he had barely noticed him in front of the Celestial Paragon’s Martial Demonstration Scroll earlier.

For the remainder of his shift, Zhang Yu continued to act as security, exchanging a few words with guests, both familiar and unfamiliar.

By the time his security work for the day was done, his savings had grown by 1,600 and 10,000 yuan, soaring to a total of 13,300.

After paying off the remaining 5,000 on his loan for the month, his balance dropped to 8,300, and Zhang Yu could finally stop worrying about collections for a while.

(End of Chapter)

# Chapter 23: Negotiations

One in the morning.

Having finished his security shift, Zhang Yu navigated the crowded subways and buses, making his way back to his rented room in the suburbs.

As for why the public transit was still packed at one in the morning, it was naturally because this was the evening rush hour for the night shift in Songyang City, teeming with commuters.

Back home, he first took a shower, then glanced at his account balance, wondering if he could finally afford an air conditioner.

After all, with a deposit of 8,300, his finances for the month suddenly felt much more comfortable.

But then he remembered that the next month was only two weeks away, and he would have to repay a 15,000 loan, which made him frown.

He recalled what Bai Zhenzhen had said.

*The school's contract?* he murmured to himself.

If signing a contract could provide him a large sum of money each month, he would not have to worry about the loan anymore.

However, Zhang Yu knew it was useless to overthink it. Whether it was his performance before the Celestial Paragon’s Martial Demonstration Scroll or the school’s contract, everything ultimately boiled down to his own talent and strength.

With this in mind, he took out the neural filler he had bought at the stationery shop by the school gate earlier that day and consumed it.

He then sat cross-legged on his bed and began to circulate the Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method, feeling wisps of spiritual energy from the world flowing into his body.

Although he had switched the Feathered Tome’s specialization to the Martial Ascension Heart-Tempering Art for the trial of the Celestial Paragon’s Martial Demonstration Scroll, he would have to wait twenty-four hours to switch it back to the Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method to resume its rapid advancement.

But since his Dao heart was not yet level three, he couldn't practice the Martial Ascension Heart-Tempering Art anyway, and he needed to prepare for the Mana Competition by increasing his mana.

Even though the Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method could not be rapidly advanced for now, having already reached level four, it could still help him effectively increase his mana.

And so, the rest of the night passed in Zhang Yu’s silent breathing exercise.

…

Early the next morning.

The moment Zhang Yu stepped into the classroom, he noticed something was different.

Normally, the vast majority of students at Songyang High School were focused on their own studies and cultivation, paying little attention to the other, more ordinary students in their class.

Even two people in the same class might go months without exchanging a single word.

Just as how, every day when Zhang Yu entered the classroom, no one ever paid him any mind.

Only someone like Zhao Tianxing would wonder if his classmates were watching him every time he walked in.

But today was different; Zhang Yu could clearly feel furtive glances being cast his way from the moment he entered.

The instant Zhang Yu sat down, Zhou Tianyi clapped him on the shoulder and said, “The news that you were accepted as a disciple by a Golden Core True Monarch has spread throughout the class.”

“It seems like the few people who went to the art exhibition with Qian Shen mentioned it in the group chat.”

It was a well-known fact that schools were one of the fastest places in the world for rumors to spread.

And as a key institution, Songyang High School had immense pressure to cultivate, a surplus of celibate youths, and a mobile phone in every hand, which only accelerated the dissemination of gossip.

Forget text messages; even a photo of Zhang Yu in his security guard uniform from yesterday was already making the rounds in the group chat.

Zhang Yu let out a chuckle at this.

“Has the class started spreading tales of my exploits? Truly the speed of Songyang. Let them talk.”

In these days of being forced into ascetic training, feeling the attention and discussion of others regarding his excellent performance was a rare pleasure for Zhang Yu.

But he immediately pursed his lips, thinking of a complication.

Yesterday, Li Xuelian had secretly called him into a small meeting to inform him of her rejection.

This meant that many of the people who had been present didn't know he had actually been turned down by the Golden Core True Monarch. They all still believed what Li Xuelian had announced on the floor—that he was to be taken as a disciple.

*It would be pretty stupid of me to run up to the podium and clarify things now.*

*Whatever, let them say what they want. They'll probably forget about it after a while.*

Zhang Yu closed his eyes and resumed circulating the Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method, absorbing spiritual energy through his breathing exercise.

The chatter of his classmates was nothing more than a temporary amusement.

As he had planned, his primary goal was still to focus all his efforts on increasing his mana in preparation for the city-wide Mana Competition.

This time, however, Zhang Yu had only taken a few breaths before he was called out of the room by his class advisor, Su Haifeng.

…

He remembered the last time Su Haifeng had called him for a talk; it was on his third day in this world.

At that time, his understanding of Songyang High School and its teachers was still superficial.

He had even initially mistaken Su Haifeng for a kind teacher who cared for students in need.

But now, standing outside the classroom and walking behind Su Haifeng, Zhang Yu could feel the terrifying pressure emanating from the model class advisor who was also the grade director.

Wherever Su Haifeng passed, the classrooms instantly fell silent, and students trembled.

Qian Shen didn't dare move a muscle, focusing intently on his breathing exercise.

Zhao Tianxing, who had just stood up to go to the restroom, quickly sat back down and picked up a book to read.

Even Bai Zhenzhen sat bolt upright like a primary schooler, her eyes fixed on the textbook before her.

Everyone’s nerves were stretched taut, all of them hoping Su Haifeng’s gaze wouldn’t land on them.

This was Su Haifeng, the first-year grade director of Songyang High School, the devil incarnate in the hearts of countless Songyang students, and the author of the research paper, “On the Application Prospects of Electric Shock in High School Education.”

This was a man so intimidating that a stray dog would feel compelled to read a few pages if it passed him by.

Zhang Yu followed Su Haifeng through this oppressive scholarly field and into the office, where the demon king smiled at him and said, “I heard True Monarch Xinghuo wants to take you as a disciple?”

Zhang Yu had no intention of deceiving the school into thinking he had become a disciple of a Golden Core expert. A lie about his apprenticeship would be easily exposed, putting him in a difficult position.

So he told the truth, “No. I felt True Monarch Xinghuo’s offer was a bit lacking, so I rejected it.”

The corner of Su Haifeng’s mouth twitched.

This Zhang Yu came from a poor family and hadn’t given him a single gift in the three months since school started. Now, after a brief moment in the spotlight, he was already putting on airs.

*Is he trying to… drive up his price for the contract?*

As expected, these paupers were prone to getting inflated egos.

If that was the case, however, Su Haifeng suspected that signing the contract in a few moments would not be so easy.

“I see.” After a moment of thought, he produced a document and said, “The school is aware of your performance at the art exhibition in the Central Tower.”

“Although your grades have slipped recently, you’ve been criticized by the physical education teacher, you haven’t been proactive about purchasing medicine, and a debt collection agency even called my office, the school is still dedicated to nurturing talent and has decided to offer you some assistance.”

Zhang Yu’s eyes narrowed at his words.

Worthy of being Songyang High School’s resident devil; a master manipulator right out of the gate.

Zhang Yu recalled what Bai Zhenzhen had said about a contract and guessed this was all a prelude to negotiating its terms.

And just as he expected, Su Haifeng placed the document in front of him and continued, “The school has prepared a student aid contract for you. The terms are much better than the previous financial aid plan for impoverished students. Take a look and see if there are any issues.”

Zhang Yu took it and gave it a quick scan, discovering that upon signing, the school would give him ten thousand a month. However, the money had to be repaid, though the interest rate was significantly lower than a loan.

Furthermore, it stipulated that regardless of whether he was admitted to a university, he would be required to work for a company under the school’s affiliated education group for ten years.

Songyang High School was part of the Myriad Stars Education Group, which in turn was under the Myriad Laws Sect, one of the Ten Great Sects.

In other words, signing this contract meant Zhang Yu would have to work for the Myriad Stars Education Group for a decade.

Additionally, during the university application process, Songyang High School would have the right to decide which university and major he applied to.

“Ten thousand a month for me to sign this kind of indenture contract?”

Even without seeing any other student’s contract, Zhang Yu could tell this one was insulting.

Zhang Yu put the document down and said with a frown, “Sir, isn’t this compensation too low? I make 800 an hour as a security guard at the Central Tower.”

“Can a temporary job be a long-term solution?” Su Haifeng retorted, then shifted his tone. “I know the terms of this contract are a bit low, but the school’s leadership has its reasons.”

“After all, regarding the trial with the Celestial Paragon’s Martial Demonstration Scroll at the art exhibition—what was the content? What were the selection criteria? What were the specific qualities of the candidates? The school has no firsthand information and thus cannot make its own judgment, not to mention you failed to master the martial art in the end.”

“On the contrary, your academic performance has shown a marked decline this month.”

“The school is, ultimately, a place that values grades. The six-subject, 700-point evaluation system is certainly more in line with the Immortal Dao, more rational, and more highly regarded by the board of directors than the Celestial Paragon’s Martial Demonstration Scroll. The contract process is bound by this reality…”

Zhang Yu’s frown deepened, because what Su Haifeng said was not without reason.

At Songyang High School, academic scores were the ultimate priority.

After all, besides him, no one at the school knew the true difficulty and power of the Martial Ascension Heart-Tempering Art, much less that it required a level three Dao heart.

And Zhang Yu did not have the right to disseminate the Martial Ascension Heart-Tempering Art, nor did he have anyone to vouch for his claims about it.

Zhang Yu said, “There’s no way I can accept this contract.”

Su Haifeng smiled slightly, thinking to himself, *Is he about to ask for more?*

He said lightly, “Don’t be so hasty. I’m your class advisor, after all. I can help you fight for a better offer.”

Zhang Yu asked, “Can it be as good as the terms you gave Bai Zhenzhen?”

Su Haifeng didn’t answer directly. He simply laughed, but the meaning behind his laughter was self-evident.

Then he said, “I’m not in charge of Bai Zhenzhen’s contract, but I can give you a response. Bai Zhenzhen is number one in our grade with 650 points. What’s your score?”

Zhang Yu countered, “Does that mean if I become number one in the grade, everything is negotiable?”

Looking at Zhang Yu’s serious face, Su Haifeng smiled and took the contract back.

“How well you can score depends on your own ability.”

“The contracts are primarily based on grades. While there can be some flexibility in the details, they are generally divided into four tiers: A, B, C, and D.”

“The monthly exam is in two weeks. If you’re not satisfied with a D-tier contract, we can wait until your results are out and continue this discussion then.”

(End of Chapter)

# Chapter 24: Spiritual Root

Leaving Su Haifeng’s office, Zhang Yu walked on his way back to the classroom.

Next week, he had to break into the grade's top ten for mana to qualify to represent Songyang High School in the Mana Competition.

The week after, the monthly exams would begin, and only with a sufficiently outstanding score could he secure a better contract from the school.

Zhang Yu was fully confident he could break into the top ten in mana within the next week. After all, his Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method had already reached level four, and this level would only climb higher, making his mana growth increasingly rapid.

But the monthly exams also included physical education, Dao heart, martial arts, and Daoist arts in addition to mana, and the thought of having to drastically improve in these four areas over the next two weeks instantly filled Zhang Yu with immense pressure.

As for the general education exam?

Not only was general education itself worth a mere fifty points, but nearly everyone in the model class scored close to full marks on it, making it impossible to create any real gap.

It was safe to say that Zhang Yu wasn't quite sure what he could ultimately achieve in the monthly exams two weeks from now.

"In any case... the only way is to grind."

Zhang Yu could feel a fire ignite within him.

Who said a manual hack wasn't a hack?

_Feathered Tome! Show me your limits over these next two weeks!_

And so, the moment he returned to the classroom, Zhang Yu began his breathing exercises for spiritual energy, circulating the Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method with all his might.

In the blink of an eye, it was the end of the first period.

_Sigh, I’m so tired._

Just as Zhang Yu’s mind relaxed slightly and he considered taking a break, the countdown timer with its bone-deep chill rose once more, compelling him to push onward.

"Fuck!"

_Idiotic ritual… I’ll kill you one day!_

Meanwhile, in another corner of the classroom, Zhao Tianxing glanced at a message on his phone and breathed a sigh of relief.

Previously, the physical education teacher, Wang Hai, had tasked him with finding out Zhang Yu's supply channels. When he was asked for an update today, Zhao Tianxing told him about the art exhibition.

Wang Hai's reply was: Understood, you don't need to follow up on Zhang Yu for now, just maintain a good relationship with him. Come to the training grounds after school tomorrow, and I'll lead you through a body tempering session.

No longer needing to probe Zhang Yu for information was a great relief to Zhao Tianxing.

And the reward of an extra training session with Wang Hai made Zhao Tianxing secretly rejoice.

After all, as an ace teacher, the quality of Wang Hai’s private lessons was beyond question; not only were they expensive, but they were often impossible to book.

As for continuing to maintain a relationship with Zhang Yu...

Zhao Tianxing looked up toward Zhang Yu’s seat and saw him performing his breathing exercises.

_After what happened yesterday, I must be nothing but a clown in his eyes._

Just thinking about how the other boy might be mocking his clumsy performance from last night made Zhao Tianxing’s cheeks burn again.

But the thought of Wang Hai's private lesson spurred him on. He resolved to go and chat with Zhang Yu for a bit once class was over and he was free.

Yet as the morning classes passed one by one, Zhao Tianxing simply could not find a single opportunity to exchange a few words with Zhang Yu.

_Is he still doing breathing exercises?_

_He does them during class._

_He does them after class, too._
