This was to ensure as much as possible that each group contained contestants from all tiers, from high to low, and to prevent multiple high-tier contestants from being eliminated prematurely in the same group.

Zhang Yu thought to himself, _If I don't want to be grouped with that batch of most formidable students, then I have to get as high a score as possible._

_Only then can I avoid facing tough opponents in the group stage and better secure a spot in the top eight._

Looking at the Yellow Turban Strongman on the stage, a battle plan gradually formed in Zhang Yu's mind.

A short while later, it was finally Zhang Yu's turn.

...

In the audience.

Zhao Tianxing, Qian Shen, and He Dayou were sitting together.

Aside from He Dayou, who had a look of utter disgust on his face, Qian Shen was watching the ring intently.

Zhao Tianxing, however, kept feeling that the students from the three great high schools not far away were looking at him, and felt a bit awkward that a Songyang student like himself was here watching the competition with them.

He also felt that the Songyang High School uniform he was wearing... seemed so rare and out of place here in the hallowed halls of White Dragon High, and he felt that the people around him had strange expressions when they saw the Songyang uniform on him.

Of course, Zhao Tianxing was actually overthinking it. To the vast majority of students from the three great schools...

Songyang High School? Do the students there even understand cultivation? What's there to see? We're here to watch the competition.

But just then, a student wearing a White Dragon High uniform walked over, looked at He Dayou, and said, "Dayou, you really came to watch my match?"

He Dayou looked at him, wondering why his sunglasses and mask were so useless.

"Yeah," He Dayou nodded and said, "I came to see what the overall level of the three great schools is like this year."

Chu Qiuhe from White Dragon High chuckled and said, "I saw that your Songyang High School actually sent people to compete. What were you thinking? Aren't you afraid of being beaten into bankruptcy?"

Although he knew there was indeed a gap between Songyang and the three great schools, as the Son of the School Director, He Dayou still felt a primal discomfort hearing this.

_To insult Songyang in front of the Son of the School Director, you've already found your path to death._

But he also understood that there was indeed a tiny bit of a gap between Songyang and White Dragon.

And even though he and Chu Qiuhe had been middle school classmates, their friendship had gradually soured after he was admitted to Songyang and the other to White Dragon High.

In front of the other boy, He Dayou always felt a sense of inferiority.

Even now, Chu Qiuhe was only looking at his middle school classmate, He Dayou, treating Qian Shen and Zhao Tianxing beside him as if they were thin air.

After all, Songyang High School... Heh.

At this moment, He Dayou said lightly, "Who knows. Anyway, that guy got fourth in the last Mana Competition, so maybe he wanted to try his luck again this time."

Hearing the title of fourth in the Mana Competition, Chu Qiuhe was momentarily choked up and gave an awkward laugh.

"Martial arts combat is different from the Mana Competition. Martial combat is about comprehensive strength; the gap between White Dragon, Purple Cloud, Red Pagoda, and the other high schools will be stretched very wide."

As he spoke, he looked toward the ring and said, "Perfect timing, someone from your school is up. Let me help you see what his level is like..."

Meanwhile, seeing that it was a student from Songyang High School who was taking the stage, many in the audience also expected a tough fight.

But then they saw Zhang Yu clash with the Yellow Turban Strongman, and with a bang... the Yellow Turban Strongman was thrown out of bounds.

Zhang Yu, 300 points.

The entire arena was suddenly in an uproar, as no one had expected that a student from Songyang High School could achieve this.

Chu Qiuhe was also stunned. Seeing the Yellow Turban Strongman thrown out by Zhang Yu before he had even finished his sentence, he asked in astonishment, "300 points? Your Songyang can produce a student like this?"

That tone... it was as if he had just seen a flower bloom on a pile of cow dung.

Although he hated Zhang Yu, He Dayou had to admit that at this moment, seeing Chu Qiuhe's astonished expression, he felt a slight sense of satisfaction. He nodded reservedly, "Our year is quite formidable."

Qian Shen, beside him, also said, "Zhang Yu does have a score of 653, after all. He's very strong."

Zhao Tianxing, seeing the uproar in the arena, subconsciously puffed out his chest, feeling that the Songyang uniform on his body didn't seem so humble anymore.

...

When Chu Qiuhe returned to Song Hailong's side, he saw the competition coach reviewing the slow-motion replay with a few others.

The coach analyzed, "This Zhang Yu positioned himself at the edge of the ring right from the start."

"This was to make the Yellow Turban Strongman take the initiative to come to the edge of the ring after it attacked."

"Then, he used an ordinary straight punch, and this is where it gets interesting."

In the footage, Zhang Yu, as if he had predicted it, intercepted the Yellow Turban Strongman's move in advance.

The competition coach continued his analysis, "In that instant, he determined the Yellow Turban Strongman's attack, then interrupted it early, and then used the Limitless Cloud Hand to redirect the Strongman's power, ultimately throwing it several steps away."

"And because of his positioning, several steps away was right outside the boundary."

"From start to finish, every move was calculated to perfection..."

After hearing this analysis, Song Hailong's initially intrigued gaze instantly faded, and he turned his head away with a bored expression.

"I thought this kid was a dark horse like he was in the Mana Competition and would have some real strength."

"Turns out he just likes to use these clever little tricks. How boring."

The competition coach didn't refute Song Hailong's words, because he was both the dominant number one student of the year and undeniably wealthy, so as long as he didn't insult the teacher, he could say whatever he wanted.

Besides, the coach also knew that this ace son truly didn't need to consider a contestant of Zhang Yu's level.

But the competition coach still looked at the other students and reminded them, "Don't underestimate him. Although there's an element of trickery, to be able to make that judgment in that instant means either his reaction time and concentration are exceptionally strong, and his understanding of martial arts is very deep..."

"Or he observed the Yellow Turban Strongman for a long time beforehand and figured out some of its attack patterns."

"Although his various stats are likely not as high as yours, this kind of opponent is very capable of defeating a stronger foe with a weaker force. If you encounter him, you must not be careless."

"Anyone who loses to an opponent from outside the three great schools today will be fined ten thousand credits and will have to kneel through class for the rest of the month."

The students immediately responded with a loud "Yes, sir."

Listening to the coach's analysis, Chu Qiuhe thought to himself, _So that's how it was._

When he first saw Zhang Yu instantly defeat the Yellow Turban Strongman, he thought the guy was a powerhouse on the same level as Song Hailong.

But now, after hearing the explanation, he felt that with some preparation, it seemed like something he could do as well.

...

On the other side, in the Purple Cloud High School preparation area.

Lian Tianji laughed. "Zhang Yu is really impressive."

Le Mulan, who was next to him, glanced over and said indifferently, "He can't even afford to rent the most basic combat spiritual root. Poor people are truly pathetic."

"But even though he's already so poor, he still insists on risking bankruptcy to participate. I really can't understand it."

Le Mulan turned her head to look at Lian Tianji, asking with a curious and uncomprehending expression, "You're so much poorer than me. Can you understand what they're thinking?"

Lian Tianji gave an awkward laugh, at a loss for words for a moment. He could only comfort himself in his heart, _The divine number one is just being blunt, she's not intentionally looking down on me. I shouldn't take it to heart._

...

And not long after Zhang Yu left the stage, it was finally Bai Zhenzhen's turn.

In the audience, Qian Shen and Zhao Tianxing were originally looking forward to Bai Zhenzhen's performance.

Who would have known that moments later, they would find Bai Zhenzhen fighting a difficult battle on the ring, desperately dodging the Yellow Turban Strongman while barely finding openings to touch the sensor patches on its body.

"Bai Zhenzhen is struggling this much?"

He Dayou watched the spirited Bai Zhenzhen who had beaten him up now being pushed into a corner by the Yellow Turban Strongman's attacks. He suddenly found that he felt no pleasure in his heart, but rather a kind of bitterness.

And this bitterness was less because of Bai Zhenzhen and more because of the version of himself who had once been beaten by her.

Qian Shen, at his side, frowned. "Bai Zhenzhen's fighting style doesn't seem well-suited for dealing with the Yellow Turban Strongman."

Zhao Tianxing said worriedly, "At this rate, isn't she going to be placed in a group with a high-scoring contestant? It's very likely she'll be eliminated in the group stage."

...

As Bai Zhenzhen's difficult fight on the ring dragged on, the audience and other contestants quickly lost interest.

Song Hailong had long since closed his eyes in boredom, seemingly feeling that watching such a fight for even another second was a waste of time.

On the other side, Lian Tianji also felt a sense of surprise.

_That girl who came to compete with Zhang Yu... it seems she was with Zhang Yu at the last Mana Competition too._

_She's clearly so weak, why does she insist on accompanying Zhang Yu to compete? Could it be... she's Zhang Yu's slave at Songyang High? Has Songyang started playing that game too?_

Lei Jun, watching this scene, said thoughtfully, "It seems Bai Zhenzhen realized her fighting style is not suited for fighting the Yellow Turban Strongman and decided to hide her strength."

As the teacher who had tutored Bai Zhenzhen for two weeks, Lei Jun knew that her true strength was far beyond what she was displaying on the stage at this moment.

Zhang Yu folded his arms across his chest, watching the figure on the ring, and gradually understood her plan as well.

Although the Yellow Turban Strongman was only outputting at a physical fortitude of 1.98, its own material composition was unchanged; it was still an indestructible object for students.

And Bai Zhenzhen's fighting style had always been to attack the enemy's weak points. Facing an opponent like the Yellow Turban Strongman that was impervious to blades and spears and required a head-on clash, it was obvious that she would easily be at a disadvantage.

Zhang Yu thought to himself, _My goal is to avoid strong opponents in the group stage as much as possible, to guarantee a spot in the top eight._

_It looks like Zhen knows she can't get a high score, so she's simply hiding her strength, planning to give her opponent a surprise when she encounters a powerhouse in the group stage?_

In the end, Bai Zhenzhen scored 89 points.

(End of chapter)

# Chapter 69: Hidden Spiritual Root

Soon after, the last contestant stepped down from the arena, and the scoring for all participants was complete.

During that time, two more contestants from other high schools withdrew, leaving a total of 33 participants to be divided into eight groups for the elimination tournament.

Seven of these groups had four contestants each and would proceed with one-on-one duels determined by a draw, eliminating combatants until only one remained.

The remaining group, however, consisted of five contestants; after the draw, one would receive a bye while the others fought one-on-one, again eliminating combatants until a single victor emerged.

The sole survivor from each of the eight groups would form the final top eight of the competition.

After the scoring round, there was a break. Zhang Yu stretched and decided to find a restroom with Bai Zhenzhen.

But after searching for a long time, they couldn't find a single one anywhere near the venue.

Spotting Song Hailong walking by, Zhang Yu couldn't help but ask, "Do you know where the restrooms are?"

Song Hailong smirked arrogantly. "White Dragon High School has no restrooms."

"What?" Zhang Yu was shocked. "You just go wherever you want?"

Song Hailong's face darkened. "The teachers and students of White Dragon High School have all undergone digestive system modification surgery," he said coldly. "We have no need for such backward, filthy, and time-wasting places."

Zhang Yu was speechless. "Then what are we supposed to do?"

"Go look on the first floor," Song Hailong said dismissively. "There might be some restrooms there reserved for the lower class."

So, Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen finally found two makeshift restrooms outside a hallway on the first floor, which charged ten yuan per person.

After borrowing money from Qian Shen again, the two of them finally used the facilities, grumbling the whole time.

By the time they returned to the arena, the eight groups had already been finalized.

Eight massive arenas rose into view, ready to host the elimination matches for all eight groups simultaneously.

Zhang Yu looked at the bracket and breathed a quiet sigh of relief.

_Thank goodness Zhen and I aren't in the same group._

_But her group..._

Seeing the high-scoring contestant in Bai Zhenzhen's group, Zhang Yu frowned slightly. 

_They're very strong._

It was a demon-kin contestant from Red Pagoda High School.

He had a humanoid body but the head and striped fur of a tiger, looking like some kind of anthropomorphic tiger.

Previously, when Zhang Yu had used his Heaven's Eye Talisman to investigate, a series of component analyses had appeared over the contestant's head.

Conservation | Dragon-Tiger Demon Blood | Alchemical Vat | Steel Bones

Zhang Yu recalled Lei Jun's translation: "From a demon conservation, a tiger-demon bloodline mixed with dragon's blood. He's consumed a lot of alchemical enhancers and has undergone some kind of skeletal modification surgery."

_I remember he scored 266 in the evaluation round, right?_ Zhang Yu thought. _That's the second-highest score among the Red Pagoda High School students._

Based on his performance in the scoring round, Zhang Yu's assessment was that this demon-kin, named Hu Yuntao, was a well-rounded fighter with high strength, agility, offense, and defense, showing no obvious weaknesses in combat.

_This guy didn't participate in the last Mana Competition, so he's probably not good at mana control._

_But the fact that he's in the Martial Arts Tournament means his practical combat skills must be exceptional._

Zhang Yu’s gaze swept over the sharp, gleaming claws on his hands.

_Shouldn't demons have to get declawed to compete? It's like bringing your own weapons. What a cheat._

_This has to be the kind of opponent Zhen hates most._

With a trace of concern, Zhang Yu walked toward his own group's designated area.

_Don't go broke, Zhen. I don't have any more money to lend you._

…

Bai Zhenzhen arrived at her group's competition area.

The other three contestants were already there, hailing from White Dragon High School, Purple Cloud High School, and Red Pagoda High School.

The most conspicuous among them was the contestant from Red Pagoda High School, whose tiger-headed appearance hardly seemed human.

The four of them then drew lots, and Bai Zhenzhen was matched against Hu Yuntao.

After their one-on-one match, the victor would face the winner of the other pair to determine who would advance from the group.

Bai Zhenzhen touched her lower abdomen, feeling the power latent within as she slowly walked onto the arena.

_I've held back for so long. Finally, I have a chance to use you._

_Today, it's finally my turn to soar to the heavens and astonish everyone!_

Across from her, Hu Yuntao ambled onto the stage, seemingly paying her no mind as he casually glanced around.

…

Hu Yuntao, like Xiong Bufan from the Mana Competition, came from the breeding center in the demon-kin conservation area.

But Hu Yuntao had never been ashamed of his origins, nor did he consider his demon-kin status inferior; on the contrary, deep in his bones, he held a profound pride in his race and bloodline.

For he possessed the blood of dragons; the draconic lineage flowed within him, making him far nobler than any mere mortal!

In the conservation area, his 'Father,' the director of Red Pagoda High School, would inseminate gestating females of every race each month, ensuring the mothers in the breeding center would conceive 'Father's' children.

Every month, hundreds upon thousands of demon-kin were born in the center, each bearing the dragon's blood of their 'Father' and thus destined for greatness.

From the moment of conception, these children were constantly injected with a variety of alchemical enhancers and subjected to adaptive training.

The weak work, the strong study—this was the principle Hu Yuntao learned as he grew.

Those who failed to adapt to the enhancers from a young age were sent to work in the food processing plants.

Later on, those found lacking in intelligence became workers in the ecological preserve.

And as they grew older still, those deemed to have insufficient potential were sent to work in garment factories, tanneries, textile mills, and the like.

Only by passing trial after trial, escaping one 'work opportunity' after another, could one finally reach the paradise known as Red Pagoda High School.

There, they would sign a contract with 'Father,' becoming one of his truly acknowledged sons.

Only then did they earn the opportunity to continue their studies and test into a university.

I don't want to work! I want to study! This was the cry in the heart of every demon-kin in the breeding center.

And Hu Yuntao was one such son of the School Director, having passed through countless trials to study at Red Pagoda High School.

He had endured innumerable tests, breaking free from the divergent path of labor time and again, to finally earn the right to attend high school and test for university.

Now, he would use the bloodline his father had bestowed upon him to defeat every opponent in this competition and make his father proud!

…

On the arena stage.

As the referee counted down—three, two, one—Hu Yuntao shot forward with a whoosh, his claws trailing a foul wind and a cold light, slashing toward Bai Zhenzhen like razor-sharp blades.

The woman before him was his inferior in size, strength, and speed. Hu Yuntao was confident he could shred her hands, tear open her throat, and claim total victory in the next instant.

_This one strike will cost you at least 600,000 in medical bills._

But in the next moment, a powerful sense of danger welled up within him, causing him to instinctively halt and leap backward.

He looked at Bai Zhenzhen again and sensed wisps of spiritual energy in the air surging toward her, even beginning to condense at her fingertips into what looked like a faint sword-light.

Hu Yuntao’s eyes shifted. "A combat spiritual root?"

…

In the spectator stands.

Qian Shen looked toward Bai Zhenzhen's arena and asked curiously, "What kind of spiritual root is that? I don't think I've ever seen it before. But the way it's drawing in spiritual energy is impressive. It must be a Heavenly Spiritual Root, right?"

Zhao Tianxing added, "No wonder Zhen didn't have money for food. She must have spent it all on renting a combat spiritual root. It looks like she's dead set on winning."

Considering the travel time and the hours the tournament would last, Zhao Tianxing figured the rental fee for the combat spiritual root had to be at least tens of thousands. He was secretly astonished; this Martial Arts Tournament was a truly expensive endeavor.

…

On the arena stage.

Feeling the spiritual energy suffusing her body, Bai Zhenzhen thought, _They must all think I rented a combat spiritual root for the Martial Arts Tournament._

But she knew that wasn't the case.

She would rather spend money on alchemical enhancers and cultivation techniques than on renting a spiritual root.

After all, she had a spiritual root of her own.

In order to hide this spiritual root, Bai Zhenzhen felt as if she'd been holding in the urge to use the restroom since childhood, and she had been holding it for ten years now.

"Zhen, you must control yourself. Don't absorb spiritual energy. Don't let anyone discover you have a spiritual root."

This was the first thing Bai Zhenzhen heard every single morning for countless years.

"Zhen, hold it in! Don't cause a spiritual energy disturbance. Don't let anyone discover you have a spiritual root."

Countless nights, she would be woken up and forced to regain control over her spiritual root, forcing it to cease its activity.

"Zhen, I know it's difficult, but we can only return to Songyang when you have it under control, when no one can discover your spiritual root."

It was like being surrounded by air but unable to breathe, finding water but unable to drink, or feeling the urge to relieve oneself but being denied a restroom.

Don't let them find the spiritual root!

Don't let them find the spiritual root!

Don't be discovered!

Don't be discovered!

Bai Zhenzhen held it in and held it in... until one day, she felt as if her spiritual root had been suppressed out of existence.

That was the happiest day of her life since she was old enough to understand.

After nine years of suppression, nine years of hiding, the troublesome thing was finally gone. She didn't have to hold back anymore.

But she soon discovered it hadn't disappeared, only hidden itself away. And it wasn't just the spiritual root that was hiding...

After "holding her breath" time and time again, the spiritual root had hidden her along with it.

She became like a ghost, and no one could see or perceive her... or perhaps, everyone else became like ghosts to her, and no one paid her any mind or spoke with her.

That night... it seemed as if she were the only person left in the entire world.

Until she found a way to make herself seen again.

…

Seeing the spiritual energy surging toward Bai Zhenzhen with increasing intensity, Hu Yuntao decided not to give her any more time and charged forward with a roar.

But in the next instant, Bai Zhenzhen vanished before his very eyes.

Hu Yuntao's eyes shot wide as he scanned the entire arena.

Nothing!

Nothing!

Nothing!

_A stealth-type combat spiritual root?_

To find her, he quickly retreated to a corner, his eyes scanning the entire stage before him, but he couldn't see the slightest trace of her.

Could it be...

In the next moment, he snapped his head up toward the sky, but still saw nothing!

An instant later, an extreme sense of danger washed over him.

Bai Zhenzhen had reappeared right in front of him, her finger jabbing toward his dantian.

Though the attack was sudden and perilous, Hu Yuntao's reaction was incredibly fast; the instant Bai Zhenzhen appeared, he swiped a claw toward her extended finger with lightning speed.

"Hmph! Weak and slow. Even with the element of surprise, how could you possibly beat me?"

But in the next moment, as if she had already seen through his movements, Bai Zhenzhen altered her finger-sword's path and retreated.

Hu Yuntao moved to pursue, only to feel a sharp pain at his feet as he was tripped.

It was all so perfectly timed it was as if he had actively charged forward to trip himself.

With a soft thud, Hu Yuntao watched himself tumble off the stage, his heart filled with indignation.

Roar!

"I don't accept this! I wasn't even using my full strength!"

Watching the flailing Hu Yuntao being dragged away by the scruff of his neck by the referee, Bai Zhenzhen nonchalantly flicked her fingertips.

"What an idiot. I wasn't using my full strength either."

In this match, Bai Zhenzhen was victorious!

(End of Chapter)

# Chapter 70: Suppression

Having defeated a powerful opponent, Bai Zhenzhen glanced around, expecting her victory over a top student from Red Pagoda High School to have stunned the entire crowd.

But as she looked up, she realized almost no one was paying attention to the fight in her corner of the venue.

The vast majority of the audience was watching Song Hailong, Le Mulan, and the 300-point Zhang Yu.

_Damn it!_ Bai Zhenzhen thought. _A bunch of fools blinded by scores, unable to open their eyes and see the real championship contender._

Still, Bai Zhenzhen believed that as time went on, more and more people would surely take notice of her accomplishments.

Meanwhile, the other two students in Bai Zhenzhen's group had watched her fight against Hu Yuntao intently from start to finish.

Their original intent had been to observe Hu Yuntao, since Bai Zhenzhen's performance in the scoring round had been so poor; he was the opponent they were focused on.

They hadn't expected Hu Yuntao to inexplicably run to the edge of the stage and then get tricked out of the ring with a single careless move.

From their perspective, it was clear that Bai Zhenzhen hadn't disappeared at all.

Suddenly, they recalled the 300-point Zhang Yu, who had used a similar tactic to get the Yellow Turban Strongmen out of bounds.

A thought occurred to them both: _Is this a new tactic developed by Songyang High School?_

_Using underhanded tricks to push people out of the ring, allowing the weak to defeat the strong?_

_The quality of these low-scoring students from other schools is just so poor._

Low-scoring students are of poor quality; the pair felt this accepted theorem of the three major high schools had once again been proven true.

However, despite their contempt, they both raised their guard, silently warning themselves not to be careless and suffer an embarrassing defeat if they faced Bai Zhenzhen later.

Just then, Bai Zhenzhen noticed Zhao Tianxing in the stands, waving and giving her a thumbs-up.

_Hmph, that old Zhao._ Bai Zhenzhen waved back in his direction, thinking, _As expected, you get plenty of emotional validation from these low-scoring students._

…

In the spectator stands.

Zhao Tianxing beamed while giving a thumbs-up. "Zhen saw us."

"I can't believe she beat that Hu Yuntao from Red Pagoda High School so easily."

"At first, I was honestly worried he was going to eat her."

He Dayou commented dismissively, "Just luck. That tiger-demon is a classic case of high scores but low ability. Getting tripped out of the ring like that... even I could probably beat him."

Though he had felt for Bai Zhenzhen when she struggled against the Yellow Turban Strongmen, seeing her smug look after defeating Hu Yuntao was even more vexing to him now.

Qian Shen said, "I feel... it wasn't that simple."

"Why did that tiger suddenly run to the edge of the stage?"

Just then, Zhao Tianxing pointed toward Zhang Yu. "Zhang Yu's about to go up."

Zhao Tianxing remarked with a sigh, "Good thing Yu-boy and Zhen are in different brackets, one in the upper and one in the lower. They won't have to face each other early on."

He Dayou muttered darkly, "Maybe Zhang Pianpian pulled some strings."

He thought about how he, as the son of the School Director at Songyang High, could slightly rig the lottery for the practical exams.

For a super-tycoon like Zhang Pianpian, with over 2.5 billion in savings, arranging a small convenience for her people would be nothing.

Just then, Qian Shen asked in surprise, "Dayou, look. Isn't Zhang Yu's opponent that old classmate of yours from junior high?"

He Dayou started and quickly looked toward the stage.

When he saw Zhang Yu and Chu Qiuhe walk onto the stage together, He Dayou's brow furrowed.

Zhang Yu... He Dayou definitely didn't want this poor kid who had instantly defeated him to win.

But Chu Qiuhe... He Dayou didn't particularly care about his former classmate who had always looked down on him, but if he were to defeat a contestant from Songyang High School, that would also make him deeply uncomfortable.

Damn it... caught between a rock and a hard place. Couldn't they both just be eliminated?

…

On the arena stage.

Chu Qiuhe walked to the center of the stage first, ensuring he wouldn't be too close to the edge and get carelessly pulled off.

As he walked, Chu Qiuhe could feel the vital energy surging wildly through his body. His heart pounded, and the veins on his temples bulged, all of which pointed to one thing—he had used an alchemical enhancer.

The words of his competition coach echoed in his mind: "This is the latest combat supplement. It will enhance your muscle strength and stamina, temporarily boosting your physical fortitude to a 2.2 level."

Chu Qiuhe had hesitated. "Is that really necessary?"

"Although this Zhang Yu's stats are all inferior to yours," the coach had said, "his martial skill is decent, and he's good at developing tactics. Besides... do you really think a student from a school like that wouldn't use enhancers to beat one of us?"

Now, on the stage, feeling the enhancer's power spreading through him, invigorating every muscle and ounce of vital energy, Chu Qiuhe felt better than he ever had before.

_This new enhancer is incredible!_

_I don't care about your techniques or tactics. Today, I'll crush you with absolute power._

With the countdown of three, two, one, the match began.

Chu Qiuhe lunged at Zhang Yu like a ferocious beast, leaving a trail of afterimages in his wake.

Boom!

He threw a punch, his entire body radiating a savage aura as he charged Zhang Yu like a massive truck.

Expert-level technique—Truck-Charging Fist! Level 2 Propulsion!

In ancient times, martial arts masters created techniques by observing flying birds, running beasts, mountains, rivers, the sun, and the moon.

Now, in this modern era, masters created techniques by observing bustling traffic and towering skyscrapers.

The Truck-Charging Fist was said to have been created by a martial arts master who spent three months observing a highway, grasping the artistic intent of a truck's impact and infusing the momentum of multi-ton heavy trucks into his fist style.

As a strength-based body tempering practitioner, Chu Qiuhe had chosen to cultivate the Truck-Charging Fist to perfectly leverage his natural power.

Now, as he unleashed the level-two Truck-Charging Fist with all his might, he truly seemed to transform into a terrifying hundred-ton truck, the stage groaning under his weight as he barreled head-on toward Zhang Yu.

_Faced with this attack, Zhang Yu has only one option..._

Chu Qiuhe was confident that Zhang Yu could not possibly meet his strength head-on; his only choice was to dodge.

But the Truck-Charging Fist had a counter for that.

_Once he dodges, I'll follow up with the 'Truck's Sharp Turn,' adding the force of this punch into a high-speed shift. The fist's momentum will increase by another fifty percent._

_I'll send you flying out of the ring with a single punch!_

But in the next moment, to Chu Qiuhe's surprise, Zhang Yu met his charge head-on with a palm strike wreathed in white astral qi.

Boom!

As Chu Qiuhe’s fist slammed into the Formless Cloud-Astral Qi, Zhang Yu felt a force like a stampeding herd of wild boars surging through it, threatening to tear the astral qi apart and send him flying.

Level 10 Martial Ascension Heart-Tempering Art—Total Concentration!

Everything around him instantly slowed to a crawl.

Watching Chu Qiuhe's fist sink into the astral qi inch by inch, Zhang Yu clearly and keenly discerned the trajectory of the incoming force, then slowly swirled the Formless Cloud-Astral Qi, guiding his opponent's power...

Thwack!

Chu Qiuhe felt his punch connect with the Formless Cloud-Astral Qi as if he were striking a slippery ball; his fist was guided aside, striking nothing but the air beside Zhang Yu.

But in the next instant, with a furious roar, Chu Qiuhe used his raw physical power to halt his momentum and launched another fierce punch at Zhang Yu.

Thwack!

But this punch was also deflected, leaving Chu Qiuhe wide open as he watched Zhang Yu slip inside his guard.

With a rapid-fire crackle, Zhang Yu landed three successive blows to Chu Qiuhe's chest, ribs, and abdomen.

Roar!

The combat supplement prevented Chu Qiuhe from feeling any pain. Instead, with blood rushing to his head, he forcefully brought his arms together, intending to crush Zhang Yu in a grapple.

_With my strength, if I can just grab him, I can crush him..._

But Zhang Yu seemed to anticipate his move, dodging the grapple by the narrowest of margins.

Chu Qiuhe threw another punch, only for its force to be deflected again before two more blows landed on his chest.

_Damn it... just one punch!_

_With his physique, if I can just get my Truck-Charging Fist past that astral qi and land a single solid hit on his body, I can definitely crush him!_

He felt certain that all he needed was one solid hit to win.

Roaring, Chu Qiuhe unleashed a relentless, stormy barrage of attacks.

And yet, he was the one being suppressed.

Zhang Yu was like a winged ball, dancing amid his attacks, either dodging his grapples by an impossible margin or deflecting his fists with the Formless Cloud-Astral Qi.

_He keeps hitting me..._

_Am I... being suppressed?_

_He's using pure technique to suppress me, even though I'm stronger, faster, and have more stamina?_

Chu Qiuhe couldn't believe what was happening, and in the next moment, the Formless Cloud-Astral Qi slammed into his abdomen again.

Although he still felt no pain, his seemingly endless stamina was interrupted, and his entire body froze for a fraction of a second.

_Not good... I think I'm bleeding internally._

And Zhang Yu seized that momentary stiffness immediately.

Upper abdomen... chest... shoulder... waist...

Zhang Yu struck Chu Qiuhe's body repeatedly, interrupting every attempt he made to exert force with a heavy blow.

In that moment, he felt like a giant sandbag, allowing Zhang Yu to unleash his power upon him until he collapsed limply to the floor.

_I... I lost?_

_Lost to a student from outside the three major high schools?_

At that moment, Chu Qiuhe felt he could never face his classmates at White Dragon High School again.

He could already see his social standing plummeting, being ridiculed by the entire school, becoming a slave to his countless classmates. He wished he could just jump from the roof of the thirty-story White Dragon High School building...

And then, the horror of this dark future caused him to faint dead away.

With this, Zhang Yu was victorious!

(End of Chapter)

# Chapter 71: Quarterfinals

Watching Chu Qiuhe fall at Zhang Yu's hands, Qian Shen said in astonishment, "Zhang Yu won."

Zhao Tianxing had also been observing the fight, but he hadn't understood it at all, asking in confusion, "How did he suddenly win? It felt like Zhang Yu was being completely suppressed."

Qian Shen replied thoughtfully, "Although Zhang Yu was being suppressed, if you think about it carefully... he actually blocked almost all of Chu Qiuhe's attacks. On the other hand, Chu Qiuhe, relying on his superior physique, was all offense and no defense."

He continued, a little uncertainly, "And then it seems Zhang Yu managed to land a direct hit on a vital point?"

"I heard that the old college entrance exams were purely arena battles, but combat has too many random factors. You can't select the most outstanding talents through fighting alone, which is why it was gradually revised into the current six-subject, 700-point system."

He Dayou gloated, "With this loss, Chu Qiuhe is finished at White Dragon High School."

Zhao Tianxing said, "He just lost one fight, that's a bit of an exaggeration, isn't it?"

He Dayou: "What would the consequences be if you lost to an ordinary high school?"

Zhao Tianxing's brow immediately furrowed. "What do students from ordinary high schools know about immortal cultivation? How could I possibly lose to them?"

He Dayou said flatly, "But what if you did lose?"

The sky would fall, it would be the shame of Songyang, the entire school would ridicule him, he'd end up on a rooftop... Just the thought of it sent a wave of darkness through Zhao Tianxing's mind.

Seeing the change in his expression, He Dayou let out a chuckle. "So you get it now, don't you?"

But then his eyes fell on Zhang Yu walking down from the stage, and his brow couldn't help but furrow again.

As much as Chu Qiuhe's loss secretly thrilled him, Zhang Yu's victory pained him.

...

Meanwhile, in another part of the arena.

The unconscious Chu Qiuhe was carried back to the White Dragon High School preparation area.

The competition coach glanced over but didn't rush to wake him up for a round of humiliation.

After all, only Chu Qiuhe had returned so far; the other competitors were still at the stages continuing their matches.

Of course, it was best to wait until everyone was back before making Chu Qiuhe kneel before all the students for a thorough shaming.

"To actually lose to someone from Songyang High School."

The mere thought of it made the coach's anger smolder. His upcoming bonus and performance review would be docked, he'd probably be laughed at by the other teachers, and get chewed out by the school leadership...

Just as the coach was thinking about this, another student from White Dragon High School was suddenly carried over.

The coach looked at the student on the stretcher and frowned. "And what happened to you?"

The student's face was pale as he stammered, "I beat the guy from Purple Cloud, but then Songyang High School's Bai Zhenzhen beat Hu Yuntao, and then she fought me... I lost to her."

As soon as he finished speaking, he felt the temperature around him drop by ten degrees, and he couldn't help but start trembling.

The coach said in a frigid tone, "How did you lose?"

The student lowered his head. "That Bai Zhenzhen rented a stealth-type spiritual root. She could flicker in and out of my perception."

The coach said coldly, "Her stats are so much lower than yours. Even with the element of surprise, it should have been very difficult for her to defeat you."

A trace of confusion flashed in the student's eyes. "I... I don't know either. Suddenly, she hit a vital point, and I just blacked out."

On the other stretcher, Chu Qiuhe, who had woken up long ago but had been feigning unconsciousness, suddenly breathed a sigh of relief, thinking to himself, _Thank goodness I'm not the only one who lost._

In that instant, another thought suddenly surged in Chu Qiuhe's mind.

_Zhang Yu... you'd better win a few more matches for me!_

_It would be best if you beat a few more people from White Dragon High School._

As long as Zhang Yu won enough, Chu Qiuhe felt his own loss wouldn't look so bad.

As for the wins and losses of his other classmates?

A classmate's victory couldn't be written on his resume, but a classmate's defeat would do more to preserve his own dignity.

At the same time, the battles on the various stages were all drawing to a close.

On one stage, Song Hailong let out a wild roar, grabbed his opponent, and unleashed a terrifying burst of strength, flinging the person away like a ball. The opponent crashed into the ten-meter-high ceiling with a thunderous boom, a feat that stunned the entire audience.

The White Dragon High School spectators in the stands erupted in frenzied applause, which only ceased in an instant when Song Hailong raised his right hand and clenched it into a fist.

On another stage, Le Mulan pointed a delicate finger, and streams of ice-blue mana shot out like sharp swords, piercing toward her opponent three meters away and carving out a series of sword marks.

No matter how desperately the opponent fought back, he was consistently intercepted by the ice-blue sword-light, kept at a distance of three meters. Not a single drop of his own splattered blood could get within three meters of Le Mulan.

Watching her opponent finally pass out from excessive blood loss, Le Mulan turned and slowly walked off the stage.

The Purple Cloud High School spectators in the stands were completely silent, not daring to make a sound. But the cheers for Song Hailong from the distant White Dragon section made Le Mulan frown.

"So noisy."

In the blink of an eye, all eight groups had determined their winners, and the top eight of the martial arts competition were officially decided.

Besides Zhang Yu, Bai Zhenzhen, Song Hailong, and Le Mulan, the top eight also included Lian Tianji, two students from Red Pagoda High School, and another student from White Dragon High School.

Zhang Yu looked at the match schedule for the quarterfinals.

"My first fight is against Lian Tianji, and after that, I'll have to face... the winner between Song Hailong and the other Red Pagoda student."

By Zhang Yu's own judgment, the Red Pagoda student was likely no match for Song Hailong.

This meant that if he wanted a shot at the championship, he would have to defeat Lian Tianji first, then Song Hailong.

_But by comparison, Zhen's side of the bracket is even more difficult._

Zhang Yu glanced at the lower half of the bracket. Bai Zhenzhen needed to first defeat the top-ranked 300-point student from Red Pagoda High School, and then overcome Le Mulan from Purple Cloud High School, just to meet him in the final for the championship.

There wasn't much time for Zhang Yu to reflect, as the quarterfinal matches began almost immediately.

The number of stages in the arena was reduced from eight to four.

Zhang Yu walked onto the stage and saw that Lian Tianji was already waiting there.

Upon seeing Zhang Yu, Lian Tianji's eyes lit up. "Zhang Yu, I saw the replay of your last fight. It was a spectacular battle."

"To be able to use technique to suppress an opponent superior in strength, speed, and stamina—your understanding of the martial Dao has already surpassed my own."

"However, real combat is never just a contest of a single dimension."

With that, he swung the backpack from his back to his front. "And out of respect for you, I will now fight you with my full strength."

As soon as he finished speaking, Lian Tianji pulled a bottle of alchemical enhancer from his backpack and prepared to drink it.

Zhang Yu was already used to the sight of his opponent preparing to use enhancers. This was just how things were in Songyang City; this was the full strength of a high school student!

But just then, the referee on the side walked over and actually stopped Lian Tianji from drinking.

Now it was Zhang Yu's turn to be surprised. _Are enhancers banned in this competition?_

_Is this still Kunxu?_

However, after the referee inspected Lian Tianji's backpack and confirmed that all the drugs were compliant with regulations, he simply said, "Everything is fine, you may continue."

So, Lian Tianji first drank a bottle of enhancer, then swallowed a few capsules, and then began to pull out a syringe to inject into his arm.

As the drugs entered his system, Lian Tianji's body underwent a noticeable change.

His muscles seemed to swell, green veins bulged on the surface of his skin, and his breathing became deeper and heavier...

Watching his opponent continuously take more and more enhancers, Zhang Yu was speechless.

_Seriously... could you please stop respecting me? Can't you just look down on me and underestimate me?_

Then Zhang Yu gradually noticed something was off.

As Lian Tianji was injecting the enhancers, he was also reciting something to the side.

"I've been on this combat stimulant for three months. The effects are fantastic. It rapidly unleashes muscle potential, suppresses pain..."

Zhang Yu looked at another person from Purple Cloud High standing nearby, filming Lian Tianji with a phone, and couldn't help but ask, "Are you guys filming a commercial?"

Lian Tianji replied, "I often share my study and cultivation routines online and through live streams. I'm taking this opportunity to recommend some reliable and effective combat enhancers to my fans."

He then added, "Student Zhang Yu, you shouldn't be so dismissive of this."

"On the long road of the Immortal Dao, learning to earn money, and having the ability to earn money, is a very important matter."

"As the saying goes, 'Wealth is the path up the mountain of books, and riches are the boat on the endless sea of learning.' Those who only know how to spend money but not how to make it will not go far on the path of cultivation."

Zhang Yu looked at the referee and asked, "Can we start now?"

The referee shot him a sideways glance. "You want to start before he's even done taking his enhancers? Don't you think that would be an dishonorable victory?"

_What the hell..._ Zhang Yu was completely done. "Fine, fine, take all you want."

A moment later.

"My apologies for the wait." Lian Tianji cupped his fist toward Zhang Yu. "Then... let us begin."

As the referee's countdown of 3, 2, 1 finished, both of them shot forward like lightning and collided with a thunderous boom.

Every clash between Lian Tianji's fists and Zhang Yu's Formless Cloud-Astral Qi produced a deafening sound.

Zhang Yu could feel an explosive force contained within his opponent's punches. The moment it made contact with his astral qi, it would detonate, scattering his Formless Cloud-Astral Qi and forcing him to constantly draw on his mana to replenish it.

This was Lian Tianji's expert-level cultivation technique—Explosive Wave Fist! Level 3 Push!

This fist art, inspired by the explosion of dynamite and the shockwaves of airflow, converted mana into a specialized form known as explosive fist-force. It could detonate the projected mana upon impact, not only doubling its power but also making it unpredictable and incredibly difficult to redirect.

Lian Tianji thought to himself, _The Limitless Cloud Hand excels at using the Formless Cloud-Astral Qi to borrow and redirect force._

_But my Explosive Wave Fist is an explosive force. The Formless Cloud-Astral Qi can't redirect it; it will just be blasted apart._

_Zhang Yu's strength is less than mine, and his mana is not as abundant. He shouldn't be able to hold out for much longer._

In theory, that should have been the case.

But to Lian Tianji's astonishment, not only could Zhang Yu block his moves at the last possible second with perfect timing, but he was also gradually beginning to redirect his explosive fist-force, using it against him.

It was Zhang Yu using the Imperishable Seal Art to channel and shift Lian Tianji's mana.

"He can actually redirect my fist-force? This means that in addition to the Limitless Cloud Hand, he is also skilled in another profound martial art that can leverage an opponent's mana."

At this thought, Lian Tianji burst into laughter. "Zhang Yu, you truly have not disappointed me."

Just then, the person from Purple Cloud below the stage said, "Lord Lian Tianji, the sponsor said that if you can't defeat your opponent within a minute, they're going to dock your pay."

Lian Tianji's face darkened. "I know."

Zhang Yu felt his opponent's demeanor shift abruptly. The smile was gone, and his eyes now held faint traces of killing intent.

At the same time, the spiritual energy in the air began to churn and roil.

Zhang Yu's eyes narrowed.

_Did Lian Tianji also bring a combat spiritual root to the competition?_

(End of Chapter)

---

# Chapter 72: A Bloody Battle

The fight could be taken slowly; Lian Tianji was in no hurry.

Although Zhang Yu's formidable technique compensated for much of the physical gap between them, Lian Tianji was still confident he could defeat him.

He was more than willing to spend a little more time fighting, to confront and learn from Zhang Yu's powerful techniques in the heat of battle.

After all, a martial arts competition was not a true life-or-death struggle. Absorbing nutrients during combat and becoming stronger was, in Lian Tianji's view, equally important.

But since the sponsor required him to finish the opponent quickly to showcase the effectiveness of the combat enhancers, he could no longer afford to drag things out.

Although both learning through combat and earning money through advertising could make one stronger...

Ultimately, the power of money was more important.

"My apologies, Zhang Yu."

"Though I'd like to exchange pointers with you a while longer, the sponsor's request cannot be ignored."

So, Lian Tianji directly activated the combat spiritual root he had rented. As the spiritual energy in the air stirred, it began to converge upon his hands.

Combat Spiritual Root—Surge.

Spiritual energy would continuously flood his body, actively participating in his mana circulation during combat to amplify the power of his martial arts.

It had a particularly miraculous effect when paired with his Explosive Wave Fist.

At this moment, he once again threw a punch at Zhang Yu, the surging force of the blow rushing forward.

The strike detonated the spiritual energy surrounding his fist, creating a shockwave that slammed mercilessly into Zhang Yu.

This method not only increased the power of the Explosive Wave Fist but also expanded its attack range several times over.

This meant Lian Tianji's fist didn't even need to touch Zhang Yu or his Formless Cloud-Astral Qi; the explosive shockwave could bombard Zhang Yu from a distance.

Boom! Boom! Boom! Boom! Boom!

One punch after another, Lian Tianji seemed to transform into a human cannon, relentlessly bombarding Zhang Yu.

The surging waves of energy instantly engulfed Zhang Yu's figure.

But just as Lian Tianji thought this series of attacks would be enough to defeat him.

To his astonished gaze, Zhang Yu, who was already covered in blood from the blasts, suddenly smashed through the shockwave, his hands wreathed in layers of white mist, and charged violently toward him.

"You're still fighting when you're this badly injured?"

"Aren't you afraid of going bankrupt?"

Though he didn't understand Zhang Yu's choice, Lian Tianji's fighting spirit soared with the advertisement running, and he wouldn't hold back in the slightest while on camera.

And so, the two unyielding fighters crashed into each other.

Fist-winds and palm-shadows devoured one another.

Amidst the deafening explosions, Lian Tianji felt his fists repeatedly hammering into Zhang Yu's body, while Zhang Yu's hands, coated in Formless Cloud-Astral Qi, also slammed into his own body again and again.

This left Lian Tianji even more bewildered.

_Has he lost the focus to maintain his technique?_

_He's actually choosing to trade injuries with me in a brawl?_

Smack! Smack!

Watching Zhang Yu's skin split open and blood erupt under the force of his Explosive Wave Fist, Lian Tianji predicted that his opponent couldn't last much longer.

But ten seconds later... the opponent was still trading blows with him.

Twenty seconds later... there was still no sign of him stopping.

"How is this possible!"

Lian Tianji stared at Zhang Yu, who, despite being covered in blood, was still as fierce as a dragon. In contrast, he himself had been hit in more and more places, and his injuries were gradually starting to warp the form of his fist technique.

At this moment, Lian Tianji found it utterly unbelievable.

_What kind of enhancers did he take?_

Meanwhile, inside Zhang Yu's body, astral qi rolled and surged, flowing like a great river through his entire being.

After his Limitless Cloud Hand reached level 10, Zhang Yu could already generate Formless Cloud-Astral Qi from any part of his body.

This meant he could circulate the Formless Cloud-Astral Qi to any location in his body without causing the slightest harm to himself.

So, after deciding to hide his level 10 Limitless Cloud Hand, he had devised a new tactic, which he called—Subcutaneous Astral Qi.

He circulated the Formless Astral Qi to various parts of his body but kept it hidden beneath his skin, not letting it erupt outwards.

Right now, the Formless Astral Qi was like a suit of armor worn under his skin, absorbing the various injuries that penetrated his flesh.

This was why, although Zhang Yu appeared to be drenched in blood, his wounds were merely superficial, without any real damage to his muscles or bones.

Conversely, as Lian Tianji traded blows with Zhang Yu, he was repeatedly rocked by the backlash from the Formless Cloud-Astral Qi, his own strength rebounding against him.

In particular, the more impatient he became, the more forcefully he struck, the more ferocious his attacks, the more tumultuous and overwhelming was the force that returned from Zhang Yu's body.

It was only the painkillers that suppressed these sensations, allowing him to continue fighting at full power.

But after the injuries steadily accumulated...

_Oomph!_

Lian Tianji suddenly coughed up a large mouthful of blood, feeling his body begin to tremble slightly.

"My strength, speed, and stamina are all clearly superior to his."

"In a close-quarters brawl, I'm actually losing?"

Looking at the blood-soaked Zhang Yu, who was obviously more heavily injured than he was, Lian Tianji couldn't understand why he hadn't collapsed yet.

"What's the point of winning like this? Can you even afford the medical fees?"

Just then, the person from Purple Cloud below the stage shouted, "Lord Lian Tianji, the sponsor is very displeased. If you can't defeat Zhang Yu in the next 30 seconds, they're pulling the ad and canceling all future collaborations..."

Pull the ad? Cancel collaborations?

Hearing these words, Lian Tianji's fighting spirit instantly surged. Like a startled beast, a new wave of strength emanated from his body.

"Must! Immediately! Now! Defeat! Zhang! Yu!"

Explosive Wave Fist! Self-Destruct Mode!

Using both spiritual energy and mana to fuel the explosion for this punch.

Accepting grievous injury to his arm in the pursuit of the absolute limit of his power.

In this moment, Lian Tianji unleashed his ultimate strength.

His right arm swelled violently as spiritual energy and mana poured into it.

Bang!

As Lian Tianji stomped his foot, the entire stage shook violently.

The next moment, his right arm, wrapped in a thick mist of blood, hurtled toward Zhang Yu with power that surpassed all limits!

Facing this ferociously powerful punch, Zhang Yu dared not be the least bit careless. The astral qi within him surged as he simultaneously activated the Limitless Cloud Hand and the Imperishable Seal Art.

The Formless Cloud-Astral Qi, now stained a crimson red with blood, met Lian Tianji's attack head-on.

In the next instant, their fist and palm connected. A violent explosion erupted from the stage, reverberating throughout the entire arena like a string of muffled thunder, drawing the attention of countless spectators.

Zhang Yu's entire body was once again blasted by the force, turning an even deeper shade of red.

The power crashed against him like a tidal wave, pushing him toward the edge of the stage.

Thud! Thud! Thud! Thud!

But after four consecutive steps, to Lian Tianji's disappointment, he stood his ground firmly.

"You managed to neutralize even that punch? Your martial technique..."

Zhang Yu smiled faintly and said, "Thank you for the pressure you gave me in this fight. It finally allowed my Limitless Cloud Hand to break through its limit and reach level 4."

Hearing that Zhang Yu had achieved a breakthrough in the middle of their fight, Lian Tianji gave a bitter smile and finally collapsed to the ground.

At this moment, Lian Tianji's right arm was severely injured, and the pain from his other wounds flared up all at once, leaving him completely unable to fight on.

Lian Tianji said, "It's probably not just the Limitless Cloud Hand, is it? That art alone couldn't have held me off for so long."

Zhang Yu nodded, giving his prepared response. "I also trained in the mana-redirecting Imperishable Seal Art, and a body-hardening martial art."

Pretending to have trained in a body-hardening art to conceal the effect of his Subcutaneous Astral Qi—this was Zhang Yu's plan.

Lian Tianji nodded in understanding, his gaze toward Zhang Yu now filled with an incredibly complex mix of emotions.

"With Songyang High School's resources, you were actually able to master three such martial arts in just half a year of school, enough to close the gap in physical strength between us... Your talent for the martial Dao is something I truly envy."

The first-aid team quickly rushed onto the stage, lifted Lian Tianji onto a stretcher, and carried him away for treatment.

The blood-soaked Zhang Yu was also being carried away, but as soon as he saw a medic approaching, he quickly raised a hand to stop him, shouting, "Wait! First, tell me how much it'll cost to treat these injuries! And how much will insurance cover?"

Zhang Yu was genuinely afraid of winning on the stage only to be bankrupted off it and forced to withdraw.

The emergency medic frowned. "You're this injured and you have time to worry about that?"

In the medic's eyes, the blood-drenched Zhang Yu wasn't bleeding blood; he was bleeding money.

Injuries this severe? If he didn't charge at least a few hundred thousand, it would be a disgrace to his medical license.

The medic began his examination, saying, "With injuries this severe, if we don't treat them immediately..."

He suddenly paused. "Huh? There don't seem to be any major injuries?"

Protected by the Subcutaneous Astral Qi, combined with his extreme focus and precise control, Zhang Yu had constantly avoided having his vital points attacked and prevented repeated blows to the same areas... This made his injuries far less severe than they appeared.

"They're just superficial wounds?"

The medic said in surprise, "Five thousand for the examination, fifteen thousand for treatment, and another ten thousand for alchemical enhancers. These are all standard items, covered by insurance. Shall we begin?"

Hearing the quote, Zhang Yu was stunned. "That expensive?"

The medic said impatiently, "If you don't get treated properly, how are you going to participate in the next matches? It's all covered by insurance anyway, what are you afraid of?"

"Fine, fine, treat me."

Zhang Yu sighed internally. _Ugh, my insurance premiums are going to go up now._

...

In the White Dragon High School rest area.

"This Lian Tianji has some skill."

"The physical strength he's displaying must be around 2.3, right?"

"That fist art is formidable. Paired with his combat spiritual root, his overall combat strength at Purple Cloud High should be second only to Le Mulan's..."

"That student from Songyang High is being completely suppressed. He should be losing soon..."

But a moment later, to the utter shock of the White Dragon High School students, it was Lian Tianji who lay defeated on the stage while Zhang Yu remained standing, completely upending their expectations.

"Lian Tianji actually lost?"

"This Zhang Yu managed to bridge such a massive gap with just martial skill..."

"And the enhancers! He must have taken some incredibly potent combat enhancers to last until the end."

"Looking at it this way, Old Chu losing to this Zhang Yu doesn't seem so outrageous after all."

On his stretcher, Chu Qiuhe, who had been feigning unconsciousness, felt his eyelids twitch slightly. He thought to himself, _Go for it, Zhang Yu!_

At this moment, Chu Qiuhe desperately wanted Zhang Yu to keep winning. Though he knew it was impossible, he couldn't help but hope that Zhang Yu would somehow blast Song Hailong off the stage and take the championship.

He felt that he was probably the one person in the entire arena who most wanted Zhang Yu to win, since it was directly tied to his own reputation and status at White Dragon High School for the next two and a half years.

After all, losing to someone from Songyang? That was just pathetic.

But losing to the champion of the martial arts competition? Well, that would just mean the opponent was too strong, and it was hardly his fault for losing.

(End of Chapter)

# Chapter 73: A Raging Storm

Just as Zhang Yu and Lian Tianji were walking onto the arena stage.

On another stage.

Bai Zhenzhen sat cross-legged, awaiting her opponent from Red Pagoda High School, Xiong Wenwu, a demon-kin student over 2.7 meters tall and weighing nearly a ton; like Song Hailong and Zhang Yu, he was also a high schooler who had achieved a score of 300.

At this moment, the demon-kin student was in the Red Pagoda High School rest area, glaring at Hu Yuntao.

“You lost? Why did you lose? And to someone from Songyang?”

Xiong Wenwu slapped Hu Yuntao’s forehead again and again, and the same Hu Yuntao who was so ferocious on the stage was now like a little kitten, obediently squatting before him for a scolding.

However, the tail swishing restlessly behind his backside betrayed the impatience in his heart.

With deep disappointment, Xiong Wenwu said, “Failing to even pass the group stage means you don’t get a ranking at all, and that’s one less good result on your resume.”

“Do you have any idea that this one missing result could get you rejected from your university interviews?”

“If you can’t get into a good university, Father will disown you and send you straight to the factories to work!”

Disowned! Sent to the factories!

Hu Yuntao, who had been listening obediently, couldn’t help but stiffen at these words.

Why did so many demons from the conservation area have no fathers? It was because demons who couldn’t succeed in their studies and could only work were directly disowned by their fathers.

“Do you know what working in a factory means?”

Xiong Wenwu continued his tirade, “It’s hard for demons to find jobs, so you’ll have no choice but to work in Father’s factory, where you’ll undergo modification and be grafted onto the assembly line, eating, drinking, and defecating there until you die, just like those ox demons, horse demons, and monkey demons, spending your entire life paying off your breeding loan.”

Hu Yuntao’s fists clenched as he recalled a factory he had once visited, where countless workers were fused with an assembly line forged from the flesh and blood of a great demon, working day and night without rest. The thought of all the demon-kin seniors on those lines—those who had almost finished elementary school, middle school, or high school—filled his heart with a surge of fear.

“After more than ten years of difficult study to get into high school, is your final destination really the factory?”

Xiong Wenwu continued to berate him, “If you reach the peak in university, with a degree from a prestigious school in hand, who would dare disown you? Who could drag you off to a factory?”

Hu Yuntao’s face was filled with shame. “Big Brother, I know I was wrong. In the next competition, I’ll give it my all and won’t be the least bit complacent again.”

Xiong Wenwu sighed, “I just don’t want to see your years of hard study go to waste, to see you unable to attend university and instead be grafted onto an assembly line for the rest of your miserable life after graduation. Father would lose a good son, and I would lose another brother.”

“What happens from here on out depends on your own performance.”

“As for today’s matter, I’ll start by avenging you.”

With that, he turned and strode quickly toward the arena stage.

Hu Yuntao called out a reminder from behind him, “Big Brother, that girl has a stealth-type spiritual root that can reduce an opponent’s perception. You have to be careful…”

Xiong Wenwu waved his hand dismissively, then broke into a sprint and leaped, his nearly one-ton body descending like a small mountain, causing the entire stage to boom and shake violently.

“Woman, I never know what it means to hold back in a real fight. If you feel like you’re about to die, just hurry up and surrender.”

After saying this, Xiong Wenwu took out three syringes and jabbed them forcefully into his own neck.

With a hissing sound, three tubes of alchemical enhancers were instantly pushed into his veins, causing every hair on his body to stand on end and the muscles on his bear-like face to bulge.

Just looking at her opponent’s height and weight, Bai Zhenzhen could feel the astonishing power he contained.

And based on Lei Jun's prior assessment, Bai Zhenzhen knew that this demon-kin student, Xiong Wenwu, likely possessed the greatest physical strength among all the first-year high school students present.

_Approximately between 2.5 and 2.6._

Hooo…

Exhaling deeply, Bai Zhenzhen also felt the release of the spiritual root within her.

At this moment, she felt as if a restraint on her mind had been lifted, and countless martial arts moves she had learned and witnessed surged through her thoughts, coming alive.

Ever since entering high school and beginning her martial arts training.

She, who had once only known how to use her spiritual root for concealment… had started to gain a deeper and deeper understanding of martial arts after being exposed to them, not only learning them faster and faster but also gradually being able to see the flaws in various techniques after actual combat.

3, 2, 1, begin!

As the referee’s whistle blew, Xiong Wenwu leaped up abruptly, diving forward like a cannonball.

_I can’t block it head-on, I can only retreat first._

Bai Zhenzhen shot backward, and at the same time, a flicker of spiritual energy appeared at her fingertips as a sharp sword qi burst forth from her body.

Expert-level cultivation technique—Body-Piercing Sword Qi, Level 3.

A foot-long blade of sword qi extended from Bai Zhenzhen’s fingertip, stabbing toward the freshly landed Xiong Wenwu.

But as a flurry of fur scattered through the air, Bai Zhenzhen felt as if her sword had struck a steel plate. After cutting through the fur and outer skin, it struggled to penetrate deeper into the muscle.

_A protective cultivation technique? And the effect of a combat spiritual root, plus immense physical strength…_

Bai Zhenzhen’s brow furrowed, and in the next moment, her figure vanished from Xiong Wenwu’s sight.

But Xiong Wenwu was prepared for this. Without the slightest hesitation, like a rampaging beast, his claws glinted with a cold light as he attacked the spot where Bai Zhenzhen had disappeared, relentlessly and without pause, like a raging storm.

While attacking, Xiong Wenwu was also sniffing the air wildly with his nose, apparently trying to determine Bai Zhenzhen’s position by scent.

Bai Zhenzhen’s eyes widened as she watched his movements. With the enhancement of her spiritual root, she could clearly see the spiritual energy fluctuations caused by his every action and every move.

She could even faintly predict his subsequent attacks based on the flow of this spiritual energy in the air.

But even when combining this with her stealth ability, after a series of last-second dodges, wounds began to appear on her arms, thighs, and waist.

The claws swept past her skin and muscle like a searing blade slicing through butter, easily leaving behind terrifying wounds with flesh curling at the edges.

In contrast, her Body-Piercing Sword Qi could only ever shave off some of his fur, leaving behind a few insignificant scratches.

_There’s just too great a difference in power and speed._

_At most, I have another four or five seconds before I’m defeated._

Despite this, Bai Zhenzhen felt incredibly calm at this moment.

As her opponent executed more and more moves and the surrounding spiritual energy grew denser, his techniques and body became clearer in her eyes.

In her vision, Xiong Wenwu was like a gigantic furnace, with more and more spiritual energy and mana condensing within him, burning fiercely to power his formidable physique.

Beyond that, Bai Zhenzhen could also see that Xiong Wenwu’s skin was densely covered in spiritual energy, as if he were wearing it like a suit of armor.

_No weaknesses anywhere on his body… No, there are weaknesses._

As another set of claw marks, deep enough to reveal bone, was carved into her calf, Bai Zhenzhen gradually saw her opponent’s flaws.

Flaws in his techniques… flaws in his body…

Finally, she took a step, like a butterfly dancing gracefully in a storm.

Step by step, she passed through the biting cold that rushed toward her, step by step, she evaded the deadly sharpness.

_I don’t want to be stuck on the first floor working for the rest of my life…_

_I want to get into one of the Ten Greats!_

_I want to walk further on the path of cultivation!_

The sword qi at Bai Zhenzhen’s fingertip roared as she slashed toward the flaw in her vision.

…

In the spectator stands.

Qian Shen and the other two stared wide-eyed at the clash between Xiong Wenwu and Bai Zhenzhen.

Xiong Wenwu’s assault was too fierce, his movements too swift, pressing down on Bai Zhenzhen like a clap of thunder.

It was so intense that the three of them couldn't spare a single thought to speak, and even from a distance, they felt the illusion of being crushed by his presence.

Bai Zhenzhen’s figure appeared especially tiny in front of Xiong Wenwu, giving off a feeling of being far too fragile.

Qian Shen thought to himself, _He’s too ferocious. Just a glancing blow breaks the skin, and if she takes a direct hit, Bai Zhenzhen will be severely injured, if not dead._

_She’s going to lose…_

Seeing a spray of blood erupt from Bai Zhenzhen’s calf as another wound was added, the three of them couldn’t help but feel their hearts sink, as if they could already see her mangled body.

But in the very next moment, they watched in shock as Bai Zhenzhen passed through the storm of claw shadows, then sent a reverse slash of sword qi outward.

Xiong Wenwu’s figure seemed to pause slightly, and then a great spray of blood erupted from his back.

Zhao Tianxing said in astonishment, “Did she break through his defense?”

He Dayou added, “She couldn’t even get through Xiong Wenwu’s muscles before, how did it suddenly work now?”

Qian Shen frowned in deep thought. “Could it be that she struck a flaw in his cultivation technique?”

Watching the blood gushing more and more violently from Xiong Wenwu’s back, gradually resembling a fountain, Qian Shen exclaimed in shock, “Did she hit an artery? The amount of blood is terrifying!”

In the arena on the other side.

Lei Jun watched Xiong Wenwu, who was hemorrhaging from behind, and as he looked at the location of the bleeding, his eyes suddenly lit up.

“It’s a hemorrhoid! And an external one!”

“That’s right, most of the demon clan originally walked on all fours. After taking human form to study and cultivate, they have to sit for long periods every day, so their hemorrhoids must be more severe and larger.”

“Especially an external one that’s already outside the body, unprotected by his body tempering cultivation technique!”

“On top of that, Xiong Wenwu was just moving violently and took so many potent drugs, his whole body is engorged with blood, making this hemorrhage even worse.”

Lei Jun grew excited. “To think she could find such a weakness! It really wasn't a waste of my time tutoring you for so long…”

But in the next moment, Xiong Wenwu’s eyes on the stage turned crimson, and he let out a furious roar like that of a dying beast.

Xiong Wenwu roared in his heart, _I want to study! I don’t want to die on an assembly line! I want to always be my father’s son!_

In the next instant, as Xiong Wenwu spun at high speed, a sky full of blood and claw shadows shot out in all directions.

“Not good!” Lei Jun’s gaze hardened. “This demon has gone berserk! He’s attacking completely at random…”

Looking at Bai Zhenzhen, whose leg was injured and who was now caught in Xiong Wenwu’s onslaught, he knew that with her movements restricted by her injury, it would be extremely difficult for her to dodge such a chaotic, patternless attack.

By the time Lei Jun reached the side of the stage.

He saw that Xiong Wenwu had already collapsed to the ground, covered in blood.

Nearby, Bai Zhenzhen stood gasping for breath, and besides the scratches all over her body, there was nothing below her right elbow.

Her right arm had been torn off by the frenzied Xiong Wenwu.

Bai Zhenzhen wins!

Lei Jun quickly picked up her severed arm and carried Bai Zhenzhen to the first-aid area.

The emergency doctor took one look and couldn’t help but laugh internally, but when he turned to see his colleague taking over Xiong Wenwu’s case, he couldn’t help but feel a twinge of envy.

_Massive blood loss, cultivation overexertion, organ failure, plus hemorrhoid surgery, and his physical strength is so high… that bear demon will cost at least several hundred thousand._

With a sigh, he turned his attention back to Bai Zhenzhen.

But just as he was about to act, Bai Zhenzhen struggled and said, “How much is it? Is it covered by insurance?”

The emergency doctor said flatly, “Examination, basic treatment, and reattaching the arm will be eighty-eight thousand for you. The remaining thirty thousand for other procedures isn’t covered by insurance, you’ll have to pay out of pocket.”

“Out of pocket?” Bai Zhenzhen said angrily, “I have insurance and you want me to pay thirty thousand out of pocket?”

The doctor ignored her and simply urged, “If you want treatment, do it now. If the arm becomes severely necrotic, I won’t be able to treat it here. By the time you get to a hospital, it might cost you upwards of three hundred thousand.”

(End of Chapter)

---

# Chapter 74: Poor, The Semifinals

In the semifinals, Xiong Wenwu's massive blood loss was clearly the most eye-catching event.

Many spectators looked over because of all the blood on the ground, then were surprised to find that a student from Songyang High School had actually defeated Red Pagoda High School's strongest contender this time.

Hu Yuntao rushed over immediately, taking Xiong Wenwu for treatment.

When he heard that Xiong Wenwu's hemorrhage was caused by a hemorrhoid, Hu Yuntao subconsciously clenched his buttocks.

_What do I do about this? Does it mean relying on surgery? Go to the hospital for hemorrhoid surgery every time it recurs?_

The thought of the repeated surgical fees made Hu Yuntao’s heart ache.

_Damn it! Why do I also have external hemorrhoids! Why couldn’t they be internal! If they were internal, they would be protected by my body tempering cultivation technique, and I wouldn’t have to spend money on surgery._

The competition coach at his side patted his shoulder and smiled.

“Silly boy, what do people do when they discover their head is being targeted as a weakness?”

“They practice Iron Head Kung Fu, of course!” Hu Yuntao’s eyes lit up. “Are you saying?”

“That’s right.” The coach’s gaze suddenly turned cold, and looking at Hu Yuntao and the now-bandaged Xiong Wenwu, he said frigidly, “Prepare for ascetic training as soon as you get back to school. School Director Long is extremely dissatisfied with your performance this time.”

The emergency doctor, listening to their conversation nearby, couldn't help but think, _The head is a vital point. Couldn’t he just wear a helmet?_

…

In another part of the first-aid area.

Hearing the doctor’s price, Bai Zhenzhen’s expression darkened. After asking a few more times, she suddenly said, “For these scratches on my body, don’t worry about cosmetic repairs or preventing scars. Just use the fastest and simplest treatment method. That should all be covered by insurance, right?”

The emergency doctor sighed helplessly. “Fine, fine. Then ninety-eight thousand covered by insurance, but these wounds on your body will definitely leave scars…”

As he spoke, the doctor circulated his mana, his hands a flurry of afterimages as he began cleaning, reattaching the arm, suturing, stopping the bleeding… applying various medicines… and finally infusing a type of healing mana into Bai Zhenzhen’s body to accelerate her wound recovery.

Although the fee wasn't cheap, the doctor's skills were indeed excellent.

After just over half an hour, Bai Zhenzhen felt that the majority of her injuries had already healed.

However, scars were left on her arms, thighs, calves, and waist.

After being sent back to the rest area, Bai Zhenzhen swung her arm and smiled. “His technique isn’t bad. I feel like using it at eighty or ninety percent strength won’t be a problem.”

As for the scars on her body, Bai Zhenzhen naturally didn’t care.

Procedures like cosmetic surgery and scar removal were things only rich people did; they had nothing to do with her.

Lei Jun, however, looked at Bai Zhenzhen with a complex expression and said, “Are you planning to continue competing?”

Bai Zhenzhen smiled. “Of course. As long as I beat that Le Mulan in the next match, I can meet Yu-boy in the finals, right? Then we’ll get first and second place, and you’ll look good too, Old Lei.”

Lei Jun sighed. “But you’ve already used up most of your insurance coverage. I’ve seen Le Mulan’s fighting style; her sword qi is sharp and has a wide attack range. If you fight her… the medical bill could easily climb to over a hundred thousand, or even several hundred thousand.”

Bai Zhenzhen fell silent at his words.

Lei Jun said, “You’ve already made it to the top four, which is an excellent achievement to put on your resume. Why risk continuing the competition?”

What he left unsaid was… _After all, you aren't aiming for one of the Ten Greats, so winning first place in the martial arts competition isn't that important for you._

Lei Jun continued to persuade her, “Your fighting style makes you prone to injury. If you had a few hundred thousand on hand and didn’t have to worry about post-match treatment, I would never advise you against it.”

“But are you sure you want to take on a debt of over a hundred thousand, possibly even several hundred thousand, for this martial arts competition?”

Seeing that Bai Zhenzhen was still silent, Lei Jun advised helplessly, “Zhen, we’re different from those rich people. When we compete, we also have to consider the cost-effectiveness.”

Just then, a figure limped over in pain. It was Zhang Yu, who had just finished his treatment.

Seeing Zhang Yu covered in injuries, Lei Jun sighed inwardly. _It seems Zhang Yu won’t be able to continue competing either._

However, Zhang Yu stretched his arms and legs and said, “Don’t worry, Old Lei, I was careful during the fight. I didn’t injure any vital points, it’s all just superficial wounds.”

“Plus, I just mastered a new body hardening technique yesterday, so the injuries only look serious. The insurance only cost me thirty thousand…”

Lei Jun was skeptical at first, but after checking Zhang Yu’s condition, he looked at him in surprise.

“You kid, you really didn’t get hurt much, did you?”

“I’ll go get you two something to eat and drink. You guys hurry up and rest.”

Not long after Lei Jun left, Zhang Yu, while looking at his phone, said to the silent Bai Zhenzhen beside him,

“Zhen, I heard what you guys were talking about. You know I’ve maxed out all my available credit, so I can’t get much more, but I can borrow some from my sister.”

“But it’s not easy for my sister either. I asked, and I can borrow at most two hundred thousand from her. Do you think that’s enough for your next match?”
