Through his recent training, Li Yong had learned that the sports competition was not an event where victory was decided simply by comparing physical strength numbers.

Otherwise, they could just rank all the high school students in Songyang by their numbers and be done with it. Why even hold a competition?

The physical strength number was just a foundation. What the sports competition truly tested… was how effectively a student could utilize their flesh and blood.

_Bai Zhenzhen has the support of a tycoon like Zhang Pianpian, so her funding is surely more abundant than mine. But I refuse to believe her training this past month has been more diligent or focused than mine. Her control over her body's strength might not even be as good as mine._

_Plus, in the special training program, my fascial self-limitation was surgically released. My muscles can burst with overloaded power… I can definitely defeat her!_

As he hyped himself up internally, Li Yong pointed at Bai Zhenzhen. "I want to compete with you to see who is stronger. Do you dare?"

Before anyone else could speak, Bai Zhenzhen was already smiling with anticipation, shouting a resounding "yes" in her mind.

_Today is my stage. It's not Yu-boy's turn to show off._

But the thought that Zhang Yu couldn't continue his show of dominance because his score was too high for anyone to challenge made her feel a little less gleeful.

She looked at Li Yong, adopting the cool, unapproachable demeanor of an ice queen, and said flatly, "How do you want to compete?"

Li Yong strode forward. "Alright, then we'll compete by…"

"Insolence," Lan Ling snapped. "This is to decide the school's competition spots, not a childish game for the two of you. The specific event will be decided by me and the teachers."

And so, after a brief discussion, it was decided that Bai Zhenzhen and Li Yong would compare their physical strength through barbell weightlifting.

Of course, as in all sports competitions, the use of mana was forbidden. The contest was one of pure physical power.

Consequently, both of them had detection patches placed on their bodies to monitor any mana circulation.

Zhang Yu watched this scene unfold and thought, _Looks like I'll have to stop the Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method during the competition. It's a shame to lose that period of passive breathing._

Zhang Yu could, of course, stop the passive breathing of the Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method at will. After all, it was a breathing exercise he had mastered.

On the other side, Li Yong approached a 1500-kilogram barbell. He gripped the bar, and with a thunderous roar and a face flushed crimson, he heaved the barbell into the air.

After holding it for five seconds, the 1500-kilogram barbell slammed back to the ground with a deafening crash, bouncing several times.

Li Yong looked at Bai Zhenzhen with a grave expression. "Your turn."

Under the gazes of everyone present, Bai Zhenzhen walked to the barbell. Her body gave a slight shudder, and as her muscles tensed, her entire frame seemed to swell.

Her muscles coiled and pushed against one another, seeming to merge into a single, unified whole.

Her training with the Thunderclap True Body had already significantly strengthened her nervous system, giving her powerful control over muscle recruitment and force.

And after cultivating with the shared spiritual root, her body tempering had taken on some of the qualities of the Crimson Marrow Primordial Qi, making her coordination and explosive power even stronger.

Now, Bai Zhenzhen gripped the bar, and without her face turning red or her breath catching, she effortlessly lifted the 1500-kilogram barbell.

While holding it aloft, her expression remained unchanged as she said coolly, "This is too easy. Let's try something more challenging."

After five seconds, Bai Zhenzhen casually dropped the barbell where she stood and strode toward another one weighing 2000 kilograms.

Then, to the astonishment of the crowd, a faint blush appeared on her cheeks. With a low shout, her arms bulged with power as she violently hoisted the barbell over her head.

Lan Ling's eyes narrowed. _Impressive explosive power and muscle control. This probably isn't even her limit. Zhang Pianpian really spared no expense._

He Dayou had initially shared Li Yong's thoughts, believing that since Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen's physical strength had skyrocketed in a short time without their participating in the special training program, their control couldn't possibly match theirs.

Now, seeing Bai Zhenzhen effortlessly lift the 2000-kilogram barbell, a shadow of gloom crossed his eyes.

But the person in the worst mood at the scene was, naturally, Li Yong.

His previous limit had been just over 1900 kilograms, and Bai Zhenzhen's performance had clearly far surpassed that.

Rationally, he should give up.

But he was unwilling to concede.

_I've sacrificed so much to get this far. Am I really going to surrender just because of some rich person's money?_

So Li Yong walked up to the 2000-kilogram barbell, took a deep breath, and lunged for the bar.

His muscles tensed violently. The 2000-kilogram barbell stood before him like an immovable mountain, barely budging despite his explosive effort.

Li Yong screamed in his mind, _I want to go to a university!_

_I don't want my parents to stay in the gang!_

_Get the hell up!_

As his entire body trembled and blue veins bulged on his crimson forehead, the 2000-kilogram barbell actually began to rise, inch by agonizing inch.

"Roar!"

With a furious cry, Li Yong looked at the barbell held high above his head, a faint smile gracing his lips.

But in the next instant, soft popping sounds echoed from his arm.

Then, before his stunned eyes, blood sprayed from his right arm.

As his grip went slack, the barbell he had just held aloft came crashing down.

Wang Hai's expression tightened. He rushed forward, catching the two-thousand-kilogram barbell with one hand while supporting Li Yong with the other.

Li Yong desperately tried to control his right arm, wanting to raise it, but found the muscles twitching uncontrollably.

"Teacher… what's wrong with me?" Li Yong asked in a panic.

Wang Hai understood the situation at a glance and sighed. "After you had the fascial de-limitation surgery, your muscles can expand beyond their normal limits."

"But your body hasn't adapted to the overloaded exertion of your arm muscles. The tissue has torn."

Wang Hai knew this was one of the drawbacks of the special training program. The body's muscles were not a single, integrated unit. When transplanted muscle fibers unleashed their violent power, if the original flesh and blood couldn't handle the load, a collapse would occur.

Hearing this, Li Yong grew even more panicked. "Can I recover? Can I still participate in the special training program?"

Wang Hai comforted him, "It's alright, it's alright. Just get some treatment and rest for a few days, and you can continue training…"

Lan Ling didn't spare the defeated Li Yong a single glance. He simply looked at Bai Zhenzhen and Zhang Yu and said in a professional tone, "Then, as agreed, your results are sufficient for you to join the sports competition team."

"You will participate in next month's sports competition along with He Dayou and the other two."

"As for the subsequent training sessions for the competition team, your attendance is optional."

Zhang Yu, however, asked curiously, "Then… what about that special training program? Can we participate?"

Both Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen had long been intensely curious about this so-called special training program, the method that had allowed He Dayou and the others to rapidly increase their physical strength in just one month.

Lan Ling looked at them and sneered, thinking, _Could it be that Zhang Pianpian has also taken an interest in Songyang High School's transplant technology? Is that why she had these two join?_

He stated in a businesslike manner, "The special training program is led by the Student Council with the school's cooperation. Participants are selected according to specific criteria."

"You two do not meet the selection criteria. You are not qualified to participate in this program."

# Chapter 101: A Concealment Talisman and the Eve of the Competition

Hearing Lan Ling's words, Zhang Yu asked, “What are the selection criteria? Why don’t we meet them?”

Lan Ling gave them a cold glance and stated flatly, “The initial phase requires a capital investment of at least three million. Do you have that?”

Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen were instantly speechless. Where would they get that kind of money? Even if they did, they certainly wouldn't invest it in a project led by the Student Council.

Seeing that Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen had no reply, Lan Ling thought to himself, _So they really are broke? It seems Zhang Pianpian knows her limits and didn’t support their bid to join the special training program._

After saying this, Lan Ling turned and left, seemingly unconcerned with the remaining affairs of the competition team.

Zhang Yu, however, asked again, “Hey, what about the other benefits for the competition team? Doesn’t the school offer us any training or subsidies?”

Without turning his head, Lan Ling replied, “That’s not my responsibility. Go ask Wang Hai.”

Wang Hai came over to Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen and said, “The second-year sports competition is in two weeks. Lan Ling and the others need to hurry up with their body tempering to prepare.”

“I’ll be the one to explain the situation for the first-year competition team.”

Wang Hai smiled at the two of them. “I originally thought you two wouldn’t have the chance to compete. I didn’t expect you to find another way and actually catch up.”

“Don’t worry, you don’t have to explain it to me. I know these kinds of things involve signed contracts and can’t be casually disclosed.”

Evidently, Wang Hai was convinced the two had used some kind of powerful Immortal Dao technology.

He continued, “The competition team has quite a few benefits. I’ll go over them with you one by one.”

“First, all members who join the competition team will receive a complimentary set of the Nine Dragons Acupuncture Technique.”

Hearing this, Zhang Yu's and Bai Zhenzhen’s eyes lit up. A free cultivation technique? How could it be this good?

Zhang Yu asked, “The Nine Dragons Acupuncture Technique… is it an acupuncture method? A set of combat arts? Why would the sports competition team need to practice combat arts?”

Wang Hai smiled faintly. “The Nine Dragons Acupuncture Technique isn't for combat; it’s a standard body tempering cultivation technique.”

“It uses mana to operate syringes, injecting different medicinal agents into 36 specific points on the body with various techniques and different syringes to maximally stimulate human potential and enhance the effects of body tempering…”

Zhang Yu was taken aback. _Damn, this is Songyang High School, all right. The competition team and the PE classes really do share the same style of body tempering._

Wang Hai went on, “The second benefit is a discount on drugs.”

“The Nine Dragons Acupuncture Technique requires a combination of nine different body tempering agents. Coincidentally, we sell all nine of them right here. They’re all from major, reputable brands, and they’re all sold at a discount to team members, so you can inject with confidence and use them with ease.”

Zhang Yu secretly shook his head. He didn't have any extra money to play around with this Nine Dragons Acupuncture Technique.

Bai Zhenzhen, on the other hand, was listening with rapt attention. She was clearly very interested, being a top student in body tempering who had long relied on alchemical enhancers.

Wang Hai continued, “The third benefit is that if a team member purchases an expert-level body tempering cultivation technique, they can apply for a subsidy from us. Regular members get a 2,000 subsidy, but if you get a rank in the competition, the subsidy is higher, up to a maximum of 20,000.”

“The fourth benefit is that the training equipment here is available for your free use 24 hours a day. You can go register your information in a bit, and then you’ll be able to get in just by swiping your student cards.”

“The final benefit is that you can buy dietary supplement foods from us at a discount, including all kinds of demonic beast meat…”

Bai Zhenzhen immediately asked, “Can we buy synthetic food from you at a discount then?”

_Synthetic food? What class of item is that? Would our competition team sell it?_ Wang Hai had intended to say this, but looking at the expectant gazes of Bai Zhenzhen and Zhang Yu, and considering their impoverished status, he finally cleared his throat and said, “Mm, you can get a ten percent discount, I suppose.”

Bai Zhenzhen immediately broke into a smile.

Wang Hai thought to himself, _It’s just a matter of submitting an application anyway. Since these two kids are on the competition team, a full stomach might help them get better results for me._

Zhang Yu, standing to the side, thought, _From the looks of it, the third and last benefits are the most useful for us._

_But the Crimson Marrow Primordial Qi was a prize given to me for free, so I can’t apply for a subsidy for it._

_If I were to buy another expert-level body tempering cultivation technique… I’ll have to give it some serious thought._

However, Zhang Yu’s goal was definitely the highest-tier subsidy of 20,000, which meant he would have to wait until after participating in the sports competition a month from now and securing a ranking.

But at that moment, Zhang Yu couldn't help but ask, “For the subsidy, does it have to be a body tempering cultivation technique?”

Wang Hai replied, “Of course. This is the sports competition team, after all. If you’re not buying body tempering techniques, should we be subsidizing combat techniques or breathing exercises for you?”

After completing the procedures to join the team and receiving a digital manual and usage rights for the Nine Dragons Acupuncture Technique from Wang Hai, Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen left the stadium.

After all, they were carrying too many secrets now and it wasn’t suitable for them to stay and practice body tempering there.

---

That night.

Under the bridge, beside the riverbed.

After finishing their tutoring session, Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen leaned against each other, staring together at the Talisman Tome in their hands.

For some time now, before every session, they had been requesting talismans from Zhang Pianpian over the Heavenly Net.

Now, after this night's class, the two had finally saved up enough money to buy the usage rights for the Concealment Talisman.

“Yu-boy, I’ve transferred the twenty thousand to you. From now on, whenever I want to use a Concealment Talisman, you have to draw it for me.”

Zhang Yu patted his chest. "Brothers for life. I’d flake on anyone before I’d flake on you. Don’t worry, whenever you need one in the future, I’ll draw one on the spot.”

Zhang Yu opened the Talisman Tome, entered the Department of the People's Spirit Realm temple, and selected the option to consult a god.

A huge list of options instantly popped up. Zhang Yu scrolled down past god-to-human training, god-companion modes, and divine-son packages, finally finding the option for talisman bestowal.

Among the many talismans offered by the Department of the People, the Concealment Talisman was ranked at the very top, clearly the most frequently used and purchased.

Seeing this, Zhang Yu couldn't help but curse inwardly, _These money-grubbing righteous gods. Was it them who pushed the schools to teach the Heaven's Eye Talisman?_

_With everyone learning the Heaven's Eye Talisman, of course many people would need to buy Concealment Talismans. If that thing didn't exist, no one would need to buy these either…_

Zhang Yu selected the Concealment Talisman and saw that the basic version required 40,000 yuan.

Just as a notification of a 40,000 deduction from his bank account sounded, the image on the Talisman Tome changed. Three righteous gods suddenly appeared, seemingly able to see him through the screen, and gave him a slight smile, their faces full of appreciation for a promising talent.

At the same time, three voices exploded in his mind simultaneously.

“The disciple Zhang Yu, with a heart devoted to the Dao, of sincere piety and superior aptitude… is hereby granted this talisman. It is hoped that you will practice it diligently in the days to come and spread the divine way far and wide.”

The next moment, the specific details of the Concealment Talisman were displayed before him.

The basic version didn't have much content. After flipping through a few pages, Zhang Yu saw a recommendation to upgrade to the advanced version.

Concealment Talisman Upgrade to Advanced Version, Basic Version

Conceal component function, √, √

Component color-change function, √, X

Individually hide components, √, X

Personalized camouflage signature, √, X

Forced display function, √, X

…

…

Zhang Yu gave it a quick glance and looked away. The advanced version of the Concealment Talisman had many functions, but it was far too expensive.

“The upgrade costs a full hundred thousand. With that kind of money, I’d be better off spending it on my own cultivation.”

The doll, disguised as prayer beads, had been silently watching this unfold, growing more envious and jealous by the second. It couldn't help but think, _Those righteous gods are really just lying around making money every day now._

_We evil gods have to brave the elements, take enormous risks, and rack our brains just to swindle a single person out of their family fortune._

_Those guys just have to lie back in the thirty-six heavens, eating and drinking and having fun, and billions of beings will offer up their life savings with both hands._

_Damn, that’s the life! Why was I born an evil god? I want to be a righteous god too!_

Meanwhile, after studying the Concealment Talisman for a while, Zhang Yu extended a finger and began to draw shakily on the Talisman Tome.

A moment later, with a flash of the yellow paper on the tome, the Concealment Talisman was successfully cast upon himself.

“Did it work?” Bai Zhenzhen asked excitedly from the side. “Come on, try casting one on me.”

Zhang Yu quickly drew another one, but just as the talisman was completed, his free daily quota on the Talisman Tome having been used up, his phone vibrated.

Department of the People - All-Beings Innate God

Debit: 500

“This one costs 500?”

“Didn’t I buy the usage rights?”

Zhang Yu quickly looked at the talisman bestowal page and only then discovered that for the basic version of the Concealment Talisman, one could only purchase paid usage rights.

This meant that having the rights simply allowed Zhang Yu to spend 500 yuan to use the Concealment Talisman once.

Zhang Yu laughed in exasperation. He wanted to curse out the Eight Ministries of Righteous Gods, but he was afraid of being overheard by them, especially while holding the Talisman Tome. What if they hit him with some kind of fine?

He had heard news of people cursing the heavens and being fined over a hundred thousand for it.

There was nothing for it. Zhang Yu couldn't afford to curse gods right now, so he could only swallow his anger.

At that moment, Zhang Yu also had a sudden realization as to why Zhang Pianpian’s expression had grown increasingly grim each time she drew talismans for them remotely as their tutoring sessions went on.

Bai Zhenzhen, who was beside him, also saw the debit notification on his phone and sighed, “I wonder how much money Godmother spent drawing talismans for us all these days?”

Zhang Yu didn’t know, but he guessed that drawing talismans remotely must be quite expensive, so he nodded. “Big Sis is so good to us. We have to repay her properly and fulfill our filial duties once we get into university.”

In the days that followed, Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen continued to shuttle between the Dark Learning Gang and Songyang High School, attending classes, teaching, and cultivating.

As Ma Yunteng and Le Mulan’s fame began to spread a little in the dark world of tutoring, the number of students enrolling in their courses increased slightly, and their income rose as well.

---

In the blink of an eye, another two weeks passed. It was the day the latest monthly exam results were announced, and the first-year sports competition was only two weeks away.

Inside the classroom, He Dayou looked at the score rankings and sighed softly to himself.

First place, Zhang Yu, 665

Second place, He Dayou, 661

Third place, Bai Zhenzhen, 660

Although it seemed like only a few points separated them, He Dayou knew it was because the 150 points for mana and physical education were no longer sufficient to reflect the true strength of Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen.

As for himself, besides the general knowledge courses, He Dayou hadn't maxed out a single subject; he had relied mainly on his Daoist art scores to close the gap with Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen.

Moreover, according to news passed on from other students, Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen had earned high praise from several PE teachers during the exam, repeatedly breaking the diagnostic patches. Wang Hai had even called the pair the treasures of Songyang High's first-year athletics.

_Is it because I’m not as rich as Zhang Pianpian?_

He was not naive enough to think he had lost to things like talent or hard work.

In He Dayou's view, the only reason someone as wealthy as him could lose in the sports competition… was because his opponents were even wealthier.

_Perhaps the Zhang family isn't as wealthy as the He family, but the amount of money the He family has spent on me probably can't compare to what Zhang Pianpian has spent on Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen._

_Damn it, why do those two paupers have such good luck? How did they run into a major sponsor like Zhang Pianpian?_

As He Dayou was stewing in his thoughts, he suddenly noticed his phone buzzing nonstop, as if some news was spreading like wildfire through various group chats.

He opened it and took a look, his expression changing repeatedly.

[The second-year competition team was completely wiped out! The top ten places in the sports competition were all seized by White Dragon, Purple Cloud, and Red Pagoda!]

[The Oasis Group has partnered with the companies behind White Dragon, Purple Cloud, and Red Pagoda, sharing some of the Immortal Dao technology for physical cultivation from their synthetic food.]

No wonder the Oasis Group could enter the Songyang City market; they joined forces with the local companies!

[Songyang High's Immortal Dao technology is completely obsolete. The three major high schools have achieved a comprehensive breakthrough in body tempering techniques. The new generation of top students has seen their physical strength skyrocket. In the future, they’ll even dominate the sports competitions. All future competitions will have nothing to do with the other high schools anymore.]

Reading this, He Dayou suddenly let out a bitter laugh.

He felt as though they were all just a bunch of clowns. While they were here, chasing after one another, the students from the three major high schools had already boarded a flying ship to another level.

# Chapter 102: The Competition Arrives

Night.

Beside the riverbed.

Zhang Yu’s muscles twitched and pulsed as he circulated the Crimson Marrow Primordial Qi with the aid of the True Spiritual Root.

Ever since joining the sports competition team and securing a spot in the athletics meet, Zhang Yu had not once returned to the team’s training gym, instead continuing to cultivate quietly as before.

After all, the 30,000-yuan Crimson Marrow Primordial Pills had consumed the vast majority of his income, and he had no money to enjoy the Nine Dragons Acupuncture Technique and related alchemical enhancers provided by the team.

Bai Zhenzhen, on the other hand, didn't need to spend her money on something as expensive as the Crimson Marrow Primordial Pill, so she learned the Nine Dragons Acupuncture Technique and bought the related drugs from the competition team to try them out.

Bai Zhenzhen’s review of the team’s training method was: “After the shots, you can’t get full, you can’t fall asleep, and you can’t stop training. The body tempering effects are insane! Yu-boy, using enhancers is so much more effective than natural body tempering. You should hurry up and try it.”

Of course, Zhang Yu knew that Zhen could handle the acupuncture not only because her drug resistance was quite good, but also because she had the assistance of the True Spiritual Root. Furthermore, the spiritual root had recently begun to transfer a portion of the effects from his own Crimson Marrow Primordial Qi cultivation, strengthening her internal organs…

Just then, his phone vibrated. Zhang Yu opened it to find a message from Zhao Tianxing.

“Hm?”

It was the news that was currently spreading like wildfire through all the Songyang High group chats: the complete defeat of Songyang High's second-year students in the sports competition, Oasis Group's sharing of partial Immortal Dao technology, the comprehensive breakthrough in body tempering techniques at the three major high schools, and the soaring physical strength of their top students across all grades…

Zhao Tianxing knew that Zhang Yu spent nearly every second of his time cultivating and couldn't be bothered to look at group chats, having muted all the Songyang High student groups he had joined. That was why he had sent the message directly to his good friend to give him a heads-up.

After reading it, Zhang Yu was quite surprised. “Lan Ling and that group of second-years, they all lost?”

“New technology? I wonder how much Song Hailong and the others have grown… Maybe I can ask my sister.”

Zhang Yu knew that Lan Ling's skill was by no means weak. For him to not even make it into the top ten of the athletics meet, it was clear that the students from the three major schools must have made significant progress after obtaining the breakthrough in body tempering technology.

Feeling a hint of pressure, Zhang Yu could only calm his mind and refocus his attention on cultivating the Crimson Marrow Primordial Qi.

A short while later, Bai Zhenzhen, now wearing a blonde wig, stick-on tattoos, padding, and a mask, came running over.

She leaped gracefully onto Zhang Yu's back, skillfully hopping on and wrapping her arms around him from behind. “It's time, Yu-boy. We need to get to class.”

At the same time, the True Spiritual Root flashed faintly and slipped back into Bai Zhenzhen’s stomach, making her feel a wave of comfort.

With the True Spiritual Root switching back and forth between their bodies during this period, Bai Zhenzhen wasn’t sure if she had adapted to the shape of the root after Zhang Yu had stretched it, or if the spiritual root had adapted to their two forms. Now, the transfers were almost free of the previous discomfort, leaving only a refreshing sensation of spiritual energy infusing her body.

Zhang Yu activated his Sports Car Legs, dashing toward the industrial park like a gust of wind. As his physical strength had surged, the speed of his technique had also become faster and faster.

Feeling Bai Zhenzhen's head resting on his back, Zhang Yu said, “Zhen, you’re pretty fast now too. Have you considered learning Sports Car Legs for travel? This cultivation technique is really useful.”

“No.”

Leaning on Zhang Yu’s back, Bai Zhenzhen closed her eyes, comfortably circulating her breathing exercise to seize the moment and refine her mana.

Seeing that Zhen didn't seem to get his meaning, Zhang Yu decided to be more direct. “Sigh, running such a long way every day, I feel like my shoes are about to wear out.”

Bai Zhenzhen, however, kept her eyes tightly shut as if she hadn't heard a thing, continuing to absorb spiritual energy through her breathing.

_Is Yu-boy trying to hint at something? Does this guy want to turn the tables, make me learn Sports Car Legs, and carry him so he can cultivate on the way? Silly child, whoever gets to ride on top would never be willing to get down._

Feeling Bai Zhenzhen seem to hug him even tighter, resolute in her decision not to get off, Zhang Yu cursed inwardly.

_This girl, Zhen. I was hoping that once she got stronger, she could carry me for a bit too. Good brothers should take turns riding each other, and I could get more time to cultivate. But now she won't even be my running partner. She's just using me as a chauffeur, cultivating while I'm running every day._

So Zhang Yu thought for a moment and said, “I always feel like it's not good for one person to do all the running. If both of us could run, it would be like having dual engines. If one gets sick or injured, the other can still go, don't you think so, Zhen?”

But Bai Zhenzhen seemed not to hear, only clamping her powerful thighs tighter around Zhang Yu, the sound of her breathing exercise echoing like thunder.

Zhang Yu thought, _This girl… she’s pretending not to hear me again, isn’t she?_

Bai Zhenzhen thought, _Good son, you want me to get down already? You have no idea how thick-skinned your old mom can be!_

_I could ride on you for a year without getting off!_

In the days that followed, as the sports competition drew ever closer, Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen, amidst their constant ascetic training, gradually felt a growing sense of urgency.

Fearing that they wouldn't achieve a good ranking in the competition, they always seized every possible opportunity to become stronger.

And so, time passed day by day in their arduous cultivation…

---

On this day, inside a training room at Purple Cloud High School.

Bai Zhenzhen walked in, a little puzzled, and looked at the slightly panting Le Mulan. “You asked me to train with you?” she asked curiously.

Le Mulan nodded. “I need to practice my close combat.”

“But I’m telling you beforehand, no moves like spitting blood or saliva.”

Actually, the training partner Le Mulan had wanted to hire was Zhang Yu.

But she felt that the leap from his clothes to the man himself was a bit too large. If he were to end up sitting on her again… she was afraid it would leave an even deeper shadow on her heart.

_It just so happens that this Bai Zhenzhen is also poor, and she’s with Zhang Yu every day. Her bottom line is probably just as low. I’ll test the waters with her first._

After a few moments of combat, Le Mulan confirmed her suspicions. _The other person’s scent on Zhang Yu’s clothes is Bai Zhenzhen’s._

_And Bai Zhenzhen has Zhang Yu’s scent on her as well._

_Those two… they must be doing close-quarters combat training together every day, right? That’s why they’ve left their scents on each other._

_So right now, I’m indirectly training with Zhang Yu._

At this thought, Le Mulan felt her breathing quicken and her nerves tense slightly.

_I knew it. I have to keep training._

An hour later, the training ended. Bai Zhenzhen looked at the 5,000 yuan that had been transferred to her account and felt a complex mix of emotions. _These guys from the three major high schools… they really have money to burn._

---

On this day, within the Dark Learning Gang's compound.

As soon as Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen entered the underground classroom, they noticed that many people they passed—security guards, teachers, salespeople—were injured.

Upon asking, they learned that the Dark Learning Gang and the Golden Class Gang had clashed yesterday over student recruitment.

Zhang Yu asked again, “Where’s Cai Tou? Why haven’t I seen him?”

Che Nu sighed, a trace of sadness in her eyes. “Oh, Cai Tou left.”

Zhang Yu was surprised. “He… did something happen during the fight?”

Che Nu smiled at his words. “How could that be? Cai Tou is very strong; he wouldn’t die in a small skirmish like yesterday’s. He was… fired.”

Zhang Yu said, “Fired? If he’s so strong, why was he fired?”

Che Nu shook her head helplessly. “What’s the use of being a good fighter? No matter how well a Qi Refinement cultivator can fight, can they block a flying sword? It's not as good as being able to teach a few more classes and earn more money.”

“But Cai Tou is old, and he’s been taking Dao heart buffers for so many years. His memory has been getting worse and worse these past few months, and fewer students were signing up for his classes. His performance wasn't up to par, so naturally, he had to go.”

As she spoke, Che Nu gave a bitter smile. “In the end, whether you’re in a company or a gang, if you don’t get into a university and obtain a Foundation Establishment certificate, isn’t this how everyone ends up? Leaving sooner or later is just a matter of time.”

Watching Che Nu’s dejected figure walk away, Bai Zhenzhen slowly pressed against Zhang Yu from behind and passed the spiritual root to him.

She said with a determined expression, “Yu-boy, we must get into one of the Ten Greats and achieve Foundation Establishment.”

Zhang Yu nodded with equal resolve. “Yeah. I’m going to cultivate first. You have a good class.”

---

In the cafeteria during lunchtime.

Zhao Tianxing watched with envy as Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen shoveled synthetic food into their mouths with gusto.

_I can't believe Zhen and Yu-boy actually made it onto the competition team._

_But the three major high schools have gained so much momentum after getting Oasis Group’s technology._

Zhao Tianxing recalled some recent rumors and looked at Zhang Yu. “Li Yong and Ye Haitao from the competition team are making a scene, demanding a refund. Do you guys know about this?”

“Huh?” Zhang Yu shook his head. “No idea. I haven't been to the team training for the past two weeks.”

Bai Zhenzhen chimed in from the side, “Yeah, I heard them arguing when I went. I think it was about getting their money back.”

Zhao Tianxing lamented, “Sigh, a single strategic move by a behemoth like Oasis Group can unknowingly affect the future of so many families.”

Qian Shen also nodded, his expression grave. “From now on, the three major high schools will monopolize all competitions.”

“But that’s not the scariest part. They’ve already monopolized all the other competitions besides the athletics meet in the past.”

“The scariest part is that with their enhanced body tempering techniques, the top students' physical education scores are bound to soar, and the average scores will rise again.”

“I did the math yesterday. If this continues, with the dual gap in competitions and scores, Songyang High might only have one or two people per graduating class who can get into the top Ten Greats in the future.”

The doll, disguised as prayer beads hanging on Zhang Yu's neck, let out a chuckle in his mind. “The wealthy families of Songyang City are starting to fight among themselves.”

“Heh heh, this is the work of the wealthy families behind the three major high schools. They want to completely monopolize the admission spots to the Ten Greats and squeeze out all the other high schools.”

Zhang Yu was startled. _Infighting among the rich?_

Sensing Zhang Yu’s surprise, the doll chuckled lightly and continued, “Wealth continuously accumulates. The three major high schools get the most admissions to the Ten Greats from Songyang City every year. The families behind them grow stronger and stronger, and their wealth naturally grows much faster than that of the other high schools.”

“Otherwise, how do you think they managed to slowly monopolize the competitions, year after year?”

“The situation in Songyang City is actually considered pretty good.”

“I know of some cities on the first layer of Kunxu where a population of tens of millions is served by only a single key high school.”

Zhang Yu thought to himself, _So we’ve happened to run into the era where the three major high schools are further monopolizing the spots in the Ten Greats?_

Zhang Yu sighed. The longer he stayed in Kunxu, the more weary he felt. It was as if the entire world exerted an invisible pressure, constantly urging him, pushing him to hurry up and run forward.

As the days passed one by one, the day of the sports competition finally arrived.

(End of Chapter)

# Chapter 103: The Extension of the Corporate Battlefield

Just like the martial arts competition at White Dragon High School, the athletics meet held at Purple Cloud High School was also scheduled for midnight.

However, due to Songyang High School's consistent investment in athletics, the school had arranged for a bus this time.

In the dead of night.

He Dayou, Zhang Yu, Bai Zhenzhen, and the other two contestants, making a total of five, along with their coach Wang Hai, were riding the bus toward Purple Cloud High School.

Additionally, Qian Shen and Zhao Tianxing, as friends of Zhang Yu, had been allowed by Wang Hai to board the bus to watch the competition.

But aside from the spirited Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen, the others on the bus were subdued… some were cultivating through breathing exercises, some were reading, and others were scrolling through videos on their phones. In short, they had no expectations for this athletics meet, carrying an air of just wanting to get it over with.

Of course, even when scrolling on their phones, Songyang High School students were not just watching anything.

On the screen was a woman, over four meters tall with shoulders broader than a truck, who looked like a giantess, instructing on the essentials of body tempering and promoting body tempering drugs.

Wang Hai glanced at the video the student was watching and frowned. "Watch less of these body tempering influencers. They're all fake, just trying to trick you into buying alchemical enhancers."

The student was skeptical. "Mr. Wang, she's a major influencer with tens of millions of followers. Many people have seen her in person, so she can't be fake, can she?"

Wang Hai snorted. "How could anyone in the Qi Refinement realm achieve that height and dimension just by relying on drugs? It's obviously plastic surgery, all fake and unresponsive muscle."

With the growing number of high school students and the development of the body tempering industry, a peculiar aesthetic of "taller is more beautiful, bigger is better" had naturally emerged.

Wang Hai knew that the body tempering influencers online, under intense competition, were pursuing increasingly extreme physiques.

They had even started to abandon true strength for eye-catching appearances, moving from a normal physique of two or three meters to a grotesque aesthetic of four or even five meters.

Wang Hai lamented, "A practitioner who earnestly tempers their body, relying on drugs and exercise supplemented by some modification surgeries, will find that reaching three meters tall and two meters wide is basically the limit."

"Those four-meter-tall influencers are filled with prosthetic muscles and bones. If you look closely at the injection marks on their bodies, you'll see the needle points are all wrong."

Shaking his head, Wang Hai sighed, "Every year, corporations entice young people to take out loans for plastic surgery. If they don't die on the operating table, they can become influencers hawking products. After a few years, when the surgical side effects kick in, they're replaced by new influencers."

"To earn money for their own treatment, these people will tell any lie and sell any piece of junk. You should stop watching them from now on."

How did Wang Hai know so much? It was because a former classmate of his had gone down that path. After the side effects of the surgery manifested, he exhausted his family's fortune but couldn't be cured, ultimately dying during a live broadcast. Even Wang Hai himself had been approached by a talent agency, nearly getting pulled into the world of body tempering influencers.

But after saying all this, Wang Hai was overcome by a wave of listlessness.

He was reminded of the recent breakthroughs in body tempering technology at White Dragon, Purple Cloud, and Red Pagoda.

For the past two weeks, Wang Hai had been using his connections to find out what kind of technology Oasis Group had provided to the three major high schools, and what concessions those schools had made in return.

After all, such a generational update in body tempering technology was bound to affect the entire body tempering market in Songyang City, and it would certainly have a huge impact on a top-tier coach like him.

But whether it was the three major high schools or the corporations behind them, they all maintained strict secrecy. Apart from some obvious characteristics displayed at the second-year athletics meet, the true intelligence within was beyond what a physical education teacher like him could uncover.

And the thought of that second-year athletics meet made Wang Hai's expression darken further.

He had personally witnessed at that competition how the second-year students from Songyang High School were miserably eliminated, how they were pushed out of the rankings by the sheer power of the students from the three major high schools.

Even Lan Ling, whom the school had meticulously cultivated and who had received muscle fiber transplants from third-year students early on, was trampled under the feet of the top students from the three schools.

It made him sigh inwardly that the times had changed.

As he thought of this, Wang Hai couldn't help but think of one person.

_Zhou Chechen…_

Based on his results, the vice president of the second-year Student Council should have participated in this year's second-year athletics meet.

But for some reason, Zhou Chechen was absent this time; he did not participate in the competition.

_Does Zhou Chechen know something?_

While Wang Hai was pondering, Zhang Yu, sitting not far away, was also contemplating today's athletics meet.

After learning about the breakthroughs in body tempering technology at the three major high schools, Zhang Yu had naturally asked his sister, Zhang Pianpian, who stood at the pinnacle of all high school students in Songyang City and was ranked first among the third-years at White Dragon High School.

Zhang Pianpian's words now surfaced in Zhang Yu's mind.

"This time, whether it's Oasis Group or the corporations and families behind White Dragon, Purple Cloud, and Red Pagoda, they are all placing great importance on this first-year athletics meet."

"You ask why the focus is on the first-year competition and not the other grades?"

"It's because the lower the grade, the more the influence of body tempering technology on scores outweighs the individual student's talent, and the more it highlights the differences between the technologies."

"Zhang Yu, this first-year athletics meet isn't just a competition between students. It's a competition between the Immortal Dao technologies embodied by the students, and behind those technologies, the schools and corporations."

"It's a clash of Immortal Dao technologies between the major corporations, an extension of the corporate battlefield."

"As for their attitude toward the other high schools… for the big three, it's a matter of crushing them as a matter of course."

"It is by showcasing this process of crushing you that they will advertise their advanced body tempering technology."

And now Zhang Yu recalled the question he had asked at the time.

Zhang Yu: "Sis, from the sound of it, you're not very optimistic about my chances?"

Zhang Pianpian had smiled faintly and said, "Whether I'm optimistic about you or not is unimportant. What matters is whether you truly have the strength to defeat your opponents."

At this moment, on the bus, Zhang Yu looked at his Feathered Tome. _Is this strength enough to defeat them?_

More than a month had passed since the last time he competed for a spot at Songyang High School.

In this month, with the help of the Crimson Marrow Primordial Pill, his True Spiritual Root, and the Crimson Marrow Primordial Qi, his strength had broken through repeatedly, and his body strength in particular had developed by leaps and bounds.

Dao heart: Level 4 (80%)

Mana: 43.9

Body Strength: Level 4.95

But looking at his three basic stats, Zhang Yu still felt unsatisfied, sighing inwardly that he was gradually hitting a bottleneck in his Dao heart, mana, and body strength.

_Sigh, the Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method is becoming less and less effective. The speed of my mana refinement has been slowing down recently. After this athletics meet, I must start looking for a new breathing exercise to practice._

Cultivation techniques were graded as basic, advanced, expert, military, and immortal sect, primarily based on their quality.

But no matter how good a technique was for the Qi Refinement realm, it would be useless in the Foundation Establishment realm.

The Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method was a technique for the early stage of Qi Refinement. Zhang Yu's current level was already approaching that of a second-year student, so he needed to consider a technique for the middle stage of Qi Refinement.

_Next is my Dao heart. The Martial Ascension Heart-Tempering Art is actually sufficient to continue raising my Dao heart, but the trouble with this technique is… every practice session requires both internal and external cultivation, practicing those nine external arts."_

And it just so happened that Zhang Yu had recently been focusing on increasing his body strength, cultivating the Crimson Marrow Primordial Qi.

This meant he had no time to practice the Martial Ascension Heart-Tempering Art and could only continuously circulate the Desolate Ox Soul-Suppressing Mantra in his mind, causing his Dao heart's improvement to hit a bottleneck.

This was because the Desolate Ox Soul-Suppressing Mantra could only be considered an early-stage Qi Refinement technique; reaching level 5 Dao heart was pretty much its limit.

_So I still need to find a heart art that I can practice constantly in my sea of consciousness to continue raising my Dao heart._

Finally, there was his body strength.

Originally, with the assistance of his True Spiritual Root, coupled with the Crimson Marrow Primordial Pill and the level 10 Crimson Marrow Primordial Qi, Zhang Yu's body strength had been soaring. It was only when he gradually approached level 5.00 that the progress began to slow.

_The Crimson Marrow Primordial Qi is still effective enough; its bottleneck should be at a much higher level._

_The reason it's slowed down recently should be because over the past two months… especially this last month, my body strength has increased too quickly, and the strength of my heart hasn't kept up._

Because he relied on purely natural body tempering and used very few drugs, the growth rate of Zhang Yu's internal organs was not fast, and his heart was not enlarging as rapidly as those of the drug-reliant competitors.

_Fortunately, with the help of the True Spiritual Root, it should be soon…_

Zhang Yu could feel his heart growing stronger and more powerful these days. It should soon be able to support another breakthrough in his body strength.

_By this calculation, I should hurry up and buy a new breathing exercise and heart art after this athletics meet._

_Speaking of which, the prize money for the champion of this athletics meet has increased several times, finally reaching a full 300,000. As long as I get that 300,000…_

The thought of the 300,000 prize money made Zhang Yu slightly excited.

But the 300,000 prize also indicated the high profile of this athletics meet and the importance the major corporations placed on it. Just as Zhang Pianpian had said, the competition was bound to be unprecedentedly fierce, making Zhang Yu feel a trace of pressure.

In reality, it had only been eight months since the start of his first year, and Zhang Yu's basic stats were already approaching the average level of a second-year student at Songyang High School. This was already considered meteoric progress, and it was only when competing against the freaks from the three major high schools that he felt any pressure.

Not far away, He Dayou looked at the determined faces of Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen with confusion.

He didn't understand why, given the current situation, these two still looked so confident.

Although he hadn't been able to gauge their progress since the last monthly exam because they were always skipping class.

But in such a short amount of time, no matter how much an individual broke through… how could it possibly compare to the technological breakthroughs of the three major high schools?

Just then, the bus they were on pulled to a stop at the entrance of Purple Cloud High School.

Unlike the modern skyscrapers of White Dragon High School, Purple Cloud High School had an appearance of small bridges, flowing water, pavilions, and terraces, giving it a classical, quaint feeling.

Especially under the illumination of various gold and white lights, it appeared even more ethereal, like a realm of immortals.

The entire campus of Purple Cloud High School covered a vast area, yet there were no tall buildings to be seen.

However, being able to occupy such a large piece of land in the city and build a school that looked like a park was enough to give one a profound understanding of the immense financial power behind Purple Cloud High School.

Shortly after entering the campus, Zhang Yu and the others were led into a guest passageway.

As the receiving teacher made introductions, the passageway ahead began to spray a disinfectant.

The receiving teacher from Purple Cloud High School looked at them apologetically and said, "My apologies, this is a school rule at Purple Cloud High. All off-campus personnel must be disinfected upon entry to remove any filth."

_What the hell… Are they treating us like some kind of vermin?_ Zhang Yu was speechless. At that moment, he deeply understood that it wasn't just Le Mulan who had a cleanliness obsession; this whole damn school had one.

This wretched school was just as unreliable as White Dragon High School.

So Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen stepped forward together, looking at the teacher seriously.

Zhang Yu pointed to himself and then to the others from Songyang, saying, "I scored over 660 on the monthly exam, and I'm first in the martial competition and fourth in the Mana Competition. I'm different from them."

"At my level, I could get into White Dragon High School for free. I don't need to be disinfected, right?"

Bai Zhenzhen's eyes flickered, and she nodded in agreement. "That's right. Is there a VIP channel suitable for those of us with scores over 660?"

The receiving teacher said with an apologetic face, "I'm sorry, the school rules are absolute. All outside personnel must be disinfected, with no distinction based on scores."

_Damn it, this is even more unreliable than White Dragon High School._

In an instant, in the minds of Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen, Purple Cloud High School had already hit rock bottom in their ranking of the three major high schools.

Then Bai Zhenzhen suddenly pointed to people walking down another passageway. "How come they don't need to be disinfected?"

Everyone immediately looked over and saw a group of 'monsters' in White Dragon High School uniforms walking through an adjacent passageway, with no disinfection measures in sight.

The receiving teacher from Purple Cloud High School chuckled at her words, his expression seeming to say, 'Does this even need an explanation?'

"How can that be the same?" The receiving teacher shook his head. "They are from White Dragon High School, after all. As a partner school of Purple Cloud High, they are not considered off-campus personnel."

Wang Hai spoke up. "Alright, alright, when in Rome, do as the Romans do. Since we're here, let's follow Purple Cloud High's rules. Don't delay the start of the competition."

As a veteran coach who had led teams to the three major high schools for competitions countless times over the years, Wang Hai was exceptionally experienced.

He was especially experienced in being insulted by the three major high schools, and his heart was no longer stirred by such things.

It was just that in previous years, Wang Hai could still count on his students to fight for some glory in the athletics meet, to snatch a ranking and win back some face.

_This year, however, there's no hope._

He sighed and stepped into the disinfection channel first.

# Chapter 104: A Sea of Voices

With a sigh, Wang Hai stepped into the disinfection channel, his gaze instinctively drifting toward the White Dragon students in the other lane.

As the remaining members of his team passed through the disinfection channel, their eyes were also drawn to the White Dragon contingent.

The appearance of that group was simply too eye-catching.

Zhang Yu thought to himself, _Yu Xinghan looks the same as when I saw him filming that commercial._

_But Song Hailong, who's following behind him, has changed drastically…_

Besides the number on his chest and back changing from a 1 to a 2, Song Hailong’s skin now looked coarse, as if polished by rock. His limbs were far thicker than before; his forearm alone was as thick as Zhang Yu's waist. The overall impression… was as if he had transformed into a humanoid giant elephant.

But Song Hailong's transformation was relatively minor; at least he still looked human.

Looking past Song Hailong, the White Dragon students further back looked less and less human, their forms approaching that of demonic beasts.

Zhang Yu recalled the intelligence his sister, Zhang Pianpian, had given him.

"White Dragon High School's body tempering technology has indeed achieved a breakthrough. It's no longer as simple as Song Hailong's previous partial elephant muscle implants."

"They can now transform a student's muscles into imitation demonic muscle, forcibly breaking through the body's natural limits to achieve explosive growth in physical strength."

"The wealthier the student, the more imitation demonic muscle they have transformed, and the less human they appear."

"However, this imitation demonic muscle possesses a certain plasticity. If a student can fully master the power within, they can gradually retract the demonic beast features and look more and more human."

Zhang Yu stared at Yu Xinghan, who was walking at the very front, momentarily unsure if the Golden Core disciple had undergone the imitation demonic muscle surgery.

After exiting the disinfection channel, the group from Songyang High School found a rhinoceros in a White Dragon High School uniform waiting for them.

It was unmistakably a rhinoceros, from its coarse, gray-black hide and the horn-like protrusion on its forehead, to its small eyes, elongated face, and thick limbs… the creature gave the impression of a humanoid rhino.

The rhinoceros waved at Zhang Yu and greeted him, "Zhang Yu, long time no see."

"Oh, you probably don't recognize me now, do you?"

The rhinoceros smiled faintly. "It's me, Chu Qiuhe, the White Dragon High student you defeated in the last martial arts competition."

Hearing the rhinoceros speak, a look of astonishment appeared in everyone's eyes. Chu Qiuhe's current humanoid rhinoceros form was so vastly different from before that it was as if he had been completely reborn.

The reason Chu Qiuhe came to see the Songyang group was simply because he wanted to confirm one thing upon seeing their team.

And that was whether Zhang Yu, the champion of the first-year martial arts competition, was representing Songyang High School this time.

Chu Qiuhe knew he wasn't the only one curious about this; many of the students who had been defeated in the martial arts competition were looking forward to avenging their loss in this athletics meet.

Seeing that Zhang Yu was indeed on the Songyang High School team, Chu Qiuhe couldn't help but feel a flicker of anticipation.

Chu Qiuhe looked at Zhang Yu and smiled faintly. "Many people were hoping you would participate in this athletics meet…"

Just then, a loud bang erupted from the White Dragon contingent ahead.

Song Hailong had viciously driven an elbow toward Yu Xinghan's temple. Amidst a sound like a cannon blast, Yu Xinghan's head twisted a mere four or five degrees from the blow before stopping.

Then, with a sharp jerk of his head, Yu Xinghan sent Song Hailong, who was taller and two to three times his size, flying.

With a resounding thud, the tumbling Song Hailong landed steadily on his feet, an unwilling look on his face as he stared at Yu Xinghan.

Yu Xinghan, however, calmly remarked, "Not good enough, little Song. That blow had far too much killing intent. There was no sense of a sudden, covert attack. You still need more practice."

The other White Dragon students seemed unfazed by this, continuing to follow Yu Xinghan forward.

The students from Songyang High School watched this scene of internal strife with surprise.

He Dayou was shocked. _The second-ranked student dares to attack the first-ranked? Have White Dragon's school rules changed?_

Beside them, Chu Qiuhe chuckled and casually explained, "It's been like this ever since Yu Xinghan became number one."

Bai Zhenzhen frowned. "Is Song Hailong that petty? He ambushes whoever surpasses him?"

Chu Qiuhe clarified, "Big Brother Hailong isn't that petty, of course. It was Yu Xinghan who demanded it. He requires Song Hailong to attack him with full force five times every twenty-four hours, saying he wants to use it as a training method."

Chu Qiuhe said with some emotion, "As a demand from the top-ranked student, Big Brother Hailong had no choice but to accept."

"From then on, his eyes and mind have been filled with nothing but Yu Xinghan. There's no one else."

"I suspect he's constantly thinking about how to take down Yu Xinghan. He's on the verge of madness."

Shaking his head with a sigh, Chu Qiuhe clapped Zhang Yu on the shoulder and said meaningfully, "Well then, I'll see you on the field. I look forward to competing with you."

Gazing at the retreating backs of the White Dragon students, at their inhuman forms, Zhang Yu suddenly felt a sense of melancholy.

_First, Red Pagoda High School, in its pursuit of results, turned demonic beasts into people. Now, White Dragon High School, in its pursuit of greater strength, is turning people into demonic beasts._

Guided by the receiving teacher, the group walked among the pavilions and terraces of Purple Cloud High School and soon arrived at a massive indoor stadium.

The teacher introduced, "This is the largest stadium at Purple Cloud High. It's generally only used for major competitions and school-wide events."

Even before entering, they could feel the deafening roar of a crowd.

Upon entering, the first thing they felt was the brightness of day.

Unlike the midnight outside, the ceiling of the stadium was hung with what looked like numerous small suns, illuminating the entire indoor stadium as if it were noon.

The second thing they noticed was the immense size of the indoor stadium and the sheer number of people.

Unlike the dangers of the martial arts competition, this athletics meet didn't carry the risk of being beaten into bankruptcy, so almost every key high school and regular high school that could participate had come.

Within the massive arena, students and coaches were everywhere. Some were injecting drugs to warm up, some were trading alchemical enhancers, and others were being insulted by the three major high schools—a vibrant scene of Kunxu's passionate high school life unfolded before them.

Besides the competitors, Zhang Yu and the others also saw staff members on the periphery and countless spectators in the stands.

He Dayou asked, puzzled, "There are a lot of people filming."

The receiving teacher beside them explained, "They are all professional spectators invited by the sponsors of this competition. There are media reporters, influencers, and many people from various corporations."

Zhang Yu looked up and indeed saw many people in suits and ties with weary expressions. The stench of corporate overtime wafted over from a great distance; they were clearly corporate drones who regularly worked late.

Zhang Yu then looked toward the spectator stands. The largest indoor stadium at Purple Cloud High School had tens of thousands of seats, and at this moment, it was packed with people.

Aside from the students of the three major high schools, Zhang Yu also saw many figures completely wrapped up, looking like mummies or rice dumplings.

Just then, a hearty laugh rang out.

"You've finally arrived."

"Those are student spectators from other regular high schools. To prevent them from dirtying the venue, they were each given a clean suit upon entry to avoid too much contact with us from Purple Cloud High."

The newcomer was Lian Tianji of Purple Cloud High School. He nodded to the receiving teacher beside him and seamlessly took over the task of guiding the Songyang High School contestants.

Facing this major client for his clothes, Zhang Yu laughed and positioned himself behind Bai Zhenzhen, greeting him warmly, "Brother Lian, what brings you here to receive us?"

Lian Tianji replied, "I know where the rest area for Songyang High School is. Let me take you there."

On the way to the rest area, Zhang Yu saw all sorts of advertisements on the floor, walls, and billboards. He also saw numerous influencers, both large and small, filming the arena and interviewing students and corporate personnel.

They were truly influencers of all sizes, with the larger ones standing over four meters tall and the smaller ones less than two. Their follower counts were generally directly proportional to their physical size.

There were also corporate people in suits and ties walking about, constantly filming and recording something.

Feeling the deafening roar of the entire arena, Zhang Yu once again understood what Zhang Pianpian had said.

Zhang Yu murmured to himself, _This athletics meet truly is an extension of the corporate battlefield, a stage for them to promote their new technologies._

Along the way, Zhang Yu also saw many students in Purple Cloud High School uniforms, their entire bodies tinged with purple, bowing to Lian Tianji. They only resumed their activities after he was out of sight.

Zhang Yu once again recalled the intelligence from Zhang Pianpian.

"Purple Cloud High School's technological breakthrough lies in enhancing a cultivator's metabolic rate and drug resistance, allowing them to take more than ten times the amount of drugs as before. All sorts of prohibited substances can be taken as if they were routine."

"However, due to the side effects of the Purple Cloud Supplements, the more fiercely they take the drugs, the more purple drug residue remains on their skin. In other words, the more money one has to take more drugs, the more purple their entire body becomes."

"But at a more advanced stage, for those who can rapidly refine the medicinal power, the drug residue on their skin is completely broken down, leaving only a purple mark on their forehead. At this point, the more medicinal power one refines, the more complex the pattern on their forehead becomes, eventually forming a tattoo of a purple eye."

Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen occasionally glanced at Lian Tianji beside them, noticing a thumb-sized purple circular mark on his forehead.

"We're here."

Lian Tianji smiled and pointed forward. "This is the rest area for Songyang High School."

Zhang Yu and the others looked up and saw an area enclosed by partitions. Not only was it fully equipped with sofas, power outlets, drinking water, and energy drinks, but there were even fruits and snacks. It once again made them feel the immense investment in this athletics meet, that even the humble Songyang contingent could receive such treatment.

# Chapter 105: Can I Touch You?

Looking at the amenities in the Songyang High School rest area, Qian Shen and Zhao Tianxing exchanged glances.

They had both been to White Dragon High School and witnessed the last martial arts competition, so the treatment of the Songyang High School rest area back then was still fresh in their minds.

Now, seeing such well-appointed facilities at the athletics meet, Zhao Tianxing suspected they might have gone to the wrong place.

Qian Shen couldn't help but think, _No way… with Songyang High School's average score, do they really rate a rest area with these kinds of conditions?_

Even Wang Hai had to admit that in all his years of leading teams to athletics meets, this was the grandest event and the best treatment Songyang High School had ever received.

Lian Tianji, standing nearby, seemed to be aware of their surprise and explained with a smile, "The on-site facilities this time are co-sponsored by Purple Cloud Supplements and Oasis Group, so the conditions are indeed excellent."

He pointed toward the east side of the arena and said, "Over there, Oasis Group and Red Pagoda Husbandry are providing a complimentary buffet for all competitors, as well as the Purple Cloud students and other staff helping out. Would you like to go and have a taste?"

Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen, who had just sat down, immediately stood up. "We're going to familiarize ourselves with the competition environment."

So the two of them followed Lian Tianji across the arena to the buffet area on the east side.

From a distance, they could see purple-skinned students from Purple Cloud High School holding plates and eating inside.

The reason they were holding plates was that Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen noticed these Purple Cloud students would start eating while walking as soon as they had filled their trays.

By the time these Purple Cloud students reached the exit of the buffet area, they would have finished everything and placed their trays on the dish return table.

Bai Zhenzhen's eyes lit up as she said, "I get it. These students eating while walking must be the poor performers from your school, right? Because their grades are so bad, they aren't qualified to sit down and eat. They have to finish their food while walking from the moment they get it to the moment they return their trays."

Lian Tianji chuckled. "You think too harshly of our Purple Cloud High. Our requirements for underperforming students aren't that strict. These are just the ordinary students who aren't qualified to sit and eat."

"Huh? What about the underperformers then?"

Lian Tianji said nonchalantly, "The bottom 50 students eat in the restroom. They can take as long as they want, no requirements at all."

Zhang Yu thought to himself, _These Purple Cloud High students really are devil incarnates._

But on second thought, although making the bottom 50 students eat in the restroom was a bit inhuman, on the flip side… didn't this just mean that Purple Cloud High at least had plenty of restrooms?

_In that respect, at least they're doing better than White Dragon High School,_ Zhang Yu thought.

Just then, a rumbling sound, like the thundering of ten thousand horses, echoed as a large group of black monsters in Red Pagoda High School uniforms entered the buffet area.

Zhang Yu's eyes widened in astonishment. "What the hell… are those students? Students from Red Pagoda High School?"

It wasn't that Zhang Yu had never seen the demon-kin students from Red Pagoda High before.

Although their appearances were a bit different from humans, forms like brown bears and tigers were still within the realm of normalcy.

But these creatures before him… each one was covered in an oily, smooth blackness, with only a pair of eyes glowing crimson.

He thought in shock, _My sister said that Red Pagoda High's technological breakthrough allowed their demon students to awaken the bloodline power of a black creature, which they successfully extracted and injected into the human students…_

_Could it be that they've awakened a black person's bloodline? Gaining powerful athletic abilities, which is why they've become black bears, black tigers, and… black students?_

Lian Tianji, noticing Zhang Yu's shocked expression, kindly explained, "Red Pagoda High School successfully stimulated the Black Dragon bloodline in their demon-kin students, resulting in a transformative change in their physique."

"If you look closely at their skin, the blackness is the texture reflected by dragon scales."

As Zhang Yu got closer, he could faintly discern a layer of fine black scales within the black sheen, which shimmered with an iridescent blackness.

At the same time, he noticed more black details that were hard to see from a distance.

For instance, the two small horns on Xiong Wenwu's forehead, the five sharp and slender claws on his hands, the small tail on his backside, and the long whiskers at the corners of his mouth… moreover, a heart-palpitating pressure continuously emanated from their bodies, as if predators were eyeing their prey.

Lian Tianji continued at his side, "It's said that among these demon-kin students from Red Pagoda, those who have awakened more of the Black Dragon bloodline exhibit more Black Dragon features, and their physique inherits more of the Black Dragon's traits, resulting in a more terrifying increase in body strength."

As he said this, a hint of excitement crept into Lian Tianji's tone. "In terms of body strength, these guys have a unique advantage. I'm really looking forward to competing against them."

Bai Zhenzhen urged from the side, "Are you done talking? If we don't eat now, I don't think there'll be anything left."

Indeed, within the buffet area, the students from Red Pagoda High were devouring all kinds of food like a storm sweeping away clouds. A single opening and closing of their mouths often meant an entire plate of food was swallowed into their bellies.

Zhang Yu quickly pulled Bai Zhenzhen and rushed in, grabbing a plate of food and pouring it into his mouth.

Bai Zhenzhen grabbed a handful of chicken legs, and after a few bites, tears welled up in her eyes.

For the past month, she and Zhang Yu had been eating synthetic food almost every day.

It was fine at first, but later on, she found the mush increasingly unappetizing. Her body's craving for real food had been suppressed to its absolute limit.

At this moment, actually eating a chicken leg, feeling the real chicken juices burst in her mouth, Bai Zhenzhen had only one thought: "Real roasted chicken legs are so delicious!"

After taking a sip of the beast protein milk from Red Pagoda Husbandry, the expression on Bai Zhenzhen's face became even more satisfied.

Lian Tianji walked over and sat down in front of the two, who were wolfing down their food, and said with a smile, "No need to rush. The buffet here is provided by both Oasis Group and Red Pagoda Husbandry. Even if there were ten times as many people, the supply is absolutely guaranteed."

After chatting casually with Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen for a bit, Lian Tianji finally asked a question he had been curious about for a long time.

"Zhang Yu, in these past two months, to what level has your body strength increased?"

Lian Tianji looked at Zhang Yu, who was currently stuffing steak into his mouth, and his mind seemed to flash back to the moment he was defeated by him on the martial arts stage two months ago.

He thought to himself, _Although I want to defeat you, if there's too great a gap in our body strength, then such a victory would be meaningless._

The thought that he might never be able to defeat the Zhang Yu from that time filled Lian Tianji's heart with a trace of regret.

Zhang Yu casually replied, "Level 4.95."

Lian Tianji was taken aback for a moment, then chuckled the next. "I'm not joking with you. I'm asking what your body strength is."

Zhang Yu gave Lian Tianji a strange look.

"It's level 4.95. Who's joking with you?"

After saying that, he stuffed a few more lamb chops into his mouth.

Lian Tianji's brow furrowed, and his first thought was disbelief.

_After undergoing Purple Cloud Supplements' super-metabolism modification, I've been injecting nearly ten kilograms of drugs daily._

_I've endured the constant pain of torn muscles and ruptured organs, been rushed to the emergency room several times, and even then, I've only managed to raise my body strength to level 4.56._

_How could Zhang Yu possibly be at 4.95?_

_Is he intentionally spouting nonsense, not wanting to reveal his true body strength? But what's the point? Once the competition starts, everyone's body strength will be tested and revealed._

_Could it be that he's not lying? But how is that possible?_

For a moment, Lian Tianji felt that Zhang Yu probably wasn't lying, but it was also highly unlikely that Zhang Yu wasn't lying.

Just as he was pondering this, a slender, cold, and beautiful figure silently entered the cafeteria, drawing everyone's attention.

The reason she drew attention was only partly due to her beauty; the main reason was that all the Purple Cloud students present stood up in unison and bowed to Le Mulan.

At this moment, Le Mulan had tied her long hair into a ponytail with a purple silk ribbon. She was wearing a purple tracksuit that revealed her snow-white arms and long, slender legs, exuding a rare athletic aura.

And what attracted the eyes of Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen the most was, naturally, the purple mark on her brow.

That mark was far more complex than Lian Tianji's simple dot; it looked like a purple vertical pupil imprinted on Le Mulan's forehead.

The aloof, top-ranked student nodded, her cold face devoid of expression as she said, "You may all go about your business."

Hearing her response, the bowing Purple Cloud students all returned to their previous states.

Then, Le Mulan walked straight to the table where Zhang Yu, Bai Zhenzhen, and Lian Tianji were and stopped.

Zhang Yu looked at Le Mulan, whose breathing was slightly heavy, and shrugged. "You want to eat with us? There's no seat for you though."

Le Mulan said flatly, "It's fine."

She glanced at Lian Tianji, who was occupying two seats due to his size, and said coolly, "I need a stool."

Immediately, several Purple Cloud students rushed over. The first girl to reach them dropped to the ground, positioning herself like a stool in front of Le Mulan.

_Holy crap!_ Zhang Yu thought to himself, _These Purple Cloud people… they seem even more deranged than two months ago._

The reason for Zhang Yu's curiosity was simple. It was because after Purple Cloud obtained its technological breakthrough and numerous first-year prodigies underwent the super-metabolism surgery, causing their body strengths to skyrocket… Le Mulan had defeated them all over again.

The first-year students of Purple Cloud discovered to their despair that even with the super-metabolism surgery, the gap between them and the wealthiest student in the grade, Le Mulan, had not narrowed but had instead grown even wider.

The role of wealth in cultivation and scores had once again been magnified.

And in the environment of Purple Cloud High School, this disparity had created an even more exaggerated worship of wealth and scores.

Zhang Yu sensed that Le Mulan had been occasionally glancing at him since she arrived, making him feel a bit awkward as he ate.

He thought to himself, _This woman couldn't possibly still be thinking of getting revenge on me, could she?_

Just then, Le Mulan's clear and cold voice rang out, "Can I touch you?"

Sensing the silence at the table, Le Mulan added, "I can pay."

# Chapter 106: Zhang Yu, Level 4.95

"What is wrong with you?"

That was what Zhang Yu had wanted to say in response to Le Mulan's attempt to throw money at him.

But before the words could leave his mouth, Bai Zhenzhen nudged him in the shoulder. "She's offering money! What are you waiting for?"

Bai Zhenzhen then turned to Le Mulan. "Where do you want to touch? Taking off his shirt will cost extra."

Le Mulan shook her head repeatedly. "No need, just… just a touch of the hand will be fine."

Just then, Le Mulan trembled slightly. She frowned, patting the stool beneath her. "Don't move."

The girl lying prone under Le Mulan gritted her teeth and stopped moving, her face contorting as if her eyes and nose were being scrunched together. In her heart, she felt like crying tears of blood.

_Why? Why would someone so rich, so brilliant, so noble as the top student in the grade, spend money on a poor, dirty student from Songyang High School?_

Once the stool beneath her was still, Le Mulan looked at Zhang Yu again and slowly extended her hand.

Suddenly, Bai Zhenzhen pressed down on her palm. "Hey, hey, hey! What do you think you're doing? You haven't paid yet."

And so, after Le Mulan transferred 2,000 yuan, Zhang Yu felt a small, cold hand slowly reach for his.

It started with a tentative touch to his fingertips, then he felt the hand slide like a snake along his fingers to the back of his hand, where it rested gently.

_It's like a block of ice…_ The thought had barely crossed Zhang Yu's mind when Le Mulan quickly pulled her hand back.

She nodded, exhaling softly. "That's enough."

Bai Zhenzhen watched her with curiosity. "All done? Want to touch me? I can give you a discount."

The corners of Le Mulan's normally cold lips curled up slightly as she shook her head in satisfaction. "Not today, but maybe next time."

"When that time comes, could I pay you both to touch you at the same time?"

After receiving an affirmative answer, the arc of Le Mulan's lips widened, and she departed with Lian Tianji.

Watching the 'stool' also get up and walk away, Zhang Yu was speechless. "Is Le Mulan sick or something?"

"What's wrong with an easy chance to make money?" Bai Zhenzhen said.

Zhang Yu was still puzzled. "But why did she want to touch us?"

Bai Zhenzhen shrugged. "Who knows? Maybe it's some kind of heart art? Rich people have all sorts of bizarre heart arts."

After finishing their meal at the buffet, Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen made their way to the spectator stands. They planned to use a Heaven's Eye Talisman to gather some intelligence on the three major high schools before the competition began.

As for their concealment talismans, they had naturally activated those long before setting foot inside Purple Cloud High School.

But the next moment, as he activated the Heaven's Eye Talisman, Zhang Yu stared, momentarily stunned at the sight before him.

In the direction of the White Dragon High School contingent, the same line of text floated above every competitor's head: Immortal Resonance Group Company Data.

Over at the Red Pagoda High School area, several students with dark complexions had another message: For business inquiries, please contact Red Pagoda Husbandry.

Zhang Yu quickly glanced toward the Purple Cloud High School team and saw text materializing over the heads of Le Mulan, Lian Tianji, and the others: Purple Cloud Supplements Non-Public Information. Legal action will be pursued for any forced viewing.

Zhang Yu sighed faintly. "Their information is all hidden."

"The companies behind the three major high schools—Immortal Resonance, Red Pagoda, and Purple Cloud—are really taking this competition seriously."

…

In the audience.

Lan Ling stared down at the bustling competition grounds.

"Why did you drag me here?" he asked coldly. "To watch our school's team get annihilated?"

Beside him, Zhou Chechen chuckled. "Lan Ling, don't confine your vision to a single high school or a single competition."

"I brought you here today to witness a new body tempering revolution in Songyang City."

Lan Ling frowned. "What are you trying to do? Why didn't you participate in the athletics meet two weeks ago? Did you already know about Oasis Group's partnership with them?"
