Zhou Chechen smiled faintly. "Lan Ling, the three major high schools gave us a spot—a spot to receive their technical support in body tempering and compete for a place among the Ten Greats."

"This year, you will give that spot to me."

"Next year, during our third year, I will give you my full support to seize that spot."

"If you agree, then from this day forward, we will be the last two students from Songyang High School to enter the Ten Greats."

"If you refuse, then for the next year, I will do nothing but beat you every single day. I guarantee you won't graduate."

…

In the Spirit Realm.

Having taken a rare half-day off, Mo Tianyi felt a profound sense of weakness, a wave of guilt for not working washing over him.

Watching the competition at Purple Cloud High School via a live stream, he couldn't help but ask, "Boss, is this competition really that important? Important enough to watch live?"

A blurry figure beside him nodded. "Very important. It could even affect the entire power structure of Songyang's sixteen families."

_The sixteen families of Songyang…_ Mo Tianyi knew these were the sixteen wealthiest and most powerful families in the city.

Their members not only intermarried but were also deeply embedded within the Songyang branches of major corporations, acting as local dragons who helped the large companies manage the region and control an immense amount of resources.

The 'Boss' watched the live feed. "The athletics meet usually starts with a physical strength assessment, followed by tests of agility, speed, and power—four events in total. The final scores are then calculated…"

Here, his voice trailed off. "It's starting. They're about to test the competitors' physical strength. Let's see just how far the technological breakthroughs of the three major high schools have come."

On the large screen at the venue, names and scores flickered into view as contestant after contestant completed the test.

However, only the top ten scores remained displayed on the screen.

Currently occupying the top spot was… Chu Qiuhe of White Dragon High School, with a level of 4.49.

…

Just before the physical strength test began.

At the highest point of the stands, at the very back of the crowd, a boy in a Purple Cloud High School uniform was also watching the competition grounds.

The young man bore a slight resemblance to Le Mulan; at first glance, he could almost be mistaken for a girl. This was especially true given his height of just under two meters, which made him appear even more delicate at Purple Cloud High School, where everyone was physically imposing.

Only the incredibly complex, purple, vertical-pupil marking between his brows hinted at his extraordinary nature.

At that moment, another man—this one with bronze skin, standing about two and a half meters tall, and holding a phone for a live stream—approached the Purple Cloud student, laughing as he walked.

"Everyone, look who it is! My good brother, the top student of Purple Cloud High School's second year, Le Jingchen, who is also the vice president of the Student Council."

The live-streaming giant squeezed in next to Le Jingchen, fitting both of them into the frame.

Feeling the man's proximity, Le Jingchen's muscles tensed for an instant before relaxing again. He smiled and waved at the live stream audience.

Though he disliked the man's closeness, Le Jingchen knew that this body tempering influencer, known as 'Gang Shan,' had over eight million followers. He was a representative figure of traditional body tempering in Songyang City, famous for his insistence on using only alchemical enhancers and no surgery.

And Gang Shan's signature was that he never wore anything but shorts, so as to display his meticulously honed muscles to the world.

The reason he was here live-streaming a first-year athletics competition was, naturally, at the invitation of a corporation.

_So what if he's a representative of traditional body tempering,_ Le Jingchen thought. _If the price is right, he still has to come and promote the new technology._

He even knew that his current encounter with the man, and their subsequent joint broadcast, were all orchestrated by Purple Cloud Supplements.

_Today's athletics competition… the clash of students and technologies on the field is one thing._

_The war of public opinion off the field is a whole other battle._

_Hmph, I wonder how many people will jump out today to pull stunts for attention._

Just then, the influencer, Gang Shan, spoke up.

"Jingchen, what are your thoughts on today's competition?"

Le Jingchen offered a faint smile. "Just like the second-year athletics meet two weeks ago, it's primarily a contest between the three major high schools. After all, the recent breakthroughs in body tempering have only been applied to their students…"

Following the pre-arranged plan, Le Jingchen began to promote the new technology in a seemingly objective and neutral manner, dropping hints here and there.

After they had chatted for a while, Gang Shan looked toward the competition floor.

"Oh, the competition has officially begun. First up is the physical strength test. This round is scored based on physical strength, with a maximum of 50 points, correct?"

"Then the second event tests agility, for a total of 75 points. The third event is speed, also for 75 points, and the final power event is worth a total of 150."

"The final ranking of the athletics competition is calculated from the total score of these four events."

Gang Shan first explained the scoring system to his viewers.

Then, to give his audience a more intuitive understanding of the revolutionary nature of the new body tempering technology, Gang Shan provided some context.

"It's been about eight and a half months since the school year started for these first-years."

"The average physical strength for most ordinary high schools at this point is around level 1.0."

"Key high schools are a bit better. Their students' average level can reach close to 2.0 by now."

"Of course, among the key high schools, Songyang High is particularly strong in athletics, so they'd be much higher. A few of their top students might even have a chance to challenge the powerhouses from the three major high schools."

"As for Songyang City's three major high schools, they are in a league of their own. Based on previous years' data, their students' average level can approach 3.0, and the absolute top students might even break through level 4.0."

Meanwhile, as the physical tests began, the contestants' physical strength levels flashed across the big screen one after another.

Very quickly, the score in first place stunned countless people in the audience, as well as the many netizens watching the live stream.

White Dragon High School, Chu Qiuhe, 4.49.

Gang Shan was astonished. "Level 4.49? To reach this level in just eight and a half months? This Chu Qiuhe must be White Dragon High School's ace, right?"

Beside him, Le Jingchen smiled faintly. "He's hardly an ace. The strongest in this year's class at White Dragon High should be Yu Xinghan and Song Hailong."

Gang Shan replied, "Level 4.49 isn't even considered an ace?"

Le Jingchen explained, "That's because the body tempering technologies of all three major high schools have had a breakthrough. You can tell from Chu Qiuhe's appearance that he's undergone modification surgery. This allows his body to mimic the muscular structure of a demonic beast, shattering his original limitations and achieving explosive growth."

Gang Shan said, "But modification surgery still has its risks, doesn't it? And many people find the physical changes difficult to accept."

Le Jingchen nodded. "This kind of surgery that directly alters the body is certainly very risky. In contrast, Purple Cloud's super-metabolism surgery is much simpler, with lower risk and higher efficiency…"

As Le Jingchen was introducing the technological advancements of Purple Cloud Supplements, as if to prove his point, the big screen changed. The first-place spot now read: Purple Cloud High School, Lian Tianji, 4.56.

Gang Shan was amazed. "This level of physical strength is already higher than any first-year champion from previous years, isn't it?"

Le Jingchen nodded slightly. "With the breakthrough in body tempering technology, the first-year athletics records are bound to be broken time and time again. The difference between contestants who have used the new technology and those who haven't will be like the difference between heaven and earth, like modern people versus ancient ones…"

Just as Le Jingchen was expounding on the importance of the new body tempering technology, the name at the top of the big screen changed once more.

Songyang High School, Zhang Yu, 4.95.

---

# Chapter 107: Physical Strength Ranking

The strongest is White Dragon High School?

Red Pagoda High School is certainly formidable as well.

If it were Purple Cloud High School, that wouldn't be impossible either.

What the hell? What is Songyang High School?

Songyang High School, Zhang Yu, 4.95?

The sudden appearance of Zhang Yu's score left countless people utterly stunned.

The students from the three major high schools were the most shocked of all.

Only because they had undergone modifications with the new body tempering technology did they truly understand the chasm between their former and current selves.

Chu Qiuhe stared intently at the "4.95" on the screen. It was a terrifying score, one that made him feel an impulse to fall to his knees, and a score that a student from Songyang High School should never have been able to achieve.

His pair of rhinoceros-like ears twitched rapidly. "How did he do it? Did Purple Cloud or Red Pagoda help him? But he shows no physical signs of their new technologies."

"Could it be…"

Chu Qiuhe subconsciously glanced in Yu Xinghan's direction.

If there was a single competitor among the three major high schools who showed no signs of any new technology, it was this disciple of a Golden Core master.

"Did Zhang Yu receive our White Dragon High School's body tempering technology? And has he already achieved the same level of physical control as Yu Xinghan?"

"Is… is that even possible?"

Chu Qiuhe shook his head, dismissing the guess. Neither the Immortal Resonance Group nor the Oasis Group had any such plans, and it was even more impossible for Zhang Yu to possess an aptitude that could rival Yu Xinghan's.

So, after eliminating all other possibilities, Chu Qiuhe arrived at the only remaining one: "Songyang High School's body tempering technology has also had a breakthrough?"

…

On the other side.

In the Purple Cloud High School rest area, Lian Tianji gazed at the score on the big screen and lamented internally, "He wasn't lying? His physical strength is really level 4.95?"

If someone like that came to Purple Cloud High School, he would be another powerhouse capable of using him as a stool.

"How did he do it? Which company is backing him?"

"Could it be… Songyang High School has also mastered a new body tempering technology?"

Lian Tianji's gaze suddenly shifted to Le Mulan beside him. _The venerable number one has been keeping an eye on Zhang Yu for a while. Did she see how extraordinary he was from the start? As expected of the top student in our grade; her intelligence network and judgment of character are far superior to mine._

…

Meanwhile.

In the Songyang High School rest area.

He Dayou, who had just completed his own physical strength test, shot to his feet, staring in disbelief at Zhang Yu's score.

"4.95?!"

The score wasn't just high; in He Dayou's eyes, it was absurdly high. He suspected that 4.95 might very well be the highest physical strength level among all the competitors in the entire event.

He looked at Zhang Yu, his face a mask of envy and jealousy, and thought, _Could Zhang Pianpian have secretly supported Zhang Yu with White Dragon High School's technology?_

_Even if she didn't, she must have poured an insane amount of money into him._

_What exactly is the relationship between Zhang Yu and Zhang Pianpian? A mother investing in her son… no, even a daughter paying off her father's debts wouldn't throw money around this recklessly!_

Wang Hai, who was also in the Songyang High rest area watching the competition, was equally stunned. "What just happened?"

In the next few moments, his phone rang several times in succession.

He found himself explaining to the school's leadership on the other end of the line, "No, I really don't know anything about a new technology."

"Zhang Yu hardly ever trained with me."

"I have no idea how he got his level to 4.95."

…

In the stands.

Lan Ling stared at the score, both shocked and furious. He turned to Zhou Chechen.

"How could that poor bastard Zhang Yu get this far? Did he undergo White Dragon's surgery?"

Zhou Chechen frowned. "I haven't heard anything about that, but…"

Thinking about the timing of Oasis Group's arrival in Songyang City, recalling Zhang Pianpian's investment in Zhang Yu, and then considering Zhang Yu's almost unbelievable improvement in physical strength…

Zhou Chechen's expression slowly darkened. "Could it be that Zhang Pianpian knew all along about the Oasis Group partnership and the coming breakthroughs in the three major high schools' body tempering technology? Is that why she set things up on Songyang's side?"

"But what is her objective?"

Zhou Chechen couldn't figure it out at the moment, but that didn't stop the sight of Zhang Yu on the field from becoming increasingly irritating.

He took a deep breath. "Whatever her goal is, it's already mid-April. In less than two months, Zhang Pianpian has the college entrance exams, and then university interviews…"

…

At the back of the stands.

One moment, Le Jingchen had been introducing Purple Cloud High School's super-metabolism surgery. The next, Zhang Yu's score of 4.95 left him momentarily speechless.

However, as a professional influencer, Gang Shan reacted quickly. "This student from Songyang High School must have used a new body tempering technology as well, right?"

Le Jingchen nodded decisively. "Without a doubt. Without using the latest body tempering technology, it's impossible to reach a physical strength of 4.95 at this stage of the first year just by relying on alchemical enhancers and acupuncture."

"This student from Songyang High has definitely used some new technology, and his body has been modified."

Seeing that Zhang Yu's skin was neither dark nor purplish, and that he displayed no demonic beast characteristics, Le Jingchen guessed internally, _Has Songyang High also mastered some new technology?_

Le Jingchen didn't jump to conclusions, deciding instead to carefully observe the performance of the other Songyang High students.

Just then, Gang Shan sighed. "This wave of developments in new body tempering technology is truly astonishing. Even a student from Songyang High has reached a level that far surpasses previous champions."

Le Jingchen set aside his thoughts and chimed in, "That's the nature of progress in the Immortal Dao. It always benefits society, allowing more and more people to walk further down the path of cultivation."

Gang Shan asked curiously, "A physical strength of 4.95 is terrifying for a first-year. There can't be anyone here with a higher score, can there?"

Le Jingchen shook his head with a chuckle. "4.95 is indeed impressive, but it's still a bit lacking compared to the top students from the three major high schools who have been enhanced with the latest body tempering technologies."

Shortly after Le Jingchen spoke, a terrifying dragon's roar echoed from the competition floor, causing countless spectators' faces to pale and their hearts to race as an instinctual fear washed over them.

And the name at the top of the big screen had changed again.

Red Pagoda High School, Hu Yuntao, 4.98.

But before the crowd could fully express their amazement at Hu Yuntao's score, another, deeper and more majestic beastly roar resounded, pushing him down to second place.

White Dragon High School, Song Hailong, 5.03.

Gang Shan exclaimed, "School has only been in session for just over seven months, and his physical strength has already broken level 5?"

He shook his head with a wry smile. "The times are truly changing."

As if in response to Gang Shan's remark, the scores on the big screen changed again and again as more students from the three major high schools completed their tests.

The top spot, in particular, was contested fiercely.

Song Hailong had just claimed first place with a 5.03, only to be supplanted moments later by Xiong Wenwu's 5.05.

But Xiong Wenwu's 5.05 didn't hold for long before Yu Xinghan seized the top spot with a 5.07.

Once Yu Xinghan took first place, his position remained unshakable, and the entire top-ten list gradually began to solidify.

But while the vast majority of the audience and staff were captivated by the performance of the top students from the three major high schools, marveling at their ever-increasing physical strength.

Le Jingchen's attention was fixed on the fifth and seventh places.

Fifth Place, Songyang High School, Zhang Yu, 4.95.

Seventh Place, Songyang High School, Bai Zhenzhen, 4.92.

_Songyang High School… they really have mastered a new body tempering technology?_ Le Jingchen thought.

_Hmph… so they deliberately sacrificed the second-year competition to feign weakness, all so they could make a stunning debut at today's first-year competition and promote their new technology?_

_Are they trying to usurp the position of the three major high schools?_

_Heh, quite ambitious. I really underestimated you._

Although he knew the collective strength of the top students from the three major high schools was more than enough to crush the others.

The thought that the latter half of the top ten might be infiltrated by this Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen filled Le Jingchen with a sense of disgust.

It felt like watching a poor person enter Purple Cloud High School without being disinfected, like a pristine tabletop being sullied by a dirty hand.

Just then, Gang Shan asked curiously, "Jingchen, that Le Mulan from Purple Cloud is your sister, right? Her performance seems a little lackluster. What are your thoughts?"

Sixth Place, Purple Cloud High School, Le Mulan, 4.93.

Le Jingchen smiled faintly and explained with composure, "Purple Cloud's super-metabolism technology primarily focuses on enhancing the body's drug resistance. This allows a cultivator to increase their physical strength more easily and rapidly, but it also leads to an issue."

"That is, raw physical strength alone cannot fully represent their true combat potential."

Gang Shan asked, "True combat potential?"

Le Jingchen elaborated, "Naturally, it refers to their performance after their usual regimen of alchemical enhancers."

Gang Shan nodded slightly. They were all people who used enhancers daily, so of course 'true combat potential' referred to their strength under the influence of their regular doses.

Le Jingchen continued, "Although Le Mulan's physical strength appears to be 4.93, because she can handle more potent alchemical enhancers on a daily basis, her true combat potential is actually far greater. When she really exerts herself, she can perform at a level comparable to someone with a physical strength of 5.05."

"And that is something a simple physical strength test can't measure."

"But once they reach a bottleneck, say at the peak of the Qi Refining stage where both competitors have a physical strength of 10, the one who has undergone the super-metabolism surgery will undoubtedly perform better."

"If you don't believe me," Le Jingchen said with utter confidence, "just watch the upcoming events. Le Mulan will definitely place in the top three."

…

At the same time, Wang Hai's phone was about to explode from the sheer volume of calls.

Zhou Chechen was also being bombarded with one inquiry after another.

"No, Principal! We really haven't had a technological breakthrough."

"Uncle, you should know my situation. I haven't even undergone the surgery myself, so how could I give it to some poor first-year?"

"Auntie, please help me contact Purple Cloud Supplements. I have no intention of breaching our contract. We haven't made any deals with other companies…"

Hanging up, thoroughly exasperated, Zhou Chechen shot a furious glare toward the Songyang High School rest area.

"Zhang Yu… Bai Zhenzhen… just which company did Zhang Pianpian sell them out to?"

Amidst the noise and chaos, as opinions and rumors about companies, high schools, and competitors began to ripple out from the venue, the physical strength test finally concluded. The second event of the athletics meet was about to begin.

---

# Chapter 108: Agility

With a deep rumble, walls began to rise from the stadium floor, partitioning the vast space into a series of smaller rooms.

In the Songyang High School rest area, Zhang Yu watched in amazement. "Purple Cloud High's stadium can actually transform? Compared to this, what is our school's stadium but a glorified sandpit?"

The faces of most Songyang students around him darkened at his words. However, considering the 4.95 physical strength that had just earned him fifth place, no one dared to openly rebuke him. Even He Dayou, the Son of the School Director, could only pretend he hadn't heard the slander against their school.

After all, at Songyang High, scores were king, and a physical strength level like the one Zhang Yu had just displayed was the king of kings. He was at a level where a single glance could shatter the soul of a lesser student.

Wang Hai quickly changed the subject. "The athletics meet doesn't just test physical strength. The next events will test agility, speed, and power."

"Agility is worth 75 points, speed is also 75, and power is worth 150. Every event is crucial. Anyone who specializes too much won't get a good rank, because this meet tests a student's comprehensive physical abilities."

"Pay attention, they're explaining the rules now."

An animated video began playing on the big screen, demonstrating the next trial.

In the video, a single competitor stood alone in one of the small rooms on the field.

A ring of light with a three-meter radius illuminated the ground beneath the competitor's feet.

Of course, the ring's size would be proportionally increased for larger competitors.

Then, the video showed the room's four walls beginning to shoot high-speed steel balls toward the competitor.

Simultaneously, the ring of light on the floor would begin to shrink, steadily increasing the difficulty of dodging the steel balls within its confines.

The trial would end the moment a competitor was struck by a steel ball; stepping outside the circle also counted as a failure.

A competitor's score for this event was determined by how long they could last inside the ring. The longer the time, the better the score, and the one who lasted the longest would take first place.

Any competitor who failed to place in the top twenty in this event would be immediately eliminated, barred from even participating in the next round.

"Everyone understand?" Wang Hai asked. "It's very similar to the agility training I usually have you do, just much more extreme."

Zhang Yu stroked his chin. "In that case, bigger competitors are at a huge disadvantage in this round. They'll have to dodge more steel balls at any given moment."

Wang Hai added, "A larger physique has its advantages. It allows one to excel in the later power competition, so it naturally has its drawbacks, like being an easier target in this agility trial and being at a disadvantage in the upcoming speed event."

"The athletics meet is designed to test all-around physical fitness. Even with certain focuses, it won't allow heavily specialized students to achieve high rankings… power, speed, and agility are all indispensable."

The video then went on to explain some of the finer details, such as the prohibition on circulating mana during the competition, which would be monitored by a mandatory mana-detecting patch.

Zhang Yu nodded, understanding that he would have to temporarily halt even the passive breathing exercise of his Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method.

And since it was an athletics meet testing physical prowess, spiritual roots were also forbidden.

For that reason, Bai Zhenzhen had kept her spiritual root completely suppressed since she had boarded the bus that morning, with no intention of letting its power manifest.

Once the detailed rules had been explained, Bai Zhenzhen spoke up. "The event officially starts in ten minutes. Come on, Yu-boy, let's hit the restroom so we don't have to hold it during the competition."

The two of them headed for the restrooms together. Along the way, they saw teams from the various high schools making their final preparations, which, of course, primarily involved taking alchemical enhancers.

They watched students from ordinary high schools inject unmarked, unpackaged syringes into their acne-ridden arms.

They saw students from White Dragon High, confident in their physical might, downing cans of brand-name potions in front of any nearby cameras.

They observed the dark-skinned monsters from Red Pagoda High injecting needle after needle into their veins.

They witnessed Le Mulan and Lian Tianji from Purple Cloud High performing intracranial injections after their intracardiac ones, enhancing their all-around capabilities…

After seeing all that… well, Zhang Yu was no longer as shocked as he used to be. He wouldn't ask naive questions like, "I thought the athletics meet was only supposed to test physical ability? Why aren't enhancers banned?"

Now, if someone were to ask him that, he would explain with righteous conviction, "When testing the body's various capabilities, that naturally includes its drug resistance. That's just how things are in Kunxu."

They arrived at the restrooms and split off toward the men's and women's facilities.

Although Zhang Yu had sampled many a restroom in his life—including, but not limited to, those at Songyang High, Red Pagoda High, and White Dragon High…

He was still shocked by what he saw now.

_This place actually has a sideboard? And there's a box of chopsticks and a box of spoons on it?_

And since there was a sideboard, the sight of a dining table next to it wasn't quite as surprising.

But when he saw the sign taped to the table that read, "Urinating on the dining table is prohibited,"… he fell silent once more.

_What the hell… are the students at Purple Cloud High this uncivilized?_

However, after reading a notice posted on the adjacent wall, he realized his understanding had been slightly off.

Due to an excessive number of students suffering from mental breakdowns, the school's profits had declined in the previous quarter. As a result, they had implemented a "Care for Underachievers" policy.

Not only had they installed dining tables and sideboards in the restrooms to allow underachievers to eat in comfort and peace, but they had also banned all forms of bullying within the lavatories.

_I see, so it's to care for the underachievers… but that somehow makes it even more like the work of a devil incarnate._

Meanwhile, outside the women's restroom.

Bai Zhenzhen was curiously inspecting the… other doors besides the standard men's and women's rooms.

One of them was labeled: Le Mulan's Private Restroom.

_A private restroom for the top student in the grade?_

Bai Zhenzhen wanted to try going inside, but she found the door had no handle. It seemed to require some form of identity verification to open automatically.

A flicker of envy crossed Bai Zhenzhen's eyes.

"Songyang High is so lame. They should really learn from Purple Cloud. Wouldn't it be great if they built private restrooms for the top three students?"

A few moments later, the two returned to the competition area.

Just before entering the field, Bai Zhenzhen consumed a vial of an intellect-enhancement agent to improve her focus during the event.

Zhang Yu also took a stimulant to increase his reaction speed on the field.

Although he was following a path of natural body tempering, if a little help could earn him a few extra points, he wasn't stubborn enough to refuse it.

Then, they both drank a few bottles of a neural filler to ward off any drowsiness during the late-night competition.

Soon, all the competitors entered the arena. After a mana-detecting patch was affixed to each of them, they were assigned to their individual rooms.

As the ring of light on the floor flared to life, Zhang Yu's nerves tensed.

The next moment, with a sharp whistle, steel balls shot out from the surrounding walls at high speed.

_Not bad… much slower than the Body-Piercing Sword Qi Zhen stabs me with._

The stimulant had fully kicked in, and Zhang Yu's muscles were primed. His reactions were incredibly swift. He watched the incoming steel balls and moved his body fluidly, dodging each one.

_As long as the circle is this big, I don't need to use full concentration yet._

The state of full concentration was the level-ten effect of his Martial Ascension Heart-Tempering Art. It focused his mind to an unprecedented degree, to the point where the world seemed to slow down.

But full concentration had one drawback: it couldn't be maintained for long.

When he had first mastered it, he could only hold it for a minute.

Now, with the growth of his Dao heart and the strengthening of his martial will, he had extended that time to a minute and a half.

_But since I can still manage in my normal state, I'll wait until the circle gets smaller and dodging becomes more difficult before I activate full concentration…_

…

In the stands.

The influencer Gang Shan watched the field and began his commentary. "In this round, as the circle continues to shrink, the difficulty will increase dramatically. It tests not only the body's reaction time and speed, but also the endurance of one's mental focus…"

Just then, the first eliminations began to occur.

A high-speed steel ball slammed into the leg of a student from an ordinary high school, causing him to stagger.

As his movement faltered, more steel balls shot toward him.

The student's mind was already in a panic; his physical conditioning and mental reflexes were completely overwhelmed by the barrage of projectiles.

_Is the competition this much harder than our usual school training?_

The next moment, as a volley of steel balls rattled against his body, the student coughed up blood and collapsed.

After being removed from the field, he stared at the big screen, at the images of those still competing, his expression a mixture of envy and jealousy.

_Are these guys from the key high schools and the three major high schools all monsters? How can they last this long?_

Similar scenes were unfolding in every corner of the arena, as a large number of competitors from ordinary high schools were eliminated, many of them injured in the process.

Gang Shan directed his viewers' attention from the eliminated students to the competitors from Purple Cloud High, who were dodging with composed ease.

Inside his circle, Lian Tianji seemed to have eyes in the back of his head, making small, precise movements to avoid the incoming steel balls.

Nearby, Le Mulan appeared even more relaxed. She strolled within her circle as if taking a leisurely walk in a garden, letting the blurs of the high-speed projectiles pass right by her, as if they were dancing in unison with her graceful steps.

Gang Shan sighed. "The gap between them is just too vast. Nearly all the students from the ordinary high schools have been eliminated, while those from the three major high schools are still far from their limits."

Le Jingchen looked at the eliminated students with a sense of disdain.

_Spending a few thousand or tens of thousands a month to try and become a cultivator?_

Le Jingchen couldn't understand why these poor people tried so hard to cultivate. In his view, it made little difference to their lives whether they cultivated or not; forcing the issue was just looking for trouble.

But, of course, Le Jingchen would never voice such thoughts aloud. Otherwise, how would Purple Cloud Supplements make so much money? How would his family acquire so many resources?

So, for the live stream, Le Jingchen said, "Actually, the gap isn't as large as it seems. I believe that ordinary high schools also have students with extraordinary aptitude. The reason for the large performance gap we're seeing is often just a lack of access to information."

Before the competition, the three major high schools had kept their technological breakthroughs a closely guarded secret while probing each other for weaknesses.

Now that the competition was underway, Le Jingchen knew there was no longer a need for secrecy.

He continued, "Take, for example, Purple Cloud High's super-metabolism surgery, or the slightly inferior demonic muscle surgery from White Dragon High. If students from ordinary high schools knew about these technologies and underwent these procedures, they might very well have a chance to compete with the likes of Le Mulan and Song Hailong."

With that, Le Jingchen pointed toward Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen. "Look, Gang Shan. After those two students from Songyang High received the new body tempering technology, aren't they now keeping pace with the students from the three major high schools?"

Since he had sensed that Songyang High was trying to make a name for itself at this athletics meet, Le Jingchen had no qualms about using them to promote the new body tempering technology.

# Chapter 109: If You're a Brother, Come Borrow Money

On the field of competition.

Bai Zhenzhen’s form was a phantom, flashing back and forth at high speeds within the circle, constantly evading the steel balls rocketing toward her from all directions.

After two months of arduous training, the repeated tempering of the Thunderclap True Body, aided by her True Spiritual Root, had continuously elevated the reaction and explosive speed of every muscle in Bai Zhenzhen's body.

At this very moment, nerves running through her entire frame transmitted her will, controlling the contraction and eruption of her muscles, allowing her to move and dodge the high-speed steel balls simultaneously.

Because her body's reactions and movements were so incredibly fast, she left a trail of afterimages in her wake, always managing to dodge each steel ball in the nick of time.

"Much slower than Yu-boy's hands."

Compared to Zhang Yu, who went all out during their practical training, the steel balls before her seemed significantly slower, allowing Bai Zhenzhen to even spare a thought to critique them as she dodged.

Meanwhile, nearly all the contestants from the three great high schools, just like Bai Zhenzhen, were effortlessly evading the high-speed steel balls assailing them from every direction, creating a stark contrast with the other contestants who were being continuously eliminated.

…

In the spectator stands.

Gang Shan nodded and said, "Jingchen, you were right. These two students from Songyang High School have indeed caught up to the level of the three great high schools."

Le Jingchen smiled. "This is the impact of breakthroughs in body tempering technology. Even students who were once far inferior to those from the three great high schools now have the potential to catch up to their top performers after undergoing surgical modification."

"But their performance seems to be a far cry from Le Mulan's? They don't look as comfortable as she does," Gang SHan commented.

Le Jingchen nodded, stating as if it were obvious, "The super-metabolism surgery brings about a comprehensive improvement in drug resistance, allowing for the excessive consumption of various alchemical enhancers. And the effects of these enhancers cover all aspects, whether it's strength, speed, explosiveness, balance, flexibility, reaction, focus, digestion… all of the body’s various functions can be improved through potions. In other words, the enhancement a person gains from super-metabolism surgery is the most comprehensive, without any blind spots or weaknesses."

"Take this current round, for example. Besides physical speed and reflexes, it tests the brain's focus and endurance even more, which are things that most body tempering cultivation techniques struggle to develop."

"But for Le Mulan, who has undergone the super-metabolism surgery, it's just a matter of an injection into the cranium. If one shot isn't enough, she takes two, and she can possess a level of focus that surpasses every other student on this field."

Le Jingchen then recommended, "If anyone is interested in the super-metabolism body tempering technology, you can follow the official website of Purple Cloud Supplements, where you will find more detailed information…"

After Le Jingchen finished his spiel for Purple Cloud, Gang Shan asked curiously, "Then is this surgery very expensive?"

Le Jingchen nodded. "Purple Cloud has always wanted to benefit the world with new technology. Although the cost of this technique is not low, the surgical fee has now been brought down to under one million."

Gang Shan said, "That price is certainly not cheap, but as it happens, the 'Dare to Lend' platform recently discussed something with me, and together we are launching a benefit for everyone."

"As long as you go to the 'Dare to Lend' platform and borrow money from me, you can be exempt from six installments of service fees."

"If you're a true brother, come to me for a loan…"

Le Jingchen watched quietly from the side as the other man ran his advertisement, sighing internally, _Although this Gang Shan is a body-tempering influencer, he neither sells alchemical enhancers nor cultivation techniques. He only does the safest thing, which is loan advertising. The mortality rate of his fans is among the lowest in the body-tempering influencer world. Among streamers, he's a rare breed who cherishes his reputation._

_I wonder how much the company paid to have him come here and promote the new technology._

…

Meanwhile, right after Le Jingchen and Gang Shan had each finished their wave of advertisements.

All the students from ordinary high schools on the field had been eliminated.

And as the space for dodging continued to shrink, students from the key high schools also began to be eliminated one after another.

He Dayou desperately dodged the high-speed steel balls coming from all directions. As the available space shrank, his mind was in a state of extreme focus, and beads of sweat dripped continuously from his forehead.

Suddenly, he felt his leg slow down; the exertion of his muscles didn't seem to keep up with his brain's commands.

Then, with a series of sharp impacts, He Dayou fell to the ground, unwilling to accept his defeat.

The transplanted muscles, after all, were not yet fully under his control, and after a long period of high-intensity operation, a mistake had finally occurred.

He looked at his time: 58 seconds.

Sighing with regret, he returned to the Songyang High School rest area.

Zhao Tianxing, who was beside him, looked at He Dayou with some envy. _He actually lasted for 58 seconds. If I had gone up there, I probably would have lasted 30 seconds at most, right?_

But He Dayou, the object of Zhao Tianxing's envy, felt not the slightest bit of joy.

At this moment, He Dayou was gazing wistfully at the large screen broadcasting the event.

"Not a single person from the three great high schools has been eliminated?"

"The new body tempering technology… if only I could also undergo that kind of modification."

…

Le Jingchen commented, "The students from the key high schools are almost all eliminated, and the circle has already shrunk by nearly half. Next, it'll be the students from the three great high schools who start getting hit."

Gang Shan asked curiously, "Jingchen, who do you think will ultimately take the championship in this round?"

Le Jingchen answered with composure, "The students from Red Pagoda High School generally have larger bodies, which puts them at the biggest disadvantage in this round. They should be the first among the three great high schools to be hit by the steel balls."

"Songyang's two students have the advantage of a smaller build, so they can last a bit longer. They'll probably be hit after Red Pagoda High School, along with most of the contestants from Purple Cloud and White Dragon."

"As for the final first place… it should be between Le Mulan and Yu Xinghan."

"Although I am very confident in my younger sister's strength and Purple Cloud's new technology, Yu Xinghan is a Golden Core disciple, after all. The investment in him far exceeds that of any other contestant present, and all his stats are the highest in the entire field. Mulan may not necessarily be able to defeat him…"

In his commentary, although Le Jingchen praised Yu Xinghan highly, his words constantly emphasized the other's status as a Golden Core disciple.

His intention was clearly that even if Yu Xinghan won later, the reason would be attributed to his status, whereas if Le Mulan won, it would be due to the power of Purple Cloud's technology.

And the subsequent progression of the competition unfolded just as Le Jingchen had predicted.

First, the students from Red Pagoda High School were struck by the steel balls amidst furious, beastly roars.

Next, contestants from Purple Cloud and White Dragon High Schools began to be hit.

Bang!

Chu Qiuhe felt the impact of a steel ball on his arm. He gave a cold snort and simply stopped dodging, allowing a barrage of steel balls to slam into his body with a series of crisp cracks. He, however, walked out of the room nonchalantly as if nothing had happened.

"Dodging back and forth is so annoying. As I thought, taking it head-on suits me better."

As he walked, he also turned his gaze to the large screen, concerned with the performance of the remaining students still in the competition.

Lian Tianji, on the other side, held on for another ten seconds or so before he too was struck for failing to dodge in time.

Facing the admiring gazes of countless students from ordinary and key high schools, Lian Tianji walked towards the rest area while staring intently at the live broadcast on the large screen, watching to see who was still competing.

A trace of regret appeared on his face. "As expected, I still couldn't measure up to the divine number one and Zhang Yu, huh?"

But as the students from the three great high schools were gradually eliminated, Gang Shan was surprised to find that Bai Zhenzhen and Zhang Yu were still on the field.

Besides Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen, the only contestants remaining were Le Mulan and Yu Xinghan.

"They made it to the top four?"

Le Jingchen also felt a bit of surprise, but on second thought, it seemed normal.

"The physical strength of this Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen is, after all, ranked 5th and 7th on this field. With the advantage of their smaller builds, it's quite normal for them to squeeze into the top four in this round."

"I shouldn't have subconsciously looked down on them because of Songyang High School. After all, they must have also applied the new body tempering techniques."

"These two might have a chance to rank in the top five for the overall athletics meet score."

Le Jingchen secretly reflected for a moment, then turned his attention back to the competition field.

By now, the circle had shrunk to the size of a single person. Zhang Yu had long since entered a state of full concentration, minutely shifting his body as he observed the slowly approaching steel balls, doing his utmost to evade each one.

Bai Zhenzhen, on the other hand, twisted her body again and again, performing all sorts of incredible evasive maneuvers. With astonishing speed, neural response, and flexibility, she compensated for her lack of focus and continued to hold on.

But for both of them, the most difficult part now was not the evasion itself, but having to constantly turn their heads and bodies to see the steel balls coming from all directions in the insufficient space.

Bai Zhenzhen gritted her teeth in her mind, _At this rate, I won't be able to see them all._

As the space for evasion shrank further, dodging became increasingly difficult for both Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen, and they were eventually eliminated one after the other.

4th Place, Songyang High School, Bai Zhenzhen, 2 minutes 13 seconds

3rd Place, Songyang High School, Zhang Yu, 2 minutes 18 seconds

After leaving the field, Bai Zhenzhen and Zhang Yu, met with the awed gazes of the surrounding contestants, also looked with concern toward the large screen, watching Le Mulan and Yu Xinghan who were still competing for first place.

Bai Zhenzhen said with some resentment, "Those two… how do I get the feeling they can see the steel balls coming from behind them?"

Meanwhile, Le Mulan on the other side had lost her initial composure.

Her eyes and ears, under the effect of a tenfold stimulant, were sharpened to their absolute limit, perceiving the changes in airflow all around her to judge the positions from which the steel balls were being shot.

Her brain, stimulated by a tenfold intellect-enhancement agent, was operating beyond its limits, constantly determining the sequence of her next evasive actions and following the optimal path to dodge one speeding steel ball after another.

Her surging blood flowed like a great river, transporting the alchemical enhancers to every muscle in her body, stimulating their contraction and explosion, causing each of her movements to leave behind a continuous trail of afterimages.

Even so, as the circle contracted, Le Mulan felt evasion becoming more and more difficult. Her brain grew hotter from the high-speed processing, and sweat constantly secreted from her forehead, flowing down her cheeks and along her snow-white neck.

Especially as the dodging space shrank, Le Mulan could no longer turn around at all. Her perception of the steel balls coming from behind relied entirely on her hearing, which became increasingly difficult.

Bang!

The moment a steel ball struck her back, Le Mulan abruptly relaxed. Her figure flickered, and she left the small room.

2nd Place, Purple Cloud High School, Le Mulan, 2 minutes 25 seconds

When Le Mulan, having left the competition area, looked at the large screen, she was shocked to discover that Yu Xinghan was still evading within that tiny circle.

Le Mulan was stunned. _How is he doing that?_

Yu Xinghan felt the world slow down. The third eye in his mind seemed to sense the shock of the countless people present.

_Do you all find this difficult?_

His level 10 Martial Ascension Heart-Tempering Art allowed him to see a slowed world when in a state of full concentration.

The third eye in his mind granted him a three-hundred-and-sixty-degree field of vision.

And his physical strength, the highest among all contestants, displayed the most terrifying speed when he unleashed it.

…

In the spectator stands, Le Jingchen watched Yu Xinghan's movements and thought to himself, _This guy… can see behind himself? Without the circulation of mana, it must be the effect of some kind of physical modification?_

_But White Dragon High School doesn't have any related technology either. Could it be a technique from True Monarch Xinghuo? Or… is it some innate peculiarity of this guy?_

Le Jingchen couldn't be sure, but he didn't raise any objections.

After all, athletic competitions test physical power. Having a physical peculiarity was either a congenital advantage or a technological one, both of which were within the rules.

And in the very next moment, a wave of gasps erupted from the crowd.

…

On the competition field.

Just as the circle on the ground shrank to a point where it was becoming increasingly difficult for Yu Xinghan to stand, he suddenly squatted down and then pointed a single finger downward.

He actually supported himself on one index finger, with his legs crossed in a seated position, and 'sat' steadily within the circle.

Then, while touching the ground with only his index finger, the other parts of his body continued to adjust their posture, like a silver tree dancing wildly, continuing to dodge the steel balls with various incredible and superhuman poses.

In the few short seconds that followed, the strength, speed, balance, flexibility, and reaction that Yu Xinghan displayed to the crowd was that of a body so perfect it was stunning, a body that exhibited dominant power in every aspect.

It was not until the circle completely shrank, becoming smaller than the spot his finger occupied, that Yu Xinghan, under the astonished gazes of the entire audience, flickered slightly. With a push of his fingertip, he shot into the air, dodging the final wave of steel balls.

And the steel balls shooting from all directions also ceased their firing as the circle fully contracted.

When Yu Xinghan's figure descended from mid-air and stood once more in the room, he still had not been hit by a single steel ball.

1st Place, White Dragon High School, Yu Xinghan, 2 minutes 33 seconds

On the large screen, Yu Xinghan gave a slight smile to everyone present and said calmly, "Starting next month, the Immortal Resonance Group will be providing demonic muscle body tempering services in Songyang City. Everyone is welcome to follow our updates."

---

# Chapter 110: The Contest of Speed

After Yu Xinghan finished his one-sentence advertisement, he knew that an advertising fee of 100,000 would be credited to his account. He smiled, waved at the camera, and slowly walked off the competition field.

Song Hailong watched Yu Xinghan on the large screen coldly, his eyes betraying no emotion, as if the outcome of this match had long been expected.

Song Hailong believed that no one in the entire arena understood how strong Yu Xinghan was better than he did.

"The first place in this athletics meet can, without a doubt, only be him."

"Everyone else is just competing for second."

"Defeating him is not something that can be accomplished overnight."

Song Hailong had already made up his mind; whether it took one year or two, he would definitely defeat this strongest opponent he had ever faced during his high school years.

The next moment, his figure flashed. His legs, as thick as pillars, carried a terrifying impact as they swept viciously towards the approaching Yu Xinghan.

Bang!

Yu Xinghan raised his calf and casually blocked Song Hailong's sweeping kick.

As their forces collided, a strong gust of wind exploded from between them.

Yu Xinghan gave a helpless smile. "Too direct. How many times have I told you to be more subtle, to hide your hostility? Such a straightforward attack is useless against me."

Song Hailong retorted without backing down, "It's no problem for me to ambush you, but I will defeat you honorably and openly."

…

In the spectator stands.

Gang Shan exclaimed in amazement, "Yu Xinghan… what a powerful body. Is he really a first-year high school student?"

Le Jingchen nodded and said, "He is a Golden Core disciple, after all. I heard he is also True Monarch Xinghuo's final disciple, so the investment he has received is incomparable to that of an ordinary student."

"I'm afraid he will be the champion of every round for the rest of this first-year athletics meet."

After watching Yu Xinghan's performance in the previous round, Le Jingchen understood one thing.

The champion of this athletics meet was already certain to be Yu Xinghan.

Therefore, what he needed to do next was to downplay the influence of body tempering technology on Yu Xinghan as much as possible and reinforce the public's impression of his identity as a Golden Core disciple. It would be best to attribute all of the other's victories to True Monarch Xinghuo.

…

In the Songyang High School rest area on the other side.

Bai Zhenzhen looked at the large screen with some resentment, which was still replaying the spectacular highlights of Yu Xinghan's performance just now.

"Damn it, this Golden Core disciple is truly a monster."

"Before my physical strength breaks through to level 5.0, I probably have no chance of beating him."

"But…"

Bai Zhenzhen looked at Zhang Yu beside her and said, "Yu-boy, I think you have a chance to beat him."

Zhang Yu, while drinking water, chuckled. "Is that so? I'm afraid there are only two people in this entire arena who would believe in me like that."

Bai Zhenzhen asked quizzically, "Oh? Who else has such unique insight as I do?"

Zhang Yu laughed heartily. "That would be me, of course."

The two looked at each other and smiled. Bai Zhenzhen then continued, "That guy feels like he has eyes in the back of his head, which is why he had such a huge advantage in the first round. Otherwise, he might not have been so far ahead of us."

"But when it comes to a real competition of absolute strength and speed, although his physical strength is a bit higher than yours, I don't think his control is as strong as yours…"

Level 10 Martial Ascension Heart-Tempering Art, level 10 Thirty-Six Body-Strengthening Forms, level 10 Dragonback Mountain Toppler Hand, level 10 Crimson Marrow Primordial Qi, and also level 10 Excavator Palm, Crane Claw, Sports Car Legs, Elevator Ascent…

Zhang Yu nodded slightly. He believed that on this competition field today, no one was stronger than him in terms of muscle control and physical strength extraction.

Although his physical strength was 4.95, with his extraction of his body's power, the strength and speed he could unleash were comparable to, and even surpassed, the few students on the field with physical strength above level 5.0.

He subconsciously touched his heart.

If the competition were held a little later, when his heart had grown stronger, Zhang Yu would be more confident in defeating Yu Xinghan in a contest of strength and speed.

But as for now…

_Not only do I have to defeat my opponents in the next two matches, but I also have to create a large enough gap to surpass him in the overall score._

The pressure was immense.

Zhang Yu downed the stamina potion in his hand and seized every second to rest, recovering the energy and stamina he had expended in the previous match.

He Dayou, who was listening to their conversation from the side, rolled his eyes internally, his mind seemingly mocking their arrogance.

But he said nothing, because no matter how arrogant these two were, their achievements had already crushed him completely.

In other words, in He Dayou's mind, Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen had unknowingly earned the right to be as arrogant as they pleased in front of him.

After everyone had rested for about half an hour, the walls of the venue suddenly trembled in unison and began to descend.

Following that, a circular track appeared before everyone present.

The third event of the athletics meet was about to begin.

The content of this event was also very simple: a 5000-meter race. Points would be awarded based on the contestants' completion times, with a maximum total of 75 points.

Once again, no mana could be used; the race had to be run relying purely on physical strength. Techniques like Sports Car Legs and Elevator Ascent, which required mana for support, were naturally all unusable.

Under these conditions that relied entirely on the physical body, simple running was the most efficient method of movement for the vast majority of people.

And while 5000 meters is long for an ordinary person, it is very short for a high school student; most of the race could be maintained at a sprinting pace.

Wang Hai looked at the rules being explained on the large screen and thought to himself, _The key to this round is how to unleash the speed of one's own body to the greatest extent possible._

…

Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen applied their mana-detecting patches and stood in order behind the starting line.

The contestants who did not make it into the top 20 in the previous round had all been eliminated.

At this moment, only 20 people remained on the track.

Everyone was wearing the running shoes and sportswear uniformly provided by Purple Cloud High School to prevent anyone from gaining an advantage through any Immortal Dao technology on their shoes or clothes.

After all, this was an athletics competition that tested pure physical strength. Taking drugs and injections was fine, but tampering with shoes and clothes was a serious violation.

Zhang Yu glanced at Song Hailong, Hu Yuntao, Xiong Wenwu… and Yu Xinghan not far from him. He took a deep breath and activated the Martial Ascension Heart-Tempering Art, casting aside all distracting thoughts.

Only one thought remained in his mind.

Defeat everyone!

And at the very instant he activated the Martial Ascension Heart-Tempering Art, Yu Xinghan suddenly turned his head and looked in Zhang Yu's direction.

Zhang Yu, as if sensing something, also met Yu Xinghan's gaze.

In that moment, both saw an endless fighting spirit in the other's eyes.

And in that instant, both understood that the other person had also activated the Martial Ascension Heart-Tempering Art.

Yu Xinghan smiled faintly and thought to himself, _Seems to be the guy who got third place in the last round. He knows the Martial Ascension Heart-Tempering Art too? Right, I heard Senior Sister Li say that they had originally found a suitable successor over here…_

With a shift of his gaze, Yu Xinghan silently formed two words with his lips for Zhang Yu.

"Keep up."

Then he turned his head back to face forward.

3!

2!

Following the announcer's count, all 20 contestants tensed their muscles. The very air around them seemed to freeze as they held their breath.

1!

The next moment, it was as if twenty cannons had fired at once.

With a series of explosive bangs, twenty afterimages stretched out on the track as everyone shot forward.

Amidst the booming sounds, the one charging at the very front was none other than Hu Yuntao!

This demon-kin student from Red Pagoda High School was now on all fours, his dragon scales bristling with the rise and fall of his powerful muscles, shimmering with a multicolored halo.

His posture and habit of running on all fours gave him a huge advantage at the start, as if he were flying through the air… he shot out dozens of meters in one breath, taking the lead.

The wind rushed against his face, blowing across his eyes, which had turned increasingly scarlet from the excitement of his nerves and blood vessels.

"Father! Watch closely, I will take first place in this round!"

The memory of the scolding his father had delivered after the last martial arts competition filled Hu Yuntao with intense unwillingness, shame, and fear.

The fear of working, the fear of being disowned… these had haunted his mind for the past two months, pushing him to squeeze out his latent potential time and time again.

Whenever he thought of those 'brothers' and 'sisters' who had died on the assembly line, Hu Yuntao was always able to break through his physical limits in training.

Especially now, he was no longer fighting alone.

His father's blood essence, after being adapted by the bodies of his brothers and sisters, had been injected into his own body, awakening his Black Dragon bloodline.

At this moment, Hu Yuntao could almost feel the blood of his father, brothers, and sisters flowing within him, like a fire that caused his body to erupt with terrifying power.

Bang!

His feet kicked up a blast of air on the track.

_I can win!_

_First place in this round…_

Just as Hu Yuntao was running faster and faster, his confidence burning brighter with his fiery blood, a shadow suddenly fell over his vision.

A male voice came from his side. "Little kitty, you're pretty fast off the line."

"What?" Hu Yuntao whipped his head around, only to see Yu Xinghan passing him at full speed like a meteor, continuously pulling away.

"This guy!" Hu Yuntao let out a sudden roar. The dragon blood throughout his body seemed to boil, and as steam rose from his entire frame, he accelerated once more, chasing after Yu Xinghan.

He could almost feel countless brothers and sisters cheering for him from within his boiling dragon blood.

"Run!"

"Run faster, Yuntao!"

"Run out of the factory!"

It was as if the factory gates had opened behind him, and if he were even a step too slow, he would be swallowed by this boundless darkness.

But what made Hu Yuntao feel utter despair was that even as he accelerated frantically, Yu Xinghan in front of him was getting farther and farther away.

The other person was like a real star in the sky; no matter how hard he tried, no matter how much he fought, he couldn't even touch a speck of it.

And the continuous, frantic acceleration had disrupted his original rhythm. Coupled with the weight and wind resistance from his already large frame… all of this caused his stamina to be consumed at a frantic rate, and his speed began to slow slightly.

Just then, another gust of wind swept past.

Song Hailong, Zhang Yu, Bai Zhenzhen, and Le Mulan had all surpassed him one after another.

Hu Yuntao watched this scene in horror, feeling as though even though he was running forward desperately, as person after person overtook him, he seemed to be continuously moving backward, back into the factory gates.

And those factory gates had at some point transformed into a giant dragon's mouth… about to swallow him whole.

(End of this chapter)

# Chapter 111: Challenging Yu Xinghan

After surpassing Hu Yuntao, Song Hailong now found himself in second place on the track.

Yet his face showed no hint of joy; he merely stared intently at the distant Yu Xinghan.

_That man..._

To Song Hailong, the only opponent in this race was Yu Xinghan.

At this moment, Song Hailong’s muscles were drawn taut, making him appear a size smaller and giving him a certain streamlined beauty.

He was leveraging his powerful control over his demonic muscle to temporarily shift into a speed-oriented form.

The powerful plasticity of demonic muscle allowed students who had undergone the modification to gradually retract the external demonic beast characteristics as their physical control improved.

For a top student like Song Hailong, who had already undergone an elephant muscle implant modification, adapting to the demonic muscle was not difficult. As his physical control continued to increase, he could even temporarily alter his body's form to enhance his speed.

While the resulting speed was purely explosive and lacked the control necessary for the previous stage, it was perfectly suited for this round's contest of pure velocity.

Every muscle fiber, after contracting to its absolute limit, erupted like a spring forged from steel, unleashing immense kinetic energy.

With each violent beat of his heart, blood pumped to every muscle in his body, constantly transporting surging energy and dispersing the effects of various alchemical enhancers throughout his limbs.

_But it's still not enough._

_This isn't enough to defeat Yu Xinghan._

Song Hailong recalled his failures over the recent past, how he had fallen before Yu Xinghan time and time again, utterly defeated by the man in every aspect: Dao heart, mana, athletics, martial skill, and Daoist arts.

He remembered the repeated humiliations at the man’s hands in front of the entire school.

He remembered the shame of kneeling, his father’s disappointment, his brother’s criticism...

But he knew that for now, all he could do was endure.

_To beat Yu Xinghan, I have to close the gap little by little._

_To dream of soaring to the heavens and defeating him in an instant would be disrespectful not only to his talent, but also to the wealth of a Golden Core True Monarch._

_I will etch the failure of this race into my heart._

_One day, I will defeat you._

For Song Hailong, taking second in this race was already a failure, a disgrace he would never forget.

But a moment later, Song Hailong, still holding second place, felt his gaze shift.

In his peripheral vision, a sudden whoosh of displaced air drew his attention to two figures, one on his left and one on his right, surging past him.

Zhang Yu thought to himself, _Thanks, old Song. Drafting behind you saved us from a lot of wind resistance._

_For this final stretch, I'm going all out._

Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen, who had been conserving their energy while following Song Hailong, suddenly unleashed their power.

Song Hailong was taken aback as he watched Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen shoot past him like a flash of lightning.

_Their physical strength is clearly inferior to mine, yet they can burst forth with such speed? They actually... surpassed me?_

Song Hailong tried to give chase, only to find with a shock that he couldn't keep up.

_Have I slowed down?_

_No, they're accelerating! These two... they can still go faster?_

Song Hailong stared fixedly at Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen just ahead, his eyes locked on the constant ripple, contraction, and expansion of their muscles.

_Has that Bai Zhenzhen been practicing a speed-oriented body tempering cultivation technique?_

Watching the high frequency of her movements and the incredible coordination in her muscular rhythm, Song Hailong sensed an extraordinary lightness about her.

He had to admit that while he could likely overpower her in strength, he had fallen behind in speed.

As for Zhang Yu…

Encased in the tight-fitting athletic wear, Zhang Yu’s muscle definition was clearly visible to Song Hailong, his entire vital energy from head to toe seeming to move as a single, unified whole. With every movement, every explosion of power, it radiated the dazzling brilliance of a perfect work of art.

Only someone with physical control and strength on Song Hailong's level could perceive its stunning brilliance and appreciate the precision and fluidity of that physique.

_Zhang Yu... he's perfectly unleashing every ounce of power in his body..._

Zhang Yu’s physical strength might not have been as great as his own, but his control over his body, his mastery of his muscles, and the speed he was now unleashing at full power seemed utterly dazzling to Song Hailong.

It was as if everyone possessed electromagnetic force within them, but not just anyone could fire a railgun.

And now, as Song Hailong looked at Zhang Yu—a person with slightly less physical strength than himself—he felt only power, a familiar sense of power.

_It's... Yu Xinghan!_

_Zhang Yu's ability to extract power from every muscle in his body... has it reached the same level as Yu Xinghan?_

Watching Zhang Yu pull farther and farther away, Song Hailong pumped his legs furiously but couldn't close the distance by a single inch.

It was the same feeling he got every time he tried to catch up to Yu Xinghan.

Unconsciously, the figures of Zhang Yu and Yu Xinghan seemed to merge into one.

No… they weren’t merging!

_Damn it... that kid Zhang Yu is about to catch Yu Xinghan!_

To Song Hailong's astonishment, after surpassing him, Zhang Yu quickly left Bai Zhenzhen behind, accelerating, accelerating, and accelerating again, until he actually began to close in on Yu Xinghan.

His steps grew lighter and lighter, each stride covering dozens of meters, as if he were about to fly into the sky and pluck the stars from the heavens; and the glittering star he was rapidly approaching was none other than Yu Xinghan.

Song Hailong’s heart trembled. _He wants to challenge Yu Xinghan?_

Challenge Yu Xinghan? The undisputed number one, a man whose overall physical attributes surpassed every other competitor here?

Meanwhile, the third eye on Yu Xinghan’s brow clearly saw the figure that was gradually catching up.

Yu Xinghan smiled. "Oh? Did you really catch up?"

At a moment when everyone was pushing forward at full speed, unleashing all their strength.

Yu Xinghan suddenly turned his head to look back at the pursuing Zhang Yu.

He even spoke, his voice carrying over the wind, "I know you."

"You're the one I eliminated, aren't you?"

"If it weren't for me, my master would have taken you as his disciple."

"So... you must hate me, don't you?"

Hearing the powerful voice carried on the gale, Zhang Yu did not reply.

He had no intention of wasting energy on conversation. Right now, his eyes saw only victory.

Whether his opponent was Song Hailong or Yu Xinghan, they were simply obstacles to be overcome.

_Beat them, win this competition._

_Get into the Ten Greats._

_And climb to the second level of Kunxu with Zhen!_

At this moment, Zhang Yu simply continued to unleash his body’s power, just as he had through countless days and nights of running; though he couldn't circulate his mana, he could still vent the full might of his vital energy.

As if sensing the determination in Zhang Yu's gaze, Yu Xinghan smiled faintly. "Not bad. You're truly worthy of someone who, like me, has mastered the Martial Ascension Heart-Tempering Art."

"In that case... I'll play with you for a bit."

To everyone's astonishment, Yu Xinghan suddenly slowed down, seemingly moving backward relative to the onrushing Zhang Yu, until he was running right alongside him.

Then, as Yu Xinghan and Zhang Yu raced shoulder-to-shoulder, kicking up a gale, he slowly raised his right hand and extended three fingers.

Three!

Then two fingers.

Two!

Zhang Yu’s breath hitched, and he mentally gritted his teeth. _A countdown? This guy..._

Zhang Yu understood at once; Yu Xinghan wanted to fall back to his position and race him from an even start.

The next moment, Yu Xinghan held up a single finger.

One!

A roar erupted in Zhang Yu’s mind.

If he had been sprinting at his limit before, then at this instant, every muscle fiber and every drop of blood in his body, under his exquisite control, erupted in a supercharged burst.

Though he couldn’t circulate mana, the experience from countless sprints and numerous level-ten cultivation techniques—Sports Car Legs, Elevator Leap, the Thirty-Six Body-Strengthening Forms, the Crimson Marrow Primordial Qi—all surged forth in an overloaded display.

His entire vital energy became an extension of his thoughts, obeying his will and charging forward with frenzied desperation.

The muscular self-limiters that the Songyang High School team needed surgery to release were something Zhang Yu could now shatter through sheer force of will and physical control.

Under this supercharged burst, his muscles began to tremble and his organs seemed to groan as his body erupted with a speed that shattered his limits.

But he had no energy to spare for such details; his eyes were fixed on Yu Xinghan, who he was doggedly keeping pace with.

_I can do this..._

_I can beat him._

_My control over my body is greater than his. I'm better at accelerating, better at pushing past my limits._

_Even if my physical strength is lower, I can still be faster!_

Under the astonished eyes of the countless spectators.

Zhang Yu and Yu Xinghan accelerated again and again, as if starting a new race entirely.

The two figures, like streaks of light, instantly left everyone else behind, bolting down the track.

Neck and neck!

...

"So fast!" Qian Shen muttered. "Can first-years really be this fast?"

In the Songyang High School rest area, He Dayou, Qian Shen, Zhao Tianxing, and the others all watched in shock as Zhang Yu ran neck and neck with Yu Xinghan, the strongest competitor in the field, the two of them like twin bolts of lightning on the track.

"Running neck and neck with Yu Xinghan's level 5.07 physique with only a level 4.95..." Wang Hai watched the speeding Zhang Yu on the large screen, his expression thrilled as a trembling thought crossed his mind.

_Does this mean Zhang Yu's ability to tap into his body's power... is greater than Yu Xinghan's?_

But he quickly dismissed the incredible idea.

"No, impossible. It must be some kind of potent drug to unlock his potential."

"But for a drug to let Zhang Yu match Yu Xinghan's speed, the side effects must be immense."

Wang Hai looked at Zhang Yu on the screen with concern. "Can he hold on?"

...

In the stands.

The announcer, Gang Shan, exclaimed, “This student from Songyang High School can actually keep up with Yu Xinghan? The skill level of these two must be higher than most second-years, right?”

Le Jingchen was also watching with utter surprise, wondering, _What in the world has Songyang High School done?_

He nodded. "He must have taken some kind of potent drug to keep up with Yu Xinghan for a short period. It seems that with the help of new technology and drugs, it's not impossible for an ordinary person to challenge a Golden Core disciple."

As he spoke, he had Gang Shan turn the camera toward Le Mulan.

"She's been warming up for so long, the drug should have taken full effect. Mulan is about to make her move, isn't she?"

On the track, Le Mulan, who had been holding fifth place, suddenly accelerated, surpassing Song Hailong in a single burst and then rapidly closing in on Bai Zhenzhen.

Her cheeks were flushed, her breathing was heavy, and steam rose from her body as the purple, vertical-pupil marking on her forehead grew more vivid.

Her coach's words replayed in her mind.

"This is the newest illicit alchemical enhancer from Purple Cloud Labs. A single dose costs a hundred thousand, and it's potent enough to burn an ordinary high school student's organs to ash."

"However, with your super-metabolism surgery, you can handle it just fine."

"Because once the enhancer wears off, your entire body will be plunged into a state of extreme fatigue, you could only take it before this round began."

"And after taking it, you needed to warm up while waiting for its effects to kick in."

"Then, the only thing you have to do is... run."

"Run the rest of the race with all your might before it wears off."

# Chapter 112: Victory and Defeat

Even with her Ice-Skinned and Jade-Boned physique, Le Mulan felt as if her body were about to melt.

Spurred on by the alchemical enhancer, the power within her erupted like molten lava, sending her figure surging forward like a gale.

Purple Cloud High School, Purple Cloud Pharmaceuticals, and the family that backed her had all invested massive resources into this competition and the subsequent promotion of their new technology.

This placed a heavy burden on Le Mulan, one she had never felt before.

But she did not resent this burden.

The care of her family, the investment from her parents, the guidance of her brother—all this had allowed her to live the life of a chosen one since childhood.

Because repeated tests had deemed her genes and her talent to be the most outstanding.

Thus, she constantly received, constantly benefited from special care, and was constantly showered with favorable conditions.

Yet this had also left Le Mulan with something to prove.

She wanted everyone in the family, all the siblings who had been passed over, to understand.

She was worthy of this investment.

And now, with this breakthrough in body tempering technology extending the corporate battlefield to the athletics meet, she finally had a chance to prove herself to her family and repay her parents.

Le Mulan’s eyes were fixed on the distant figures of Yu Xinghan and Zhang Yu.

_I thought I could at least get second..._

With a soft whoosh, Le Mulan shot past Bai Zhenzhen.

_This distance..._ she thought, gritting her teeth as she kept her eyes on Zhang Yu and Yu Xinghan. _It's too far... No, I have to at least try..._

Just then, Le Mulan was surprised to see a shadow appear at her side.

_Someone's caught up?_

_Who?_

_Song Hailong?_

But looking at the slender figure, Le Mulan knew it wasn't him.

_Then... Bai Zhenzhen?_

A flicker of surprise crossed Le Mulan's face; she hadn't expected the person she just passed to catch up so quickly.

_She can actually keep up?_

Meanwhile, amidst the gale, Bai Zhenzhen felt waves of tearing pain from multiple parts of her body, and her internal organs were under immense pressure.

Unlike Zhang Yu, who could push his body beyond its limits and into overload through sheer physical mastery without relying on enhancers.

Although Bai Zhenzhen had managed to absorb some of the training effects of the Crimson Marrow Primordial Qi through her spiritual root, she was ultimately not at Zhang Yu's level.

That was why she had given herself twelve injections before the race, which was the source of the pressure on her organs.

But as she accelerated alongside Zhang Yu, the quickening of her circulation and the full exertion of her muscles made the scars on her body throb with ever-increasing pain.

So instead of continuing at her maximum pace, she had chosen to hold her position in third.

_I can't catch Yu Xinghan anyway. I'll leave him to Yu-boy._

_I need to conserve my strength. Can't get injured before the next round..._

But just as she was thinking this, Le Mulan caught up to her.

Bai Zhenzhen knew she could no longer afford to hold back.

_Yu-boy is going to beat Yu Xinghan and take first._

_I have to at least hold onto third, or he'll laugh me to death._

Wisps of steam began to rise from Bai Zhenzhen’s body as her muscles strained, and the scars across her skin turned a deep crimson, looking like dragon claws tearing at her flesh and causing an agonizing, ripping pain.

Sensing Bai Zhenzhen right on her heels, Le Mulan accelerated desperately, trying to shake her.

_How can I lose to this pauper?_

_I'll show everyone in the family that their investment in me wasn't a waste._

Bai Zhenzhen doggedly pursued Le Mulan, their two figures sweeping down the track, kicking up colliding gales that seemed about to strike sparks.

_I'm getting into the Ten Greats with Yu-boy!_

The crimson scars on Bai Zhenzhen’s body grew more lurid, as if they would start to bleed from the force of her acceleration, and the agony of tearing flesh intensified.

_Damn it... I knew I shouldn't have skimped on the painkillers..._

With a silent roar, Bai Zhenzhen pushed her increasingly tormented body to its limits, managing to keep pace with Le Mulan down to the final five hundred meters.

_Hah!_

A roar echoed in both their minds, their thoughts narrowing to a single point.

Surpass her!

_I will surpass her!_

The next moment, to Le Mulan's shock, Bai Zhenzhen surged past her, reclaiming third place.

But when an excited Bai Zhenzhen looked ahead, she saw that Zhang Yu’s pace had slackened slightly.

The contest between Zhang Yu and Yu Xinghan, who had been running neck and neck like twin bolts of lightning, was already over.

_Swoosh!_

In the end, Yu Xinghan was the first to cross the finish line.

Zhang Yu followed close behind, stopping, pale-faced, after he crossed.

Bai Zhenzhen crossed the finish line third and ran to Zhang Yu with a look of concern. "What's wrong?"

Zhang Yu shook his head, signaling that he was fine.

Zhang Yu focused on his heart. During the desperate struggle against Yu Xinghan, his body had been pushed to its limits again and again, and he had felt his heart beating faster and faster, as if it were about to burst from his chest.

His heartbeat could no longer keep up with the demands he placed on his body; it couldn't fulfill his will's command for another burst of power.

But under these conditions, under the pressure of the fierce contest and his own frantic exertion, he could feel that his heart, in that short span of time, had completed a transformation that should have taken days, shattering its own limits.

The price, however, was the strain and consumption of his heart muscle, which caused him to fall behind Yu Xinghan in the final sprint.
