_It's like when muscles break their limits during exercise,_ Zhang Yu thought. _They need to recover and regrow to become stronger._

_My heart may have achieved a breakthrough under this pressure, but it won't get stronger from nothing. It needs time and resources to repair and grow before it will be stronger than it was..._

At that moment, Zhang Yu felt an extreme hunger wracking his body.

He needed vast amounts of food and nutrients to replenish what he had expended during the race, but more than that, his heart, having just broken through, was crying out for sustenance, expressing its desire for nutrients to grow stronger.

_Breaking a limit is just that._

Zhang Yu thought, touching his chest, _True growth requires a foundation of matter and energy. For my heart to grow stronger, it now needs massive amounts of nutrients and food._

_Then I'll use the Crimson Marrow Primordial Qi to accelerate digestion and growth._

Level-ten Crimson Marrow Primordial Qi granted Zhang Yu a powerful metabolism and digestive system, which was one of the reasons his physical strength had been able to increase so dramatically.

Elsewhere, Yu Xinghan shot Zhang Yu a cold glance. _Did he slow down at the end because the drug wore off? Or was it the side effects?_

Although he knew the other boy must have taken some kind of potent drug to keep up, being matched by a student from Songyang High School—especially the very one whose position as a Golden Core disciple he had taken—left a sour taste in Yu Xinghan's mouth.

_It seems I was a bit too careless._

_For the next round, perhaps I'll take something as well._

But when the surrounding cameras focused on him, his smile immediately returned.

"Everyone, remember to look out for the Immortal Resonance Group's demonic muscle surgery next month..."

After leaving the arena, Yu Xinghan took a call from Li Xuelian.

Li Xuelian was the daughter of True Monarch Xinghuo, making her Yu Xinghan's nominal senior sister.

"How is the competition going?" Li Xuelian asked.

Hearing her question, Yu Xinghan reported his results. "I've taken first in all three rounds so far."

"Once I win the final round, it'll be sealed."

"Don't worry, senior sister. I won't let there be any problems with the Immortal Resonance contract."

"Who else could possibly take first place overall in this athletics meet but me?"

...

In the stands.

Le Jingchen's expression was grim; Le Mulan hadn't even made the top three, finishing in fourth place.

In contrast, that Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen had somehow used unknown technology and potent drugs to squeeze their way into the top three.

Zhang Yu, in particular, had even run neck and neck with Yu Xinghan for a time.

While this had much to do with Yu Xinghan deliberately falling back, it was still enough to draw massive attention, completely stealing Le Mulan’s spotlight.

"Songyang High School..."

A cold light flashed in Le Jingchen's eyes at the thought of Purple Cloud High School being upstaged by Songyang High.

The next moment, his phone vibrated with a series of incoming messages.

Le Jingchen’s eyes scanned the screen.

_Zhou Chechen of the Zhou family and Lan Ling of the Lan family both said Songyang High had no technological breakthrough?_

_And they said this Zhang Yu... is a dog of Zhang Pianpian from White Dragon High?_

A thought struck Le Jingchen. _White Dragon High School... Immortal Resonance Group? Is this some move by Immortal Resonance?_

He whipped his head toward the large screen. _If Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen are also using Immortal Resonance Group's technology, doesn't that mean five of the top ten are backed by Immortal Resonance?_

Le Jingchen could already see it: after the athletics meet, the technology behind Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen would be revealed, and White Dragon High and the Immortal Resonance Group would emerge as the biggest winners.

...

After the third event, Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen immediately headed for the buffet area.

"Zhen," Zhang Yu said as they walked, his face pale, "I need to eat a lot, then circulate my cultivation technique to digest it and speed up my heart's recovery. That way, I can unleash my body's power more perfectly in the next round and defeat Yu Xinghan."

Bai Zhenzhen frowned. "Even if you take first in the next round, will that be enough to win overall?"

The four events of the athletics meet were weighted as follows: physical strength, fifty points; agility, seventy-five points; speed, seventy-five points; and the final strength round, one hundred and fifty points.

Bai Zhenzhen figured that since Yu Xinghan had won the first three rounds, even if Zhang Yu got a perfect one hundred and fifty points in the fourth, he still couldn't catch up.

"So I don't just need to take first place, I have to open up a huge lead over him in the strength competition."

"Yu Xinghan has a perfect two hundred points from the first three rounds combined, while I have one hundred and ninety-one."

Zhang Yu said gravely, "The points are awarded based on performance. If I take first and get the full one hundred and fifty points, the better I perform compared to Yu Xinghan in the strength competition, the lower his score will be."

"To beat him, I have to keep his score below one hundred and forty-one. In other words... I need to outperform him by more than nine points."

Hearing this, Bai Zhenzhen understood just how difficult that would be.

"Outperforming that freak Yu Xinghan by more than nine points in a one-hundred-and-fifty-point event? Is that even possible?"

"Possible or not, I have to try," Zhang Yu said.

"Besides, to allow the competitors who just went all out to rest and recover their stamina, there's an hour-and-a-half break before the next round. We can get a lot done in that time."

And so, upon reaching the buffet area, Bai Zhenzhen brought plate after plate of food to Zhang Yu and watched as he wolfed it all down.

# Chapter 113: Pre-Competition Breakthrough, the Sky Pillar

With a series of gulps, Zhang Yu poured a large barrel of synthetic food into his mouth, swallowing it all in one go.

He then circulated the Crimson Marrow Primordial Qi, and with a churning of his internal organs, he accelerated the digestion of the food before accepting another barrel from Bai Zhenzhen.

After the previous round’s grueling sprint and extreme physical exertion, Zhang Yu felt an insatiable hunger and thirst wracking his entire body, especially from his heart, which seemed to be crying out for sustenance.

Bai Zhenzhen bustled about, continuously bringing barrels of synthetic food to his side.

Compared to pre-made meals, synthetic food was less palatable but easier to digest, making it more suitable for Zhang Yu’s current condition.

To ensure better and faster digestion without wasting a single drop of energy or nutrition, the synthetic food Bai Zhenzhen served was completely unflavored; it was pure sustenance, barrel after barrel, like fuel being poured into Zhang Yu's body.

Though it was disgusting and hard to stomach, Zhang Yu closed his eyes and forced it all down for the sake of the next event.

Besides Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen, many students from other schools had also come to the cafeteria area to eat.

There were ordinary high school students who had already been eliminated and were just there for a free meal.

There were also students like those from Red Pagoda High School, who were massive in stature and had astonishing appetites.

However, wealthy students like Yu Xinghan, Song Hailong, and Le Mulan were eating their own provisions and did not join the others.

Hu Yuntao was devouring the synthetic food before him.

Xiong Wenwu, opposite him, was practically inhaling it, downing one barrel after another like a storm.

Watching Xiong Wenwu eat, Hu Yuntao couldn't help but feel a sense of admiration. *Big Brother had taste-removal surgery long ago so that food wouldn't interfere with his cultivation; how many people possess that kind of determination?*

Xiong Wenwu glanced at Hu Yuntao and said, "The first two rounds weren't our strong suit, so falling a little behind doesn't matter."

"But in the strength event up next, we have to let everyone know that Red Pagoda is the strongest."

Hu Yuntao nodded fiercely. "I understand, Big Brother. I'll hold on until the very end in the next event, even if it means breaking my arms and legs."

Meanwhile, as Zhang Yu was eating voraciously, two figures suddenly appeared before him.

It was Zhou Chechen, the vice president of Songyang High School's Student Council, and Lan Ling, the head of the athletics department.

Zhang Yu glanced at the ID cards on their chests, wondering what kind of connections these two had used with Purple Cloud High School to get into the contestants' private cafeteria.

Zhou Chechen looked coldly at Zhang Yu, recalling his recent conversation with the people from Purple Cloud.

*Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen most likely underwent technical modification from White Dragon High School through Zhang Pianpian's connections,* he thought.

*If White Dragon pulls this off and later announces that Bai Zhenzhen and Zhang Yu also received the Immortal Resonance Group's latest body tempering technology, then the number of their sponsored contestants who place will surpass Purple Cloud or Red Pagoda, making them the biggest winner in this promotion.*

Recalling the deal between Purple Cloud and his own side, Zhou Chechen said coolly, "You don't need to be so aggressive in this next event. Just participate casually."

Zhang Yu frowned but didn't reply, simply continuing to eat.

Zhou Chechen didn't seem to care whether Zhang Yu answered. "Your little conspiracy with White Dragon High School has been seen through by the other corporations."

"If you want to keep showing off, thinking Zhang Pianpian will toss you an extra piece of meat, you should consider how the other corporations will deal with you. Do you think the person backing you will protect you?"

"Don't get sold out and still be counting the money for them."

After saying his piece, Zhou Chechen left with Lan Ling.

On their way out, Lan Ling asked, confused, "Is that all? Shouldn't we have threatened him a little? We have Purple Cloud backing us now, so we don't need to worry about Zhang Pianpian anymore, right?"

Zhou Chechen shot Lan Ling a helpless look, thinking that this guy had truly trained his brain into muscle. *Extreme body tempering really isn't worth pursuing.*

After a moment's thought, Zhou Chechen explained, "This arena is now the battleground for Red Pagoda Husbandry, Purple Cloud Supplements, and the Immortal Resonance Group. These three corporations are the ones pulling the strings."

"If you fight that hard... aren't you afraid of being crushed by the aftershocks of their clash?"

Seeing Lan Ling's pensive expression, Zhou Chechen elaborated, "Just giving Zhang Yu a little warning is enough. We've done our part. Don't go all out... and end up being targeted by Zhang Pianpian, or even the Immortal Resonance Group."

"Our ability to make a deal with Purple Cloud ultimately relies on our own capital, and Songyang High School's transplant technology is something Purple Cloud wants."

"So we don't have to be like Zhang Yu, who has nothing but his own life to risk, throwing himself into every fight."

"So what if he gets a moment of glory by fighting so desperately? In the end, he won't get into the Ten Greats and will spend his life as someone's dog. Eventually, he'll be targeted by the corporations and sold for a good price by Zhang Pianpian."

Recalling Zhang Yu's appearance just now, Zhou Chechen continued, "Besides, look how weak he looks. To catch up to Yu Xinghan in the last round, he must have taken some kind of potent drug that probably damaged his potential or ruined his body..."

"Coupled with the pressure we just put on him, it will definitely affect him."

"The next round is the strength event, which is White Dragon's and Red Pagoda's specialty. With Zhang Yu's body compromised and his mind affected, his final result is bound to be poor."

"This way, we've warned Zhang Yu as Purple Cloud requested, and in the end, he won't get a good result. That's enough to answer to Le Jingchen..."

Lan Ling nodded repeatedly, feeling that Zhou Chechen, as the student council vice president, was far more thoughtful than a mere head of the athletics department like himself.

Back in the cafeteria, Zhang Yu watched Zhou Chechen and Lan Ling leave as he ate. *What were those two just talking about?*

However, the mention of corporations put him on guard.

After some thought, he called Zhang Pianpian and explained the current situation at the competition.

Then he asked, "If I beat Yu Xinghan in the next round, will I be targeted by some corporation?"

Zhang Pianpian chuckled and asked, "Can you win?"

Zhang Yu thought for a moment, then nodded firmly. "I'm confident."

Zhang Pianpian replied, "Then go win."

"If you can take first place, I'll negotiate with White Dragon for you."

"All you'll have to do is admit you used the Immortal Resonance Group's technology to enhance your body tempering, and then wait for the money to roll in."

Hearing Zhang Pianpian's reply, especially the final word "money," both Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen instantly grew excited.

After hanging up, the two of them devoured their food like a whirlwind, stuffing themselves until their stomachs were bulging.

Patting his belly, Zhang Yu let out a breath. "I'm full. Now to digest, promote my body's growth and recovery, and complete my breakthrough..."

Just then, Zhang Yu noticed the scars on Bai Zhenzhen's body, recalling her strange condition after the sprint.

Zhang Yu suddenly said, "Zhen, after we win the championship, I'll pay to have those scars of yours removed."

Bai Zhenzhen replied, "You said it! You're treating me at the hospital then!"

In Kunxu, treating someone at the hospital was a social gesture reserved for the closest of family and friends.

Zhang Yu nodded. "Don't worry. Since we were kids, when has your old man ever lied to you?"

Bai Zhenzhen retorted, "You son of a..."

A moment later, the two arrived at a more secluded restroom.

Bai Zhenzhen then hugged Zhang Yu from behind, pressing against him. "A'Yu, let me lend you my True Spiritual Root."

Zhang Yu was slightly taken aback. "Zhen, what about you?"

Bai Zhenzhen smiled. "I can't have a breakthrough in the next hour and a half anyway. I just need to digest my food and recover some stamina, so I don't need the True Spiritual Root."

"As for you, kid, remember to treat me at the hospital after you win."

As the familiar spiritual root entered his body once more, Zhang Yu took a deep breath, nodded, and walked into the restroom.

He then took out a prepared Crimson Marrow Primordial Pill from the medicine box in his pocket.

*"I thought I wouldn't be training today and wouldn't need this."*

*"Good thing I brought it, though."*

After all, something as expensive as a Crimson Marrow Primordial Pill was something Zhang Yu always kept in his personal bag.

The next moment, Zhang Yu swallowed the pill.

As the medicinal power surged, spiritual energy flooded in, and Zhang Yu began to operate the Crimson Marrow Primordial Qi at full capacity.

Every muscle in his body tensed, absorbing the rampant medicinal power and spiritual energy.

At the same time, his heart, which had been depleted during the previous sprint, acted like a black hole, frantically absorbing the nutrients from the food he had eaten, the medicinal power of the pill, and the spiritual energy from the spiritual root.

His organs worked like a rock crusher, completely breaking down the synthetic food he had just consumed, transforming it into warm currents that flowed into his blood vessels and nourished his entire body.

Through long-term integration, the True Spiritual Root within him had long since adapted to Zhang Yu's cultivation of the Crimson Marrow Primordial Qi.

At this moment, streams of spiritual energy were being infused into his organs and mixed with those warm currents, accelerating his digestion and absorption.

The largest of these currents naturally flowed towards his heart, accelerating its growth and strengthening it with every passing second.

Under this continuous supply, Zhang Yu's originally pale face gradually became rosy, and his breathing and heartbeat grew stronger and more powerful.

Especially as the Crimson Marrow Primordial Qi circulated, his heartbeat sounded like a great drum, its thunderous *thump, thump, thump* echoing throughout the restroom.

Outside, Bai Zhenzhen stood guard at the door, preventing anyone from entering and either disturbing Zhang Yu or witnessing the commotion from his cultivation.

Lian Tianji, who had been looking for Zhang Yu, came over and couldn't help but ask curiously, "Is Zhang Yu in there... cultivating?"

Bai Zhenzhen nodded. "It's quieter in the restroom, easier for him to focus on cultivating and resting."

Lian Tianji cast a thoughtful glance towards the restroom, chatted casually with Bai Zhenzhen for a few more moments, and then left.

As the hour and a half slowly passed, Bai Zhenzhen listened to the sounds coming from inside, feeling Zhang Yu's heartbeat grow steadily stronger, and a sense of confidence grew within her.

*"When Yu-boy takes first place, when he gets first, I'm definitely going to borrow a huge sum of money from him."*

In the blink of an eye, the ninety minutes were up, and the final event of the athletics meet—the strength event, worth a total of 150 points—officially began.

A two-meter-high platform rose from the center of the arena, and then a giant pillar descended from the ceiling of the stadium.

The pillar was silver-black, covered in dense layers of fine runes, and made of some unknown metal, with a diameter of about five meters.

It descended from the ceiling, extending all the way down until it stopped three meters above the platform.

This was the Sky Pillar, the final event.

The pillar could exert a downward force ranging from a minimum of one thousand kilograms to a maximum of one hundred thousand kilograms, capable of accurately testing the strength limit of a Qi Refinement stage expert.

For this event, the numerous contestants would take turns ascending the platform to hold up the Sky Pillar.

# Chapter 114: Brewing

In the live broadcast room, Le Jingchen was explaining the rules and procedures of the Sky Pillar event to the audience.

"The specific process for the Sky Pillar event is... in the first round, each contestant will submit their target weight and then take turns ascending the platform to lift the Sky Pillar."

"This will be repeated for a total of three rounds, and each contestant's final score will be based on their best performance out of the three."

"It's important to note that... during the process of submitting target weights for each round, contestants will not know the weights submitted by others."

"This means that before stepping onto the stage each round, aside from the weight they themselves have to lift, they won't know what weight other contestants are attempting—whether it's higher or lower than their own—until the contestants go up one by one during that round."

Beside him, Gang Shan asked, "So it seems a crucial aspect of this event is judging one's own physical limits."

Gang Shan continued slowly, "If you misjudge your limit and aim too low, your score will be low. But if you misjudge and aim too high, you might fail to lift it at all, wasting an attempt and possibly even injuring yourself."

Le Jingchen nodded in agreement. "That's right. By my estimation, all the contestants will report a relatively easy weight in the first round to acclimate, warm up, and conserve energy while gauging the maximum weight they can lift."

"In the second round, they'll aim for a weight close to their personal limit to secure a baseline score."

"Only in the third round will they go all out and push for their absolute limit."

...

In the Songyang High School rest area.

Wang Hai, He Dayou, and the others were watching Gang Shan's live broadcast while also keeping an eye on the live event.

The reason they were watching Gang Shan's broadcast was due to Wang Hai's recommendation.

Wang Hai had said: If you're going to watch a body tempering streamer, watch Gang Shan. He has a wealth of experience, and he doesn't sell supplements or cultivation techniques. He's one of the few honest streamers out there.

After watching, they found that Gang Shan and Le Jingchen's commentary on the athletics meet was excellent, and so they had continued to watch until now.

Qian Shen, listening from the side, nodded. "I see. So even though this event is a competition, it's really a challenge against oneself."

He Dayou asked, "Teacher Wang, what weight do you think Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen can lift?"

Wang Hai replied calmly, "At least six or seven thousand kilograms should be no problem. Any higher than that... I can't say for sure."

Wang Hai looked at Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen, who were in line to submit their target weights, then glanced up at the Sky Pillar. *Besides the exertion of strength, the most important thing in this final event is the insight and judgment of one's own physical limits.*

*A truly skilled body temperer not only possesses immense strength and speed but also has a deep understanding and awareness of their own physical condition.*

*There are only three chances. Will you choose a result close to your limit, or will you attempt to challenge a result that surpasses it?*

*What will you choose?*

The others gasped upon hearing the figure of six to seven thousand kilograms, exclaiming in amazement.

Zhao Tianxing remained silent, feeling that if he, the weakest person present, were to exclaim or even show surprise, he would look like a clown.

*Alas, when a person is weak and poor, their every word and action appears ridiculous in the eyes of the strong.*

*And weakness and poverty are both relative.*

He glanced at Qian Shen and He Dayou beside him and thought, *Even someone as wealthy as Qian Shen or as strong as He Dayou... appears weak and poor in comparison to the contestants in this arena.*

*And no matter how arrogant they were in the past or how much they stood out at school, their actions now seem comical, like those of a clown, when contrasted with the powerful individuals on the stage.*

This was a law Zhao Tianxing had summarized through extensive self-observation... he called it the weak-poor-clown theory.

*When a strong or wealthy person comes before a group of even stronger and wealthier people, they become the poor one or the weak one, then they become comical, and finally, they become the clown.*

Zhao Tianxing lamented internally, *There's no helping it. This is an era where scores are king, the Immortal Dao reigns supreme, and money can achieve divine consultation.*

...

As all the contestants finished submitting their target weights for the first round, the competition officially began.

The contestants would ascend the stage one by one in order of their target weights, from lowest to highest.

The first to take the stage was a student from Purple Cloud.

His body glowing with a faint purple light, he walked slowly onto the platform as the number "2000 kg" appeared on the Sky Pillar.

Looking up at the slowly descending pillar, the Purple Cloud student let out a sharp cry, thrust his palms skyward, and slammed them against the base of the Sky Pillar.

With a loud bang, the slowly descending pillar was brought to an abrupt halt.

After five seconds had passed, the "2000 kg" display vanished, and the pillar slowly ascended back into place.

The Purple Cloud student on the stage breathed a small sigh of relief and walked down.

One by one, contestants took the stage, each lifting their declared weight.

The numbers displayed on the Sky Pillar climbed higher and higher, from 2000 kilograms, to 2500, then to 3000...

By the time Chu Qiuhe took the stage, he was lifting a 3500-kilogram Sky Pillar.

With a shout, he easily stopped the 3500-kilogram pillar, then pushed up slightly, feeling the pressure it exerted.

He estimated silently, *With my strength, I should be able to lift 6500 kilograms at most, right? Should I push it a little higher? Challenge my limit...*

...

Meanwhile, in the broadcast room, Gang Shan and Le Jingchen watched as the students took the stage.

Gang Shan laughed. "As expected, everyone is just warming up in the first round, getting a feel for the Sky Pillar's force."

Le Jingchen said, "How much physical strength can be exerted, and ultimately how much weight can be lifted, is inextricably linked to a person's physical limits and their condition on the day of the competition."

"But for contestants with a strong awareness of their own bodies, this round is enough for them to accurately judge their limits and know how much weight they can lift."

As the two of them commented on the competition, the numbers on the Sky Pillar continued to change, but they generally ranged from two or three thousand kilograms to three or four thousand.

It was clear that no one was using their full strength in this round; all the contestants were adapting to the pillar, conserving their energy, and silently judging how much their bodies could lift.

But even a three or four-thousand-kilogram Sky Pillar was enough to astound many of the students present.

...

Zhang Yu walked onto the high platform and slowly positioned himself directly beneath the Sky Pillar.

He hadn't felt it from below, but now, standing at the center beneath the pillar and looking up... he felt as if the entire sky was being blotted out.

Especially as the Sky Pillar slowly descended, it was as if the whole sky was caving in, creating an immense sense of oppression for the person below.

Zhang Yu reached out and touched the bottom of the Sky Pillar, feeling its weight pressing down from above. *So this is what a 3600-kilogram Sky Pillar feels like?*

By sensing the pillar's weight and observing his own body's condition, the support from every single muscle... Zhang Yu gradually formed an estimate of how much weight he could lift.

As Zhang Yu walked off the stage, he nodded at Bai Zhenzhen, who was preparing to go up.

When Bai Zhenzhen stood beneath the Sky Pillar, feeling the force pressing down from above, she couldn't help but think, *Watching from below and actually lifting it on stage are completely different experiences...*

...

In the broadcast room, Gang Shan said, "Jingchen, who do you think will win this Sky Pillar event?"

Le Jingchen replied, "Demon-kin students have far more muscle mass than other contestants, so even with similar physical strength, their power output is often greater."

"This greater strength from more muscle mass, which was a burden in the first two rounds of agility and speed due to the extra volume and weight, has now become an advantage in this round."

"And among the demon-kin students, Xiong Wenwu has the highest body weight and the greatest physical strength."

"But if Xiong Wenwu represents the pinnacle of raw power, then Yu Xinghan represents the fusion of strength and skill, able to tap deeper into his body's power and unleash greater force with less muscle mass."

"The ultimate champion of this Sky Pillar event will likely be decided between Xiong Wenwu and Yu Xinghan."

...

While Le Jingchen and Gang Shan were talking, the second round of the Sky Pillar event had already begun.

And just as they had predicted, the contestants all chose a weight close to their limit, aiming to secure a baseline score in this round.

As contestant after contestant took the stage, the numbers on the Sky Pillar rose steadily, with every student demonstrating a weight far higher than in the previous round.

Shortly after Lian Tianji successfully lifted a 6000-kilogram Sky Pillar.

Chu Qiuhe failed in his attempt to challenge a 6800-kilogram pillar.

He let out a fierce roar, his palms pressed firmly against the bottom of the pillar, but his body trembled under the 6800-kilogram pressure, unable to stop its descent in the slightest. In the end, he could only grit his teeth and retreat from the stage.

In the broadcast room, Gang Shan said, "Alas, that's what happens when you overestimate your own abilities."

Le Jingchen commented, "A drawback of demonic muscle is that it can reduce one's control over their body, leading to inaccurate judgments. For ordinary people looking to gain immense physical strength, the best method is still to use alchemical enhancers..."

"As for the demon-kin's naturally superior muscle mass and Yu Xinghan's level of physical prowess and control, those require the careful guidance of a Golden Core True Monarch and are not conditions accessible to the average person..."

It was clear that in this Sky Pillar event, Le Jingchen intended to label the championship contenders, Xiong Wenwu and Yu Xinghan, as demon-kin and a Golden Core disciple, respectively, to highlight the greater accessibility and importance of alchemical enhancers and super-metabolism surgery for ordinary people.

Just as Le Jingchen began another promotion for Purple Cloud Supplements' new technology.

It was finally Bai Zhenzhen's turn to take the stage for the second time.

With a burst of strength from her body, she lifted the 7000-kilogram Sky Pillar.

Feeling the state of her body, especially the throbbing of her scars, Bai Zhenzhen thought, *I'll try for 8000 kilograms next round. That should be pretty close to my limit.*

After Bai Zhenzhen finished, it was Zhang Yu's turn.

He lifted the 7000-kilogram Sky Pillar and then walked off the stage with a neutral expression.

Seeing Zhang Yu's 7000-kilogram performance, Le Jingchen thought, *Oh? Based on the level he's shown before, he should be able to lift a much heavier pillar... Did Zhou Chechen's warning work?*

*Or has his body not yet recovered from the potent drugs he took during the last event?*

In the Songyang High School rest area, watching Zhang Yu's performance, Wang Hai sighed inwardly. *Did he really injure his body in the last round? Alas, that's not how you use enhancers. This kid... why didn't he ask me before taking them?*

After Zhang Yu finished, Le Mulan lifted a 7500-kilogram pillar, Song Hailong succeeded at 8300 kilograms, Hu Yuntao managed 8800 kilograms, and Yu Xinghan broke the 9000-kilogram mark.

But Zhang Yu, by the side of the arena, paid no mind to anyone's thoughts, nor did he even watch the other contestants take the stage.

At this moment, his focus was solely on himself, on his own flesh and blood.

He was completely concentrated on his own being, all to unleash his ultimate power in the next round.

Because from the very first time he lifted the Sky Pillar, Zhang Yu, with his deep understanding and mastery of his own body, already knew exactly where his limit was.

With his level of skill, he could even sense how much weight this body could lift after an overloaded burst of power.

So he chose not to waste energy in the second round chasing some baseline score, nor did he go all out early to alert and provoke his competitors.

He simply lifted a 7000-kilogram pillar, neither attracting attention nor expending much effort, and then wholeheartedly focused his mind and conserved his strength, determined to reveal his peak moment on the final stage.

# Chapter 115: Holding Up the Sky

While Zhang Yu was silently conserving his energy and spirit, a wave of gasps erupted from the arena.

In the broadcast room, Gang Shan stared at the "10000 kg" displayed on the Sky Pillar, astonished. "Challenging such a high weight in the second round?"

Xiong Wenwu slowly ascended the stage, his eyes fixed on the Sky Pillar pressing down from above, as if he were watching a section of the sky collapsing towards him.

The next moment, his massive, bear-paw-like hands shot up and slammed against the descending pillar.

With an explosive bang, Xiong Wenwu's entire body tensed, veins bulging on his skin as blood seeped from between his clenched teeth.

But even with such exertion, the Sky Pillar's descent didn't slow in the slightest; it seemed poised to crush the figure on the stage, inch by inch.

However, in the next instant, a ferocious roar burst from Xiong Wenwu, and a sound like a dragon's cry seemed to ripple through the arena, causing countless students and spectators to tremble.

Simultaneously, a bloody mist erupted from all over Xiong Wenwu's body.

The black dragon scales cracked like overstretched clothing, splitting open into one bloody gash after another.

His skin, flesh, and scales couldn't withstand the overloaded burst of power, torn apart by his violently expanding muscles.

And as the bloody mist burst from his body, the descending Sky Pillar gradually came to a halt. With another thunderous roar, he even managed to push it back up by several inches.

The 10,000-kilogram challenge was a success.

Below the stage, Hu Yuntao let out a tiger's roar, leading the Red Pagoda students in a wave of cheers.

Gang Shan was surprised. "He went all out in the second round? His muscles must be severely torn. With an injury that severe, he definitely won't be able to participate in the next round."

"However, with a score of 10,000 kilograms, no one here besides Yu Xinghan has a chance of surpassing it. Now we'll see if Yu Xinghan decides to push himself in the final round."

Le Jingchen watched Xiong Wenwu walk off the stage, but he noticed that wasn't the case.

The boy's injuries... were healing rapidly.

*The Black Dragon bloodline gives them extraordinary regenerative abilities? And on top of that...*

Seeing the medical team rush towards Xiong Wenwu, Le Jingchen felt that this student might very well compete again in the third round.

Le Jingchen remarked, "Xiong Wenwu's 10,000-kilogram achievement will surely motivate the other contestants. The next round is going to be exciting."

...

As the second round concluded, the contestants began submitting their target weights for the final round.

The staff member recording the weights thought to himself, *Was everyone stimulated by Xiong Wenwu's final desperate push? They're all going so hard...*

Just then, his eyes suddenly widened, and he looked up at Zhang Yu. "This number... are you sure?"

After confirming it several times, the staff member finally recorded the target weight Zhang Yu had submitted, though a single question echoed in his mind: *"Is he insane?"*

Meanwhile.

In the White Dragon High School rest area.

Just as Yu Xinghan was about to submit his target weight... he was stopped.

Yu Xinghan spoke to Li Xuelian on the other end of the phone, "Senior Sister, why are you stopping me? You know my strength; this weight is absolutely no problem."

Li Xuelian's voice was calm. "But if you unleash an overloaded burst, you'll get injured."

"Xinghan, your body is very strong, but that also means it's very expensive to repair."

"I don't wish to waste Father's money on medical expenses."

Yu Xinghan said, "What about the contract? If I let this Xiong Wenwu beat me next round, I'll only get second place in this event."

Li Xuelian replied coolly, "Even if you get second in this event, your total score will still be first. You will still be the champion of this athletics meet."

"Don't waste money for the sake of some insignificant ranking."

Yu Xinghan still felt a sense of suppressed frustration.

The thought that he was clearly stronger than Xiong Wenwu but was being prevented from crushing him with a single burst, and might instead have to let him take first place in the final event... it made the Martial Ascension Heart-Tempering Art circulating in his mind feel sluggish.

As if sensing his dissatisfaction, Li Xuelian added a warning, "Xinghan, understand that your body no longer belongs to you. Everything you have belongs to Father. You have no right to consume assets and money that are not yours."

"This is also Father's will."

After ending the call, Li Xuelian thought to herself, *His long-term practice of the Martial Ascension Heart-Tempering Art has made his thinking somewhat rigid. This is a good opportunity to suppress that a bit, and it can serve as a foundation for his next heart art.*

As for the competition rankings, Li Xuelian had no worries.

Yu Xinghan had accumulated too large of a lead in the first three events. Even if he let Xiong Wenwu take first place here, it wouldn't matter. Yu Xinghan would still be the overall champion, and the advertising and endorsement contracts with White Dragon High School and the Immortal Resonance Group would proceed smoothly.

Back in the arena, after Yu Xinghan hung up, he crushed his phone with a crack, and a chilling aura emanated from him, causing all the surrounding high school students to keep their distance.

After a long while, and only after repeated urging from the staff, did he walk over with a frosty expression and submit his target weight for the final round.

...

As the final round of the Sky Pillar began, the contestants, no longer conservative like in the previous round, went all out and began to challenge their limits.

Some succeeded, some failed, and some were injured.

Gang Shan commented, "Everyone's giving it their all this round. The specific numbers for their target weights are also very interesting. I believe that the contestants who can set their target weights most accurately are the ones who have the most thorough understanding of their own limits."

Le Jingchen nodded. "Theoretically, the better one understands their own body and condition, the more precise the weight they set will be."

When Bai Zhenzhen took the stage, the number displayed on the Sky Pillar was 8050 kilograms.

As immense pressure transmitted from her palms, the scars on Bai Zhenzhen's body once again turned crimson, like dragon claws slowly tightening their grip on her.

Perhaps due to the stimulation from the speed competition, her scars now appeared even more vivid, glowing like rubies.

When Bai Zhenzhen let out a fierce cry and pushed the Sky Pillar upward, several scars finally split open, staining her body with blood.

Bai Zhenzhen let out a pained grunt and roared in her heart, *"Damn it, body... hold on! I have to get into the Ten Greats!"*

After holding on for five seconds, Bai Zhenzhen finally lowered her hands and walked off the platform, covered in blood.

Wang Hai immediately ran up to her, sighing helplessly. "You know your own condition. Why didn't you report a lower weight?"

Bai Zhenzhen just smiled without saying a word, thinking to herself, *In the last martial arts competition, I didn't have the money or the confidence to fight to the end.*

*This time, with Yu-boy winning the championship and reimbursing my medical expenses, I can finally let loose a little.*

At this thought, Bai Zhenzhen looked over at Zhang Yu, who was still immersed in his own world, completely focused. *That's right, Yu-boy, keep it up. Your mom is counting on you to cover these medical bills.*

Just then, Bai Zhenzhen felt a wave of heat wash over her. She saw Le Mulan, who was passing by on her way to the stage, steaming like she was being cooked.

Bai Zhenzhen couldn't help but complain internally, *How many damn enhancers did she take? Is she trying to turn into an alchemy furnace?*

Le Mulan recalled the process of taking the enhancers just moments before.

Her competition coach had said worriedly, "Even if this is Chairman Le Jingchen's request, isn't this dosage a bit too dangerous?"

Le Mulan had replied nonchalantly, "Give them to me."

She turned to the advertising camera nearby and said slowly, "For other students, this event is just about challenging their physical limits. But for me, having undergone the super-metabolism surgery, this event is also a chance to challenge my medication limits."

After displaying each of the enhancers, Le Mulan injected them one by one into her body. A moment later, she felt her heart pound violently, and her face instantly turned beet red.

"My target weight is 9000 kilograms. This is a result only strength-focused contestants can achieve, but now... I can do it!"

On the stage, after Le Mulan shakily supported the 9000-kilogram Sky Pillar for five seconds, she suddenly collapsed to her knees, feeling her leg bones fracture.

But facing the countless cameras and the upcoming media blitz, she knew she couldn't show weakness; this was her responsibility as a key member of her family's next generation.

So she forced herself to her feet, trying her best to walk off the stage as if nothing had happened.

The moment she was offstage, she was surrounded by cameras. Although her head was spinning, with reminders from her coach, Le Mulan managed to deliver her advertising lines.

After Le Mulan's successful 9000-kilogram lift, Song Hailong managed 9300 kilograms, Hu Yuntao, drenched in his own blood, lifted 9800 kilograms, and Yu Xinghan broke 10001 kilograms, becoming the second person in the entire competition to successfully challenge a 10-ton Sky Pillar.

Then, under the watchful eyes of the entire crowd, Xiong Wenwu, still bearing the bloody marks of his last attempt, slowly ascended the stage.

But just as everyone was anticipating Xiong Wenwu's performance, Wang Hai noticed something strange.

"Where's Zhang Yu? Why hasn't he gone up yet?"

"Is he scheduled after Xiong Wenwu?"

"Just how many kilograms did he report?"

Meanwhile, Xiong Wenwu once again looked up at the slowly descending Sky Pillar, feeling the oppressive black mass gradually obscure his vision, as if the sky itself were falling.

And this feeling of the sky falling... he had experienced it countless times since he was a child.

Every screening at the breeding facility, every time a companion was eliminated, every exam after entering high school... each time was so tense, so terrifying, so utterly helpless.

Just like at this very moment, as he tried to raise his palms to hold back the pressure descending from the heavens.

He could only feel the 10,800-kilogram weight pressing down with an unstoppable force, forcing his head down, bending his back, and driving him to his knees.

A referee nearby asked, "Xiong Wenwu, do you wish to continue?"

Xiong Wenwu didn't hear the referee; his mind was filled only with the orders given by his father.

*"10,800 kilograms. You should be able to do that, right? Isn't the strength event supposed to be your specialty? If you can't even do this, who will buy the new technology Red Pagoda is launching?"*

*"Injured?"*

*"If you don't get injured, how can you demonstrate the restorative capabilities of the new technology?"*

*"Getting injured is a good thing. The more severe the injury, the better you can showcase your recovery."*

At this moment, Xiong Wenwu's muscles grew tighter and tighter, his teeth felt like they were about to shatter, and his heart pounded like a car engine.

*I can do it!*

*I can do it, Father!*

*I am not the same as I was before, not the same Number 33456 who could only watch helplessly as fate was decided, as the sky fell.*

*I have studied now, I have cultivated the Immortal Dao, I am a high school student! A chosen one destined for university!*

*Now... I can hold up the sky!*

*ROAR!*

As the muscles in his arms burst, Xiong Wenwu violently stopped the descending Sky Pillar.

Then, as his massive body rose to its full height, the Sky Pillar was pushed back a full meter.

With the sound of tearing muscles and cracking bones, bloody blossoms erupted all over Xiong Wenwu's body, and a trickle of blood from his ruptured organs flowed from the corner of his mouth.

The next five seconds felt as long as his entire life.

When Xiong Wenwu came to his senses, he had already collapsed on the stage.

Looking at Hu Yuntao rushing towards him, Xiong Wenwu murmured, "Did... did I succeed?"

Hu Yuntao nodded repeatedly, exclaiming excitedly, "You did it, Big Brother! With this promotion, the Black Dragon bloodline technology will definitely be a huge seller!"

Immediately, cameras swarmed in, beginning to document the entire process of Xiong Wenwu's recovery.

Hu Yuntao encouraged him from the side, "Big Brother! You have to hold on, don't pass out! You still haven't said the advertising slogan..."

Just as Xiong Wenwu was being carried off, with the Red Pagoda students cheering for their first-place victory and the other students and spectators marveling at his achievement.

The Sky Pillar on the stage trembled slightly, and a new number appeared.

12531 kg.

Only then did everyone realize there was still a contender left. Who could it be?

# Chapter 116: The Strongest Power!

12,531 kilograms?

Was this a joke?

How could a student who had been cultivating for only eight and a half months possibly achieve this? Even a demon-kin could not do it.

When they saw the number on the Sky Pillar, this was the thought that surfaced in the minds of the vast majority of people present.

In the live broadcast room, Gang Shan also said with surprise, "Who is the next contestant? They're actually going to challenge a 12,531-kilogram Sky Pillar?"

Le Jingchen, at his side, said calmly, "The last contestant who hasn't taken the stage should be Zhang Yu of Songyang High School, right?"

Gang Shan was taken aback. "That student from Songyang High School? Didn't he only lift 7,000 kilograms in the last round? Now he's jumping straight to 12,531 kilograms? Is he not afraid of being killed by the shockwave?"

"And this kilogram amount, precise down to a single digit… does he mean to say he has a perfect grasp of his own limit, even down to the last digit?"

Le Jingchen did not speak, because he also had no idea what was going on.

"Could it be… a new publicity method? A comedic promotion?"

"Are White Dragon High School and the Immortal Resonance Group using a marketing tactic I don't understand?"

…

Wang Hai, for his part, was growing anxious. "What is this kid doing? 12,531 kilograms? Is that something he can handle right now?"

"That could kill someone!"

"How expensive is your insurance policy that you dare to play like this?"

Imagining the weight of 12,531 kilograms pressing down, and the possibility of Zhang Yu being severely injured the instant he tried to forcibly hold it, Wang Hai immediately rushed toward the competition floor.

If a student on the team had an accident, he, the teacher, would also be held responsible.

This was especially true if the student didn't die, but the money ran out.

Wang Hai did not want to see such an outstanding student have his savings wiped out by medical fees so early in his first year, losing all his potential in the Immortal Dao.

Although Wang Hai wanted to stop him, he was blocked by the event staff.

While Wang Hai was tied up with the staff, the other contestants also looked at Zhang Yu with astonishment.

Le Mulan watched his back, touching her own feverish and somewhat dizzy head, and thought distractedly, _Could it be that he filled it out wrong?_

Song Hailong grew immensely curious. _Zhang Yu doesn't seem like an idiot, so what is he planning?_

Yu Xinghan considered himself to have the strongest physique and the highest level of physical control on site.

Looking at Zhang Yu not far away, he thought to himself, _What a bluffer; with his level, it's impossible to achieve this._

Hu Yuntao's face was full of disdain, also refusing to believe Zhang Yu could lift a 12,531-kilogram Sky Pillar.

He was just about to exchange a few words with Xiong Wenwu beside him, to mock Zhang Yu, but found that Xiong Wenwu had already fainted.

At this moment, the gazes of countless people were fixed on Zhang Yu, and all their attention converged upon him, forming a heavy pressure that was almost tangible.

Just watching from afar gave Zhao Tianxing goosebumps all over his body, making him wish he could dig a hole for Zhang Yu to hide in.

But in Zhang Yu's eyes, it seemed there was no one else on the field.

He just calmly waved toward the gymnasium entrance and calmly accepted the delivery from a Purple Cloud teacher.

This was the drug he had ordered just before the start of the final event.

Although he had paid extra for a deliveryman at the peak of Qi Refinement to bring it, it had still been held up at the school gate and was only now being delivered by the Purple Cloud teacher.

Zhang Yu slowly took out the three syringes from the delivery package and injected them one by one into his body.

He felt the state of his vital energy throughout his body and thought, _After all, for a weight of 12,531 kilograms, I still need a little assistance from drugs._

Seeing Zhang Yu injecting himself, Wang Hai's heart sank even further. _What kind of drug is that? Why is he taking drugs at all? Pushing himself this hard will really cause fundamental damage._

And to many people present, the drugs Zhang Yu was now taking were clearly his trump card.

Bai Zhenzhen gazed at Zhang Yu's back as he slowly ascended the stage and thought, _Go, Yu-boy, and win the prize money, the advertisements, the endorsements, and a spot in the Ten Greats… win every last damn thing!_

In the broadcast room, Gang Shan also became excited. "This Zhang Yu's physical strength is level 4.95, right? With a weight of 12,531 kilograms, the slightest misstep will result in serious injury."

Le Jingchen nodded and said, "It is nearly impossible to make the body perform in overload to hold up a Sky Pillar of this weight. On the contrary, the slightest mistake in posture or force application will result in torn tendons and broken bones."

Gang Shan sighed. "So this isn't just a challenge of his own strength, but also his technique. He's challenging it with his medical insurance and even his Immortal Dao potential."

…

On the stage.

Zhang Yu slowly raised his head, looking at the base of the Sky Pillar.

Although the venue was incredibly noisy, although the gazes and attention of countless people were fixed on him, although this next battle concerned his future, the arrangements of the three major high schools, and the company's plans…

To the single-minded Zhang Yu, none of these things were on his mind anymore.

And when he activated the fully-focused state of the Martial Ascension Heart-Tempering Art, his spirit was concentrated to an unprecedented degree.

The entire world seemed to turn black and white in that instant, and in Zhang Yu's eyes, only the Sky Pillar before him and his own body remained.

His strong heart beat continuously, and his muscles and bones, nourished by qi, blood, and the potion, were incredibly active.

Without a doubt, after the breakthrough with his heart in the last event and an hour and a half of development, his physical body was at a peak state.

His physical strength had even risen from level 4.95 to 4.96.

At this moment, his heart was no longer a liability. His entire body was perfectly balanced, able to perfectly unleash the power contained within his vital energy.

_Then, the rest is simple._

_I just have to do what I am capable of doing._

This was a rare occasion for Zhang Yu to enter a fully-focused state purely for power circulation, outside of a high-speed environment.

He watched the Sky Pillar descend as slowly as a snail.

Zhang Yu gently extended a finger and pressed it against the base of the Sky Pillar; he could immediately feel a tsunami of power descending from the heavens, passing through his body and conducting to the platform beneath his feet.

And if he were to resist this power even slightly, it seemed he could see the pressure from the Sky Pillar and the platform below, one from above and one from below… like the massive maw of a giant beast, about to grind him to dust.

In the next moment, as Zhang Yu's palms pushed forward forcefully, beginning to resist the descending Sky Pillar, this feeling grew ever stronger.

It was a body that had been tempered through long training, incomparably powerful.

But in Zhang Yu's perception at this moment, his body became fragile under the pressure of the Sky Pillar.

His arms, shoulders, spine, leg bones, and the muscles in every part of his body… all became increasingly fragile under the oppression of this immense force.

In his perception, it was a feeling of fragility where a single lapse in attention would exceed the tolerable limits of various parts of his body, leading to torn tendons and broken bones.

Thus, as the Sky Pillar pressed down, Zhang Yu continuously adjusted his posture.

_The arm muscles can't hold up like this… I have to redirect._

_The lumbar spine can't bear it this way… I have to offload the force._

_The pressure on the legs needs to be distributed…_

Zhang Yu felt as if he were assembling a set of building blocks, freely and skillfully combining the strength from all over his body to support the torrential pressure descending from the sky.

The only difference was that these blocks were made of his flesh and blood, and at this moment they seemed as fragile as glass, liable to be shattered by the terrifying, heaven-sent force with the slightest hesitation.

_Almost…_

_It's almost complete…_

Zhang Yu's brain operated at high speed, and as he continuously adjusted and broke down the force, sweat constantly beaded on his forehead.

And during this process, the Sky Pillar continued its unwavering descent.

The Sky Pillar and the high platform were like a gradually closing maw, and Zhang Yu felt as if he were walking a tightrope above it, liable to be swallowed by this maw at any moment.

But at this moment, Zhang Yu did not even have time to panic.

With his complete and total focus, he could only feel his thoughts becoming smoother and the ‘power’ in his vision becoming clearer.

The Sky Pillar’s center of gravity, the flow of power through his muscles, the support from every fiber of his being…

Everything was so clear, so understandable, that Zhang Yu felt an unprecedented sense of clarity.

Under the immense pressure before him, Zhang Yu made a new breakthrough.

Redirection, shifting, offloading, exertion, support, explosion… the techniques brought by a dozen level-10 cultivation techniques merged into one at this moment.

Zhang Yu could seemingly see countless flows of power moving, balancing, and intertwining.

In the next instant, a sharp light flashed in his eyes, and it was as if his entire body's nerves, muscles, and bones were pierced by a bolt of lightning.

_I can feel it… I can see it…_

_All the power…_

Along with the violent exertion of his muscles, Zhang Yu's entire body of flesh and blood reached an unprecedented state of balance.

Every inch of his skin, every piece of his skeleton, every fiber of his being, was sharing the burden of that terrifying force descending from the heavens.

A force of 12,531 kilograms erupted from within Zhang Yu's body, and his frame, like a statue both incredibly fragile and incredibly strong, slowly pushed the Sky Pillar up.

It was incredibly fragile because the slightest misstep, or even the slightest tilt in the force he bore, would break his body's balance, and it would collapse, would shatter.

It was incredibly strong because every fiber of his flesh and blood had erupted with its own limit, like countless bars of steel and concrete, pushing with a terrifying force of 12,531 kilograms to lift the Sky Pillar.

And so, under the shocked gazes of countless people, Zhang Yu slowly straightened his back, steadily shouldering the Sky Pillar.

First second!

His bones began to show fractures, his skin began to split, and traces of blood appeared all over his body.

Third second!

His internal organs began to bleed.

Fifth second!

Blood trickled from the corners of Zhang Yu's mouth, eyes, and nose, yet he revealed a faint smile.

Because he had shouldered the 12,531-kilogram Sky Pillar.

At this moment, he represented the strongest power in the entire arena!

Below the stage, Yu Xinghan stared intently at Zhang Yu's body, his gaze sweeping over every revealed muscle, every ripple and contour.

At this moment, what he saw was not an ordinary physique, but a technique perfected to its peak, a display of understanding of the body and of power that completely surpassed his own.

At this moment, Yu Xinghan understood that he had lost.

In the extraction and use of physical strength, he had lost this time.

The Zhang Yu before him had wagered his own flesh and blood and defeated him.

And when the Sky Pillar slowly rose back up, there was almost no part of Zhang Yu's body that was not damaged.

But it was precisely because his entire body had sustained damage, had shouldered the harm, that he had not suffered a single, severe injury.

Wang Hai and Bai Zhenzhen rushed onto the stage.

Wang Hai quickly checked Zhang Yu's body, then sucked in a sharp breath.

"The injuries are so minor? At this rate, they could heal on their own without treatment, right? No… it's not just that they're minor; if many of these spots were just a little more severe, it would have likely caused a chain reaction, leading to serious injuries costing hundreds of thousands or even millions in medical fees."

"This kid, he controlled the damage to just below the threshold of a serious injury…"

As a top-tier athletics coach, Wang Hai was naturally extremely familiar with the human body's structure.

And it was for this reason that he knew just how incredible Zhang Yu's array of injuries was.

The only explanation Wang Hai could come up with for this was… talent.

"Absolute talent, an absolute talent for the extraction and control of physical strength."

"This Zhang Yu is the most talented and most valuable student I have encountered in my entire coaching career."

# Chapter 117: A Peerless Genius

In the spectator stands.

Lan Ling took a deep breath and slowly said, "He actually managed to do it? With the current weight of 12,531 kilograms and the gap to Yu Xinghan, it's really possible for Zhang Yu to take first place in the overall score."

As a second-year student specializing in body tempering who had participated in athletics meets before, Lan Ling deeply understood the difficulty of what Zhang Yu had just accomplished.

"To achieve this with his level of physical strength, his extraction of bodily power and his technique in circulating that power both far exceed the level of a first-year."

Beside him, Zhou Chechen frowned, seemingly not having expected things to develop to this point at all.

He murmured, "Does that mean his contest of speed with Yu Xinghan in the previous event wasn't achieved through some kind of potent drug either?"

"And this level of control over his body… no wonder he was able to control his surface features like Yu Xinghan after undergoing White Dragon's new body tempering technology modification."

Zhou Chechen looked at Zhang Yu walking off the high platform, feeling ever more regretful that he had failed to sign such a genius back then. Now, not only had he been snatched up by Zhang Pianpian, but it had also affected the deal between their two families and Purple Cloud.

Lan Ling, as a body tempering specialist, was currently full of admiration for the talent Zhang Yu had displayed.

But the more he admired it, the more he wanted to suppress him.

Lan Ling said coldly, "This Zhang Yu must be suppressed. Otherwise, if we let him keep promoting White Dragon's demonic muscle technology, it will only hinder our upcoming cooperation with Purple Cloud; this is no longer just a matter of our private conflict with him."

Zhou Chechen shook his head and said, "There you go again, getting anxious."

"Zhang Yu is in the limelight right now, but behind him are White Dragon High School and the Immortal Resonance Group. To promote their new body tempering tech, they will definitely protect him. Why should we rush up to be the villains?"

"If anyone should be anxious now, it should be Purple Cloud and Red Pagoda."

Zhou Chechen sighed and said, "Besides, in about two more months, Zhang Pianpian will be leaving."

"The promotional effect of Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen will have mostly worn off by then."

"Won't it be easy to deal with two penniless kids then? There are plenty of ways to make them obediently earn money for us."

…

In the live broadcast room.

Gang Shan watched Zhang Yu walk off the stage and said, feeling moved, "This trip to Songyang City's first-year athletics meet was truly not in vain."

"To think he could successfully challenge 12,531 kilograms, and not through pure brute force, but through a peak combination of strength and skill."

"Remarkable. The high school students these days are becoming more and more competitive, more and more terrifying."

Beside him, Le Jingchen's gaze swept across his phone, where someone had sent him the list of agents from Zhang Yu's delivery.

With a casual glance, Le Jingchen knew they were all the most common, mass-market agents.

Confirming this point, Le Jingchen's gaze hardened as he thought to himself, _A physical level of 4.95 makes it impossible to lift a 12,531-kilogram Sky Pillar with brute force._

_The drugs he used were also ordinary stuff._

_Which means this Zhang Yu was able to do this… by relying on extreme extraction and control of his own body, pushing the control of his muscle power to its absolute limit._

Thinking of this, Le Jingchen felt a small sense of relief.

_Thank goodness… thank goodness he's just a peerless genius._

Geniuses were not scary, because no matter how peerless or amazing, a genius represented only a single strong individual.

Perhaps to many students, teachers, and audience members, certain geniuses were highly valued.

But from Le Jingchen's lofty perspective, geniuses were just small, investable projects; what was truly frightening was unknown new technology.

What Le Jingchen had really been worried about… was whether the Immortal Resonance Group's technology could mass-produce individuals like Zhang Yu, capable of challenging a 12,531-kilogram Sky Pillar.

Happily, it seemed for now that it was purely because this student named Zhang Yu possessed peerless talent.

But the thought… that the top ten would now include Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen, two representatives of White Dragon's technology, and that the champion and runner-up of the overall score would be taken by Zhang Yu and Yu Xinghan, made Le Jingchen feel a wave of displeasure.

Because this meant the promotional effect for Purple Cloud Supplements was diminished, and the return on his family's investment this time was thus affected.

So, upon hearing Gang Shan's sigh beside him, Le Jingchen followed up by saying, "Indeed. This Zhang Yu's talent is quite terrifying."

Hype? Who didn't know how to do that?

Le Jingchen decided to thoroughly hype up this Zhang Yu, with the key emphasis on his peerless talent.

That way, his good results would all be because of his talent, and as a result… if the Immortal Resonance Group wanted to use this person to promote their new technology later, the effect would be diminished.

Le Jingchen was heard saying, "I don't know if you noticed, Gang Shan, but when he lifted the Sky Pillar, his whole body was covered in blood, with injuries all over."

"But he is able to move normally now, which means that although his entire body was injured, not a single area was severely hurt."

"This is very frightening. It shows that he relied on his skill to cleverly distribute the force to various parts of his body, and no single part exceeded its tolerable limit."

"You could say that he truly unleashed the absolute limit of his strength."

"This person's skill in power control has likely reached the level of peak Qi Refinement; even you and I cannot compare."

Gang Shan shot Le Jingchen a surprised look. _Brother… are you laying it on that thick? Does your Purple Cloud also have an investment in this Zhang Yu?_

However, Gang Shan was, after all, a seasoned streamer who had even promoted high-interest loans that required mortgaging one's own mother; what kind of situation hadn't he seen? With a moment's thought, he guessed Le Jingchen's intention.

So he played along, saying, "Indeed, this Zhang Yu's physical technique seems to have reached the pinnacle of perfection. In his hands, one part of strength can be used to produce ten parts of effect. Mere physical strength, body structure, or even drugs and technology… can no longer accurately describe his true power."

…

"Nice hype!"

Inside the Songyang High School rest area.

Zhang Yu, listening to the conversation between Le Jingchen and Gang Shan in the live broadcast, nodded in deep agreement and asked, "Who is this streamer? Sharp-eyed, thorough analysis. Tell me his name, I'll follow him later."

He Dayou, who was watching the stream, said helplessly, "Gang Shan."

Wang Hai said disapprovingly from the side, "He Dayou, since Zhang Yu is curious about this streamer, can't you bring your phone over and share it with your classmate?"

He Dayou was once again speechless; he had never realized before how annoying high-achieving students were. At least when his grades were higher than others, he was never this arrogant.

Fortunately, Zhang Yu waved his hand and said, "No need, Teacher Wang. Don't disturb a regular student's life just for my little bit of curiosity."

Zhang Yu sighed with emotion. "I am but a humble student who took fourth place in the Mana Competition, first place in the martial arts competition, and might take first place in the athletics meet. I just want to get along with everyone, not to create a clear hierarchy like at White Dragon and Purple Cloud."

Wang Hai said to the other students nearby, "Look, look! Do you all see? Classmate Zhang Yu has always been this humble, which is how he achieved what he has today. If this were White Dragon High, you all would have to be kneeling to listen to him speak today."

Then Wang Hai randomly pointed to a student and said, "Zhao Tianxing, what are you standing there for? Hurry up and get a few energy drinks for classmate Zhang Yu. Can't you see he needs to replenish his strength after finishing the competition?"

Zhao Tianxing understood that although Wang Hai seemed to point randomly, the fact that he could precisely single out the student with the worst grades present meant that it was definitely not random.

He could only sigh that his weak-poor-clown theory had been validated once again, and then he ran off to get energy drinks for Zhang Yu.

Just then, the Sky Pillar on the stage lit up; the final overall scores and rankings for the athletics meet were about to be announced.

Zhang Yu, Bai Zhenzhen, Wang Hai… everyone present turned their gazes to the Sky Pillar, watching as the names appeared one by one.

First Place, Songyang High School, Zhang Yu, 341 points

Second Place, White Dragon High School, Yu Xinghan, 338 points

Third Place, Purple Cloud High School, Le Mulan, 324 points

Fourth Place, White Dragon High School, Song Hailong, 322 points

Fifth Place, Songyang High School, Bai Zhenzhen, 320 points

Sixth Place, Red Pagoda High School, Xiong Wenwu…

Bai Zhenzhen didn't bother to read any further after sixth place; after all, in this competition, she felt that only the top five had any real substance. The rest were just riff-raff, not worth looking at.

On the other side, while Zhang Yu was still looking at his first-place name on the Sky Pillar, his phone rang. It was a call from Zhang Pianpian.

Zhang Yu answered the phone and said, "I took first place."

Zhang Pianpian said, "Yes, I've already communicated with the White Dragon side. As long as you are willing to admit that you underwent White Dragon's demonic muscle modification, they will give you advertisements and endorsements, and they will also handle the pressure from other companies for you."

A flicker of joy appeared in Zhang Yu's eyes as he asked, "How much money?"

Zhang Pianpian sighed. "It should have been more, but ever since Le Jingchen started hyping up your talent with Gang Shan, the Purple Cloud side has begun to promote you as a peerless genius from all angles. If this continues, the advertising and endorsement fees will likely be reduced significantly."

Zhang Yu was enraged.

The praise that had sounded so pleasant just moments ago now seemed incredibly jarring in hindsight.

For the first time, Zhang Yu discovered that he detested this kind of praise.

Zhang Yu asked again, "What about Zhen? She's in fifth place. Can you try to get some advertisements for her as well?"

Zhang Pianpian said, "I know, just wait for news."

"Also, no matter how much money you get today, remember not to spend it yet, and especially don't use it all to pay off your loans."

"In less than two months, I'll be heading to university."

"Let's meet tonight. I have some things to talk to you about as well."

From Zhang Pianpian's words, Zhang Yu felt a sense of urgency wash over him.

Before he knew it, less than two months remained before Zhang Pianpian would leave the first layer of Kunxu.

At that time, he and Bai Zhenzhen would lose the kind of protection Zhang Pianpian now provided and would have to face the pressure from the high school, the Student Council, and the companies alone.

At this thought, much of the joy in Zhang Yu's heart from winning the athletics meet was washed away, replaced instead by a rising sense of urgency.

(End of Chapter)

# Chapter 118: The Spokesperson

Not long after Zhang Yu finished his call with Zhang Pianpian, several electronic contracts were sent over.

They stipulated the requirements for their upcoming promotion of the demonic muscle, as well as the requirements for filming advertisements and being a spokesperson.

The specific reward was…

"An endorsement fee of 600,000 a year, to be paid in three installments…"

Zhang Yu felt his heart surge as he looked at this remuneration; it was the first time he had been this wealthy since coming to Kunxu.

But when he thought about how the money he should have received ought to have been more, and it was all because of that damn Le Jingchen and Purple Cloud branding him a peerless genius, causing his commercial value to plummet, Zhang Yu's heart began to burn with anger again.

Beside him, Bai Zhenzhen, seeing her own total endorsement fee of 400,000, was also flushed red with excitement.

"Haha, although my rank isn't as high as Zhang Yu's this time, I don't have the 'peerless genius' label, unlike Yu-boy who attracted a bunch of dirty traffic focused on geniuses."

Of course, the contracts also contained many restrictions for them.

For example, they could not deny that they had used demonic muscle, nor could they prevent others from using it.

As for the explanation for the lack of surface features, on one hand, it was because their control was strong, and on the other, the Immortal Resonance Group's technology was good, allowing them to adapt extremely quickly, which was why no one had seen any surface features.

Also, both he and Bai Zhenzhen had to state that the primary reason they were able to achieve excellent results in the athletics meet was because of the demonic muscle technology.

There were also other clauses, such as not criticizing the demonic muscle, not using the new body tempering technologies from Purple Cloud or Red Pagoda… and so on and so forth.

Of course, after Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen saw the payment, they felt these were all minor issues.

Not long after Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen signed the contracts, many staff members and a body tempering influencer came to the Songyang High School rest area, saying they wanted to interview Zhang Yu.

Zhang Yu had been given a heads-up by Zhang Pianpian and was already prepared for this, so he quickly appeared in front of the camera with Bai Zhenzhen…

"That's right, the achievements we have today are all because we underwent the Immortal Resonance Group's demonic muscle technology modification together…"

"I used to be a failure who couldn't even break into the top ten of my grade, but ever since I got demonic muscle, my appetite has been great, injections don't hurt, I'm more focused in class, and I gain muscle faster…"

"If you're afraid of low scores, you have to get demonic muscle. I believe that in the future, students without demonic muscle will lack competitiveness and will be gradually eliminated in the great tide of high school…"

As Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen's interview continued, a large crowd of students and teachers from regular and key high schools quickly gathered around.

Zhang Yu then noticed that many of them, and even some audience members, all went to the nearby Immortal Resonance Group's booth to inquire.

Especially not long after the interview ended, when Zhang Yu saw students from regular and key high schools running towards the booth with looks of aspiration and longing on their faces, he felt a bit emotional, as if he were watching leeks willingly offering themselves up to be harvested.

At the same time, the evil god in his chest, disguised as a prayer bead, said, "What are you sighing for? Don't tell me you pity those poor wretches?"

"If they don't spend their money here, they'll spend it elsewhere. What does it matter who squeezes them dry? Better to let us earn a little something in the process."

Zhang Yu moved to a nearby corner and said in a voice only he could hear, "I don't find them pitiful. After all, the demonic muscle technology is genuinely useful."

"Hehe, is it really useful?" the evil god suddenly chuckled lightly. "The Qi Refinement stage has its limits. The Dao heart has a maximum of level 10, mana has a maximum of 100, and the upper limit for physical strength is level 10."

"Do you think these students competing with you, even without demonic muscle, if you gave them a little more time to practice slowly, could they reach this limit?"

Zhang Yu was slightly taken aback, but he already had the answer in his heart.

The students present were, without exception, top students since childhood. If time were sufficient, pushing their cultivation to the Qi Refinement limit should not be a problem.

The evil god said faintly, "A long time ago, as long as you scored above 650 on the college entrance exam and had one or two competition rankings during your three years of high school, you could secure a spot in the Ten Greats."

"Then gradually, the college entrance exam score requirements got higher and higher, and students had to improve their stats as much as possible in just three short years, compressing the cultivation that originally took five, or even ten years, into a three-year period."

"Later still, the requirements for competition awards got higher and higher."

"The competition started in the third year, then slowly moved to the second year, and then later, you had to start competing and fighting from the first year."

"Now, they even have to use this demonic muscle, wanting to have a second-year's level in their first year."

"This so-called demonic muscle… is nothing more than a way to prematurely squeeze out the power they would have obtained with another year or two, or even three, of cultivation."

"But just like when body tempering with drugs was first promoted, when the majority of people start taking drugs, start using demonic muscle, the Immortal Dao failures will still be Immortal Dao failures."

"Those who couldn't get into the Ten Greats before still won't get into the Ten Greats, those who couldn't get a Foundation Establishment qualification certificate still won't get one, and the ultimate limit of their lives will still be the limit of Qi Refinement."

"What's the difference compared to before, when they didn't take drugs or use any new body tempering technology?"

"Oh, no, that's not right, there is a difference. These Immortal Dao failures have taken on yet another debt for this demonic muscle."

"Do you understand now? The sole purpose of these body tempering technologies is to help them compete with other students in high school."

"But no matter how hard they work, no matter how desperately they fight, the number of spots in the Ten Greats will not increase, the number of people who obtain a Foundation Establishment qualification certificate will not increase, and the limit of Qi Refinement will not change."

The evil god laughed again. "From beginning to end, this is just the Ten Great Sects and the companies playing them for fools."

"But they play them well, making them willingly hand over their money. They're much more skilled at it than we evil gods."

Just as the evil god was chuckling, Zhao Tianxing cautiously walked over and began to ask Zhang Yu about the demonic muscle.

The last time Songyang High had its special training program, Zhao Tianxing chose to give up, partly because he felt the program was too cruel, but more so because he was afraid of wasting his family's money and ending up with nothing.

But this time, seeing Zhang Yu's results had sparked a huge interest in the demonic muscle for Zhao Tianxing.

Especially since he had watched Zhang Yu's rapid progress day by day.

Originally, Zhao Tianxing was too embarrassed to ask Zhang Yu the reason for his rapid progress, but now, seeing Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen actively promoting and accepting interviews, he also wanted to inquire.

He looked at Zhang Yu and asked, "A'Yu, is the demonic muscle really that powerful? Can it close the gap between us and the three major high schools?"

Zhang Yu nodded and said, "Yes, it's very powerful. Without demonic muscle, I couldn't have taken first place."

Zhao Tianxing then asked expectantly, "Do you think it's necessary for me to use demonic muscle?"

Thinking of the restrictions in the contract, Zhang Yu could only nod again. "Yes, it's pretty good."

Zhao Tianxing smiled. "You also think I should undergo the modification?"

Seeing Zhao Tianxing's excited face, as if he had already made up his mind, Zhang Yu said jokingly, "Actually, the reason I'm so strong is also due to the effects of natural body tempering; that's how I can control the increased physical strength with such ease."

Zhao Tianxing just thought Zhang Yu was joking and laughed along with him.

The evil god disguised as a prayer bead sneered. "You still want to hint to him not to spend this money? Save it. Everyone is starting to use the new technology. If he doesn't spend the money, how can he keep up? He'll just be out of the game early."

"Besides, these Immortal Dao failures won't listen to you. If you continue to persuade them, hehe… they will only think you are trying to deceive them, afraid of them making progress."

"Don't end up violating the contract and losing a friend at the same time."

"This is Kunxu. The trend is like a tide; how can you alone change it?"

On the other side, He Dayou had been straining his ears, listening to the conversation between Zhao Tianxing and Zhang Yu. Hearing this, he couldn't help but think, _Natural body tempering? I doubt there's a single part of your body that's natural._

Then his gaze shifted as another thought occurred to him. _Is he saying this because he's afraid that if we all undergo the demonic muscle modification, we'll catch up to him in the future?_

Thinking of this, a trace of worry rose in He Dayou's heart. _I wonder if there will be any problems if I get demonic muscle, since I've already had the transplant surgery?_

Zhang Yu looked at the surrounding classmates and could feel their restless eagerness.

A trace of helplessness flashed through Zhang Yu's mind, as if he could already see the near future where, one by one, his surrounding classmates would all become neither human nor beast.

In the future, Songyang High could be renamed Songyang Demonic Beast Park.
