_No, if this keeps up, in a few years, the entire Songyang City might become a crazy Zootopia._

The evil god disguised as a prayer bead said, "Kid, you have the leisure to care about others right now?"

Zhang Yu walked to the side and said softly, "It's been a long time since you've said so much."

"Just resting and saving some energy, you know." The evil god chuckled. "Besides, there are a lot of people paying attention here. If I say less, isn't it also to avoid revealing any clues that might implicate us both?"

"Kid, everyone in this arena, from top to bottom, is a crowd of blind fools. They've only seen the tip of the iceberg of your talent. Otherwise, they would have definitely torn you limb from limb to study you thoroughly…"

"But even so, there are quite a few people who are hostile to you now, and that sister of yours is leaving for a university on the second layer of Kunxu in two months, right? In two months, many people will probably come after you…"

Zhang Yu said coldly, "What are you trying to say?"

The evil god tempted, "Don't you want your potential to be further unleashed? Don't you want to become stronger and richer, so that after your sister leaves, you can be safe and protect yourself, look after Bai Zhenzhen, and even ascend to the second layer of Kunxu together in the future…"

Apparently, during this period, although this evil god had not spoken much, through its silent observation, it had come to understand Zhang Yu's situation more and more.

Zhang Yu did not answer, but only thought to himself, _Of course I want to further unleash my potential._

Looking at the Feathered Tome appearing before him, Zhang Yu wished it would just go _ding, ding, ding, ding, ding_ and raise his level by a hundred thousand, enough to smash Kunxu with a single punch.

"But what's the price?" Zhang Yu said flatly. "Trying to trick me into dealing with your colleagues again?"

The evil god smiled. "How can you call this tricking? I'm just giving you a reminder. You always have a way out, anytime, anywhere. As long as you hunt another evil god for me, your potential can skyrocket again! Explode! Go crazy!"

Although it did not receive a reply from Zhang Yu, the evil god understood in its heart that this suggestion had surely taken root in Zhang Yu's mind. All that was left was to wait for him to walk down this path.

# Chapter 119: My Schedule's Overbooked

Within the rest area of White Dragon High School.

At this very moment, Yu Xinghan was staring at the rankings on the Sky Pillar, his eyes fixed on the name in first place.

_Zhang Yu, is it?_

_No wonder Senior Sister Li took a liking to him back then. Although I ultimately beat him out in the disciple selection, he certainly has his merits._

He glanced at Song Hailong beside him and thought, _I can find a new sparring partner now._

Elsewhere, Song Hailong seemed to sense Yu Xinghan's gaze. He watched the other boy's departing figure for a moment before turning his own eyes back to the names on the Sky Pillar.

Looking at Zhang Yu in first place, he thought to himself, _Perhaps I should also switch my sparring partner._

A thread of regret even surfaced in Song Hailong's heart; he thought that he shouldn't have canceled his sparring sessions with Zhang Yu, as he might have been able to witness firsthand how Zhang Yu transformed to reach his current level.

...

In the Songyang High School rest area, Yu Xinghan walked over, drawing the surprised gazes of the crowd.

Although Zhang Yu had defeated him this time, Yu Xinghan's dominant performance in the first three stages of the competition was still deeply seared into their minds.

Now, seeing Yu Xinghan up close, the students of Songyang High School were so pressured by the aura of a Golden Core disciple and White Dragon High's number one student that they instinctively backed away.

A girl beside He Dayou whispered, "Isn't it the custom at White Dragon High to kneel? Should we kneel to welcome him?"

"What nonsense are you spouting!" another male student said. "This is Purple Cloud High's territory. Do you know the etiquette for greeting the number one student at Purple Cloud?"

He Dayou couldn't stand the sight of his two compatriots acting so obsequious before someone from White Dragon and said coldly, "This is Songyang High's rest area, and the ground beneath our feet is Songyang High's land. A simple bow to this White Dragon fellow is more than enough."

Bai Zhenzhen inwardly cursed them as a bunch of wastes; it was up to her, the fifth-place finisher in the athletics meet, to step forward and speak with Yu Xinghan.

She walked up to Yu Xinghan and asked, "What do you want?"

Yu Xinghan glanced at her and said flatly, "Add me as a friend?"

Bai Zhenzhen paused, stunned. This guy came over to add her as a friend? She couldn't tell at all. Was this Golden Core disciple so fond of making friends?

As it happened, she, Bai Zhenzhen, also enjoyed making friends, so she immediately said, "A friend slot costs 500."

"Then never mind." Yu Xinghan put away his new phone and said indifferently, "Actually, I don't want to add you that badly."

Bai Zhenzhen quickly said, "Then 100! Is 100 okay?"

Seeing Yu Xinghan take out his phone again to add her, Bai Zhenzhen was dumbfounded.

_Is this guy really a Golden Core disciple, a rich person?_

It was the first time Bai Zhenzhen had ever seen a wealthy person haggle with her over a few hundred.

"I came over here mainly to see Zhang Yu," Yu Xinghan said, looking toward Zhang Yu, who was still resting on the sofa.

Yu Xinghan was not someone who had been invincible from birth, who had never met anyone stronger than himself.

Moreover, even when facing opponents weaker than him, there were sometimes things worth learning and reflecting on.

Just like his sparring partner for the past while, Song Hailong; that indomitable and upright spirit was a quality worth taking as a cautionary tale.

It constantly reminded him not to get too inflated just because he was number one in his year, not to abandon a great specialty of the martial way—the sneak attack—for some worthless pride and prestige.

Of course, besides learning, there was another important reason for hiring Song Hailong as a sparring partner.

But that reason was a secret that belonged to Yu Xinghan, known only to him in all of heaven and earth.

And in terms of learning alone, the Zhang Yu before him was even more worthy of his study.

_That sublime physical skill..._

_I really want to learn it._

_I want to learn it so I can beat him with it._

At this moment, Yu Xinghan looked at Zhang Yu as if he were looking at a grand feast brimming with knowledge, wanting to devour his opponent bite by bite and absorb him completely, turning him into nourishment to become even stronger.

Thus, Yu Xinghan looked at Zhang Yu and said, "Train with me. 6,000 an hour. You in?"

Zhang Yu's eyes shifted. Although prize money and endorsement fees were on their way, no one in Kunxu ever complained about having too much money.

Zhang Yu simply asked, "How do we train?"

Yu Xinghan rubbed his chin, thinking as he spoke. "Well... combat training, I guess. Just try your best to defeat me."

"15,000 an hour."

"7,000 at most."

"7,000 is impossible, it has to be at least 12,000. I can't be cheaper than Song Hailong, can I?"

Zhang Yu remembered that Song Hailong's rate for sparring with Yu Xinghan was 10,000 an hour.

Yu Xinghan said helplessly, "Then 11,000. That's the highest I can go. If you don't want it, I'm leaving."

Watching the other boy's back as he turned to leave, Zhang Yu quickly said, "Fine, fine, 11,000 it is."

And so, when Yu Xinghan left, he had already added Zhang Yu as a friend and arranged for their next combat training session at White Dragon High School.

Just then, his phone vibrated. Yu Xinghan took it out and saw it was a call from Li Xuelian.

Remembering her instructions about the weight to report for the final round, Yu Xinghan smiled slightly as he answered the phone, "Senior Sister Li, you must have seen the results?"

Li Xuelian did not dwell on the matter of the final round. In her eyes, it was a complete accident. No one could have predicted that Zhang Yu would achieve such a result at that stage. Her previous judgment had been flawless.

It was just Zhang Yu himself... he had surprised Li Xuelian somewhat.

But at this moment, Li Xuelian had no interest in discussing this with Yu Xinghan and simply said crisply, "The contract has been adjusted. For the upcoming commercials and endorsements, you'll be working together with Zhang Yu..."

After explaining the contract details, Li Xuelian was about to hang up.

But then she heard Yu Xinghan suddenly say, "Senior Sister Li, I want to ask Zhang Yu to train with me. He has many strengths worth my learning and absorbing."

Then, Yu Xinghan said with some apprehension, "I negotiated a fee of 15,000 an hour with him. Do you think you could approve that?"

As a Golden Core disciple, Yu Xinghan could be said to be very rich, and also very poor.

He was rich because True Monarch Xinghuo and Li Xuelian had invested countless resources in him, enough to make the many wealthy students of Songyang City green with envy.

He was poor because every single one of his expenses had to be approved by Li Xuelian, and the pocket money he could spend freely each month was only 5,000.

This state of being both poor and rich was the reason he had initially refused Bai Zhenzhen's friend request.

After all, Li Xuelian might not approve the 500 for Bai Zhenzhen's friend slot, which would make it far too expensive for him.

It was also the other reason he had hired Song Hailong as a sparring partner.

It was his chance to embezzle tuition fees.

"15,000?" Li Xuelian recalled Zhang Yu's performance and said flatly, "Fine. Remember to record your payment history and the sparring sessions each time and report them to me."

Yu Xinghan understood. This was to prevent him from falsifying tutoring fees and hours, from guarding the treasury only to steal from it himself. He had his ways to deal with that.

After Li Xuelian hung up the phone, however, she felt a flicker of curiosity about the outcome of a match between Yu Xinghan and Zhang Yu.

After all, Yu Xinghan had been trained by True Monarch Xinghuo for so long; in Li Xuelian's view, he was certainly far superior to Zhang Yu in terms of actual combat.

"...But this Zhang Yu really does have something worth learning for Yu Xinghan. Fifteen thousand is well worth it."

"It's just that back then, perhaps we should have signed this Zhang Yu as well."

When she relayed the results of the athletics meet and her thoughts to True Monarch Xinghuo, she received his reply.

True Monarch Xinghuo said with some regret, "It seems that Zhang Yu is quite good. I underestimated him back then. If we had more resources, we should have signed him."

"But since our resources are only enough to cultivate one disciple, we can only choose the most outstanding one with the most potential."

"Alright, Xuelian, what's past is past. No need to worry about gains and losses, it only adds to your troubles."

...

Inside the Songyang High School rest area.

Zhang Yu had just settled the sparring project with Yu Xinghan when he received a sparring request from Song Hailong.

But before he could even finish negotiating a price with Song Hailong, he received a message from Le Mulan.

Le Mulan: "Can I hire you to practice ground fighting with me?"

Zhang Yu suddenly felt the bustle of being in high demand.

He sighed, "Ah, there are so many classes I can't schedule them all, and so much money I can't earn it all."

Bai Zhenzhen, who had been watching Zhang Yu reply to his messages from the side, heard this and said, "Yu-boy, if you can't handle all the tutoring, I can substitute for you."

"I'm not the same person I was at the martial arts tournament two months ago."

Zhang Yu's gaze flickered as he thought of Bai Zhenzhen's fifth-place finish this time.

In truth, Bai Zhenzhen's results and rate of improvement were already incredibly fast and astonishing. If she had a better background, then as long as she maintained this pace in her second and third years, she would be a shoo-in for the Ten Greats.

But now, because of her status as a poor person, she needed to meet even higher requirements to get into the Ten Greats.

_Zhen's rate of improvement is only a little slower compared to mine; it's even faster than Song Hailong's and Le Mulan's._

_She'd have no problem being a sparring partner for Le Mulan and Song Hailong._

_And..._

Zhang Yu knew that Zhen desperately needed this money too.

_Once she has money, Zhen's improvement can accelerate, and in the future, she can get into the Ten Greats with me._

The thought of entering the Ten Greats with Zhen brought a shadow of doubt to Zhang Yu's mind.

He still remembered his sister's requirement that the two of them take first and second place in the competition.

But with Yu Xinghan, Song Hailong, Le Mulan... each one more driven, more monstrous than the last, he didn't know what impact Zhen's current competition results would have on her chances of getting into the Ten Greats.

_I'll ask my sister tonight._

...

That evening, not long after the competition ended.

Zhang Yu, Bai Zhenzhen, and Zhang Pianpian met under a bridge.

The three of them stood by the riverbank, chatting idly for a few moments.

Gazing at the gurgling water before her, Zhang Pianpian suddenly asked a question, "Zhang Yu, if I gave you a chance to go to the second layer with me in two months, would you be willing?"

# Chapter 120: Sorry, Zhen

In two months, go to the second layer with Zhang Pianpian?

Just as Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen were struck with astonishment, Zhang Pianpian continued, "In less than two months, the college entrance exams will begin."

"After the exams, I will head to the second layer of Kunxu to attend interviews."

"Under normal circumstances, students who pass their interviews will stay at the university. After all, time is tight, and all university students have to start their classes before enrollment."

"So in two months, I will no longer be able to watch over you in Songyang City."

Zhang Pianpian turned her head and looked at Zhang Yu, saying, "But as I said before, I have prepared a path for you: the Prodigy Class at Myriad Laws University."

Zhang Yu knew of Myriad Laws University. It was the university directly under the Myriad Laws Sect, one of the Ten Great Sects, and was one of the ten top-tier universities.

Groups like the Immortal Resonance Group, the Deep Sea Education Group, the Myriad Stars Group... even Songyang High and White Dragon High, if one traced their lineage upward, could all be considered under the Myriad Laws Sect. From the perspective of the sect above, the competition between these companies and schools was all internal.

But... the Prodigy Class? What was that? Zhang Yu searched his memories but couldn't recall anything about it.

"Sis, what is this Prodigy Class? Can I enroll as a first-year? I can enter university now?"

Zhang Pianpian explained, "The so-called Prodigy Class is a place where Myriad Laws University makes exceptions to recruit from first-year high school students, gathering a group of Immortal Dao geniuses for early cultivation. So yes, you can become a university student as a first-year."

"The main applicants for the Prodigy Class are generally first-year students from the second layer, which is why very few people on the first layer know about it."

Zhang Yu understood; it was a shortcut for the elites of the second layer.

Zhang Pianpian continued, "Your competition results recently have been excellent. As long as you place in the top three in the upcoming Dao heart competition and use your prize money and endorsement fees from this time to drastically improve your Daoist arts, you should meet the application requirements for the Myriad Laws University Prodigy Class."

"Once you pass the Prodigy Class exam, you can enter Myriad Laws University with me."

Hearing this, Zhang Yu's heart filled with joy, especially at the thought of being able to bypass the inescapable net woven by the rich of Songyang City to stop the 'poor from entering the Ten Greats,' and he would no longer have to worry about the dangers after Zhang Pianpian left.

But the next moment, he turned to look at Bai Zhenzhen beside him and asked Zhang Pianpian, "Sis, what about Zhen? Are her results good enough to apply for the Prodigy Class?"

Zhang Yu had been worried about Bai Zhenzhen's competition results.

Although Zhen's rate of progress was already astonishing, and her results of top four in the martial arts meet and top five in the athletics meet were definitely excellent, but...

Zhang Pianpian shook her head. "I'm afraid she doesn't meet the standard for the Prodigy Class."

Hearing this, Zhang Yu's heart sank. He turned his head again to look at Bai Zhenzhen.

But he saw Bai Zhenzhen force a smile. "It's okay, Yu-boy. You guys go to the second layer of Kunxu and be my advance team. I'll be up in another two years."

Zhang Yu didn't answer, instead looking at Zhang Pianpian and saying, "Sis, is there no way to make an exception? Can we use connections to buy a spot in the Prodigy Class exam?"

Hearing this, Bai Zhenzhen's breathing quickened slightly. She looked nervously at Zhang Pianpian, her hands having unconsciously clenched into tight fists.

Facing their gazes, Zhang Pianpian said in a flat tone, "It can't be done."

"You need to understand that when it comes to crossing class boundaries, there are many rules in Kunxu that cannot be defied."

"If you want to climb up layer by layer, there is no other way besides results and exams."

"Only by passing one assessment after another within the scope of the rules, obtaining sufficiently outstanding results, and earning the required certificates can you climb higher in Kunxu."

"This is the iron law of Kunxu. Anyone who tries to violate this law will only be met with a thunderous blow..."

Hearing these words, Bai Zhenzhen's heart trembled.

In the ensuing silence, Bai Zhenzhen suddenly laughed. "I said it's fine, Yu-boy. You go on up and compete with the second-layer elites first. I'll stay in Songyang and suppress all the rich people here before I go up."

Though she said this, Bai Zhenzhen knew she wasn't telling the truth.

She really... really didn't want to be left alone in Songyang City.

_But there's no other way. I can't ask A'Yu to give up his chance to go to university and stay here with me, can I?_

_If I said something like that, A'Yu and I wouldn't even be able to be friends anymore, right?_

Just then, Zhang Yu spoke again. "Sis, is there really no way to take Zhen with us?"

A chill rose from the depths of Zhang Yu's heart, because before his next words could even leave his mouth, the ritual's countdown began in his mind.

It was as if it was urging him to hurry and seize this opportunity to get into university.

But under the pressure of this chill, Zhang Yu paused, and finally spoke the words he had to say, words the ritual did not want him to say.

Because he knew that if he didn't ask this question, he would never be at peace.

Zhang Yu said, "Or... if I stay behind, do you think Zhen and I could take the normal route and get into the Ten Greats? Like you did, Sis?"

But Zhang Pianpian shook her head. "My path was only suitable for me. You can't walk it."

"Idiot!" the evil god, disguised as a prayer bead, cursed. "Have you lost your mind?"

"It's perfect if you can't take Bai Zhenzhen with you! Kill her, and take her spiritual root."

"Relying on the resources of Myriad Laws University, plus your talent and her spiritual root, reaching the Nascent Soul realm within one or two hundred years will be no problem at all! Financial freedom and cultivation freedom will be within your grasp in the future!"

At this moment, the evil god felt nothing but incomparable rage.

It felt as if it had never seen such a moron, someone ten times stupider than the poorest, lowliest, most foolish mortal it had ever tricked.

"Damn pauper! You deserve to eat dirt on the first layer of Kunxu for the rest of your life!"

And Bai Zhenzhen, hearing Zhang Yu's words, also spoke up. "Are you being stupid? Yu-boy, if you have a chance to get into the Ten Greats, you should hurry up and take it..."

Looking at Bai Zhenzhen's forced cheerful expression, Zhang Yu said suddenly, "You'll be played to death, Zhen."

"Zhen, if we both leave and you're the only one left here, those people will play you to death."

Hearing this, Bai Zhenzhen fell silent.

Especially after this period of time, after gaining a deeper understanding of the Student Council, the high school, and the corporations' methods, and after training hard with Zhang Yu and studying under Zhang Pianpian's care.

Bai Zhenzhen found that she could no longer face moving forward alone as calmly as she had in the past.

And as Zhang Yu's words laid bare the very things she had just been deliberately trying not to think about, not to contemplate.

At this moment, Bai Zhenzhen felt as if her entire being had been plunged into a frozen lake. Before her was an endless darkness and cold, and she could only sink deeper and deeper, unable to see the path ahead.

_So scared..._

_I'm so scared..._

Bai Zhenzhen wanted to say something, wanted to smile and tell Zhang Yu to be rational and go to the second layer first.

But the fear of the future, the terror of the devouring darkness around her, made it impossible for her to speak those words with composure once more.

_Sorry, Yu-boy..._ Bai Zhenzhen lowered her head, her fists clenched tighter and tighter, her heart filled with bitterness. _I'm too useless. I really... really can't just tell you to go._

On the other side, Zhang Yu looked at Zhang Pianpian, as if waiting for her answer.

But with Zhang Pianpian's silence, the chill from the bottom of Zhang Yu's heart grew deeper and deeper.

Clearly, the power of the ritual, which had always been the force pushing Zhang Yu to study hard, cultivate diligently, and get into a top-ten university.

At this moment, it could not tolerate Zhang Yu giving up such an opportunity to enter Myriad Laws University.

"Please abide by the ritual's agreement. Work hard to fulfill the wish. Do not deliberately slack off or delay. 5."

"Please abide by the ritual's agreement. Work hard to fulfill the wish. Do not deliberately slack off or delay. 4."

As the countdown in his ears neared its limit, Zhang Yu knew his time was running out.

He could not hold on any longer.

At this moment, he thought, _Sorry, Zhen._

_But if I insist on staying... this ritual will just kill me._

Not daring to look at Bai Zhenzhen beside him, Zhang Yu knew that he had to accept Zhang Pianpian's plan before the countdown ended.

The qi and blood in his body surged violently.

A furious rage rose in his mind. _This broken world, this trash Kunxu world..._

Just as Zhang Yu was about to speak at the last moment, a sigh escaped Zhang Pianpian's lips.

"Sigh, I knew it. You two are really... must you go together?"

Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen's heads snapped up, their eyes wide as they looked at Zhang Pianpian.

Sensing the expectation in their eyes, Zhang Pianpian said helplessly, "If you don't join the Prodigy Class, it means that after I leave, you must stay on the first layer of Kunxu, honestly finish three years of high school, take the college entrance exam, and get into a university."

"Without my protection, to avoid the rich families' siege and get into the Ten Greats in the next two years... I can only think of one other way."

"But this way is difficult, extremely difficult. Even I, in my three years of high school, never managed to succeed."

Zhang Pianpian's words about 'another way' stopped the countdown in Zhang Yu's mind, and made him ask impatiently, "What way?"

"The way is..." Zhang Pianpian said slowly, "after I leave, before you graduate from high school, you get your Foundation Establishment certificate while you're still in school."

What?!

That was the Foundation Establishment certificate!

Zhang Yu thought to himself, _Why does your tone make it sound as simple as 'pass the Level Four English exam before graduating high school'? That's the Foundation Establishment certificate, not some English test._

A Foundation Establishment certificate that many university students couldn't pass, and you want high school students to take the test?

Besides, could high school students even take the exam for the Foundation Establishment certificate?

And how could they possibly get the certificate before graduating from high school?

Zhang Yu asked in shock, "The Foundation Establishment certificate? Isn't that... something only university students can test for?"

Bai Zhenzhen, equally stunned, said from the side, "Can high school students take the test for the Foundation Establishment certificate?"

# Chapter 121: The Foundation Establishment Certificate

Facing Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen's tense and bewildered gazes, Zhang Pianpian first spoke of another matter.

"About a few decades ago, the number of planned admissions for the university's Foundation Establishment certificate program began to shrink."

"Do you know why the numbers were reduced?"

Zhang Pianpian didn't expect the two to answer, continuing on her own, "Because the total number of people who can achieve Foundation Establishment each year is limited."

"And reducing the number for universities was done to allocate a portion of the Foundation Establishment certificates to high school students."

Huh?

Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen were shocked. University students were allocating Foundation Establishment certificates to them, high schoolers?

Were they worthy?

As if guessing their thoughts, Zhang Pianpian continued, "Not high school students like us."

Zhang Pianpian pointed upward and said, "It's for those high school students up there."

Under their surprised gazes, Zhang Pianpian explained further, "Do you think those people on the second layer of Kunxu and above, like those on the fifth, tenth, or even twentieth layers..."

"Those Golden Core True Monarchs, Nascent Soul great cultivators, and even the super-rich higher up, like those at the Spirit Transformation or Void Refinement realms, whose Immortal Dao wealth is already an astronomical figure... do you think their children, descendants, and disciples will be like us, having to take the college entrance exam to get into the Ten Greats?"

Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen paused. Intuitively, they almost instinctively felt that the high school students from above probably didn't have to obediently take the college entrance exam like them.

But as for how those students from above actually entered the Immortal Dao, or how they went through high school and university, aside from the Prodigy Class... the two of them couldn't imagine it.

Zhang Pianpian went on to explain, "The descendants or disciples cultivated by those upper-level super-rich still have to abide by Kunxu's rules and enter the Immortal Dao in high school."

"The allocation of Foundation Establishment certificates to high school students that I just mentioned was for that kind of high school student. This led to the creation of a special exam, an exam for the Foundation Establishment certificate that high school students can register for."

Bai Zhenzhen asked, "Can we also participate in this kind of exam? Does that mean... we'd have to compete with the high school students from the upper layers?"

Zhang Pianpian shook her head, thought for a moment, and looked at the slums in the distant suburbs across the river.

"In Songyang City, the rich in the city center will band together to suppress the geniuses that emerge from among the poor, and they will try every means possible in school to limit the poor and ensure their own advantages."

"But at the same time, it is these same rich people who pay to distribute food and some daily necessities to the paupers in the suburbs, provide jobs that cultivators are unwilling to do, help the paupers in the suburbs to reproduce, and even give them the opportunity to study in the city center."

"They are all poor people, yet the attitude of the rich in the city center towards different poor people is completely different."

"The same applies to Kunxu. To the immortals who stand at the pinnacle of the Ten Great Sects, the super-rich both inside and outside the sects who wish to become immortals, along with their descendants and disciples, are targets for restriction and suppression."

"Meanwhile, the people in the lower layers of Kunxu, perhaps like this suburban slum, are considered a group to be supported, a source from which to constantly produce poor geniuses."

Listening to Zhang Pianpian's words, the evil god, still disguised as a prayer bead, sneered coldly in Zhang Yu's mind.

"Hehe, the immortals... they want to make sure that the number of people who want to go to university but can't, who want to join a company but can't get in, who want to join a sect but can't, who want to become immortal but can't achieve it... they want more and more such people, so that the competition becomes increasingly fierce."

"Only by making the competition among those below more and more intense, making them exhaust themselves, their families, and offer up everything for the sake of competition, can the profits of the Ten Great Sects grow higher and higher, enough for those lofty gods, those immortals who look down upon Kunxu, to continue to sit comfortably above the clouds."

The evil god's tone was filled with extreme envy, as if it wished it could be the one lying at the pinnacle of Kunxu, enjoying the endless contributions of trillions of living beings.

But suddenly, a thought struck it, and it realized something.

_Wait, speaking of which... could it be that some Evil God King did this to me? Afraid that I would continue to advance and become a new Evil God King?_

Zhang Yu naturally had no way of knowing the evil god's thoughts. He only listened to its words in his mind, a thoughtful look flashing in his eyes.

Originally, in his mind, all rich people who were wealthier than him, whether they were the rich of Songyang City, the rich of Kunxu's second layer, or the rich of Kunxu's third layer, were all just rich people, like a single symbol, and he couldn't be bothered to distinguish between them.

But at this moment, Zhang Yu truly realized the vast difference between one rich person and another.

Especially on the different levels of Kunxu, the attitudes of rich people one, two, or three layers above him towards him would all be different.

And the attitude of the rich on each of these layers towards people of different levels below or above them would, in turn, be completely different.

Thus, various forms of suppression, competition, alliance, support, and exploitation... incredibly complex relationships ran through Kunxu like a tangled mess of yarn.

Meanwhile, Zhang Pianpian continued to speak.

She said, "In any case, the high school Foundation Establishment certificate exam was ultimately established by the Heavenly Court."

"In addition to the spots for the high school students from above, in order to make exceptions and promote geniuses from all layers, a certain number of Foundation Establishment certificate spots were also given to the high school students of each lower layer, to be competed for among the students of that layer."

"It's just that the lower the layer, the fewer the spots."

Listening to Zhang Pianpian's words, Zhang Yu could almost see the countless bloody battles that must have surrounded this 'high school Foundation Establishment certificate exam.'

He had no idea how much political maneuvering and how many struggles had taken place in the upper echelons of Kunxu to establish such an exam for high school students on every layer.

Zhang Pianpian continued, "However... although this exam was also arranged for the first layer of Kunxu at the insistence of the Heavenly Court."

"But just like how the rich in the city center will support the commoners in the suburbs and give them a chance to interview for high school, yet the rich in the high school will then suppress the poor students who get in."

"Although the Heavenly Court arranged a high school Foundation Establishment certificate exam for the first layer of Kunxu, over the years, it has gradually been monopolized by the top powers of the first layer."

"On one hand, various methods have been used to jointly conceal information, so that after year after year, this exam is gradually no longer mentioned on the first layer of Kunxu, and fewer and fewer people know about it."

"You could say... this is a path that is hidden from the vast majority of high school students on the first layer of Kunxu."

Zhang Yu nodded slightly. If Zhang Pianpian hadn't told him today, he might never have known about this exam in his entire life.

He instantly understood that this was another information gap, a crucial tool in Kunxu's competition that Zhang Pianpian had always emphasized.

It was just like the time he took the divine ministry outsourcing exam; ordinary high school students were completely ignorant of it.

This Foundation Establishment certificate exam was the same. Ordinary high school students wouldn't just be unable to take it; they might not even know of the existence of such an exam, or even the certificate itself.

He even suspected that many teachers were probably unaware of this high school-level exam.

For example, Lei Jun, who had once told him about the university exam for the Foundation Establishment certificate, was likely ignorant of this matter for high school students.

Zhang Pianpian continued, "On the other hand, the remaining high school students who can participate in this exam are the strongest, most talented, and wealthiest... those who aspire to obtain the Foundation Establishment certificate even before university."

"And the number of spots for the first layer is only four per year. Excluding Daoist arts, which are not considered a selection criterion, these four spots are for the most outstanding high school students in four different areas: Dao heart, mana, athletics, and martial arts."

"To win this certificate basically means you have to become one of the four strongest high school students on the entire first layer of Kunxu. This level of difficulty, in itself, is another form of monopoly by the top powers of the first layer."

Seeing Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen's solemn expressions, Zhang Pianpian said flatly, "Just as I told you earlier, if you want to climb up in Kunxu, you can't do it without exams and certificates."

"Take getting into a top-ten university, for example. Even if you can find various different upward paths within the rules... every single path ultimately comes down to an exam."

"Choosing to take the Foundation Establishment certificate exam instead of the Prodigy Class will only be another, more difficult exam."

Just from listening to Zhang Pianpian's brief description, Bai Zhenzhen could feel the difficulty of this exam. But with the Prodigy Class out of reach, as long as she could get into the Ten Greats, she was willing to try, no matter how difficult or intense the competition.

In comparison, she was more worried about the monopoly the top powers of the first layer had on this exam.

Thus, Bai Zhenzhen asked, "If we participate in this exam, will there be danger? Like the rich people of Songyang City ganging up to block the poor from getting into the Ten Greats?"

Zhang Pianpian replied, "Based on the intelligence I've obtained from the Inspection Department, the high school Foundation Establishment certificate exam is, after all, an exam established by the Heavenly Court. Its standards are high, and its rules are extremely strict, precisely to make exceptions for and select geniuses from all layers."

"There are various measures in place to prevent cheating and to stop students from higher layers from dropping down to compete for spots."

"And to prevent cheating, all students must have their identities hidden from the public, a process personally carried out by the Eight Ministries of Righteous Gods."

"The top powers of the first layer might be able to deceive the public and conceal information about the exam outside the testing grounds."

"They might be able to raise the standards of their own high school students, making the exam even harder."

"But they would never be able to cheat in an exam established by the Heavenly Court, much less dare to penetrate the protection of the Eight Ministries of Righteous Gods to leak a contestant's identity."

"In other words, as long as you can successfully register, you won't have to worry about your identity being exposed."

Bai Zhenzhen then asked the second question on her mind, "And if we get the Foundation Establishment certificate, can we get into the Ten Greats?"

Zhang Pianpian stated the plain truth, "As long as you obtain the Foundation Establishment certificate, you only need a college entrance exam score of 600 or above to be admitted into any of the top-ten universities without an interview."

"This means that once you have the Foundation Establishment certificate, you won't need to expose your true strength and purpose for the rest of your high school life. You can just quietly participate in the college entrance exam and get into the Ten Greats without attracting a joint suppression from the rich."

"This way, you can avoid the situation of the rich families of Songyang City ganging up to crush you."

Zhang Pianpian said, "But you must understand, this process will not be simple."

She thought for a moment, then continued, "It is now mid-April, and the next Foundation Establishment certificate exam for the first layer of Kunxu... registration will begin around mid-June, shortly after I leave."

"Then the first round of exams is in August, the second round in early October, and the final round will be held in early January of next year, which will be around the time you are halfway through your second year."

"This means... you will have to complete the exams while still attending school, after I have left."

"During this process, you will also have to face various threats on your own, without my protection."

"Of course, as long as you don't expose the fact that you're taking the exam for the Foundation Establishment certificate, and don't expose your goal of getting into the Ten Greats, you won't face a joint suppression from the great clans of Songyang City."

"But people like Zhou Chechen and Lan Ling will definitely come after you once I'm gone."

Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen both nodded silently at this. But compared to a joint suppression by the great clans, the threat from just Zhou Chechen and Lan Ling was something they believed they could overcome as long as they had each other's support and help.

In contrast, the difficulty of the Foundation Establishment certificate exam itself was perhaps the hardest part of this whole affair.

Zhang Pianpian looked at Zhang Yu and said, "Are you certain now that you want to give up the Prodigy Class and take the much harder exam for the Foundation Establishment certificate?"

Before Zhang Yu could answer, the evil god had already spoken first in his mind, "Tell her yes."

"You can take this Foundation Establishment certificate!"

# Chapter 122: An Evil God’s Secrets

Zhang Yu was slightly taken aback by what the evil god had said in his mind.

This evil god had previously been dead set against him giving up the Prodigy Class to stay in Songyang City, so why the sudden change of heart?

As if sensing his confusion, the evil god continued to speak in his mind, "What Zhang Pianpian said has reminded me of a few things."

"I once heard the evil god king on the third subterranean level say that a struggle had broken out on the upper levels of Kunxu, and it involved the examination for this very Foundation Establishment certificate."

The evil god still remembered its time working on the third subterranean level of Kunxu.

With nothing but a telephone and a phone book, it had become the top salesperson of the month, even duping several university PhDs. Not only did it receive a reward from the evil god king, but it was also invited to the king’s banquet, where it overheard many secrets.

The evil god thought to itself, _Damn it all, what a shame. The very next month, that evil god king swindled me out of my sales skills and my bonus, then turned around and sold those skills to a bunch of dropout university students who had fled to the third level and couldn't find work. He then hired those students and kicked me to the curb, forcing me to find a new job all over again..._

The thought flashed through its mind, and the evil god continued, "I remember hearing the evil god king lament how some Immortal Venerable pushed for a series of reforms to the qualification exam quotas to increase mobility for the lower and middle classes of Kunxu, and that included changes to the Foundation Establishment certificate quotas."

"But they had to consider the disciples and descendants of every immortal, weigh the quotas for the Ten Great Sects, and balance the power of the different factions within the Heavenly Court. The web of interests was so tangled, and I can't even imagine how many struggles unfolded."

"In the end, some immortals went bankrupt from gambling, some died in their immortal abodes from cultivation deviation, and some even fled to the unknown regions more than ten levels deep beneath Kunxu."

"But it was precisely because the struggle was so fierce that the final version of the Foundation Establishment qualification exam is so authoritative; it represents the collective will of the Ten Great Sects and the Heavenly Court formed by their immortals."

"So you don't need to worry about your safety participating in this exam. Just as Zhang Pianpian said, the top powers on the first layer wouldn't dare violate the rules or cheat. The most they can do is suppress information outside the examination grounds and do their best to improve their own students' strength."

Sensing that Zhang Yu was contemplating its words, the evil god quickly added, "And if you can obtain this Foundation Establishment certificate before entering university... the advantages are huge. The exam itself, established by the Heavenly Court, carries immense authority. It practically appoints its passers as among the strongest high school students on the first layer."

"Entering university with this certificate, the treatment you receive, the courses you study, and the resources you get will all be on a completely different level."

"Most importantly, you'll be able to directly enter the university's Foundation Establishment class, study the Foundation Establishment curriculum, and enjoy the support of Foundation Establishment-level resources. This will give you a massive head start in your early university years, a far greater advantage than the Prodigy Class could offer."

Zhang Yu understood what the evil god meant. The difference was even greater than that between a key high school and an ordinary one, right?

"Secondly, neither Bai Zhenzhen nor Zhang Pianpian has any idea just how terrifying your talent has become after my enlightenment."

"From my observations during this period, as you master more and more cultivation techniques, your rate of progress will only accelerate. I firmly believe you will become the strongest high school student on Kunxu's first layer, and winning this Foundation Establishment qualification exam will be as easy as turning over your hand."

"In comparison, with your terrifying aptitude, competing for the certificate against high school students who have been on the Immortal Dao for no more than three years is likely far simpler than vying for it at university against all those cultivators at the peak of Qi Refinement."

The evil god sighed. "If I weren't broke right now, I would definitely go all-in on you."

Of course, there were some things the evil god left unsaid—things related to its own hidden agenda.

Once Zhang Pianpian left, Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen would remain in Songyang City, facing an environment of ever-increasing pressure. Zhang Yu would inevitably be driven to seek greater power, greater talent, and greater potential.

Under such circumstances, the evil god judged that Zhang Yu would eventually follow its guidance and hunt evil gods to enhance his own potential.

Then there was the matter of the True Spiritual Root.

_He's not even willing to betray his closest high school classmate, yet he still wants to climb higher in Kunxu? What a saint. If it weren't for your outrageous potential, I couldn't be bothered with you._

The evil god knew Zhang Yu was unwilling to kill someone to steal their spiritual root. Even if he went to the Prodigy Class alone, he wouldn't have the aid of a True Spiritual Root. In contrast, by staying behind to take the Foundation Establishment exam, he could continue borrowing this True Spiritual Root for his cultivation.

Considering all these factors, the evil god finally agreed that Zhang Yu should stay and take the exam.

And what the evil god said had indeed reminded Zhang Yu of one thing.

"My greatest advantage is my ability to quickly learn various cultivation techniques and raise them to level 10."

"This is an advantage that other high school students, in the short span of three years, would find very difficult to match."

"But once I get to university, those students who have been in Qi Refinement longer than me, who have lingered at the peak of Qi Refinement for ages, will have surely mastered numerous cultivation techniques."

"After all, for university students whose Dao hearts, mana, and physical strength have all reached the upper limits of Qi Refinement, one of the ways to further differentiate their power... should be the number and strength of their cultivation techniques."

"At that point, my advantage over those university students... will no longer be as great as it is now against high school students."

With this thought, Zhang Yu found himself leaning more and more towards staying behind for the Foundation Establishment qualification exam.

Zhang Pianpian, who had been observing him all this time, now remarked with a sigh, "It seems you've made your decision. Are you going to stay here with Bai Zhenzhen?"

After a moment of contemplation, Zhang Yu finally nodded, an unusual emotion rising in his heart.

It felt as if… choosing not to go with Zhang Pianpian, but to stay with Bai Zhenzhen, was somehow letting Zhang Pianpian down.

It was like telling Zhang Pianpian: _Sis, Zhen and I are the closest. If I had to choose one of you to go with, I'd choose Zhen._

And Zhang Pianpian had been looking out for them for over four months...

This strange emotion caused a trace of shame to well up in Zhang Yu's heart under Zhang Pianpian's gaze.

Beside them, Bai Zhenzhen looked at Zhang Yu, her heart gradually stirring as if a warm current was surging through her body.

_Yu-boy is really staying to take the Foundation Establishment exam with me._

At that thought, the earlier feeling of loneliness, the darkness and cold of being deep within a frozen river, seemed to be swept away, replaced by a sense of security.

Along with this feeling of security, along with the stirring in her heart, even the True Spiritual Root in her belly began to tremble slightly.

_What's this stupid spiritual root getting so excited about? Is it that fond of Yu-boy's body? Does it want to get inside that badly?_

But on second thought, Bai Zhenzhen realized that the True Spiritual Root was probably just reflecting her own feelings—a desire to be good to Zhang Yu now that he was staying to take the exam with her.

And the way to be good to Zhang Yu was to stuff the True Spiritual Root into his body; after all, it was the most valuable thing she owned.

This act of lending one's most precious possession to another was rare even among the closest of relatives in Kunxu. It was something usually only done with a signed contract, including but not limited to lending one's brain, heart, or kidneys for a while.

Realizing what she was thinking, Bai Zhenzhen's gaze toward Zhang Yu changed slightly, and she thought to herself, _Yu-boy, from now on, you will always be number one in my friendship rankings. You're my best friend in the whole world, the kind I could call 'daddy' every single day._

Zhang Pianpian looked at the two of them and said calmly, "Since you've decided to stay, then so be it. The path of the Immortal Dao is ultimately one you choose for yourself and walk step by step."

"But since you have decided, you must not have any regrets."

"In the time that follows, you must seize every minute, every second, and every coin for your cultivation."

"The Foundation Establishment qualification exam on Kunxu's first layer is divided into three rounds."

"It's mid-April now. After registration in mid-June, the first round is in August. It tests comprehensive abilities and is the least difficult of the three rounds, but you'll need to be at least at a third-year high school level to have a chance of passing."

"The second round is the specialization exam in October. Students are assessed separately in four categories: Dao heart, mana, athletics, and martial arts. At this stage, you'll need to be at the level of a city-wide third-year competition winner to have a chance of passing."

"The third round is the final selection in early January of next year. The remaining students compete against each other to finally determine the strongest in the four tracks of Dao heart, mana, athletics, and martial arts, who will then be awarded the Foundation Establishment certificates..."

As Zhang Yu listened to the description of the three rounds, an outline of the exam began to form in his mind. "This competition doesn't ultimately test a student's overall quality. The key selection criterion is specialization in one of four areas: Dao heart, mana, athletics, and martial arts."

"It makes sense. They're just high school students, after all. They can't be expected to be as well-rounded as university students who have honed their skills in the Qi Refinement stage for a long time. So the students this exam aims to select... are four geniuses with extremely high specialization in four different areas."

"To pass, the key is how long your longest plank is."

Zhang Yu then asked curiously, "Where is the exam held?"

Zhang Pianpian replied, "Both the registration and the exam are held in the Immortal Capital."

The Immortal Capital was the most prosperous and massive super-metropolis on Kunxu's first layer, far surpassing Songyang City in scale.

Zhang Yu recalled that the Immortal Capital was about fifteen hundred kilometers away from Songyang.

Thinking about how this entire exam was not only divided into three rounds spanning half a year, but was also held in the Immortal Capital a thousand miles away, Bai Zhenzhen couldn't help but sigh.

"This exam really is time-consuming. We'll probably have to take a lot of leave. And travel, accommodation, and food will cost a lot, won't they? I read online that prices in the Immortal Capital are very high."

Zhang Pianpian nodded. "The location and timing of the exam are, in themselves, a form of screening."

"For instance, you two haven't obtained your intercity travel permits yet, have you? To leave the city, especially to go to the Immortal Capital, you must apply for an intercity travel permit. You have to provide proof of education, income, and either a rental lease or home ownership..."

Zhang Yu nodded slightly. Hearing the arrangements for the exam and the requirements for the intercity travel permit, he felt like he was hearing an unstated message:

If you don't have a bit of spare cash and free time, or if you're a pauper who can't even afford to rent a place, don't even think about taking this exam. Just stay in your hometown and work.

# Chapter 123: Great Sun Sea of Qi

Zhang Pianpian continued, "Hearing this, you should understand that your time is very tight."

"Of course, even if you fail this time, you can try again next year."

According to Zhang Pianpian, the high school Foundation Establishment qualification exam started in mid-June each year, with the results announced in early January of the following year.

This meant that for every cohort of high school students, they had a total of two chances in their three years.

The first chance was to register at the end of their first year and obtain the Foundation Establishment certificate in their second year.

The second chance was to register at the end of their second year and obtain the certificate in their third year.

In Zhang Yu's mind, the evil god's voice rang out, "Although it's the same certificate, there's a clear difference in prestige between getting it in your second year versus your third. When you write that on your resume, you'll definitely receive different treatment at university..."

Even without the evil god saying it, Zhang Yu could naturally guess as much.

"With Kunxu's twisted logic, the difference between getting the certificate in your third year versus your second year, once you get to university... is probably the difference between being a person from White Dragon and a person from Songyang."

White Dragon or Songyang?

If he had a choice, even the Son of the School Director, He Dayou, would probably have fled to White Dragon.

Faced with an opportunity to change his life on the second layer by putting in some hard work, how could Zhang Yu let it pass?

He nodded at Zhang Pianpian. "Two chances. We'll definitely try for both. For something like the Foundation Establishment certificate, the sooner you get it, the better."

Zhang Pianpian continued, "It's good that you understand. Beyond that, there's the choice of exam specialization, and some arrangements I'll make for you before I leave..."

Because the exam only had four spots in total—one each for Dao heart, mana, athletics, and martial arts—Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen naturally had to choose different paths.

With the help of her spiritual root, Bai Zhenzhen's progress in mana, athletics, and martial arts was not slow.

But considering that her aptitude for martial arts had always been the strongest under the enhancement of the True Spiritual Root, she ultimately chose the martial arts track.

As for Zhang Yu, with the aid of the Feathered Tome and the True Spiritual Root, he was also very confident in mana, athletics, and martial arts. However, since Bai Zhenzhen had already chosen martial arts, his remaining choices were mana and athletics.

"Then it's athletics, of course. After all, my recent preparations for the athletics meet have pushed my physical strength far beyond my mana. If I continue to push forward relentlessly in physical strength, becoming the strongest in athletics among all high school students on Kunxu's first layer... is not impossible."

After Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen had selected their respective exam tracks, Zhang Pianpian added, "Your time is short, your task is heavy, and your funds are limited. So, when the prize money and endorsement fees come in, remember not to spend it recklessly."

"For example, don't even think about paying off your loan in one go. Not only should you not pay it off, but if possible, you should even consider borrowing more."

"For the next eight months, spend every last coin on improving your own strength."

"Before I leave, I will also find a way to provide some cover for you, to buy you a little more time to get stronger."

"I will be waiting for you at Myriad Laws University."

...

Early morning.

Songyang High School.

Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen dragged their weary bodies toward the campus gate.

The athletics meet last night had already exhausted them physically. After the competition, they discussed the Foundation Establishment certificate with Zhang Pianpian, and after she left, they didn't rest either, instead starting to map out their cultivation plan for the coming months.

After all, to successfully pass the Foundation Establishment exam and defeat the other competitors, relying on the first-year curriculum at Songyang High School was definitely not enough.

They needed a more suitable, more aggressive, and more effective training plan.

They meticulously calculated and planned everything, from how to spend their money, which cultivation techniques to practice, and what alchemical enhancers to use, to various exam-related expenses.

Just then, Bai Zhenzhen's eyes widened as she stared at the large screen at the school entrance.

"Congratulations to student Zhang Yu for winning first prize in the Songyang City athletics competition! With his outstanding talent and exceptional aptitude, student Zhang Yu overcame material hardships. With such world-class talent, he is sure to achieve even greater success in the future..."

Bai Zhenzhen read the short essay scrolling across the screen; almost the entire text was lavishing praise on Zhang Yu's peerless genius.

After reading it, she was stunned. "What about me? Why am I not mentioned?"

She had placed fifth in the athletics meet, for crying out loud. Didn't she even deserve a mention?

But Zhang Yu, standing beside her, looked at the essay on the screen and only felt a cold shiver of anger. He wasn't happy at all.

If he were a few months younger, he would have loved this kind of fawning article.

But now, seeing the screen filled with words like "talent" and "aptitude"... he only felt that his commercial value was being suppressed again.

_Does anyone get it? I win first place and they say it's all because of talent. How much more malice can this world have for geniuses?_

"Who the hell wrote this article? Can someone get it taken down?"

Later, Zhang Yu learned that it was an article arranged by the Student Council.

He immediately understood. "That guy, Zhou Chechen, he wants to sabotage my commercial value too?"

"Could he be in cahoots with that Le Jingchen from Purple Cloud?"

Recalling how Zhou Chechen and Lan Ling had specifically come to warn him during the competition, Zhang Yu grew even more suspicious that the two of them were working with Purple Cloud High School or Purple Cloud Supplements.

Just then, Zhao Tianxing, who was on the road, saw Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen, and his eyes lit up as he approached them.

Seeing the pensive Zhang Yu, Zhao Tianxing asked curiously, "A'Yu, what are you thinking about?"

Zhang Yu sighed. "I'm thinking about how to prove I'm not a genius, just an ordinary person who relies on money to improve my grades."

Zhao Tianxing was taken aback for a moment. _Is Yu-boy taking a jab at me?_

Zhang Yu continued, "And then I realized that for me, proving I'm an ordinary person is far, far more difficult than proving I'm a genius."

"My talent is like the sun; I can't hide it even if I want to... It's hard, truly so hard."

Zhao Tianxing couldn't help but recall the Zhang Yu from six months ago and thought to himself, _A'Yu, I still prefer the way you were six months ago._

_You weren't like this back then. Back then, you were just like me. Standing in front of Zhen, Qian Shen, and He Dayou, we all looked like clowns._

Looking at the new face Zhang Yu was now wearing, Zhao Tianxing had to admit that achievement corrupts students. Then, suddenly, he gained a deeper understanding of his own theory of the poor, weak clown.

"Clowns can also be interchangeable. Six months ago, Zhang Yu was a clown in front of He Dayou. Now, He Dayou is the clown in front of Zhang Yu."

"This is... the theory of clown relativity."

"In the end, it all comes down to power, like scores and wealth."

Zhao Tianxing thought that if, at the moment Zhang Yu finished his speech, he were to grab Zhang Yu by the neck, pin him to the ground, and say coolly, "Oh? Is it really that hard to prove?"

Zhao Tianxing thought to himself, _If that happened, the roles of the clown would be reversed again._

"Sigh, if you want to stand tall in school and have your voice heard, you really do need strength."

With this thought, Zhao Tianxing became even more determined to purchase the demonic muscle modification.

And throughout Songyang High School, there were many students who thought like Zhao Tianxing. It was just that some favored the demonic muscle, some wanted super metabolism, and a small minority decided to purchase Red Pagoda's True Dragon Bloodline...

The three of them walked into the classroom, and as soon as Zhang Yu sat down, he continued to browse information on various cultivation techniques on his phone.

He thought to himself, "Although I plan to take the athletics track and continue to improve my physical strength, I must ensure that my Dao heart and mana don't fall behind."

"Especially my Dao heart and mana. I need to find replacements for the Martial Ascension Heart-Tempering Art and the Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method to ensure that while I temper my body every day, my Dao heart and mana can also grow steadily."

But on the cultivation technique website, the sheer number of techniques was as vast as a sea. Even looking through the top-ranked ones left Zhang Yu dazzled and unsure of what to choose.

Just then, the evil god, which had been disguised as a prayer bead, suddenly spoke, "Try searching for Great Sun Sea of Qi."

Zhang Yu was slightly surprised, but he searched for the breathing exercise 'Great Sun Sea of Qi' anyway. He found that it was an expert-level technique with extremely low sales, suitable for the mid-stage of Qi Refinement.

The first reason for its low sales was its hefty price tag: the usage rights alone cost a full 120,000.

And the second reason for its low sales was that the technique was too difficult to practice.

Notably, the difficulty of the Great Sun Sea of Qi wasn't in its comprehension, practice, or high requirements.

The difficulty of the Great Sun Sea of Qi lay in time.

It was a cultivation technique that allowed one to condense the essence of the sun and moon and gather the spiritual energy from the radiance of heaven and earth simply by being exposed to light, using it to refine mana.

Zhang Yu read the description and thought to himself, "Just like the Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method, it allows for passive breathing. As long as there is light, the Great Sun Sea of Qi can perform continuous passive breathing, and the stronger the light, the stronger the effect."

"However, this technique emphasizes gradual progress. If the first level takes a month of light exposure to master, then the second level will take two months to break through. The third level doubles again, requiring four months of light to achieve a breakthrough. It increases exponentially like this, with each subsequent level taking longer and longer."

"By the time you reach the eighth level, breaking through to the next one would require ten years of effort."

"And breaking through from the ninth to the tenth level would take more than twenty years."

Reading this, Zhang Yu sighed. Even if someone bought this technique, they would probably just use it as a transitional breathing exercise, relying on the light-based breathing to gain a little extra mana.

"No wonder so few people buy it."

"But for me, it's just perfect."

Zhang Yu began to wonder what effect this technique, which took decades to master, would have once he pushed it to level 10.

Suddenly, Zhang Yu remembered the evil god who had told him to search for the Great Sun Sea of Qi. He thought to himself that this thing had been sticking to him 24/7 lately and seemed to know which cultivation techniques suited him best.

At this thought, Zhang Yu asked softly, "After all this time, I still don't know what to call you."

The evil god chuckled, a clear, feminine voice echoing in Zhang Yu's mind, "You can just call me Fu Ji."

"Zhang Yu, I've said it before. With my help, your climb up the ladder of Kunxu will be much smoother."

# Chapter 124: Cultivation Technique, Renting, and Le Mulan

Compared to the initial hostility with the evil god, Zhang Yu's current relationship with Fu Ji had become much calmer. One could even say he was gradually getting used to having this thing attached to him.

Of course, this was largely due to Fu Ji's repeated displays of weakness and her desire to invest in Zhang Yu by constantly showcasing her own value.

For now, Zhang Yu bookmarked the Great Sun Sea of Qi and then asked Fu Ji, "What about heart arts? Do you have any recommendations?"

Fu Ji was prepared for this.

After all, having observed Zhang Yu up close for so long, she had already given much thought to his strengths and suitable future development paths.

Fu Ji said, "You've practiced the Desolate Ox Soul-Suppressing Mantra before, right?"

"That heart art has an upgraded version, an expert-level technique suitable for the mid-stage of Qi Refinement. It's called the Crippled Ox Body-Sacrifice Heart Art."

Although the Desolate Ox Soul-Suppressing Mantra had a poor reputation and a rating of 1.2, Zhang Yu had always found it quite effective.

Now, hearing that there was an upgraded version, he immediately searched for it.

Zhang Yu read the technique's description in detail.

Still worried about your employees' irregular diets? Unhealthy schedules? The harm of sitting too long? The harm of standing too long?

Worried about toxic work environments? Worried that years of handling alchemical enhancers have damaged your employees' brains? Worried about severe wear and tear on your employees' organs?

Just have your employees cultivate the Crippled Ox Body-Sacrifice Heart Art, and you'll never have to worry about such work-related injury claims again!

No matter how much their bodies are damaged for the sake of work, your employees will face it with optimism and positivity, freeing bosses from any concern over their employees' health!

Even with Zhang Yu's current experience in Kunxu, he couldn't help but marvel at the sheer level of devil incarnate in this technique.

Scrolling down, he saw the technique's 1.1 rating and lamented that the platform didn't allow for 0-star ratings; otherwise, the Crippled Ox Body-Sacrifice Heart Art would probably be infinitely close to zero.

Even though Zhang Yu had practiced the Desolate Ox Soul-Suppressing Mantra, he couldn't help but ask, "Is this Crippled Ox Body-Sacrifice Heart Art really reliable?"

Fu Ji's clear voice once again entered Zhang Yu's mind.

"The Crippled Ox Body-Sacrifice Heart Art, the philosophy contained within this heart art is that the more one suffers, the happier one becomes, using mental pleasure to resist physical pain."

"The original intent of this heart art was likely to encourage the crippled to remain strong-willed. It was a technique meant to inspire hope in the most downtrodden, to give hope to disabled cultivators who had none."

Zhang Yu was slightly taken aback and sighed, "This was created for disabled people who couldn't afford treatment?"

Fu Ji spoke eloquently, "Although this heart art's original purpose was for disabled cultivators, it is just as useful for able-bodied ones."

"After all, it's perfectly normal for cultivators to encounter physical pain, and this heart art can help you resist it."

"And if you cultivate this heart art to level 10, you can even accelerate injury recovery and physical strengthening by reducing mental energy consumption and boosting your metabolism."

"It can be considered one of the few heart arts at the Qi Refinement stage that can affect the physical body."

"Most importantly, this heart art can improve your Dao heart through mere mental visualization, making it perfect for your continuous 24-hour cultivation."

A thought stirred in Zhang Yu's mind. "It's that amazing?"

Fu Ji, like a child showing off a toy, said smugly, "But of course! This one has roamed Kunxu for so many years. Could a heart art I recommend be wrong?"

Zhang Yu thought for a moment and added the Crippled Ox Body-Sacrifice Heart Art to his bookmarks.

Speaking of which, although this expert-level heart art had an extremely low rating, its sales were not low, and its price was as high as 30,000.

Zhang Yu glanced at the user reviews and found that the technique was a prerequisite for many hazardous jobs in factories, construction sites, laboratories, and other places, forcing many job seekers to learn it.

Seeing this, Zhang Yu couldn't help but sigh softly.

A cultivation technique meant to bring hope to disabled cultivators was ultimately used to compel healthy cultivators to work in dangerous environments, turning them into disabled individuals step by step.

"Sigh, this is Kunxu."

...

The cafeteria.

After temporarily deciding on the next two cultivation techniques to practice, Zhang Yu began to prepare his application for the intercity travel permit.

At this moment, he was scooping the mush in his bowl while looking at the application requirements.

Whether it was education, savings, or bank statements... he believed that with his current status, he could meet all of them with a bit of time and preparation.

There was only one thing that would require some effort, and that was housing.

"Without my own home, I'll need a rental."

"I never thought that after all this, I'd still have to find a place to rent."

Just then, Bai Zhenzhen sat down with her tray, a look of annoyance on her face.

"They've cut the number of windows for pre-made food by half again."

Bai Zhenzhen had planned to eat a bit more pre-made food today to celebrate her placement in the competition.

But when she went to look, she found that half the windows were gone, and the variety of dishes offered was less than a third of what it used to be.

She looked around and only then realized that, without her noticing, most of the students in the school were now eating synthetic food, and the sales of pre-made meals were getting worse and worse.

Bai Zhenzhen sighed inwardly, "Sigh, it seems it's going to be harder and harder to get a decent pre-made meal in the future. Maybe I should just get the taste-removal surgery."

Beside her, Zhao Tianxing heard Bai Zhenzhen's sigh and lamented as well, "Ever since Oasis Group entered the Songyang City market, more and more shops selling pre-made food have been crushed. After all, synthetic food is just so cheap."

"What about Red Pagoda Husbandry?" Zhang Yu asked. "They should be a major producer of pre-made food, right? Have they been affected?"

Zhao Tianxing said, "I heard that after incorporating Oasis Group's technology, Red Pagoda Husbandry has started to move into the high-end market. They've even launched something called dragon meat..."

Zhang Yu thought of the True Dragon Bloodline of those top students from Red Pagoda High School at the competition field, and wondered if Red Pagoda had started injecting dragon blood into their cattle and sheep.

But wasn't the dragon blood from one of Red Pagoda's directors?

This felt... as if the upper management of Red Pagoda was constantly selling their own vital energy, bloodline, and descendants just to make money.

"All I can say is... this is Kunxu, after all," Zhang Yu thought to himself. "Bosses will sell anything to make a profit."

Just then, Qian Shen, who was beside them, asked Zhang Yu curiously, "Zhang Yu, are you guys looking to rent a place?"

Zhang Yu nodded. "I need to leave Songyang City for something, so I have to apply for an intercity travel permit. The application requires a rental contract."

"Sigh, it's such a hassle. There are even requirements for the rental; it can't be in the sewers or a construction site shack."

"I think my dad has a few apartments for rent. I can ask him for you later. Actually, you know so many people now, you could post on your social feed and ask. Maybe someone happens to have a vacant place to rent? With your good grades, they might rent it to you for cheap."

Zhang Yu's eyes lit up; he felt that Qian Shen had a point.

"I have quite a few wealthy people on my friends list now. They should have plenty of properties to rent out, right?"

Zhang Yu immediately used his phone to post on his feed about looking for a place.

A moment later, his phone vibrated. He looked, but it wasn't someone offering to rent him a house. It was a message from Mo Tianyi.

Mo Tianyi: Congratulations on defeating Yu Xinghan and taking first place in the athletics meet.

Zhang Yu was slightly surprised to see the message from this soul cultivator of the Alliance of the Rich-Haters.

"They stopped contacting us a long time ago, after they found out we signed with Zhang Pianpian. Why are they suddenly reaching out now?"

Just then, Mo Tianyi sent another message: The boss wants to see you. Do you have time?

Zhang Yu was somewhat surprised to hear this. He hadn't expected that the leader of the poor, whom he and Bai Zhenzhen had tried so hard but failed to find before, would now request a meeting.

At that moment, Fu Ji spoke, "Don't meet this person."

She explained, "I heard you and Bai Zhenzhen talk about this person before. It's suspected that all of his students signed contracts with the school. But it's impossible for an ordinary person, under the witness of the Eight Ministries of Righteous Gods, to both promise the poor to get into one of the Ten Greats and take them to the second layer, and also promise the rich to sign a contract that restricts their university and major."

"This leader of the poor is very likely the evil god hiding in White Dragon High School."

"Since you don't want to get involved with that evil god too early, you should avoid getting close to this leader of the poor."

Zhang Yu was a little surprised. _Is this Fu Ji getting more and more sensible? She's not tempting me to hunt evil gods anymore. Or has her perspective just become more long-term?_

Speaking of White Dragon High School, Zhang Yu thought of his sister, the strongest high school student in Songyang. On their way out of the cafeteria, he lowered his voice and asked, "What about my sister? Do you think she's connected?"

Regarding his sister's formidable strength, Zhang Yu had once wondered if she, like him, had her potential unlocked by an evil god.

"Your sister?" Fu Ji sighed. "She's likely walking the Divine Dao. Even I would only dare to speak softly in her presence. The evil god from White Dragon High School wouldn't dare to show its face in front of her and reveal its tracks unless absolutely necessary."

"The Divine Dao?" Zhang Yu asked curiously. "What kind of path is that?"

Fu Ji said casually, "The path to godhood. If she graduates from university smoothly, she'll probably join the Eight Ministries of Righteous Gods."

Although her tone was casual, Fu Ji was not telling the whole truth.

_A good person like Zhang Yu is better off not knowing about the Divine Dao, lest he gets worried about this Zhang Pianpian and can't focus on staying here for the Foundation Establishment exam._

_After all, the Divine Dao..._

In Fu Ji's view, if... for the vast majority of high school students, excluding monsters like Zhang Yu... the college entrance exam was a matter of nine deaths and one life, and the Foundation Establishment exam was ten deaths and no life, then the Divine Dao...

"The moment you set foot on that path, you're already a dead person."

...

Before school ended that day, the 300,000 prize money from the athletics meet, after taxes, finally arrived.

With a wave of his hand, Zhang Yu sent Bai Zhenzhen to the hospital to have her scars removed, with all expenses covered by him as a thank you for borrowing her spiritual root all this time.

He had originally wanted to personally take Bai Zhenzhen to the hospital and treat her, but he had work after school today.

Arriving at the gate of Purple Cloud High School, Zhang Yu once again passed through the disinfection channel and, in a training room, met this session's client—Le Mulan.

# Chapter 125: Pants All Torn

Gazing at Le Mulan inside the training room, Zhang Yu was at a loss for words.

"How are you going to fight dressed like that?"

At this moment, Le Mulan was swaddled in several layers of clothing, with thick gloves on her hands and a mask on her face, giving her a bulky appearance.

_She's sick,_ Zhang Yu cursed inwardly. _This mysophobia is way too severe._

And so, Zhang Yu said, "I disinfected when I entered the school. You don't have to be so dramatic, do you?"

Le Mulan waved her hand and said, "It won't affect anything. Let's begin."

After two months of training, Le Mulan believed her tolerance for Zhang Yu had improved by leaps and bounds.

But with two months having passed since their last sparring session, she still decided it was best to ease back into it—for instance, by starting with a few extra layers of clothes.

Zhang Yu shook his head helplessly, but she was, after all, a client paying twelve thousand an hour. He naturally had to agree to any strange requests she had.

_Ah, being rich is the best,_ Zhang Yu thought. _Hiring a genius high school boy like me as a sparring partner._

Le Mulan said, "Let's start with a normal fight. Try your best to drag me into a ground fight."

A few moments later, the two stood facing each other. As Le Mulan took a deep breath and beckoned to him, Zhang Yu charged forward ferociously.

With a series of explosive bangs, Le Mulan's sword qi and Zhang Yu's astral qi violently collided.

Le Mulan felt a terrifyingly immense force, suffused with vast mana, slam into her.

She was already weaker than Zhang Yu in terms of raw strength, and her body, bundled in multiple layers of clothing, was a beat slower. Zhang Yu's assault forced her into a steady retreat, and in an instant, he was within a meter of her.

The world spun around her, and with a loud thud, Le Mulan found herself thrown to the ground.

Then, she saw a pair of large hands reaching for her.

Watching Zhang Yu's large hands extend toward her, an instinctive look of disgust flashed across Le Mulan's face, and a silent 'Ugh~' seemed to echo in her mind.

She hurriedly raised her own hands to resist.

Although Le Mulan had learned many close-combat, grappling, and wrestling techniques over the past two months, she was still utterly powerless against Zhang Yu.

Seeing him lock her hands and his legs about to entangle her own, Le Mulan frowned and said, "Stop! Stop! Stop it!"

Zhang Yu stopped with a helpless look on his face and asked, "What is it now?"

Le Mulan quickly stood up, thinking to herself, _Just as I thought… I can tolerate it for a bit, but it's still so disgusting… a pauper's body._

But Le Mulan knew she had sought out Zhang Yu precisely to overcome this mental weakness and to be able to switch between her heart arts more freely.

Yet the thought of his pauper hands touching her all over during a fight filled her with an unbearable sense of nausea.

Especially after seeing Zhang Yu’s daily social media posts, she vividly remembered those hands touching all sorts of grimy bottles and jars, touching river water, touching food from roadside stalls, and touching Bai Zhenzhen…

_A pauper’s hands reaching out to touch me everywhere… This is so much more unbearable than the simple hand-to-hand contact last time._

_Indeed… I have to take this one step at a time._

So, after some thought, she said, "Next, you will defend with all your strength. I will try to control you in a ground fight, and you are not allowed to proactively attack me with your hands."
