Zhang Yu nodded casually, thinking that the pay was the same no matter how they trained.

The next moment, the two were on the ground again, but this time it was Le Mulan on the offensive.

She reached out, wrapping her arms around Zhang Yu from behind and locking her hands toward his neck.

Her legs continuously tried to scissor around his thighs and abdomen.

But in the face of his strength, she felt as if she were trying to restrain a great dragon; a terrifying power coiled and surged between them, constantly resisting her control.

Compared to two months ago, the strength of both had grown to a point where they were in different leagues entirely.

Under the transmission of their combined force, even the high-quality fabric of Le Mulan’s clothes let out a ripping sound.

The several layers of pants she wore shredded one by one in their struggle, revealing a pair of long, fair, and powerful legs.

Zhang Yu's pants fared no better, and were similarly torn to pieces.

As they grappled, Zhang Yu could feel Le Mulan's thigh pressing and rubbing against his own. The cold, subtle sensation of their skin touching was a momentary distraction.

After all, this was completely different from his previous close encounters with a client (Song Hailong).

Le Mulan, also feeling the flesh of her thigh against Zhang Yu’s, had an expression of disgust so palpable it was almost a physical entity, and her legs subconsciously tried to shift away.

But this movement immediately created an opening for Zhang Yu to break free. Le Mulan hastily reminded herself, _Endure! You must endure! You must overcome this psychological weakness!_

Fortunately, Zhang Yu was also distracted. Not only did he fail to break free, but Le Mulan found an opportunity.

At this moment, Le Mulan's hands were hooked around Zhang Yu's neck while her legs were coiled around his waist. With a surge of power from her long, strong thigh muscles, she was like a great python, tearing a large chunk of Zhang Yu’s shirt to shreds with a rip.

Feeling the flesh of her thighs pressed tightly against Zhang Yu's waist and abdomen, Le Mulan felt as if she were clamping her legs around a bag of garbage.

However, despite the revulsion in her eyes, she ultimately persevered and endured it.

Yet in the next moment, as Zhang Yu blocked her chokehold with one hand, his other hand reached for her thigh, intending to break her leg-lock.

With a slap, his hand landed on the flesh of her thigh.

Le Mulan's physical body was incredibly strong; when she exerted her power, her skin and flesh were definitely harder than ordinary bricks and stones.

But at this moment, under the immense power of Zhang Yu's hand, Le Mulan's thigh suddenly felt fleshy, sinking in slightly with his squeeze.

It was this very squeeze that caused Le Mulan's body to tense up abruptly, as if it were about to go completely rigid.

_His hand…_

In that instant, a series of images flashed through Le Mulan's mind like a revolving lantern, all scenes she had seen on his social media feed.

This was the hand that had touched public buses, ridden the subway, grabbed synthetic food, used the bathrooms at Songyang High School, a hand brimming with a pauper’s genes, a hand that had touched that other pauper, Bai Zhenzhen, countless times…

And now, it was squeezing her thigh?

The nightmare from the arena two months ago seemed to surge through Le Mulan's mind once more, clashing violently with the heart art in her thoughts.

Le Mulan bit her lip hard, feeling the spot on her thigh ache more and more from the pressure, fighting to keep the tears from falling.

As for Zhang Yu… while he was defending against Le Mulan’s assault, he noticed the fragrance in the air growing stronger and stronger.

_What’s that smell?_

It wasn't until Le Mulan locked him in another chokehold and his face became slick with a layer of sweat from her arm that he understood.

_What the hell! Is Le Mulan’s sweat… fragrant?_

_No… something's not right. This sweat seems to be…_

As their struggle intensified, Zhang Yu's body temperature rose rapidly, making Le Mulan feel as if she were grappling with a red-hot poker; her legs, chest, and abdomen grew hotter and hotter.

And although Le Mulan's body remained cool to the touch, Zhang Yu could feel a constant secretion of sweat from her hands, wetting his entire face.

_This isn't sweat at all. It reeks of medicine… This has to be Purple Cloud Supplements!_

_Is it because of that super-metabolism surgery? Does it excrete the medicinal residue from her body as sweat?_

Inhaling the medicinal scent emanating from her body, Zhang Yu felt the qi and blood in his own body surge ever more violently, and his neural responses began to grow excited.

_This is bad. Who knows what kind of potent drugs this medicine pot of a girl has in her system? I can't let it affect me…_

Zhang Yu knew that if a master from the drug-using faction were here, they might even lick it to taste the ingredients.

As a proponent of natural body tempering, Zhang Yu would never consume drugs recklessly. He quickly clamped his mouth shut and held his breath, trying his best to avoid being affected by the sweat on Le Mulan's body.

As the sweat covered Le Mulan's entire body, particularly her thighs, it gradually took on a greasy feeling, making Zhang Yu's hand feel slippery…

The next moment, having finally gained complete control of Zhang Yu, Le Mulan felt a surge of joy. _I've finally locked him down!_

However, the instant after her success, she released him like a bolt of lightning and, with a whoosh, rolled back more than ten meters away.

Zhang Yu lay on the ground, his face flushed red. On the floor was a large, vaguely human-shaped puddle of sweat, still emitting wisps of steam.

Le Mulan asked, "Why couldn't you exert any strength at the end? You weren't holding back, were you?"

Zhang Yu shot her an irritated glance and said, "You sweat way too much. Your legs and hands were so slippery and greasy, and that smell was everywhere. I had to hold my breath the whole time."

As he spoke, Zhang Yu's gaze swept over Le Mulan. He saw that although her top was somewhat damaged, it was mostly fine, still covering the majority of her body.

In contrast, the pants on her long, straight legs had been almost completely shredded in the fight, and a large, dark handprint was visible on her right thigh.

Seeing the handprint, Zhang Yu asked, a little embarrassed, "Is your leg okay?"

Le Mulan was still pondering what Zhang Yu had just said. Hearing his question, she glanced at the bruise on her leg and said nonchalantly, "It's just a minor injury. My body has its own healing agents; it will recover in a little while."

"What you just said, why did you have to hold your breath?" Le Mulan asked, puzzled. "The super-metabolism surgery gives me an exceptionally strong ability to absorb and break down supplements."

"And I use only the highest-grade elixirs daily. After I absorb them, the liquid excreted from my skin… is residue to me, but for ordinary students, it perfectly meets normal drinking standards, non-toxic and with no side effects."

"You could even drink it directly, so there's no need to hold your breath."

"However…" Le Mulan said with a frown, "you are not to touch me with your tongue."

Zhang Yu raged internally. _You have got to be kidding me… I’m a practitioner of natural body tempering! Who gives a damn about your medicinal residue!_

# Chapter 126: Yu-boy, You Smell So Good

Two hours later, Le Mulan left the training room limping, her legs and hands covered in bruises, yet a flicker of excitement crossed her face.

"My adaptability is very fast. At this rate, it won't be long before I can completely overcome my psychological aversion to the poor."

"This way, my performance won't be affected even when I switch heart arts in the future..."

Meanwhile, inside the training room, Zhang Yu lay on the floor, panting heavily, looking as if he had just been pulled from the water.

His entire body and the floor around him were saturated with a medicinal fragrance.

"That woman… just how many alchemical enhancers does she take every day? Does she eat them for every meal?"

But after a short rest, Zhang Yu felt invigorated and full of energy.

Despite having fought fiercely with Le Mulan for two hours, he now felt that not only had his stamina not been depleted, but his energy was also incredibly abundant, and even the circulation of mana within his body seemed much more vigorous.

_Is this the effect of Le Mulan's medicinal residue?_

Zhang Yu could swear to the heavens that during the entire grueling fight with Le Mulan, he had absolutely not opened his mouth to lick up a single drop of the potion.

_Forget licking, I was holding my breath half the time. How could I still be affected by it?_

After all, the original Zhang Yu's internal organs had been damaged by drugs, so the current Zhang Yu was always very careful with dosages, never using them recklessly unless absolutely necessary.

This was to avoid the side effects from damaging his body.

Feeling his current state, Zhang Yu thought to himself, _Could it work through skin contact too?_

_And why does it feel so much more effective than the potions I normally use?_

_It doesn't seem to have that straining feeling on my body either…_

Just as Zhang Yu was slowly walking out of the training room, Fu Ji suddenly spoke up. "Leaving already?"

Zhang Yu paused. "Is there a problem?"

Fu Ji said, "Aren't you going to collect the potion?"

Zhang Yu asked, "What potion?"

Fu Ji replied, "Isn't it all over the floor?"

Zhang Yu glanced at the puddle on the floor, which was still steaming, and his face darkened. "Who would want to collect that!"

Fu Ji said, "Just as she said, that Le Mulan really does use the highest-grade stuff. For a rich person like her, even her sweat is more valuable than the enhancers you people use."

"Although it's now mixed with a lot of your sweat, lowering the purity quite a bit."

"But if you sold it as a supplement, you could probably make a few thousand..."

Zhang Yu turned and walked away. "Who knows what ingredients are in her enhancers, what effects they have, or what side effects they might cause. Besides, I don't have a license to sell them. What if I get caught?"

Fu Ji thought to herself what a pity it was, suppressing the suggestion that even if he didn't sell it, he could take it home for himself and Bai Zhenzhen to drink.

_This Zhang Yu’s pauper pride is still too strong,_ Fu Ji mused. _He's already at the bottom of the ladder. To save money, to make money, what's there to be shy about? Using every single resource to climb higher is the proper way to survive in Kunxu._

Zhang Yu looked at his shredded pants, thinking it wouldn't be right to walk all the way back like this.

After a moment's thought, he sent a message to Le Mulan: "You broke my pants."

A transfer of 200 arrived.

200 transfer received.

Zhang Yu replied, "I meant, could you send a pair of pants over."

About ten minutes later, Lian Tianji appeared before Zhang Yu, holding a pair of pants.

Lian Tianji asked with curiosity, "Were you having a sparring session with the hallowed number one?"

Zhang Yu nodded. "Yeah… my pants got ruined by accident."

With that, he took the pants from Lian Tianji and thanked him.

Looking at Zhang Yu's tattered clothes, Lian Tianji could almost imagine the intensity of the battle.

_Sigh, I wish I could have a sparring session with the hallowed number one too, instead of just delivering pants after the fight is over,_ he thought to himself.

_Unfortunately, I'm not strong enough. The closest I ever get to her is when I'm being her stool._

Lian Tianji watched Zhang Yu's retreating figure, thinking, _Only by becoming an academic prodigy like Zhang Yu can one engage in close combat with the hallowed number one, can one stand close to her, instead of having to be on all fours to approach the hallowed number one…_

On the other side, as Zhang Yu walked out of the training room, he sensed the condition of his body and thought, _Is the medicinal effect still working? I'll observe for another day._

_If there are no side effects, maybe it's because the quality of the enhancers Le Mulan uses is exceptionally good, so the side effects are minimal?_

_Or is it because my body is getting stronger, my internal organs are gradually strengthening, and I've purged the toxins accumulated in the past…_

_Or perhaps it's a combination of both?_

After some consideration, Zhang Yu decided to continue sparring with Le Mulan.

After all, at 12,000 an hour, two hours meant 24,000. For a job that paid 24,000 per session, he could tolerate being forced to take some drugs, as long as the consequences weren't severe.

Upon returning to the bridge underpass, he found that Bai Zhenzhen hadn't returned from the hospital yet. Zhang Yu thought for a moment and decided to buy and start cultivating a new technique.

After all, the 300,000 prize money had already been deposited, and Zhang Yu had been itching to spend it. He immediately spent 120,000 to purchase the usage rights for the Great Sun Sea of Qi.

With this transaction, and adding in the sparring fee from Le Mulan today, Zhang Yu's savings were now just over 210,000.

After scanning the contents of the electronic manual, Zhang Yu concluded that, as its description promised, the Great Sun Sea of Qi was not a particularly difficult technique.

"The key to this technique lies in the accumulation of practice. In that case…"

Feathered Tome: Zhang Yu! Show me your limits!

With the Feathered Tome's mastery activated, Zhang Yu began cultivating the Great Sun Sea of Qi.

Although it was an expert-level, mid-stage Qi Refinement technique, Zhang Yu's current stats were not low—in fact, they were higher than many second-year students at Songyang High School, perfectly meeting the requirements for practicing the Great Sun Sea of Qi.

He halted the flow of the Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method, which had previously circulated as ceaselessly as a mighty river.

The mana circuit that had coursed through his entire body was interrupted, and all his mana was recalled to his dantian.

Then, a stream of mana rose from his dantian and was gradually condensed by Zhang Yu into Great Sun Mana, which shone with a fine golden light.

This stream of Great Sun Mana then began to travel through the meridians in his body, starting to construct a new mana circuit.

Condensing Great Sun Mana and constructing the mana circuit simultaneously.

Yet Zhang Yu felt no difficulty at all; with the level of mana control he had gained from mastering numerous level-10 techniques, practicing the Great Sun Sea of Qi was a piece of cake.

What surprised him even more… was that under the stimulation of the lingering medicinal power, his mana circulated a third faster than usual.

And as his cultivation continued, Zhang Yu felt his mind become exceptionally sharp… it seemed he could even save on the neural filler that eliminated the need for sleep.

_Is this the effect of Le Mulan's potion?_

_Not only does it replenish stamina and stimulate mana, but it can also enhance mental acuity and eliminate sleep?_

Zhang Yu recalled what Fu Ji had said earlier.

_That Le Mulan woman… could the sweat from her body really be more effective and more valuable than the potions I bought on the day of the competition?_

_Damn it, these rich people are truly detestable._

For a moment, Zhang Yu felt a sudden kinship with the mortals who snuck into the sewers of White Dragon High School to steal gutter water.

Because just now, an impulse had flashed through his mind: the next time he went to Purple Cloud High School, maybe he should collect some of Le Mulan's sweat to use.

_Stop, Zhang Yu!_

_Don't be corrupted by Kunxu!_

_You are not that kind of person!_

Zhang Yu quickly reined in his thoughts, refocusing his attention on the Great Sun Sea of Qi.

Nine minutes later, as the first cycle of the Great Sun Sea of Qi was complete, a wealth of insights flooded Zhang Yu's mind, all related to key points to heed while circulating the Great Sun Mana.

Beyond that, he felt his internal body temperature gradually rising, growing hotter and hotter.

In the darkness, pinpricks of light were gradually drawn toward Zhang Yu.

It was the moonlight from the sky, the distant neon lights, the lights of a thousand homes on the opposite bank… wisps of radiance were drawn to Zhang Yu, causing him to slowly emanate a faint glow.

Fu Ji observed this scene and thought, _As I thought… it's a success?_

_Mastering the first level of the Great Sun Sea of Qi normally requires a month of light exposure for the cultivator to gradually adapt to the Great Sun Mana… but he completed this step in a matter of moments._

_This boy’s potential is just as I’d observed and judged. As long as he practices, he improves at a rapid pace, even bypassing some of the technique's inherent limitations._

As Fu Ji was thinking this, Zhang Yu continued to cultivate the Great Sun Sea of Qi, pushing the Great Sun Mana throughout his body, constantly attracting the light from the night sky and making himself brighter and brighter.

By the time Bai Zhenzhen returned to the bridge underpass, Zhang Yu had already advanced the Great Sun Sea of Qi to Level 1 (4/10).

At this moment, Zhang Yu's entire body was emanating faint wisps of light from within. When he opened his eyes or mouth, Bai Zhenzhen could even see light shining out from them.

Bai Zhenzhen said in surprise, "Is this that Great Sun Sea of Qi you were talking about? You're making quite a scene, glowing like that. It's too conspicuous."

Zhang Yu, feeling the faint light radiating from his body, nodded slightly. "It is a bit conspicuous, but I'm about to rent an apartment anyway. I can just practice in my room then."

"In that case, can we rely on this trick of yours to save on the electricity bill for lights?"

Zhang Yu shook his head and explained, "I'm afraid not. The essence of the Great Sun Sea of Qi is to absorb light and refine mana, not to release light."

"If I practice in a room, not only will I not save electricity, I'll probably need a high-power light bulb shining on me to improve the efficiency of mana refinement."

Bai Zhenzhen lamented, "So this technique is a major power hog."

Zhang Yu continued, "But it's only like this in the early stages. As the level of the Great Sun Sea of Qi increases, the effect of absorbing light will become stronger and stronger. Eventually, no light will shine through my body; instead, I'll become darker when I circulate my energy."

"By then, I can just go outside at night and absorb the light from the skyscrapers."

Listening to Zhang Yu's description of the Great Sun Sea of Qi, Bai Zhenzhen clicked her tongue in wonder. But as she drew closer to him, a peculiar fragrance wafted over, and she asked in surprise, "Yu-boy, what’s that smell on you? Why do you smell so good?"

# Chapter 127: Great Sun Circulation, A Successful House Hunt

Hearing Bai Zhenzhen's curious question, Zhang Yu recounted the events with Le Mulan and her potion-sweat.

He concluded with a helpless tone, "I don't know if there are any side effects from this potion Le Mulan sweats out. I just hope the tutoring fees I earn will cover any future medical bills."

Bai Zhenzhen's eyes, however, were sparkling. "You're saying her sweat can restore stamina, excite the nerves, and stimulate mana? And according to her, it can also heal injuries?"

"That's a damn panacea, isn't it?"

"Bring some back for me next time. Let me try it. I have high drug resistance; I'm not afraid of side effects."

Zhang Yu realized that even though he had been in Kunxu for some time, he still felt like a fish out of water in many ways.

For instance, the idea of collecting a rich person's sweat—even if he tried to steel himself, he just couldn't bring himself to do it.

Seeing Zhang Yu remain silent, Bai Zhenzhen said, "Then ask Le Mulan when she's going to hire both of us for sparring. Didn't she say during the athletics meet that she'd consider it?"

Since Zhang Yu was unwilling, Bai Zhenzhen figured she could just collect the sweat herself when the time came.

Zhang Yu replied casually, "She said she needs to adapt more before she can take on both of us at once. I have no idea what she needs to adapt to."

"I alone was enough to make her break out in a full-body sweat. How could she possibly adapt to fight both of us at the same time?"

As he spoke, Zhang Yu's gaze swept over Bai Zhenzhen's calves, over the skin exposed to the air. He noticed that the scars from the martial arts tournament had all disappeared.

Seeing the smooth, porcelain-like skin, Zhang Yu smiled. "Zhen, you got rid of your scars successfully? Now you won't have to worry about them splitting open when you go all out."

Bai Zhenzhen nodded with a smile, rolling up her sleeve to show the newly repaired skin on her arm.

"How's it look? I think it's pretty good, basically the same as my old skin."

Zhang Yu was about to comment on the fair, soft-looking skin when he suddenly noticed a Xinchuang Medical logo and asked in confusion, "What's this?"

Bai Zhenzhen said nonchalantly, "It's a surgical implant ad. You either have to be a gold member of the hospital to get rid of it, or pay an extra two thousand."

"I'm not wasting my money on that. My metabolism is fast enough; this thing will be gone in a few weeks anyway."

Zhang Yu nodded in agreement. There was no need to pay to remove an ad that would disappear on its own soon.

Zhang Yu then asked, "How much was it? I'll transfer you the money, reimburse you."

Bai Zhenzhen showed him the electronic bill. "After a promotional discount, the quote was 38,888. They also threw in a free physical check-up."

After transferring the money to Bai Zhenzhen, Zhang Yu's savings dropped to just over one hundred and seventy thousand, making him lament how quickly money was spent.

Bai Zhenzhen, on the other hand, let out a cheer and hugged Zhang Yu from behind. "Your reward, Yu-boy."

Feeling the True Spiritual Root enter his dantian and spiritual energy rush in from all directions, Zhang Yu couldn't help but hum in comfort.

Bai Zhenzhen ran to the side and said, "You cultivate for a bit. I'll be ready to go once I finish my disguise."

Bai Zhenzhen began to put on a wig, temporary tattoos, padding, and other items, preparing for her part-time job in the dark world of tutoring.

With the spiritual root inside him, Zhang Yu once again activated the Great Sun Sea of Qi.

At first, nothing happened, but after a moment, he felt the True Spiritual Root begin to adapt to the Great Sun Sea of Qi technique, vaguely assisting him in absorbing the light.

However, after just one breathing cycle, Bai Zhenzhen had finished her disguise. Zhang Yu would have to wait until they reached the industrial park to further test the True Spiritual Root's assistance with the Great Sun Sea of Qi.

...

Three hours passed in a flash.

By the small lake in the industrial park.

The lights from the office buildings, the moonlight cascading from the sky, and the nearby streetlights—wisps of light were being continuously absorbed by Zhang Yu, the spiritual energy within them refined into mana.

The Great Sun Sea of Qi had already been advanced by Zhang Yu to Level 2 (11/20).

At this moment, not a single trace of light could be seen on his body. On the contrary, he appeared even dimmer in the darkness of the night.

And under the influence of the True Spiritual Root, this dimness gradually expanded from his skin to a radius of several dozen centimeters around him, as if he were shrouded in an invisible shadow.

_As expected,_ Zhang Yu thought, _the True Spiritual Root is indeed adapting to the new technique, helping me improve the efficiency of absorbing light and gathering spiritual energy._

Fu Ji, witnessing this, was even more impressed. "Bai Zhenzhen's evolutionary spiritual root is too useful. It can continuously adapt and evolve according to the user's cultivation technique and direction. It's practically an all-purpose spiritual root."

"Right now, the root has already improved the absorption efficiency of the Great Sun Sea of Qi by at least ten percent. If it continues to adapt, I wonder how high the improvement will reach."

At the same time, a flicker of curiosity arose within her. "This root is currently at the level of a Heavenly Spiritual Root. In the future, could it evolve into a Divine Spiritual Root... or even an Immortal Spiritual Root?"

Fu Ji couldn't be sure, but her curiosity grew.

After all, above the Heavenly Spiritual Root was the military-grade Divine Spiritual Root, and above that was the Immortal Spiritual Root, exclusively supplied to the Ten Great Sects.

_If Bai Zhenzhen's spiritual root could evolve to the Immortal Spiritual Root level,_ Fu Ji mused, _it would be a heaven-defying fortune... but also a heaven-defying disaster._

...

An entire night passed.

Facing the morning sun, Zhang Yu carried Bai Zhenzhen on his back, running from the suburbs toward the city.

By now, Zhang Yu had advanced the Great Sun Sea of Qi to Level 3 (14/30). Even without intentionally circulating the technique, the passive absorption was running on its own.

And Zhang Yu estimated that the passive absorption effect at Level 3 was about thirty percent of the active absorption.

He figured this technique was probably like the Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method; once it reached Level 10, there would be little difference between the passive and active effects.

At this moment, as the morning sun rose, Zhang Yu felt the wisps of sunlight being fiercely funneled into his body like sparks. Accompanied by the ceaseless circulation of his Great Sun Mana, the light was continuously drawn into his dantian and ultimately refined into his own mana.

As the morning sun grew brighter, Zhang Yu felt the Great Sun Sea of Qi within him operate with increasing ferocity.

The golden Great Sun Mana carried waves of heat, coursing through his body like streams of fire, crazily craving and devouring the sunlight he absorbed.

Zhang Yu felt his dantian had become a small furnace, which, like adding fuel to a fire, burned brighter and brighter with the absorption of light, continuously producing an ever-denser Great Sun Mana.

But Zhang Yu felt no discomfort; instead, it was like basking in the sun in winter, a pleasantly warm feeling.

He thought to himself that the Great Sun Sea of Qi was indeed much more effective to practice during the day; the efficiency was worlds apart from last night.

From Zhang Yu's back, Bai Zhenzhen said in surprise, "Yu-boy, you're getting darker and darker."

As the Great Sun Sea of Qi circulated fiercely, Zhang Yu's entire person seemed to be enveloped in a layer of shadow, making him appear several shades darker than before.

Zhang Yu quickly looked at his body and immediately realized it too.

_Damn! Am I turning black?_

He thought to himself that it was a good thing he was in Kunxu; otherwise, in another place, wouldn't using this technique get him shot on a daily basis?

However, the Great Sun Sea of Qi contained a method to eliminate such phenomena. With a thought from Zhang Yu, he slightly smoothed out the Great Sun Mana, reducing the passive absorption effect a little, and the shadow on his body vanished instantly.

Bai Zhenzhen asked curiously, "If your Great Sun Sea of Qi keeps leveling up and its light absorption gets stronger, will you eventually become completely pitch black? Could you use that to hide your identity?"

"In the future, when you turn black, you can try to see if you can evade fares, dodge surveillance, and even steal or rob..."

_Zhen, you're... you're getting more and more out of line! Who told you that turning black makes it easier to commit crimes?_

Zhang Yu was about to reprimand her loudly when Bai Zhenzhen added, "Ah, forget it. It feels like doing all that won't make as much money as underground tutoring, and you'd have to figure out how to pay taxes on your own. Too much trouble."

Hearing this, Zhang Yu couldn't help but reflect that the tax system was definitely a major factor in maintaining public order in Kunxu.

On the way back to the city, Zhang Yu's phone vibrated. He opened it to see a message from Yu Xinghan.

Yu Xinghan: You're looking to rent a place?

Zhang Yu's interest was piqued. He must have seen his social media post about renting.

Considering he was a Golden Core disciple, who knew how much wealth he controlled? He probably had a vacant apartment to rent out.

So, Zhang Yu immediately replied: Yes.

Yu Xinghan: The place I'm renting is a bit big. Want to be roommates?

Zhang Yu frowned and replied: A Golden Core disciple still rents?

Yu Xinghan: Never buying a house is a principle upheld by my master's lineage. It's better to invest in yourself than to spend money on a house.

Zhang Yu thought to himself that this True Monarch Xinghuo was truly a destitute Golden Core. A dignified Golden Core True Monarch couldn't even afford a house in Songyang City on the first layer of Kunxu. It was a good thing he hadn't joined his sect back then.

But when he asked about the rent and was told it was over a hundred thousand a month, Zhang Yu felt he had been presumptuous.

So Zhang Yu replied: I don't like having roommates.

He thought that by rejecting Yu Xinghan, their conversation would end there.

Unexpectedly, the other party sent another link from a shopping platform.

Yu Xinghan: Go in and help me click this.

Zhang Yu was momentarily stunned. He looked at it carefully and was speechless.

_Well, I'll be damned. It's one of those 'slash the price' promotions from a Kunxu shopping site._

_Isn't this Yu Xinghan guy a Golden Core disciple? He needs to stoop to this level for such a small gain?_

Zhang Yu couldn't be bothered to reply.

Over the rest of the day, Zhang Yu continued to receive more messages about renting.

While he was on the rooftop, absorbing the sun and cultivating the Great Sun Sea of Qi, he received a message from Qian Shen.

It was a small apartment of over 20 square meters under his father's name, with a monthly rent of 6,000.

Zhang Yu was slightly tempted, as this price was definitely a bargain in the city center—a friendship price from Qian Shen.

While eating in the cafeteria, Zhang Yu received a message from Song Hailong.

He sent photos of the room directly. It looked much larger than Qian Shen's 20-square-meter apartment, had great lighting, and even a large balcony outside, perfect for him to practice the Great Sun Sea of Qi.

The only thing was, there were a lot of washing machines. Why were there four in the room?

When Zhang Yu asked, Song Hailong replied: I'm not done sending the photos yet. This is just the nanny's room.

After seeing the subsequent photos of the entire 200-square-meter house and the rental price of over 100,000, Zhang Yu silently replied: Too spacious, I don't like it.

On the rooftop after school, Zhang Yu received a rental message from Le Mulan.

He opened the photos of the apartment. Hmm… no bed, no sofa, no kitchen, and certainly no TV or anything of the sort. There was a medicine cabinet, a meditation room, body tempering equipment, and a washing machine...

The size was about 60 square meters, and with the standard Immortal Dao decor, it perfectly met the needs of both Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen.

It was just the "Quick-Quick Clean" disinfection spray from Purple Cloud Pharmacy at the entrance that Zhang Yu felt would take some getting used to.

And the fact that the 60-square-meter apartment had two bathrooms also struck Zhang Yu as strange.

Le Mulan: This apartment is across the street from Purple Cloud High School. It's a place I used for a while. You only need to pay 2,000 a month.

Le Mulan: However, if you move in, our future sparring sessions will be held here.

Le Mulan: After all, changing and washing up at school is not very convenient.

Le Mulan: Oh, right, this apartment has two bathrooms. One of them is for my exclusive use; you can't enter it.

Zhang Yu did a quick calculation. Le Mulan's private bathroom was about 30 square meters, taking up half the apartment's area.

Zhang Yu cursed inwardly. _So, this apartment's main feature is your private, off-campus bathroom, isn't it? Just how many dedicated toilets do you need? Are you trying to claim territory everywhere?_

Zhang Yu: No problem. I'll rent this apartment.

Looking at the rental information he received today, Zhang Yu felt he had made a new discovery.

Although the factions behind Yu Xinghan, Song Hailong, and Le Mulan... all these super-rich people... were probably very wealthy.

But he had a feeling... that Le Mulan had far fewer reservations when it came to spending money.

Just then, Bai Zhenzhen, from the other side of the rooftop, said, "Yu-boy, it's about time. We should head to White Dragon."

Today was the day for their combat training with Yu Xinghan and Song Hailong at White Dragon High School.

At the thought of sparring with a Golden Core disciple, a hint of anticipation appeared in Zhang Yu's eyes.

# Chapter 128: Battle at White Dragon

Beneath the lingering glow of the setting sun.

On the rooftop of Songyang High School.

Zhang Yu’s Great Sun Sea of Qi had now been pushed to level 4 (21/40), and his mana, freed from the bottleneck that had slowed its progress under the Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method, had reached 44.3, its growth accelerating.

As the sun sank below the horizon and the daylight dimmed, Zhang Yu could feel the once-boiling Great Sun Sea of Qi within him gradually calm.

“Sigh, the sunlight during the day is still the best; the effects on my cultivation are so much stronger.”

“As for the night… I’ll have to find a suitable alternative.”

Just then, Bai Zhenzhen, who was beside him, once again urged Zhang Yu to head to White Dragon High to earn his sparring fees from Song Hailong and Yu Xinghan.

And the reason he was taking Bai Zhenzhen with him was, of course, to recommend her as a substitute training partner.

…

In a flash, the two had already walked into White Dragon High School.

As semi-insiders, they navigated the corridors of varying colors and access requirements with practiced ease, passing students kneeling in cultivation and a math teacher who was being verbally abused by his students…

The sights along the way stirred a mix of emotions in both of them.

_White Dragon High School has turned into a zoo,_ Zhang Yu thought.

From the moment they had entered White Dragon High, they had noticed that nearly seven or eight out of every ten students they saw no longer looked entirely human.

For instance, they were currently watching a student who looked like a bear demon and another who resembled a werewolf disciplining a student who still retained his human form.

The bear demon’s uniform was emblazoned with the number 35, the werewolf’s with 36, while the human-looking student had the number 99 on his chest.

The bear demon pressed down on the human student’s head, saying irritably, “You brat! Did you just peek at my study notes?”

The human-looking student’s voice trembled. “I… I just saw them by accident.”

The werewolf chimed in, “A mere rank 99, a piece of trash without even demonic muscle, dares to peek at the study notes of the model class? Hand over your workbook; we’ll be doing your homework today.”

The human-looking student let out a terrified scream. “No! Please don’t take my homework! You can hit me, just hit me, alright?”

Watching the three of them scuffle, Zhang Yu mused, _Aside from people like Yu Xinghan and Song Hailong who have exceptional control over their bodies, for the rest of the students at White Dragon… the less human you look, the higher your status on campus._

_This place has really become a kingdom of beastmen, hasn't it?_

Just then, the bear-man noticed the human-shaped Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen, as well as the Songyang High School uniforms they were wearing.

_Hm? A Songyang slacker dares to set foot in our White Dragon empire?_

The bear-man’s brow furrowed as he strode toward Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen.

“What are you two doing at White Dragon?”

The other werewolf also approached, looking down at Zhang Yu.

“Sneaking around like this, are you here to steal White Dragon’s learning methods?”

Zhang Yu scratched his head helplessly. “Um… I’m here to see Yu Xinghan and Song Hailong.”

The bear-man and the werewolf both looked utterly unconvinced; as if the top two students of White Dragon High School would ever associate with a Songyang slacker.

At that moment, an even taller figure approached and, upon seeing Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen, said, “It’s been a while, you two.”

Zhang Yu’s gaze shifted. “Chu Qiuhe?”

The newcomer was none other than Chu Qiuhe, whom Zhang Yu had defeated in the martial arts competition.

Seeing Chu Qiuhe, who consistently ranked in the top five, the nearby bear-man and werewolf immediately prostrated themselves on the ground like submissive dogs.

Chu Qiuhe glanced at the two and said flatly, “This is Zhang Yu, the champion of both the martial arts competition and the athletics meet. He defeated me to claim the martial arts title.”

Hearing this, the bear-man and the werewolf were visibly shocked. They had not attended the competitions, and while they had heard tales of this formidable figure, this was the first time they had met him.

The two immediately dropped to their knees again, shouting in unison, “Big Brother Zhang Yu!”

Chu Qiuhe continued, “The reason he shows no demonic traits is that he has already achieved complete mastery over the demonic muscle in his body.”

“So he is no ordinary Songyang High School student; he is the sovereign of Songyang High School.”

“To disrespect him is to disrespect me.”

In the next moment, Chu Qiuhe delivered their punishment in an icy tone, “After school today, neither of you will do your homework.”

“Tomorrow morning, you are forbidden to hand in a! single! piece! of! homework!”

At Chu Qiuhe’s words, the bear and the wolf looked as though they had lost their parents. Utterly horrified, they backed away slowly, their tails between their legs.

After reprimanding the two, Chu Qiuhe turned back to Zhang Yu and explained, “My apologies for the scene, Zhang Yu. These students haven't been to the competitions, so they have no idea what Songyang’s top students are capable of.”

“You’re here for Brother Xinghan and Brother Hailong, right? They’re waiting for you in the training room down there.”

Following Chu Qiuhe’s directions, Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen made their way to the training room at the end of the hall.

Suddenly, a group of elders—tall and muscular, yet with stark white hair, gaunt faces, and numb expressions—walked past them.

Even from a distance, Zhang Yu could feel a palpable wave of resentment washing over him.

Then, to the surprise of both Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen, Chu Qiuhe bowed and said, “Greetings, seniors!”

The ‘elders’ gave a dismissive wave, seemingly too weary to even utter a word, and drifted away, leaving a chilling aura in their wake.

Zhang Yu asked curiously, “Who are they?”

Chu Qiuhe replied, “They are third-year seniors. The academic pressure is intense, so some of them age a little faster.”

_A little faster? They look like they have one foot in the grave!_ Zhang Yu grumbled internally, suspecting it was yet another consequence of some Immortal Dao technology.

Despite their appearance, however, Zhang Yu dared not underestimate them.

In fact, ever since learning about the Foundation Establishment exam from Zhang Pianpian and being tasked with reaching the third-year standard before the first round, Zhang Yu had begun to research the data on White Dragon High School’s third-year students.

Fortunately, White Dragon always went to great lengths to publicize performance data at various academic milestones, practically drilling it into the students, which made Zhang Yu’s research quite easy.

_However, students continue to improve rapidly in their third year, so the data obviously varies from one period to the next,_ Zhang Yu thought.

_For instance, right at the start of the third year, the average is around a level 6 Dao heart, approximately 70 units of mana, and a physical strength of level 7.5 or higher._

_By the time of the college entrance exam, the average is probably a level 8 Dao heart, around 90 units of mana, and a physical strength of level 9.5 or higher._

Knowing this data, both Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen felt a mounting pressure, especially when they recalled Zhang Pianpian’s words—to reach the third-year standard before the first round of the Foundation Establishment exam.

_There are only four months until the first round of the Foundation Establishment exam begins…_ Zhang Yu thought.

He knew that registration for the exam was in June, the first round was in August, the second in October, and the final round in January of the following year.

According to this timeline, when they participated in the first round, their opponents would include students from their own year who had just finished their first year and were about to start their second.

There would also be students who had finished their second year and were on the verge of entering their third.

_And that group, the ones who will be nearly third-years by August, they are our main competitors._

_Considering their backgrounds and strength, plus the fact that they began the Immortal Dao a year before us…_

_By the time of the first round in August, they will have definitely reached the third-year standard._

The stats of White Dragon’s third-years surfaced in Zhang Yu’s mind.

_Even if I use the lowest standard and treat the new third-years as our benchmark, the average is still a level 6 Dao heart, around 70 units of mana, and a physical strength of 7.5…_

_And as the Foundation Establishment exam progresses, our opponents will also continue to improve. By the second and final rounds, their stats will only be higher._

Every time they considered this, both Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen felt an immense wave of pressure.

After all, Zhang Yu’s Dao heart was currently only level 4, his mana was at 44.3, and his physical strength was at level 4.96.

And Bai Zhenzhen’s stats were a notch weaker than his.

Faced with this reality, the two steeled their resolve.

_It’s mid-April now… Within four months, before the first round in August, we have to at least reach the average standard of a new White Dragon third-year._

_A level 6 Dao heart, over 70 units of mana, and a physical strength of over 7.5._

…

When Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen arrived at the training room.

They saw Yu Xinghan and Song Hailong locked in combat.

The massive Song Hailong’s every punch and kick summoned gusts of wind and thunder, his limbs striking like massive steel pillars toward Yu Xinghan.

But each blow was met and steadily blocked by Yu Xinghan’s single hand.

Although it looked like Song Hailong was on a frenzied offensive, the distinct impression was that he was being completely suppressed.

Upon noticing the arrival of Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen, Yu Xinghan was able to smile, his breathing perfectly even.

“Zhang Yu, you’re here? Song Hailong and I had some free time, so we were just warming up. Now that you’re here, we can begin.”

The next moment, as Yu Xinghan’s palm met Song Hailong’s fist, the elephantine Song Hailong was driven back, his feet stomping a series of resounding booms on the floor.

Long aware of the gap between himself and Yu Xinghan, Song Hailong was not surprised. He simply took a deep breath to calm the roiling blood and qi in his body before turning his attention to Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen.

Song Hailong frowned. “You’re saying Bai Zhenzhen can be my combat training partner?”

Bai Zhenzhen replied with a cool expression, “Defeat me first, then you can think about sparring with Zhang Yu.”

Song Hailong let out a cold snort and beckoned to Bai Zhenzhen. “Fine, I’ll defeat you first, then I’ll fight Zhang Yu.”

In the next instant, the two were engaged in a fierce battle.

Song Hailong moved like a rampaging elephant, his hands sweeping with immense force toward Bai Zhenzhen’s position in an attempt to capture her in one move.

But Bai Zhenzhen’s movements were as swift as lightning, darting around Song Hailong as her Body-Piercing Sword Qi erupted at will. She would strike and retreat in an instant, giving Song Hailong no opportunity to engage in a contest of strength.

As the two began their fight, Yu Xinghan’s gaze shifted to Zhang Yu, the opponent who had bested him in the athletics meet.

It was from that moment on that Yu Xinghan had conceived the idea of having Zhang Yu serve as his sparring partner, to become another whetstone to sharpen his skills.

(End of Chapter)

---

# Chapter 129: Whetstone, Mountain-Shattering Palm

Yu Xinghan looked at Zhang Yu beside him and gestured with his hand. “Let’s get ready to start as well.”

“But before we begin our combat training, I have a request to make.”

“First, during our training, we will not use any mana. We will fight using only martial arts powered by our pure physical strength.”

It was precisely because he had witnessed Zhang Yu’s control over his physical body during the athletics meet that Yu Xinghan had invited him to be a sparring partner.

Learning and absorbing his opponent’s various techniques for physical control was, in truth, his primary objective for this training.

It was for this reason that he had proposed they fight without mana, relying solely on pure physical strength.

Yu Xinghan continued, “Second, in our combat training, whoever injures the other must pay for the other's medical fees.”

Zhang Yu shot him a suspicious look. “You’re not trying to scam me, are you?”

It was no wonder Zhang Yu thought this; his impression of Yu Xinghan was that of… a very stingy rich person.

Yu Xinghan explained, “Don’t think I’m trying to swindle you. This is training for how to defeat an opponent without injuring them.”

“You must understand that in Kunxu, a true expert can control every last shred of their power. The ability to defeat an opponent without having to pay a single coin—that should be the true purpose of combat training.”

“I’ve seen the recordings of your martial arts competition. Blood and flesh flying everywhere. It’s too crude, too inefficient.”

Yu Xinghan shook his head. “That is a lack of training in control.”

Zhang Yu thought it made a lot of sense and couldn't help but ask, “Did the esteemed Xinghuo teach you this as well?”

Seeing Yu Xinghan nod, Zhang Yu thought to himself, _Did that old codger Xinghuo have to pay a lot for fighting in the past? Is that why he values this so much when training his disciple? He’s even turned his disciple into a cheapskate._

…

Meanwhile, Chu Qiuhe had, at some point, arrived outside the training room door and was observing the situation through the wide-open entrance.

As he watched the fierce battle between Song Hailong and Bai Zhenzhen, he sighed internally. _That woman, Bai Zhenzhen… as expected, it’s not just her physical strength that has progressed by leaps and bounds; her combat ability has risen just as dramatically._

_If I were to fight her, I probably wouldn’t last ten moves._

_Such terrifying progress in just two short months._

_But rumor has it that both Bai Zhenzhen and Zhang Yu received an investment from the third-year senior, Zhang Pianpian. They became her dogs and even underwent the demonic muscle modification…_

At this thought, a flicker of longing appeared in Chu Qiuhe’s heart.

_Damn it, I want to be Senior Zhang’s dog too, to be whipped by her into improving my scores!_

But Chu Qiuhe only dared to entertain the thought, for he knew that if he ever voiced such an extravagant wish, word would quickly spread to the third-years, and he would be dragged into a corner and taught a harsh lesson by the seniors.

After all, when it came to Zhang Pianpian, who dominated the academic rankings and was worth hundreds of millions, at least eighty percent of the students at White Dragon High School wanted to be her dog.

It was a prize even the third-years couldn't secure, so how could a mere first-year like Chu Qiuhe even dream of it?

_An opportunity I couldn’t even get in line for was snatched up by those two?_

At that moment, as Chu Qiuhe looked at Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen, his eyes could not help but reveal a trace of jealousy.

Just then, the battle between Zhang Yu and Yu Xinghan officially began, once again capturing Chu Qiuhe’s full attention.

…

Yu Xinghan and Zhang Yu walked toward each other, closing the distance step by step.

The next moment, with a resounding bang, their arms collided fiercely.

And that sound of impact was like a signal.

As fists, palms, arms, and elbows crashed against one another, a continuous series of thunderous booms erupted, like a chain of lightning strikes detonating within the training room.

In the blink of an eye, the arms of the two fighters became a blur of afterimages, locked in a ferocious exchange.

…

Outside the training room.

Chu Qiuhe watched the battle between Zhang Yu and Yu Xinghan with rapt attention.

Suddenly, he sensed two figures beside him; it was the bear-man, number 35, and the werewolf, number 36.

Meeting Chu Qiuhe’s gaze, the two ventured bravely, “We also want to watch Brother Xinghan and Big Brother Zhang Yu’s match.”

Chu Qiuhe snorted, but since he had already punished them, he did not prevent them from satisfying their scholarly curiosity.

Meanwhile, in the center of the room, Yu Xinghan’s attacks grew increasingly ferocious, especially as his figure began to move at high speed around Zhang Yu, bombarding him from all directions like a tempest.

In contrast, Zhang Yu stood his ground, steady and unmoving, like a small boat in a raging sea storm, appearing on the verge of being overwhelmed by the violent tide.

The bear-man exclaimed in awe, “Brother Xinghan is so strong! Just his physical power alone, the speed and force he’s unleashing would completely crush us. Big Brother Zhang Yu can’t hold on for much longer, can he?”

“You blind fool,” Chu Qiuhe scoffed. “Zhang Yu won the athletics meet because of his understanding of power and his mastery of force-channeling techniques. His ability to borrow and redirect force can be considered the pinnacle among first-years.”

In Chu Qiuhe’s eyes, Zhang Yu was no small boat; he was a fortress forged from countless tons of steel and concrete, standing as firm as a mountain, no matter how fierce the bombardment.

Just then, a long cry of excitement came from the rapidly moving Yu Xinghan.

“Excellent, excellent! It’s been too long since I’ve had such a satisfying fight. You’re much more durable than little Song.”

“In that case, I’ll be using my full strength from now on.”

Yu Xinghan looked at Zhang Yu before him as if he were looking at an exceptionally fine target.

_Usually, when facing students from my own year, I worry about the medical fees being too high, so I never dare to fight with my full power. But with this Zhang Yu’s skill, even if I go all out, he won’t be so easily sent to the medical bay, right?_

Thinking of this, Yu Xinghan smiled faintly. “But don’t worry. Like I said before, if I injure you, I will reimburse all your medical expenses…”

The same Martial Ascension Heart-Tempering Art operated in both their eyes, causing their gazes to collide as if their respective battle intents were clashing in mid-air.

And after his remark about reimbursing medical fees, the aura around Yu Xinghan changed abruptly.

The next moment, the third eye in Yu Xinghan’s mind opened completely, first granting him a 360-degree field of vision.

Then, the tendrils extending from the third eye suddenly tensed, instantly enhancing Yu Xinghan’s ability to recruit power from every single muscle, as if he had gained an additional nervous system.

Boom!

Yu Xinghan’s palms shot out, carrying the roar of a dragon and the trumpet of an elephant as they flew toward Zhang Yu.

Before the palms even arrived, the air was violently crushed and displaced, creating a suffocating pressure.

This was the Dragon-Elephant Mountain-Shattering Palm, which Yu Xinghan had now pushed to level 8!

This palm technique, which could be powered by pure physical strength, was created by a senior master with a background in civil engineering who had observed elephant demons and flood dragons moving mountains and filling seas in the wild.

The technique's greatest characteristic was its imitation of a dragon-elephant's power, resulting in a palm force that was incomparably fierce, like a flash flood or a tidal wave.

Its essence lay entirely in the channeling and release of force, with an emphasis on overwhelming the opponent with irresistible power, unleashing one's full strength to pulverize any and all defenses.

Now, with the power of Yu Xinghan’s entire body highly mobilized, the might of this palm had far surpassed the standard of a first-year student.

Zhang Yu’s expression was composed as he raised a hand to block, intending to deflect the force of the incoming palm.

Bang!

With an incredibly deep thud, their palms collided violently.

And with Yu Xinghan’s third eye paired with the fully concentrated state of the Martial Ascension Heart-Tempering Art, every one of Zhang Yu’s movements to borrow and redirect the force, every ripple of his muscles, became incredibly clear and profound.

It was through this observation that he intended to rapidly learn and mimic his opponent’s movements, to master Zhang Yu’s control and application of physical strength.

Yu Xinghan watched as his palm’s force traveled down Zhang Yu’s steel-like muscle fibers, being channeled downward…

He watched as Zhang Yu took three steps back, his feet creating heavy thuds on the ground as he redirected the force into the floor…

A brilliant light shone in Yu Xinghan’s eyes, as if he were admiring a priceless work of art.

“This control of power is… exquisite.”

“I’m going to learn everything you have!”

With that, his figure flashed forward, closing the distance once more. Another palm, roaring with the sound of a dragon and elephant, blasted toward Zhang Yu.

“Show it to me again!”

Meanwhile, also in a state of full concentration, Zhang Yu observed every one of Yu Xinghan’s slowed-down movements, studying his opponent's every move and technique, doing his utmost to neutralize the assault.

After a few more moments of fierce exchange, Yu Xinghan sensed that his fully concentrated state was nearing its limit. Their stamina was no longer at its peak, and their movements had lost their perfection.

So, Yu Xinghan stopped and said, “Let’s rest for a while before we continue.”

“If we’re not in peak condition, the training won’t be as effective.”

Yu Xinghan sat down to the side, replaying the recent battle in his mind, recalling the various techniques Zhang Yu had displayed, striving to absorb them and turn them into fuel for his own growth.

_This Zhang Yu…_ he thought, _is truly the best whetstone I could ask for._

_Once I use different attack methods to learn every technique he possesses, and combine that with my own rate of physical growth, no one in high school will be able to surpass me in terms of physical strength._

Not far from where Yu Xinghan was sitting, Zhang Yu also sat down and gazed at the Feathered Tome that had appeared before him.

Dragon-Elephant Mountain-Shattering Palm Level 0 (0/1, 4.96/5.0 physical strength, 4/5 level Dao heart)

_Is this the palm technique Yu Xinghan was just using?_ Zhang Yu wondered.

He did a quick search online, and his brow furrowed. “The usage rights for this technique cost 200,000?”

_Damn it… If I actually learn this palm technique, does that mean after just one training session, I’ll be 200,000 in the hole before I’ve even earned much?_

But as he recalled the domineering power of Yu Xinghan’s palm, he felt a flicker of temptation.

He especially considered that this type of martial art, powered purely by physical strength, offered great scalability and could be applied in many situations, making it a high-quality foundational technique…

_Maybe I could learn it secretly and not buy the usage rights for now? At worst, I can just keep it hidden and not use it in public._

Zhang Yu was momentarily undecided, but considering he had not yet met the cultivation requirements for the technique, he set the matter aside for the time being.

Just then, Yu Xinghan, who was opening his phone, asked, “That link I asked you to click last time, you still haven’t clicked it?”

---

# Chapter 130: Level 10 Great Sun, The Agony of Poverty

Hearing Yu Xinghan’s question, Zhang Yu’s expression darkened.

“I couldn’t be bothered,” he said flatly.

Yu Xinghan tried to persuade him, “Why not? You can get discount coupons for talismans just by watching ads. You could use them yourself.”

Zhang Yu was surprised. “Talisman discount coupons?”

Yu Xinghan nodded. “You of all people should know how much talismans cost. Watching a few ads every day to collect coupons is a form of talisman cultivation in itself. It will make your talisman skills stronger.”

Zhang Yu sat down next to him and finally couldn't resist asking, “You’re True Monarch Xinghuo’s disciple, aren’t you? Are you really that short on money?”

Yu Xinghan shook his head and spoke with the air of an experienced elder.

“The one thing Kunxu has no shortage of is rich people. The one thing it lacks the most is money.”

“Money is cultivation. It is potential. It is the future. No one in this world has enough money.”

“Even an expert like me has to learn how to save.”

“Every coin saved is an enhancement to my foundation and potential.”

“If you want to walk far on the Immortal Dao, you must not only learn how to earn money and how to spend it, but also how to save it.”

Yu Xinghan turned to look at Zhang Yu. “Otherwise, what will you do when you suddenly discover a crucial cultivation technique, or a spiritual root, or an Arcane Frame, and after scraping everything you have together, you’re still just a little short?”

“Money is potential. And when you find your potential exhausted, unable to take the next step.”

“You will regret not having saved more back then.”

“Every coin you save now will allow you to take a few more steps in the future.”

Zhang Yu nodded slightly, feeling that there was a great deal of truth in what he said. He took out his phone and clicked the link his friend had sent.

After resting for a few minutes, the two resumed their fierce battle.

Two hours passed in the blink of an eye.

But everyone felt they had gained a great deal.

Song Hailong felt that his martial arts experience had improved.

Yu Xinghan had learned numerous force-channeling techniques from watching Zhang Yu, enhancing his control over his physical body.

Bai Zhenzhen, in addition to gaining combat experience, would receive a payment of 20,000.

And Zhang Yu, besides his own 22,000 fee, now had the opportunity to learn the Dragon-Elephant Mountain-Shattering Palm and take on a 200,000 debt.

However, a moment later, when Yu Xinghan transferred the money, Zhang Yu was slightly taken aback to see 30,000 arrive in his account.

Yu Xinghan smiled. “My apologies, I accidentally sent too much.”

“Could you please transfer the extra to my other account?”

Although he found it a bit odd, Zhang Yu still transferred the 8,000 to the other account.

…

Time flowed by as Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen fell into a daily routine of school, cultivation, tutoring, and sparring.

The days turned to late April.

On the rooftop one afternoon.

A pitch-black shadow materialized.

Even though it was exposed to the blinding sun, no amount of light could disperse the deep, heavy darkness.

It was Zhang Yu, cultivating the Great Sun Sea of Qi.

Following a rumble from the Great Sun mana within his body, this breathing exercise, which could only be cultivated in the middle stage of Qi Refinement, was finally pushed by Zhang Yu to the 10th level.

With the Great Sun Sea of Qi operating at level 10, the shadow that was Zhang Yu grew even deeper, as if it were about to swallow all the light in its surroundings.

As the blazing light poured into his body, the Great Sun Sea of Qi within him churned ever more violently. Torrents of Great Sun mana, like molten lava, roared as they absorbed all the light, gradually refining it into a single thread of mana in his dantian.

Zhang Yu knew that with his Great Sun Sea of Qi at level 10, he had once again entered a period of rapid mana growth.

Furthermore, Zhang Yu could feel his body becoming more vibrant and agile under the sun’s rays.

It was as if every cell, every fiber of his flesh and blood was cheering, accelerating its own growth.

Zhang Yu knew that this was the effect of the level 10 Great Sun Sea of Qi. As he was exposed to light, it accelerated his body’s metabolism, increasing the efficiency of his body tempering.

The drawback was that the longer he maintained this state of accelerated metabolism, the more it would shorten his lifespan.

_Damn it… This Great Sun Sea of Qi is already the most time-consuming, and it even shortens the cultivator’s lifespan on top of that._

Zhang Yu shook his head. Although he cursed internally, he had no intention of stopping.

In the treacherous world of Kunxu, the flaws of the Great Sun Sea of Qi were hardly anything to fuss about.

Besides, he could always switch to other breathing exercises later. Practicing this one for a year or so would only shorten his life by a few weeks.

To increase his body tempering efficiency at such a cost was well within his acceptable limits.

_The Great Sun Sea of Qi combined with the Crippled Ox Body-Sacrifice Heart Art means that not only can my mana and Dao heart improve steadily, but both techniques also enhance body tempering efficiency._

_That Fu Ji, she really knows how to pick cultivation techniques._

As he elevated his Great Sun Sea of Qi to level 10, Zhang Yu’s mana had also grown with increasing speed, now standing at 46.8.

However, he was still a long way from his target of 70 mana, the standard for a student just entering their third year.

Just then, a series of whistling sounds came from beside him.

Zhang Yu turned his head to see Bai Zhenzhen surrounded by howling sword qi, like countless invisible blades slashing through the air.

Just a few days prior, Bai Zhenzhen had also raised her Body-Piercing Sword Qi to the 10th level. Now, in addition to her fingertips, she could launch attacks with sword qi from any part of her body, as if she were wearing a suit of invisible sword armor, perfect for both offense and defense.

And under Fu Ji’s guidance, Zhang Yu had Bai Zhenzhen use her prize money to purchase a sword art called the Formless Sword Art.

It was an assassination technique designed to hide sword qi, killing intent, and even sound, which was perfect for Bai Zhenzhen to practice in conjunction with her Body-Piercing Sword Qi.

_This sword art is very suitable for Zhen and her martial arts path._

Zhang Yu could sense that, although she hadn’t mentioned it, Bai Zhenzhen’s cultivation had become even more diligent these past few days. She cycled through mana, Dao heart, physical strength, and various martial arts, improving almost every moment.

Although after her conversation with Zhang Pianpian, Bai Zhenzhen seemed to be her old self—joking with Zhang Yu, earning money, and cultivating together—everything appeared the same.

But inwardly… she was anxious.

_Reach the third-year standard in four months: level 6 Dao heart, over 70 units of mana, and a physical strength of over 7.5… Only then will I have a chance to pass the Foundation Establishment exam._

The pressure of the exam was a constant weight on her, like an invisible monster chasing at her heels.

She secretly made a resolution: _I must become stronger!_

_Strong enough to pass the Foundation Establishment exam._

_Strong enough that… I will never again have to watch A'Yu feel helpless because of me, while I am unable to say a single word!_

Immense pressure and extreme desire transformed into a powerful driving force in Bai Zhenzhen’s heart, pushing her to pursue greater power, better results… and to pass the Foundation Establishment exam and enter one of the Ten Greats alongside Zhang Yu.

In her short life, Bai Zhenzhen had never so desperately wanted to pass an exam.

And the spiritual root within her body seemed to grow more active in response to her intense desire, constantly accelerating her cultivation.

Meanwhile, after finally pushing his Great Sun Sea of Qi to level 10, Zhang Yu purchased the electronic manual for the Crippled Ox Body-Sacrifice Heart Art, and his savings decreased by another 30,000.

Fortunately, he had earned a good amount from his tutoring and sparring fees lately, and unlike before… he no longer needed to buy Crimson Marrow Primordial Pills to cultivate the Crimson Marrow Primordial Qi. His savings now stood at just over 260,000.

As Zhang Yu stared at the bank balance displayed on his screen, Fu Ji said, “260,000 may seem like a lot, but once you also cultivate the Crippled Ox Body-Sacrifice Heart Art to level 10, you will need to focus all your efforts on the Crimson Marrow Primordial Qi to increase your physical strength.”

“Cultivating the Crimson Marrow Primordial Qi requires Crimson Marrow Primordial Pills, which cost 30,000 each. You’ll need one every three days on average, which comes out to 300,000 a month.”

“Besides that, if you want to pass the Foundation Establishment exam, how can the passive cultivation from two level-10 techniques be enough for your Dao heart and mana?”

“You’ll also need to spend money to rent spirit veins to increase your mana and use the Spirit Realm to train your Dao heart. Just those two expenses could easily cost one or two hundred thousand a month.”

So-called spirit veins were places with a high concentration of spiritual energy.

In ancient times, they were known as grotto-heavens and blessed lands.

Now, they were called spiritual energy ecosystem protected areas. Not only were the entrance fees exorbitant, but the cost of lodging inside was also astronomical. However, the boost they provided to mana cultivation far surpassed that of a normal urban environment.

Fu Ji continued, “And you are taking the athletics track for the Foundation Establishment exam, so your physical strength needs to be top-tier. In addition to Crimson Marrow Primordial Pills, you will definitely need other body-tempering alchemical enhancers…”

Listening to Fu Ji list one expense after another, a bitter smile formed on Zhang Yu’s face. He knew she was right; there were many more things he would need to spend money on.

And it wasn't just him. If Bai Zhenzhen wanted to keep up, she would have to spend just as much money as he did.

Seeing the silent Zhang Yu, Fu Ji thought to herself, _Eventually, you’ll be the one to bring up hunting evil gods._

Zhang Yu knew that in Kunxu, no matter what method one used for self-improvement, it was all inextricably linked to money.

_Once I’ve mastered the Crippled Ox Body-Sacrifice Heart Art, my Dao heart, mana, and physical strength will all require even more money to advance._

Suddenly, Zhang Yu remembered his old social media post about renting a place.

He thought to himself, _I know so many rich people now. Perhaps through their connections, I can save some money on renting spirit veins, accessing the Spirit Realm, buying Crimson Marrow Primordial Pills, and so on…_

Just then, Bai Zhenzhen spoke up from the side, “Yu-boy, aren’t you going to Purple Cloud today? Don’t forget to bring my things as well.”

Today, Zhang Yu was heading to Purple Cloud not only to be Le Mulan’s sparring partner but also to rent the house she had mentioned.

Watching Zhang Yu’s departing figure, Bai Zhenzhen reminded him, “Remember to collect Le Mulan’s alchemical enhancers.”

Zhang Yu rolled his eyes, determined not to do something so demeaning. He refused to collect a rich girl’s sweat.

Seeing that he hadn’t responded, Bai Zhenzhen repeated, “Did you hear me? Even though we’ve earned a bit of money, we have many more expenses coming up. Our financial situation is very tight, so we have to save every coin we can.”

As she spoke, she handed him a large water bottle. “Here, take this. You can use this bottle to collect the enhancers.”

Zhang Yu reluctantly took the large water bottle, a flash of humiliation washing over him.

_Damn it… Being poor… really is agony._

# Chapter 131: New Pharmaceutical Channels, an Immortal Resonance Endorsement

Following the address Le Mulan had given him, Zhang Yu arrived at an apartment building outside Purple Cloud High School.

The building had an antique charm, with classically styled outer walls and a grand entrance of carved beams and painted rafters. The entire structure seemed to glow under the setting sun, as if draped in a brilliant golden veil, appearing both understated and magnificent.

Zhang Yu felt that the apartment he used to live in was a pigsty by comparison.

The moment he stood before the entrance, the glass doors slid open automatically, and a voice drifted out, "Mr. Zhang, your check-in information has been registered. Please follow the guide to your room."

Following the purple, glowing arrows on the floor, Zhang Yu made his way to Room 101.

As the door opened on its own, a cleansing mist sprayed him from head to toe the moment he stepped inside.

He then saw Le Mulan sitting cross-legged on a cushion, silently performing a breathing exercise.

"You're here?"

As Zhang Yu entered, Le Mulan slowly rose to her feet. She still wore her thick school uniform on her upper body, but her trousers had been shed at some point, replaced by a pair of athletic shorts that revealed a pair of long, straight, and fair legs.

"My pants were going to tear anyway, so I took them off first. You don't mind, do you?"

Zhang Yu looked down helplessly and said, "No, do as you please."

Le Mulan picked up a nearby apartment key card and held it out to Zhang Yu.

"From now on, this place is for you and Bai Zhenzhen to live in. Just pay 2,000 a month. Internet, electricity, and water are all included."

"But I have one condition. When I come here to train with you, Bai Zhenzhen cannot be in the room without my permission."

_I'm not... ready to engage in close combat with both of them at the same time just yet,_ Le Mulan thought.

Zhang Yu frowned and said, "You have to give me a heads-up before you come, right? You can't just show up whenever you want. What if we're busy?"

Le Mulan nodded. "Of course. I'll schedule a time with you each week. I can try to arrange it for when Bai Zhenzhen isn't around."

With that, she placed the key card in Zhang Yu's hand and added, "Let's begin."

...

Two hours passed in the blink of an eye.

Le Mulan emerged from her private bathroom, having already showered and changed into a new school uniform.

She sat on the windowsill, rubbing her slightly bruised legs.

Then, she took out a Dao heart buffer and inhaled from it, a comfortable expression spreading across her face.

She was in a good mood today; after all, having completed her training with Zhang Yu, she felt her psychological mysophobia had been significantly reduced.

Furthermore, her physical control had improved from wrestling with him.

_This Zhang Yu really is talented when it comes to the physical body._

_After he graduates from university, he could probably become a decent body tempering coach._

Le Mulan turned her head, looking curiously at Zhang Yu, who was mopping the floor.

While Zhang Yu was mopping, Fu Ji reminded him, "Don't forget to bottle the potion. Bai Zhenzhen has been bugging you about it several times."

Nearby, Le Mulan watched Zhang Yu stare hesitantly at a water bottle, and she seemed to understand something.

"You can't accept this kind of potion? Can't get over the mental block?"

Le Mulan spoke in the tone of an experienced senior, "You'll get used to it."

"A person must learn to proactively adapt to their environment."

"Right now, you can't get over it mentally. You think it's disgusting, you think it's dirty, but after a few more times, you'll slowly adapt."

Zhang Yu frowned at her words. "I'm already trying my best to adapt to this rotten place."

Looking at the sweat—which smelled fragrant, looked sweet, and would probably taste good—Zhang Yu sighed. "But there are some things in this rotten place I'd rather not adapt to."

Le Mulan tilted her head and said, "Then spend money. Money can change the environment. If you buy your own alchemical enhancers, you won't have to drink this."

Zhang Yu walked up to Le Mulan and smiled. "Then do you have a channel for buying them? Could you sell some to me for cheaper?"

Le Mulan said coolly, "Money can solve it now... but one day, you'll encounter a problem that money can't solve immediately."

The image of her defeat to Zhang Yu in the martial arts competition flashed through her mind, and she said with a hint of helplessness, "When that time comes, you'll have no choice but to adapt on your own."

Zhang Yu chuckled and said, "We'll cross that bridge when we come to it."

Le Mulan stared intently at Zhang Yu, as if seeing her former self, who wanted to solve everything with money, who only wanted to use money to create a barrier against 'poverty.'

But the Zhang Yu before her was a different kind of poor person.

Le Mulan suddenly laughed, pulled on her pants, and walked towards the door. "Fine. Just send me a message on your phone with what drugs you want."

"I'll have someone sell them to you at a 20 percent discount."

Zhang Yu asked, "Is the quality as good as what you use? Oh, and do you have neural fillers? Any Crimson Marrow Primordial Pills?"

Le Mulan had already walked out of the room.

As the door closed, only her cool voice lingered.

"Just as good. They should have them."

The thought of being able to buy Crimson Marrow Primordial Pills at a 20 percent discount sent a jolt of joy through Zhang Yu.

To cultivate his body tempering technique, the Crimson Marrow Primordial Qi, he needed to spend 300,000 a month on those pills.

"A twenty percent discount will save me 60,000!"

Over an hour later, Bai Zhenzhen arrived at the room.

She first touched the body tempering equipment, then looked around the bathroom, tested the soundproofing of the quiet room, and then checked the list of room services like laundry, cleaning, and meal delivery.

The meal delivery service even offered cheap synthetic food, allowing them to eat whenever they felt hungry.

After looking everything over, Bai Zhenzhen said with a delighted surprise, "Damn, the conditions here are amazing! And we can cultivate anytime. Is it really only 2,000 a month?"

Zhang Yu nodded and then explained Le Mulan's condition.

"That's a small matter. Is there a rental contract?"

Looking at the electronic contract Zhang Yu sent her, Bai Zhenzhen said with great anticipation, "Now we can apply for the inter-city travel permit. We're one step closer to passing the Foundation Establishment exam."

Zhang Yu nodded and remarked with emotion, "I thought we wouldn't be able to live in a place like this until after we got into university."

Then Zhang Yu told her about buying alchemical enhancers from Le Mulan at a discount.

Bai Zhenzhen nodded repeatedly upon hearing this. "Great! That woman uses only high-quality drugs. Being able to use her channels for supplies, and at a discount..."

At this thought, she couldn't help but laugh, feeling that her and Zhang Yu's chances of passing the Foundation Establishment exam had grown even greater.

A moment later, Bai Zhenzhen eagerly walked toward the quiet room. 

"I'm going to try cultivating in here first."

Zhang Yu, on the other hand, turned on the lights in the room one by one, intending to test the effect of cultivating the Great Sun Sea of Qi at night with the lights on.

As the light shone on him, he immediately felt the Great Sun mana in his body stir slightly. Although it wasn't as intense as during the day, it still had about twenty to thirty percent of the effect.

_Since Le Mulan is covering our electricity bill, should I buy some high-power lights?_

...

After moving into the new apartment, Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen spent their days moving between school, the apartment, and the Dark Learning Gang, constantly advancing toward their goal of passing the Foundation Establishment exam.

Several days passed like this.

On the Songyang City subway.

Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen were leaning against each other; Bai Zhenzhen was practicing breathing exercises to absorb spiritual energy, while Zhang Yu circulated the Crippled Ox Body-Sacrifice Heart Art in his mind.

Ever since raising his Great Sun Sea of Qi to level 10, he had begun cultivating the Crippled Ox Body-Sacrifice Heart Art.

Now, as he visualized it, a great ox with all four limbs broken, blind and deaf, seemed to be crawling forward in his mind, never stopping.

With this visualization, a sense of joy began to rise in Zhang Yu's heart, as if no matter how bitter or tiring it was, as long as he could advance, as long as he could progress, that was enough.

Crippled Ox Body-Sacrifice Heart Art Level 5 (23/50)

_This heart art, just like the Desolate Ox Soul-Suppressing Mantra, has a hidden condition: hope,_ Zhang Yu thought.

_You must at least have a path forward to perfectly utilize this heart art._

More than ten minutes later, Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen exited the subway station and walked up to a skyscraper in the city center.

Looking at the tower that soared into the clouds as if to pierce the sky, a slight smile appeared on Zhang Yu's lips.

This was the Immortal Resonance Group's office building in downtown Songyang City, a place he had visited before.

However, the last time he came here was to test cultivation techniques for odd jobs. This time, he was here as an endorser to shoot a commercial.

After registering at the front desk, they followed the directions to the shooting location.

As Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen stepped out of the elevator, they were greeted by a series of advertisement posters belonging to the Immortal Resonance Group.

A Fetal Muscle Enhancement Class, to help your baby be more confident after birth.

An Elderly Longevity Class, attend for a day, live for a day.

There was also a Health Insurance Buster Training Class, on how to bankrupt your opponent in three moves.

Looking at the posters here, Zhang Yu felt an even greater sense of the Immortal Resonance Group's wealth and power, as well as the vast scope of its business.

Zhang Yu said, "The Immortal Resonance Group's customer base is really broad."

"Isn't it?" Bai Zhenzhen said from the side. "Although their main business is said to be in education, they can educate everyone."

"From fetal education to the elderly, don't they just turn everyone into their customers?"

"Only the dead haven't been educated by them yet, but I think that's coming soon..."

As Bai Zhenzhen grumbled about the Immortal Resonance Group, the two of them unknowingly stopped in front of another poster, their gazes fixed on Zhang Pianpian in the image.

"Secret Scrolls of the True God of Talismans, the top choice of study material for Zhang Pianpian, the number one high school student in talismans in the Eastern District's 12-city joint examination."
