"Co-authored by the Immortal Resonance Group and the Eight Ministries of Righteous Gods, featuring tens of thousands of talisman examples, guaranteeing every purchaser a divine spirit's guidance. Standard edition 888,888, deluxe edition 1,888,888..."

Zhang Yu felt like his eyes were playing tricks on him. "Zhen, how many eights are there? I can't even count them."

"You can't even count 880,000 and 1.88 million? The stench of poverty is all over you." Bai Zhenzhen's eyes shone as she looked at Zhang Pianpian in the poster, her voice filled with envy. "So godmother was also an endorser for the Immortal Resonance Group? I wonder what her endorsement fee was."

Then she looked at the phrase 'number one in talismans in the Eastern District's 12-city joint examination' and sighed in admiration, "The number one in talismans in the 12-city joint exam?"

Zhang Yu knew that the first layer of Kunxu contained countless cities. After all, with an area of over 20 million square kilometers, all of it land with no oceans, the number of cities far surpassed that of any country he knew from his previous life.

And this 12-city joint examination was an annual unified test held by the key high schools in 12 cities in the eastern part of Kunxu's first layer. All participants were third-year high school students, making it something of a dress rehearsal for the college entrance exams.

"To get first place in talismans even in the 12-city joint examination."

Zhang Yu grew even more curious. "How on earth did my sister get her talisman skills to this level? This must have cost a lot of money."

So, while Bai Zhenzhen went to find their contact person, Zhang Yu pinched the prayer beads on his chest and whispered, "Do you know why her talisman skills are so high?"

"What did you mean last time by the Divine Dao?"

# Chapter 132: Finding Channels, Image Design

Hearing Zhang Yu's question, Fu Ji thought with a sigh of annoyance, _What a hassle. This guy really does care about his sister._

Fu Ji knew that giving a vague answer would only make him more curious.

So, after a moment of thought, Fu Ji said, "The so-called Divine Dao is when you are noticed early by the Eight Ministries of Righteous Gods, and then you sign a contract to be cultivated by them."

"Not only do you receive resources, but you also receive the guidance of a god."

"Especially in the Dao of Talismans, they can truly master talisman-related cultivation techniques, modify various parameters of talismans, even customize their own exclusive talismans, and directly borrow the power of the Eight Ministries of Righteous Gods."

"It's not like you lot who can only dumbly trace over a Talisman Tome. Once the money runs out, all you can do is stare blankly at it."

"I once saw a true talisman master fight another who used talismans. With a single Reporting Talisman, he froze the opponent's bank account, leaving them to just stare blankly at their Talisman Tome."

"Does stepping onto the Divine Dao mean you can use talismans without money?", Zhang Yu asked,.

"Of course not. What god would you pray to without money?" Fu Ji said. "But people who have stepped onto the Divine Dao have a high credit limit. They are all postnatal Sacred Bodies of Borrowing, with unfathomable potential."

Fu Ji sighed. "Every time you think you've finally bankrupted them, they somehow manage to borrow another sum of money and their combat power skyrockets on the spot. They get stronger after borrowing. That's why these guys are best at breaking through in the middle of a fight."

Hearing this, Zhang Yu began to understand. Was this the difference between an insider and a regular user? And talismans had actual cultivation techniques? And being noticed early by the Eight Ministries of Righteous Gods...

Zhang Yu recalled the memories of his sister from the original owner's mind.

The Zhang Pianpian of the past seemed to have changed starting from elementary school, becoming more mature, smarter, and more assertive.

But the Zhang Yu of that time was too young, spending his days either being criticized or beaten by his sister, and hadn't noticed anything unusual.

And now, although more curiosity and doubt welled up in his heart, the point he cared about most was...

"So many benefits?" Zhang Yu said grimly. "Then what's the price? What is it?"

This was Kunxu. Zhang Yu didn't believe in stories where righteous gods admired a mortal's talent, took them as a disciple, and nurtured them to success.

In the world of Kunxu, any gift from a wealthy person or a god surely had its price marked long in advance.

Fu Ji had a ready answer for this. "All talents who sign a contract with a righteous god and step onto the Divine Dao must join the Eight Ministries of Righteous Gods after graduating from university, working for free as a divine official for several decades to several centuries, depending on the contract."

Zhang Yu gasped. Working for free for that long? His sister had been downgraded from a mere worker to a true beast of burden.

Fu Ji continued, "Of course, people who want to step onto the Divine Dao need to have a certain talent."

Zhang Yu asked, "What talent?"

Fu Ji chuckled. "They must be poor."

"After all, it's not just the rich who are born that way."

"Those who serve as beasts of burden are also born to it. If your family isn't poor enough, you can't be one."

_Damn it..._ Zhang Yu was speechless, only able to lament his family's exceptional talent.

Observing Zhang Yu's expression, Fu Ji knew she had deflected him for now. _He should be more concerned about himself,_ she thought.

Recalling Zhang Pianpian's performance, Fu Ji mused, _From that woman's behavior, the righteous god she signed with is likely a major deity, involving a divine post arrangement above the 10th layer._

_Once Zhang Yu goes to university, he'll realize this isn't something he should be concerned with._

Not long after Zhang Yu finished speaking with Fu Ji, Bai Zhenzhen called him over.

They met the contact person from the Immortal Resonance Group and were then led to a makeup room.

Inside the makeup room, Yu Xinghan and Song Hailong were already waiting.

This time, it was a joint advertisement shoot for the top-ranked students in the sports competition who also had connections with the Immortal Resonance Group.

Yu Xinghan was scrolling through ads on his phone. He glanced at the two who had just walked in and greeted them, "Yo, you're here too."

Song Hailong, who was seizing the moment to perform a breathing exercise, nodded at them and then resumed his ascetic training.

It was only because of Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen's current achievements that they warranted a greeting.

If it had been Zhao Tianxing who walked in, these two 'White Dragon people' would probably have ignored him, both transforming into cold icebergs.

Zhang Yu, however, struck up another conversation, asking, "Do you guys have any channels for spirit veins or the Spirit Realm?"

Yu Xinghan's eyes lit up. He stopped scrolling through ads and asked, "What? You want to rent one?"

Zhang Yu nodded. "You have connections?"

Yu Xinghan chuckled. "Spirit veins are a no-go. That stuff is in high demand; every single spot is occupied. You can only rent them, and you have to get in line. I don't have any connections to offer you."

Song Hailong suddenly chimed in from the side, "For spirit veins, you should look for Xiong Wenwu and Hu Yuntao. Red Pagoda Husbandry is the biggest landowner in Songyang City."

"The three large spiritual energy ecosystem protected areas within a hundred-kilometer radius are all managed by Red Pagoda Husbandry."

Zhang Yu nodded silently, committing this to memory.

Yu Xinghan added, "I can't help with spirit veins, but as for the Spirit Realm, I might be able to figure something out for you."

The Spirit Realm, a spiritual world created jointly by the Ten Great Sects, was what Zhang Yu considered to be something like a virtual network world.

Because of its unique nature, the Spirit Realm had functions for teaching, examinations, and tempering the Dao heart.

It was said that the higher one's level in Kunxu, and the more profound their realm, the greater the influence and the more functions the Spirit Realm possessed.

True Monarch Xinghuo, as a Golden Core True Monarch from the upper layers, also had considerable assets in the Spirit Realm, including his own Spirit Realm grotto-heaven. Even while on the first layer, he could occasionally travel to the upper layers of Kunxu through the Spirit Realm.

But for those on the lower layers of Kunxu with insufficient cultivation, especially the poor on the first layer... the restrictions of the Spirit Realm were significant. Even the daily number of access times and destinations were strictly limited. Accessing the Spirit Realm of the upper layers of Kunxu required passing through layers of approval.

One could imagine that using the Spirit Realm to train one's Dao heart was yet another business.

At this moment, Yu Xinghan thought for a moment and said, "I need to go back and ask my master. I'll give you an answer in a while."

A moment later, the makeup artists for the group arrived.

The lead makeup artist was petite but stunningly beautiful. Her eyes, nose, ears... every part of her was perfectly proportioned, like a flawless statue.

The makeup artist said, "Everyone, my name is Miao Yun. I'm your image designer for today."

"Today's advertisement requires us to capture your transformation before and after receiving the demonic muscle."

As a mature corporate drone and veteran beast of burden who hadn't been fired in 50 years, Miao Yun was proficient in skills like expense reimbursement, blame-shifting, holding meetings, and making proposals. She was also the record holder for the longest meeting attendance at the Immortal Resonance Group's Songyang branch.

Her rich experience told her that top high school students who came for ad shoots often had strong personalities, so you couldn't give them a choice. You had to give them direct orders.

She said, "In a moment, we will first apply makeup to make you look thinner, poorer, and weaker..."

Zhang Yu understood. This was to create the feeling of being poor, ugly, and pathetic before the surgery, and tall, rich, and handsome after.

Next, Miao Yun approached Song Hailong, thinking inwardly, _What a hassle._ She hated changing the image of large-sized people the most. It took a long time and consumed a lot of mana, but the performance evaluation was the same as for smaller people.

_But at least he's not as big as a body tempering influencer..._

Miao Yun recalled the time she damaged a body tempering influencer's fake muscles and had been paying compensation ever since, a wave of bitterness washing over her.

_I wonder if my overtime application for next month has been approved. I can't get by without overtime._

Though her mind was racing, Miao Yun's movements were skilled and swift.

Her fingertips tapped repeatedly on Song Hailong's body, pouring in streams of mana. His muscles suddenly shrank and contracted, and even the position of his bones began to shift.

Especially after her fingers pressed over his eyebrows, eyes, and cheeks, Song Hailong's image and temperament changed drastically. In the blink of an eye, he transformed from a strong little giant to a thin, wretched-looking figure.

After finishing, Miao Yun rubbed her hands. Song Hailong's body was quite tough, and altering it had taken a considerable amount of her effort.

Zhang Yu, watching from the side, was slightly astonished, as he couldn't follow Miao Yun's hand speed at all. This makeup artist's strength was far beyond that of a student like him.

He sighed internally, _As expected of a corporate drone from a big company, their combat power is stronger than a high school student's._

Seeing Song Hailong's sudden transformation, he mused, _It's like sculpting a person._

He also realized that Miao Yun's own perfect, exquisite appearance was likely sculpted by herself.

Next, Miao Yun walked up to Yu Xinghan. After placing a finger on him, she said, "Nice mana resistance. But you can turn it off for now."

Yu Xinghan said, embarrassed, "It's a body hardening technique. I can't really turn it off."

Miao Yun sighed helplessly. Even more than large clients, she hated clients who practiced body hardening techniques. The difficulty instantly went from kneading clay to bending steel bars, causing even more wear and tear on her hands.

_Looks like these hands won't last the year. I'll have to get them replaced,_ she thought with an internal sigh.

When Miao Yun got to Bai Zhenzhen, she observed her features for a moment and suddenly said, "Young lady, I quite like your face shape. Are you selling the face model?"

Bai Zhenzhen, with her icy demeanor, said flatly, "With a face like mine, do you think I would have reached this age without having sold the model?"

"True enough." Miao Yun smiled. "Tell me the name, I'll go collect one."

As a veteran makeup artist and image designer, Miao Yun always collected various face models to keep up with the latest trends; otherwise, she wouldn't be able to pass the company's annual technical assessment.

In her eyes, Bai Zhenzhen's face model was a kind of technical reserve.

As for Song Hailong and Yu Xinghan just now? They were purely the plastic surgery faces of the rich, used to maintain their image or hide their true identities.

# Chapter 133: Level 10 Crippled Ox, an Undercurrent Stirs

Listening to the conversation between Bai Zhenzhen and Miao Yun, Zhang Yu's eyes flickered. Although he had been in Kunxu for nearly half a year, a lot of knowledge and information was still settling deep in his mind, not yet fully integrated into his consciousness.

Hearing their conversation now, Zhang Yu gradually remembered that in Kunxu, faces could also be sold. Being good-looking was something that could be quantified by money.

He quickly took out his phone and logged into the face model website, wanting to see how much his own face was worth.

However, after the facial recognition scan, he received a notification that the model had already been sold.

Looking at the transaction record, it had sold for a mere 2,000, and it was a one-time buyout for a 20-year copyright.

There was also a user review: Handsomely generic.

_I knew it. The original owner already sold it,_ Zhang Yu thought.

_Sigh, I sold it for cheap. If I had waited until I was more famous to sell, the copyright would definitely be worth more._

He casually searched for valuable face models and found that even those of celebrities, stars, and influencers were only moderately valuable, as they were purely cosmetic face models.

The most valuable were functional face models, such as the faces of the Eight Ministries of Righteous Gods, which provided a bonus effect to talismans.

Another example was a face model with a charming effect, which served as a tool of the trade in certain special industries.

There were also various bizarre, non-human face models, which were equally expensive because they involved surgery and altering body structures.

Just then, Miao Yun came over to Zhang Yu. When she placed a finger on his body, he felt a cold, dark mana being poured into him, but it quickly stimulated the Great Sun mana circulating throughout him.

As the Great Sun mana surged back, Miao Yun quickly retracted her hand. _Is that a mana cycle constructed by passive breathing?_ she wondered.

_I think I only managed to master passive breathing in my third year of high school._

_Sigh, another rich kid, I suppose? I'm so envious._

She blew on her fingertip and said, "Hey handsome, you burned me. Turn off your mana too."

Zhang Yu immediately stopped the passive breathing of his Great Sun Sea of Qi.

Several hours later, after the ad shoot was finished, the first installment of his 600,000 after-tax endorsement fee, 200,000, arrived. Seeing his savings swell to over 480,000, Zhang Yu was ecstatic.

...

Several days later.

The calendar turned to late April.

Unconsciously, with the promotion of new body tempering techniques, sporadic purple people, black people, and beastmen had started to appear on the campus of Songyang High School.

And now, in the first-year model classroom.

Class advisor Su Haifeng's eyes flickered with electricity as he promoted Purple Cloud's 'super-metabolism' surgery to the students.

"To improve student performance, Purple Cloud Supplements has partnered with the school to offer a discounted package for the super-metabolism surgery. This is to ensure that students can use alchemical enhancers comfortably, safely, and with peace of mind in the future."

"If your family has financial difficulties and can't afford the surgery fee, you can come to me to apply for a loan..."

Below the stage, Zhao Tianxing looked at the surgery application form he had been given, a wave of hesitation washing over him.

_Which is better, demonic muscle or super-metabolism?_

_Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen both used demonic muscle. But with super-metabolism, the surgery alone isn't enough; you have to spend even more money on alchemical enhancers later, which will put a greater and greater burden on my family._

The air was filled with the discussions of his classmates, many of whom were clearly just as hesitant as he was.

Zhao Tianxing turned to Qian Shen and asked, "Which one are you choosing?"

Qian Shen glanced at Zhao Tianxing, thinking that although the guy's score was a bit low, his 'score morality' was decent.

So Qian Shen said frankly, "I originally planned to get the demonic muscle first, then the super-metabolism surgery, and finally the Black Dragon bloodline, since they are all reliable ways to improve my score..."

Hearing this, Zhao T+ianxing couldn't help but curse, _filthy rich bastard_.

Qian Shen continued, "Unfortunately, after consulting, I found out that these full-body modification surgeries conflict with each other. In the end, I had to choose super-metabolism."

Just then, Su Haifeng on the stage continued, "...Other new body tempering techniques are just shortcuts, providing a temporary increase in physical strength. Only the super-metabolism surgery improves your cultivation speed for a lifetime and expands the upper limit of your future cultivation."

"If you don't seize the time to get this surgery now, you will only be left further and further behind in the future, eventually becoming useless, and probably won't be able to stay in the model class..."

Zhao Tianxing watched as more and more classmates signed the surgery application, as if seeing crowds of purple people sprinting forward, leaving him further and further behind. He felt himself unknowingly standing with one foot out the door of the model class.

Taking a deep breath, Zhao Tianxing finally gave up on his original idea of saving some money for his family and lessening their burden, and signed his name on the super-metabolism surgery application.

Su Haifeng stood at the lectern, watching the students below sign one by one, seeming to see the future of Songyang High School, and indeed all the high school students in Songyang, turning into crowds of purple people, black people, and beastmen...

_Oasis, Immortal Resonance, Purple Cloud, Red Pagoda... what are they planning? Can it be true what Master said, that they are plotting something?_

Just then, his gaze swept over two empty seats, and he asked, "Where are Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen?"

He Dayou quickly replied, "They're skipping class!"

A faint electric spark flashed in Su Haifeng's eyes. If any other student dared to do this, he would make them understand how the thesis _On the Application Prospects of Electric Shock in High School Education_ was written.

But Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen...

They could just pull out their competition awards, bring up the mana class teacher, the martial arts class teacher, the physical education teacher. Even Su Haifeng would have a hard time dealing with them.

_Forget it. Zhang Pianpian will be gone in another month and a half. Someone will take care of these two then._

In the audience, He Dayou looked at Su Haifeng with disappointment. Even this grade director, the first-year demon king, turned a blind eye to Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen's truancy. It made the Son of the School Director feel a sense of injustice. Can you really do whatever you want just because you have good grades?

...

Meanwhile.

On the rooftop.

The crippled ox visualized in Zhang Yu's mind let out a long roar to the sky. His Crippled Ox Body-Sacrifice Heart Art had finally broken through to level 10.

As the heart art reached level 10, a surge of forward-striving intent welled up in his heart—an unyielding spirit that would not regret dying nine times, that would advance! advance! even if covered in wounds!

This resonated perfectly with Zhang Yu's current all-or-nothing mindset to pass the Foundation Establishment exam and enter one of the Ten Greats, allowing him to circulate the Crippled Ox Body-Sacrifice Heart Art more smoothly. His Dao heart became more rounded and stable, and he felt his will was stronger than before.

At the same time, at the moment the heart art reached level 10, waves of insight from honing the technique merged into his memories, giving him a new level of control over his body.

This was the effect of the level 10 Crippled Ox Body-Sacrifice Heart Art. He felt he could now empty his mind at any time, temporarily reducing mental energy consumption, and then increase the metabolism of his entire body's vital energy to accelerate wound recovery and improve the efficiency of body tempering.

_The breathing exercise and heart art are finally both at level 10..._

Feeling the Crippled Ox Body-Sacrifice Heart Art constantly circulating in his mind and the Great Sun Sea of Qi mana cycle operating naturally within his body, he felt one step closer to the Foundation Establishment certificate.

He looked at his stats on the Feathered Tome. His Dao heart and mana had been steadily increasing during this period.

Dao heart Level 4 (89%)

Mana 48.1

Body Strength 4.96

_I've been focusing on cultivating my breathing technique and heart art these days and haven't had a chance to train my body._

_Now that the Great Sun Sea of Qi and Crippled Ox Body-Sacrifice Heart Art are at level 10, I can focus most of my time on body tempering._

Since Zhang Yu planned to take the physical fitness track for the Foundation Establishment exam, his next training focus would naturally be on his physical strength.

But he also knew that in Kunxu, relying solely on his own ascetic training was not enough.

Fortunately, he now had a complete preparation and plan for body tempering.

...

After school, in the rental apartment.

Bai Zhenzhen leaned against the back of the door, listening to the thudding and banging sounds from inside.

_It's going to be two hours. I might as well find a quiet place to cultivate,_ she thought.

Inside the room, Zhang Yu and Le Mulan wore serious expressions, engrossed in a dangerous session of close-quarters combat.

Icy legs continuously scissored towards Zhang Yu, transmitting terrifying power with the close contact of their skin.

At this moment, Le Mulan felt the heat from his body on her legs. Although it was still just as scorching, she could now control her expression to not look so disgusted.

She did her best to focus on the contest of physical strength, learning Zhang Yu's techniques in the midst of their struggle.

Zhang Yu was also very serious about this training. While grappling with Le Mulan, he wore a solemn expression as he rubbed the potion off her body.

In this process, Zhang Yu clearly noticed that the more intense the battle, the more effectively Le Mulan absorbed the drug's power, and the more potion was secreted.

For example, her thighs, which showed a hint of fleshiness under his immense strength, felt cool and slippery to the touch, and the more he rubbed, the more potion seemed to be forced out.

Although he sometimes got distracted by the strange sensation from her legs, he would immediately focus on the Crippled Ox Body-Sacrifice Heart Art and on self-improvement, casting aside all distracting thoughts.

Two hours later.

Bai Zhenzhen knocked on the door and asked, "Are you done?"

"Wait a moment, Zhen," Zhang Yu said. "Le Mulan is still showering and changing."

A few moments later, Le Mulan came out after her shower, dressed in fresh clothes. She glanced at Zhang Yu, who was still lying on the floor soaking in the potion.

"Looks like you've gotten used to it?" she asked coolly.

At this moment, Zhang Yu was evenly coated in a layer of the fragrant potion. He could feel his muscles, mana, and brain becoming more active as the potion was absorbed through his skin.

Hearing Le Mulan's question, Zhang Yu replied, "As for drinking it... I will absolutely never do that."

"But deliberately washing it off... I won't do that either."

To save money, to improve his body tempering efficiency, and to pass the Foundation Establishment exam, Zhang Yu had decided to use Le Mulan's potion to accelerate his cultivation.

Le Mulan smiled slightly at his words, a sudden curiosity welling up inside her.

She thought about how, for the sake of her grades, to advance further on the Immortal Dao, and to justify the money invested in her, she had to choose to actively adapt and change herself.

Could this poor boy before her really persist in his ways and not change? He would rather not drink her high-value potion?

If it were one of the lower-class students from Purple Cloud High School, they would probably be licking the floor by now.

She thought to herself, _Can he really hold out and not drink it?_

_What if the value were even higher?_

# Chapter 134: Le and Bai Take Turns, Rapid Advancement

Le Mulan said with great interest, "What kind of alchemical enhancer are you looking for? Body tempering? Or one that boosts mana? I can take some more before I come next time."

Zhang Yu gave her a strange look and said, "What are you up to?"

Le Mulan thought to herself, _I just want to see if you can hold out and not drink my sweat._

Thinking of how he had once refused 400,000 during the martial arts competition.

Le Mulan felt that if she voiced this curiosity of hers, he would probably refuse her directly.

So she decided to secretly increase the value of the fluid, just to see if Zhang Yu would ultimately change his mind... and drink it.

The thought flashed through her mind, and Le Mulan continued, "Your service is good, so for me, it's just a small effort. I don't mind helping you out."

Zhang Yu thought for a moment and said, "I've been focusing on body tempering recently."

Le Mulan nodded. "Understood. Before I come next time, I'll inject my body with ten vials of Bone and Flesh Enhancement Serum."

"This is a body tempering enhancer that's normally only injectable in the late stages of Qi Refinement, but for someone like me with super-metabolism, it's just right. You can even use it after I metabolize it."

"The Bone and Flesh Enhancement Serum can effectively increase bone density, improve the repair efficiency of muscle fibers, and enhance the absorption of spiritual energy and nutrients."

"Each vial costs ten thousand yuan."

"Oral application is more effective than topical."

Seeing his stunned expression, Le Mulan smiled faintly, a newfound sense of anticipation for their next training session blooming in her heart.

She wanted to know if Zhang Yu would actually drink the fluid next time.

Opening the door and seeing Bai Zhenzhen already waiting outside, Le Mulan gave a nod and turned to leave.

The moment Bai Zhenzhen entered the room, her gaze fell upon the puddle on the floor.

Standing to the side, Zhang Yu watched Bai Zhenzhen begin to lick her lips and said with a roll of his eyes, "Zhen, you can't lick that!"

Bai Zhenzhen said with a regretful expression, "Isn't that a waste, Yu-boy? You can tell this stuff is high-end just by the smell. It's very valuable; one lick would be worth at least a few dozen yuan."

"You can't get arrogant just because you've made a little money and forget how to be frugal. We're still poor."

Zhang Yu advised, "You can't be willing to do anything for money."

Bai Zhenzhen said nonchalantly, "Money can buy anything, so what can't you do for money?"

Zhang Yu was somewhat speechless, because in Kunxu, you really could buy anything with money.

He could only change his approach. "Zhen, you lower your standards one step at a time. Today we're willing to lick a rich person's sweat to save a little money. Does that mean tomorrow we'll have to become a rich person's dog?"

"Remember back at the Mana Competition when you told me not to gamble? It's the same thing. One step back leads to falling back again and again."

As he spoke, Zhang Yu showed off the peculiar fragrance still emanating from the fluid on his body and said, "If you really want to try it, just rub some off the floor, or off me."

"Fine." Bai Zhenzhen nodded. "You have a point. I'll just rub some off you then."

Bai Zhenzhen ran her hand over Zhang Yu's arm, then smeared the fluid onto her own body.

Zhang Yu then pointed to a bag on the floor nearby, telling Bai Zhenzhen that it contained the enhancers he had bought from Le Mulan, which she had conveniently brought over today.

Then Zhang Yu swallowed one of the Crimson Marrow Primordial Pills in a single gulp, feeling the medicinal power of 24,000 yuan dissolving into his body.

"I need to hurry and temper my body while the effects are active. Zhen, let me borrow the True Spiritual Root for a while."

"Okay."

Bai Zhenzhen nodded and pressed herself against Zhang Yu's back.

While inhaling the medicinal fragrance coming from his body, trying to rub as much of the fluid onto herself as possible, she sent the spiritual root into Zhang Yu's body.

Meanwhile, Zhang Yu was immersed in the cultivation of the Crimson Marrow Primordial Qi.

First, the fluid from Le Mulan's body continuously seeped into his, helping him recover his stamina and energy while enhancing the effects of his training.

Then, the medicinal power of the Crimson Marrow Primordial Pill spread through his limbs and bones, increasing the strength of his flesh, blood, and bones with every cycle of the Crimson Marrow Primordial Qi.

Next was the operation of the Great Sun Sea of Qi, which constantly accelerated his metabolism, speeding up his absorption of the enhancers and hastening the transformation of his flesh and blood.

And after Zhang Yu used the Crippled Ox Body-Sacrifice Heart Art to further quiet his own mind and reduce mental exertion, his body's metabolism accelerated even more.

Finally, there was the True Spiritual Root, continuously drawing in and expelling spiritual energy, assisting the cultivation of the Crimson Marrow Primordial Qi while nourishing Zhang Yu's flesh, blood, sinews, bones, and nerves, drop by drop...

Under layer upon layer of enhancement, Zhang Yu's physical strength was being pushed to frantic new heights.

At this moment, he thought of nothing, contemplated nothing; he just cycled the Crimson Marrow Primordial Qi over and over again, feeling his physical strength constantly increasing, feeling his mortal body grow stronger and stronger.

And within Purple Cloud High School.

A few students looked at the faint bruises on Le Mulan's wrist and said with faces full of envy, "Has the divine number one student gone for combat training again?"

Another student said, his face green with jealousy, "To be the divine number one's sparring partner... and to be able to leave a mark on her. I wouldn't even dare to dream of something so wonderful."

Not far away, Lian Tianji overheard their conversation, a trace of disdain on his face as he thought to himself, _A bunch of spineless fools._

_What's there not to dare to dream about?_

...

The next day.

There was no training with Le Mulan today.

Instead, in the room, Bai Zhenzhen could be seen taking out a row of syringes, channeling her mana into them, and then her hands became a series of afterimages as she injected them one by one into various parts of Zhang Yu's body.

This was precisely the Nine Dragons Acupuncture Technique that Bai Zhenzhen had learned from the competition team.

In order to pass the Foundation Establishment certification exam and to further increase his physical strength, Zhang Yu had finally chosen to use alchemical enhancers.

Of course, this was also because his internal organs were now much stronger, and much of the medicinal poison that had previously accumulated in his body had... already been expelled during his cultivation of the Crimson Marrow Primordial Qi.

So Zhang Yu decided to try the enhancers, and if his body felt any discomfort, he would stop.

The enhancers he injected were purchased through a channel introduced by Le Mulan at a 20% discount, costing 10,500, but this was still cheaper than the prices from the competition team.

After all, Bai Zhenzhen had done a comparison; with the team's benefits, the cheapest enhancers were only discounted by 10%, and the more expensive ones were only discounted by 2%, far less cost-effective than Le Mulan's connection.

Speaking of which, Zhang Yu still remembered a benefit from the competition team: after winning first place in the athletics meet, he was eligible for a 20,000 yuan subsidy for purchasing a body tempering cultivation technique.

However, Zhang Yu had no plans to change his body tempering cultivation technique for the time being, so he decided to claim this subsidy later when he was ready to switch.

At this moment, each needle was inserted by Bai Zhenzhen with a different rhythm and at a different point, supplemented by mana oscillation to drive the medicinal power deep into Zhang Yu's muscles and bones.

After a full set of the Nine Dragons Acupuncture Technique, Zhang Yu could feel 10,500 yuan worth of medicinal fees being pushed into his flesh and blood, frantically nourishing his body.

At the same time, as his blood and qi surged, Zhang Yu also felt his body become sharper, more sensitive, and able to perceive his own physical form with greater precision.

The moment Bai Zhenzhen finished performing the Nine Dragons Acupuncture Technique, she hugged Zhang Yu tightly from behind, intending to send over the spiritual root.

Who knew that the instant she hugged him, Zhang Yu suddenly bent over, leaving Bai Zhenzhen with a look of utter confusion.

Because at the exact moment Bai Zhenzhen embraced him, Zhang Yu suddenly felt a peculiar sensation.

He was startled. _Is it because Zhen is wearing less today?_

Then he realized...

_No, it's me who's wearing less._

At this moment, Zhang Yu had no shirt on to make the injections easier.

And Zhang Yu could feel Bai Zhenzhen, wearing only a t-shirt, pressing herself tightly against him.

The barrier of a single thin layer of clothing did nothing to block Zhang Yu's perception of the force of Bai Zhenzhen's embrace.

Every point of pressure, every point of contact, even allowed him to perfectly construct a mental image of the contours of her body pressing against his.

The pressure from her abdomen, her stomach, her slender arms, and other places...

Especially as Zhang Yu bent over, the friction between them... stirred a distracting itch in his heart.

Zhang Yu finally realized that this was the sensitivity brought on by the Nine Dragons Acupuncture Technique.

_Damn it, no wonder they want you to sever your root. How can you train when you're this sensitive?_

At this moment, Zhang Yu had become a staunch supporter of Songyang High School's policy.

Of course, he himself didn't need it, because he had a firm will and extreme self-discipline to overcome the distracting thoughts in his mind.

For example, at this very moment, he was able to say with righteous conviction, "Zhen, get off as soon as you've sent the spiritual root over. You're disturbing my training."

Bai Zhenzhen sent the spiritual root into Zhang Yu's body and asked curiously, "Why are you bent over like that?"

Suddenly, she understood, and looked at Zhang Yu with contempt. 

"Look at you. I told you to get your root severed long ago, but you insisted on keeping it. If you fail to get your Foundation Establishment certificate in the future, it'll be all this damned root's fault."

Zhang Yu waved his hand and said, "It's fine. I have a supreme will. A mere distracting thought is not worth me spending money to suppress."

With that, he began to circulate the Crippled Ox Body-Sacrifice Heart Art, feeling as if he had transformed into a severely crippled ox, forging ahead valiantly through a sea of mud.

A moment later, Zhang Yu let out a long breath, feeling the medicinal power boiling throughout his body, and immediately seized the time to practice the Crimson Marrow Primordial Qi.

...

Just like that, if Le Mulan was there, he would use her fluid; on days without Le Mulan, he would have Bai Zhenzhen perform the Nine Dragons Acupuncture Technique.

Alternating between these two methods, Zhang Yu could feel his physical strength increasing by leaps and bounds every day.

And Bai Zhenzhen also gained a lot of benefits in the process, such as getting second-hand medicinal fluid and buying cheap body tempering enhancers.

Especially with the rotational use of the True Spiritual Root, every time the root re-entered her body, Bai Zhenzhen would feel a scorching heat from within.

That was the True Spiritual Root gradually beginning to develop the ability to absorb the essence of the sun and moon as it constantly adapted to Zhang Yu, allowing Bai Zhenzhen to also absorb spiritual energy from the light.

And in the small apartment they rented, unknowingly, more and more searchlights bought by Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen appeared, illuminating the entire room brightly every night, allowing the Great Sun Sea of Qi and the True Spiritual Root to absorb more spiritual energy from them.

Time flew by, and soon it was early May.

Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen also gradually realized that if they wanted to reach their goal by August, the rate of improvement for their mana and Dao hearts was still not fast enough.

So on this day, Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen came to a protected reserve 90 kilometers from the center of Songyang City, because they had arranged to meet Xiong Wenwu here to discuss the matter of a spirit vein.

--

# Chapter 135: The Difficulty of Breathing

On the pedestrian path of the highway.

Two figures, one in front of the other, kicked up gusts of wind as they sped all the way towards the spiritual energy reserve.

It was Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen.

However, at this moment, besides Zhang Yu using his Sports Car Legs to travel at high speed.

Flashes of electricity sparked around Bai Zhenzhen's body from time to time as she used her newly learned Electric Light Step to keep up with Zhang Yu.

Unlike Zhang Yu, who focused on improving his physical strength, Bai Zhenzhen, because she was participating in the martial arts track, had spent more of her energy during this period on practicing martial cultivation techniques, in addition to improving her Dao heart, mana, and physical strength.

This Electric Light Step was a combat cultivation technique that allowed Bai Zhenzhen to move at high speed over short distances in battle. It was more agile than Sports Car Legs, more adaptable, and more explosive, making the technique more suitable for combat. At this moment, she was simply using it to travel and practice at the same time.

And under the sunlight, Bai Zhenzhen could feel a faint warm current flowing continuously within her body; that was the True Spiritual Root absorbing the spiritual energy from the light.

However, the True Spiritual Root had now gradually adapted to light and dark adjustments and could understand Bai Zhenzhen's intentions, so it wouldn't make her skin dark.

Under the sunlight, Zhang Yu, on the other hand, felt as if molten lava was flowing throughout his body as he frantically absorbed the spiritual energy from the solar radiance descending from the sky.

At the same time, he was doing some calculations in his head.

This trip to the spiritual energy reserve was to see if he could rent a spot on a spirit vein for a cheaper price through Xiong Wenwu's connections to practice his breathing exercises.

After all, these past few days... although his physical strength had increased rapidly, relying solely on cultivation techniques to improve his Dao heart and mana was still too slow for Zhang Yu.

And it was said that not only was the spiritual energy in a spirit vein dense, which could greatly improve the efficiency of mana refinement, but staying there for a long time could also improve one's constitution and prolong life, offering countless benefits.

"Renting an entire spirit vein is definitely out of the question. With the money I have on hand, I'll see if I can rent a spot, just enough for Zhen and me to practice our breathing exercises inside the spirit vein."

Although he had income from the dark world of tutoring, Le Mulan, Yu Xinghan, and Song Hailong during this period, and had also received the first 200,000 in endorsement fees.

However, Zhang Yu's expenses were also considerable. For example, a Crimson Marrow Primordial Pill every three days cost 24,000, and each set of Nine Dragons Acupuncture cost another 10,500. Also, because he had been focusing on body tempering recently, his physical strength was constantly improving, and his food expenses had now reached 1,500 a day. By the beginning of May, he had also paid another 15,000 in loan interest...

Zhang Yu glanced at his account balance again; he still had 570,000.

He thought to himself, _Renting a spot on a spirit vein shouldn't be a problem, right?_

The two continued to speed along, and gradually more and more factories appeared around them, with plumes of white smoke continuously pouring out of huge chimneys. They could also see the signs of Red Pagoda Husbandry on some of the factories.

Just as Zhang Yu's gaze swept over this row of factories, he was suddenly startled. "What is that?"

On the land that was supposed to be a factory, there was now only a field of ruins, with broken walls and rubble everywhere, as if it had gone through a great battle.

There was even a palm print several hundred meters wide on the hillside not far behind, and the hillside was still littered with fragments of various tall towers, walls, and machinery.

Layers of light curtains enveloped the ruins, and various warning signs floated on the light curtains, like the police tape at a murder scene.

Zhang Yu said, "Was there a war?"

Bai Zhenzhen glanced at it and said, "You don't know about this? It was quite a hot topic online six months ago. A factory was investigated for tax evasion."

"The tax evader resisted on the spot, using all sorts of flying swords and magical treasures, and killed more than half of the tax inspectors who came to investigate."

Zhang Yu was shocked. _Tax evaders in Kunxu are this fierce?_

Bai Zhenzhen continued, "Then the tax inspector summoned the divine power of the Tribute Supervising Heavenly God. With a single palm strike, the entire factory was obliterated, and the souls of most of the criminals were torn out."

"Most?" Zhang Yu was amazed. "What about the ones whose souls weren't torn out? Did they die or escape?"

"Those were the ones who committed suicide the moment they saw the Tribute Supervising Heavenly God descend."

Zhang Yu swallowed, once again glad that he hadn't evaded taxes in Kunxu.

The two continued to speed along, and soon they saw a huge arc appear on the distant horizon.

It was their destination.

It was said that a long, long time ago, this spiritual energy reserve was once the territory of demonic beasts, and there were several powerful great demons among them.

The so-called great demons were powerful monsters. Nowadays, monsters are called demon-kin.

Unlike demonic beasts, which were regarded as animals, demon-kin often possessed true intelligence and could integrate into society to live and work.

But later, the great demons here were defeated by the company's security forces. After the reserve changed hands several times, it was finally bought by Red Pagoda Husbandry and has been managed by them ever since.

It was said that it still retained its various natural landscapes and the various demonic beasts that originally lived there. Of course... all of these had also become the assets of Red Pagoda Husbandry.

As Zhang Yu looked closely now, he could see what looked like an incredibly huge glass dome, covering the continuous mountain ranges and hills within.

As the two of them got closer, they could also see dense runes appearing on the glass dome from time to time; that was the power of a formation array separating the inner and outer worlds.

In addition, Zhang Yu could also see many red warning signs on it.

They were all things like 'Red Pagoda Husbandry Private Property, Please Purchase a Ticket and Enter Through the Main Entrance'.

Bai Zhenzhen looked at it and cursed, "So stingy. Are they unwilling to let out even a little bit of the air from the reserve?"

She had originally thought that she might be able to leech some of the spiritual energy and air coming from inside by staying near the border of the reserve, but now it seemed that they had long since taken precautions against this.

The two continued forward and arrived at the ticket office at the main entrance of the spiritual energy reserve.

When they saw that the ticket price was only 5 yuan, both Bai Zhenzhen and Zhang Yu were stunned. What was the difference between this and free? Was Red Pagoda Husbandry doing charity?

Bai Zhenzhen immediately retracted her earlier comment about them being stingy; how was Red Pagoda Husbandry stingy? They were incredibly generous.

The two opened their phones, looking to see if there were any discounts, and were shocked to find that the reserve's rating was only a 1.3.

But after the ticket seller attached the reserve's air meter, spiritual energy monitor, and body weight monitor... to their bodies, they understood why the tickets seemed to be free, and why the rating was so low.

The ticket seller said, "The air inside the reserve is priced at 1,999 yuan per cubic meter, water is 2,888 yuan per liter, and spiritual energy is 3,999 yuan per unit."

"A price list for all the plants and animals, and even the soil, stones, and other materials in the reserve is in the user manual. I'll send it to you, please accept it..."

Zhang Yu looked at the dense list of charges in the user manual and was speechless.

Everything in this spiritual energy reserve, whether it was air, water, food, or anything else, cost money. An ordinary person could bankrupt themselves by just picking up a few stones.

Bai Zhenzhen said nervously, "Yu-boy, breathe less when we go in later. This is too expensive."

After buying their tickets, the two first entered a sealed cabin. As the rear cabin door closed, they were completely cut off from the outside world.

Then, as the front cabin door opened, Zhang Yu felt a wave of incredibly fresh air rush towards him.

Just by taking a deep breath, Zhang Yu felt a sense of comfort throughout his body, and the flesh and blood of his entire body seemed to relax.

"This is... air?"

_Then what have I been breathing before?_

He felt that the air he normally breathed was like car exhaust in comparison.

_So I've been in such a terrible air environment all this time? I've just gotten used to it?_

Zhang Yu walked out of the sealed cabin and completely immersed himself in the reserve's environment.

Taking a deep breath, Zhang Yu felt as if his entire body had been cleansed, and the qi, blood, and mana within him became more active.

Even at this peripheral location, Zhang Yu could feel that the concentration of spiritual energy in the air was already comparable to the spirit-gathering quiet rooms in Songyang High School.

As the two of them walked quickly along the sightseeing path, the spiritual energy in the air became more and more dense. Bai Zhenzhen's spiritual energy charge had even risen to over 500, which scared her so much that she quickly suppressed her True Spiritual Root, telling it not to absorb spiritual energy for the time being.

Zhang Yu also felt that the spiritual energy absorbed by his Great Sun Sea of Qi from the light was more concentrated. Practicing breathing exercises here for one day was probably equivalent to several days of practice outside.

Bai Zhenzhen, on the other hand, patted her chest in fear and said, "This damn place makes it too easy to go bankrupt. Let's meet Xiong Wenwu and get out of here quickly."

Zhang Yu nodded. Staying in this spiritual energy reserve felt more dangerous to him than being in the middle of a gang fight.

_Just breathing and practicing at the outer areas is this expensive. How much would it cost to go to a real spirit vein?_

At this moment, he felt doubtful about whether he could rent a spot on a spirit vein this time.

Especially when he opened the map, he saw that there were a total of three spirit veins in this reserve, running through 7 large areas and more than twenty mountains, but they were all inaccessible to tourists. They were either private territories that had been leased out for a long time, or various pastures, factories, and plantations...

It could be said that all the areas accessible to tourists were on the periphery of the spirit veins.

However, Zhang Yu couldn't even afford the price of long-term breathing and practice in this peripheral area.

"Sigh, ordinary tourists can only enter the reserve and leech off the periphery of the spirit veins to practice their breathing. There's no way to even get in."

At this point, Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen were no longer hoping to rent a spot on a spirit vein. He would be satisfied if he could find a way to leech off the air from the periphery of the spirit vein for a cheaper price.

"Let's go see Xiong Wenwu first and see what he has to say."

The place where Xiong Wenwu had arranged to meet them was the breeding base, a remote place located at the edge of the reserve.

The two of them followed the map all the way. As they passed each mountain peak, they could feel waves of spiritual energy shooting up into the sky from the peaks, which were blocked by layers of light curtains and formation arrays. The spiritual energy was so dense that it looked like it was about to rain spiritual energy.

In fact, Bai Zhenzhen and Zhang Yu did see a light rain falling from time to time on the mountain, and the spiritual energy in the rainwater was steaming, which made them secretly click their tongues in amazement.

These mountain peaks were the true locations of the spirit veins.

Unlike the tourist area where Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen were currently walking, which was just the peripheral area of the spirit veins, where they could absorb a little of the air and spiritual energy leaking from above.

Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen couldn't imagine what the people on the mountain were doing, that they needed to absorb such a huge amount of spiritual energy, and how much money they were spending every second.

And below the mountain peak, on the side of the tourist area, outside the light curtain that separated the tourists.

Zhang Yu would occasionally see all sorts of poor people carrying oxygen tanks and water bottles, clinging to the foot of the mountain like small fish attached to a whale, absorbing the spiritual energy overflowing from the spirit veins to achieve a cultivation efficiency far exceeding that of the outside world.

No... Zhang Yu denied the thought that had just popped into his head.

_These are not poor people at all. To be able to leech off the foot of the mountain and practice, according to the charges here... they are all rich people to us._

_There are so many damn rich people in Kunxu._

Bai Zhenzhen at the side said, "We should have brought oxygen tanks too. Breathing here is too uneconomical."

Zhang Yu nodded in deep agreement.

Ten minutes later, the two finally arrived at the so-called breeding base.

--

# Chapter 136: The Breeding Base

From the outside, this place looked like a huge factory, completely sealed off from the outside.

And if tourists wanted to visit, they would have to spend another 200 yuan to buy a ticket.

Bai Zhenzhen thought to herself, _Damn it... could Xiong Wenwu be trying to boost his sales performance, so he deliberately set the meeting place here?_

Although they were unhappy, Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen still spent 400 to buy two tickets and walked into the breeding base.

The moment they entered, the feeling of transparency throughout their bodies, where every breath cleansed their bodies, that they had just experienced in the reserve, disappeared.

In its place was a dry, bitter air.

Zhang Yu said in surprise, "The breeding base isn't connected to the reserve's air? Is this the air we normally breathe?"

Bai Zhenzhen sighed in her heart, "The demonic beasts in this reserve can't even get a few mouthfuls of the air their ancestors breathed."

Just then, a deep voice rang out, "Long time no see, Zhang Yu, Bai Zhenzhen."

Zhang Yu turned his head and saw a tall figure already waiting for them; it was Xiong Wenwu from Red Pagoda High School.

Seeing the two looking over, Xiong Wenwu said, "Let's talk while we look around. Can't waste the ticket money."

Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen followed him to the first stop of the breeding base—the incubation room.

On both sides of the corridor, in row after row of transparent rooms, were all sorts of different types of demonic beasts. The only thing they had in common was that these demonic beasts were all incubating what looked like dragon eggs.

However, half of the rooms seemed to be empty and were not in use.

"So this is a demonic beast breeding base."

Bai Zhenzhen looked at the various demonic beasts in the incubation room as if she were at a zoo, and suddenly pointed to a bear and said, "Haha, Xiong Wenwu, look, doesn't that bear look like you before your transformation?"

Xiong Wenwu looked at incubation room number 33, where a huge demonic bear was lying on the ground, sleeping and snoring.

Xiong Wenwu said flatly, "That's my mom."

"Huh?" Bai Zhenzhen's mind went blank.

Xiong Wenwu looked at the two of them and said, "The breeding base will find suitable mothers from among the demonic beasts, and then sow true dragon bloodlines to create offspring containing the dragon bloodline."

"I heard they used to use incubators directly, but later the company decided that demonic beast mothers were cheaper, and the breeding base's output didn't need to be too high, so in the end, they found us real mothers."

"After all, there are plenty of demonic beasts in the reserve, so it's very convenient to catch them."

Xiong Wenwu looked at the demonic beast in the incubation room and said flatly, "Although she is my mother, she is just a demonic beast with little intelligence, and she doesn't recognize me anymore."

Having never encountered such a conversation before, Bai Zhenzhen and Zhang Yu were both stunned and didn't know what to say.

In silence, the three of them came to the newborn area.

In incubator after incubator were demon-kin infants of various different appearances.

Some were fast asleep, some were looking outside with wide eyes, and some were being injected in the back with a syringe and were wailing loudly.

Xiong Wenwu said flatly, "The infants here will continuously receive injections of various enhancers. Those who cannot withstand the medicinal power will be eliminated..."

Then there was the study room, where demon-kin infants were seriously watching a screen. What was playing was the nursery version of Red Pagoda Husbandry's new employee training, which taught how to care for the company as if it were home.

Bai Zhenzhen exclaimed in shock, "They're actually getting a damn nursery version of employee training?"

Zhang Yu nodded slightly, thinking that this Red Pagoda Husbandry was too ridiculous.

But then Bai Zhenzhen continued, "They have a job right from birth? A lot of people on the outside would be envious of that treatment, wouldn't they?"

Xiong Wenwu said with a somewhat proud tone, "The company will provide a job for every demon-kin born in the breeding base. They can receive employee training from a young age and be instilled with the company spirit."

"Because of this, every year there are mortals who come to protest, wanting to send their own children into the breeding base to study with us."

Walking a few steps further, they saw a group of demon-kin infants doing exercises while shouting slogans: Hand in hand, we create the future together. The light of a father's love shines on you and me.

In front of them was a portrait of a Black Dragon, who seemed to be the school director of Red Pagoda High School.

As they continued on, they could see that the demon-kin were getting older and older. From employee training to general education, and after rounds of exams and streaming, more and more demon-kin were assigned to work to repay their breeding debts, and the number of demon-kin who remained to continue their studies became smaller and smaller.

Xiong Wenwu continued, "Originally, a large number of demon-kin could be produced here every year. They would either study hard, get into university, and become valuable assets for Red Pagoda Husbandry."

"Or they would be directly streamed to work in the company, conscientiously becoming the cornerstone of Red Pagoda Husbandry."

"But since the introduction of new technology from Oasis Group, the company has decided to change its business direction. A large number of pastures and factories have been acquired by Oasis Group, and this breeding base will probably be phased out soon."

Xiong Wenwu knew that for the demon-kin who had lived and worked here all their lives, leaving Red Pagoda... was more terrifying than going to work in a factory.

However, as a mere first-year high school student, he couldn't change anything. The only thing he could do was to try to take care of the people he cared about.

Walking and stopping along the way, the three of them came to the finishing room.

In the rooms on both sides of the corridor, seventeen-year-old demon-kin were studying at their desks.

They wore shock collars around their necks to keep them awake and relieve fatigue.

The chains on their feet were connected to their desks, representing their determination to study wherever they went.

The feeder in front of them had an automatic feeding function, which would automatically feed them after they completed a piece of homework as required.

Xiong Wenwu looked at this scene, a trace of nostalgia flashing across his face, and said, "This is for studying the three years of high school general knowledge courses, in preparation for the breeding base's middle school graduation exam."

"After all, whether they can enter high school next year will determine whether they will study or work in the future, so everyone is very serious about their studies."

Zhang Yu thought to himself... _Damn it, if they don't study, they'll starve, won't they?_

Recalling what he had seen and heard after entering the reserve, Zhang Yu couldn't help but sigh in his heart, _This company really... squeezes every last drop out of people, and then grinds them under its heel for good measure._

As they reached the latter part of the tour, Xiong Wenwu brought up the matter of the spirit vein.

"In the breeding base's incubation room, in order to ensure the growth of the infants and the true dragon bloodline, a spirit vein pipe has been introduced, which has air and high concentrations of spiritual energy from within the spirit vein."

"But only the incubation room has this condition, so someone needs to arrange for you to sneak in."

Bai Zhenzhen asked in surprise, "Won't we be discovered?"

Xiong Wenwu at the side shook his head. "Most of the breeding base is automated, and there is only one person in charge. As long as this person agrees, no one will find out about you leeching off the spirit vein."

Zhang Yu pointed to the meter on his body and asked, "What about this?"

Xiong Wenwu said, "The breeding base is at the edge of the reserve. There is a material transport channel to the outside here. I have already cleared the way and confirmed that there are no problems. Next time, I will bring you in directly through that channel."

Only then did Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen notice that Xiong Wenwu didn't seem to have any meters on him at all.

Xiong Wenwu reminded them again, "But if you come in through that channel, you can only stay in the breeding base. Don't go out. The reserve's surveillance methods are too numerous; you will definitely be discovered."

Zhang Yu asked again, "Then what's the price?"

Xiong Wenwu said, "8,000 an hour."

Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen looked at each other, both feeling that this price was not expensive.

After all, according to the prices in the reserve outside, with their constitutions, just breathing for an hour without practicing would cost several thousand, not to mention that this was air and dense spiritual energy from a spirit vein.

Bai Zhenzhen asked again, "Why did you choose to deal with us?"

"I asked around, you two are very poor, right?" Xiong Wenwu smiled. "I don't trust people who are too rich. And you two are the only ones who are this poor and still have designs on a spirit vein, and who came to ask me about it... so I don't really have a choice."

Xiong Wenwu continued, "Now there's one last problem, which is that the only employee of this breeding base may not agree to this deal."

"The person I'm taking you to see in a moment is her."

"So I need you to cooperate with me to talk to her."

"Just follow my instructions..."

Hearing Xiong Wenwu's instructions, strange expressions appeared on Zhang Yu's and Bai Zhenzhen's faces.

Arriving at the final souvenir sales area, besides things like employee training manuals, the breeding base's special test papers, a replica shock collar, and various demon-kin dolls, Zhang Yu's gaze also swept over various beast bones, beast blood, and demonic beast meat.

Although demonic beasts had always been treated as animals, completely different from demon-kin, seeing these things here still made Zhang Yu feel a little awkward.

Arriving at the souvenir counter, Xiong Wenwu smiled and greeted, "Sis, I've come to see you."

This was the first time Zhang Yu had seen Xiong Wenwu's barbaric face smile so happily.

But looking at the small panda behind the counter, Zhang Yu's face still showed a look of confusion. However, thinking that the demon-kin of Red Pagoda High School always addressed each other as brothers and sisters, it didn't seem so strange.

Xiong Wenwu said to Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen, "This is my sister, An'an. When I was young, if she hadn't helped me learn to read, I might have been eliminated long ago."

"She has some opportunities to leech off the spirit vein here that she can introduce to you."

But the small panda behind the counter didn't seem to agree with what Xiong Wenwu said.

She raised her hands high, her face flushed with anger, and said, "Xiong Wenwu! What are you doing! I told you I would not betray the company's interests!"

Hearing this, Xiong Wenwu sighed in his heart, a trace of helplessness flashing across his face.

# Chapter 137: High School Ends, Pianpian Departs

Xiong Wenwu knew that the conservation area was a relatively insular place.

And the breeding base within the conservation area was even more isolated.

The demon-kin employees here were born here, grew up here, and died here…

An'an, the young woman before him, was vastly different from him, who had already completed his first year of high school.

Because An'an had failed the streaming exam at age six, she had been left to work at the breeding base since she was a child.

Though, as a result of this, An'an had worked and grown up at the base, which allowed her to help Xiong Wenwu later on.

But with over twenty years of work experience and long-term company training, she had become an exemplary employee of Red Pagoda, elected as the conservation area's employee of the year for eight consecutive years.

Her award poster read: My favorite thing is working for the company!

My most hated days are in February, because I can only work twenty-eight days that month!

The thing I care least about is my salary! I am willing to lessen the company's burden and be the first in the conservation area to take a pay cut!

My creed is not to compete with money, not to compete with connections, but to compete with my life!

"I have been the conservation area's best employee for eight consecutive years!"

An'an looked at Xiong Wenwu as if he were a rebellious son, pointing at the eight best-employee certificates behind her as she said furiously, "You actually want me to exploit a company loophole to help them freeload off a spirit vein?"

She was so incensed that she rushed forward and slapped Xiong Wenwu hard with her claws.

Xiong Wenwu dared not retaliate and could only continue to persuade her,

"Sis! The breeding base is about to be shut down, and the company is going to package you up and sell you to the Oasis Group!"

"Whoever the company sells me to, they must have their reasons. I will simply follow the arrangements."

Xiong Wenwu said, "The Oasis Group doesn't treat its demon-kin employees as well as Red Pagoda Husbandry. They'll use you for experiments."

An'an was skeptical. "The manager said that after I go to the Oasis Group, I will still be assigned to work at a breeding base. He wouldn't lie to me."

Xiong Wenwu sighed, knowing that in An'an's eyes, he had less credibility than the conservation area's manager.

With a thud, Xiong Wenwu's massive form dropped to its knees.

"Sis, please help me."

Seeing Xiong Wenwu in such a state, An'an's imposing manner instantly deflated, and she asked, at a loss, "You! You! What are you doing? Did you do poorly on your monthly exam? Or can you not repay your loans?"

Xiong Wenwu said in a low voice, "Sis, I'm about to be culled."

An'an exclaimed, "What? You… didn't you do well on the last few monthly exams? How could…"

Xiong Wenwu explained, "It's because my performance in the competition was abysmal. If I continue to do this poorly, the master will have me culled and sent to an inferior class."

He pointed to Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen beside him and said, "If you don't believe me, ask them. They were the ones who defeated me in the competition and got me eliminated."

Seeing the signal in Xiong Wenwu's eyes, Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen exchanged a look and gave a curt nod, acknowledging the matter.

Xiong Wenwu looked at the bewildered An'an and continued, "Sis, they said that if I arrange an opportunity for them to perform breathing exercises by the spirit vein, not only will they let me win the next competition, but they'll also tutor me for free to improve my grades."

"Sis, I'm begging you. I don't want to be culled by the master. I want to achieve a better rank in the competition. Will you help me?"

"If you don't believe me, here are the news reports and videos from the competition. Take a look…"

An'an first went online to check the information on the competition, then watched a video of Xiong Wenwu bleeding profusely after being beaten by Bai Zhenzhen in the martial arts event. In the athletics competition, he fought until his muscles tore, yet he still lost to Zhang Yu…

The little panda, An'an, turned to Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen, pressed her paws together in a gesture of supplication, and said, "How much money do you want? I'll pay it for him. He worked so incredibly hard to get into high school, and he has a chance to attend a university…"

Zhang Yu chuckled. "Ten thousand an hour."

An'an's face went pale at his words. As a demon-kin who hadn't even attended high school or begun cultivating, her monthly salary was a mere two thousand.

Bai Zhenzhen added from the side, "If you can't afford it, then let us use the spirit vein. For every hour we use it, we'll give him an hour of tutoring when we leave."

Xiong Wenwu pleaded, "Sis! I want to be tutored! I want to stay in high school and test into a university! I don't want to end up working in a factory. I'm begging you, please help me!"

An'an, the little panda, gritted her teeth. Looking at the kneeling Xiong Wenwu, she finally let out a long sigh. "Fine."

At that moment, An'an felt as though her corporate identity and spirit had been shattered, that she had failed the certificates hanging on the wall.

…

The next day, led by Xiong Wenwu and An'an, Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen entered the breeding base through a supply transport tunnel and arrived at a room in the incubation chamber.

The moment he stepped into the incubation chamber, Zhang Yu felt an incredibly fresh wave of air rush over him, cleansing his body from head to toe. It even felt as if his very soul had been washed, leaving him with a sense of blissful ecstasy.

"Is this air from a spirit vein? It's far more pleasant than even the air in the conservation area."

He took a deep breath, feeling the spiritual energy churn within him, greedily absorbed by every inch of his flesh.

But after briefly circulating his Great Sun Sea of Qi technique, he looked at the surrounding light sources, and a hint of disappointment appeared in his eyes.

Xiong Wenwu asked from the side, "Is there another problem?"

"Are there any light sources here? We need more light for our cultivation."

"Light?" Xiong Wenwu thought for a moment. "Would an incubation lamp work? They're used to warm dragon eggs."

And so, with An'an reluctantly leading the way, Zhang Yu and Xiong Wenwu moved more than a dozen incubation lamps into the room.

As the lamps switched on, Zhang Yu felt as if a dozen small suns had appeared before him. Under the intense glare, the surrounding spiritual energy seemed to converge and shine upon his body, causing the Great Sun mana within him to surge violently.

Fu Ji, residing in Zhang Yu's chest, analyzed, "These aren't ordinary lamps. They're meant for incubating dragon eggs. The light has been processed by some form of Immortal Dao technology and seems to be more effective at concentrating spiritual energy."

With the combined effects of the spirit vein and the incubation lamps, the True Spiritual Root began its breathing exercise in unison with the Great Sun Sea of Qi…

The Great Sun mana inside him erupted like a volcano, roaring as it surged back and forth through his body.

Zhang Yu felt the surrounding spiritual energy swarm toward him, creating the illusion that he was soaking in a pool of pure spiritual energy.

His breathing exercise efficiency continued to rise! And rise! And rise again! It finally reached a plateau, unable to increase any further.

"So this is the true, full-power effect of the breathing technique when combined with a spirit vein, a spiritual root, and a level ten, mid-stage Qi Refinement breathing method."

Zhang Yu felt that only now was he truly performing a breathing exercise, truly cultivating. By comparison, everything he had done before was like inhaling car exhaust.

But on second thought, for the students of a key high school, mana was something that could be systematically raised to the limit of one hundred over a few years.

Yet now, in order to reach a third-year's level by the end of his first year, he and Bai Zhenzhen had to expend a great deal of effort and money.

Just then, Bai Zhenzhen, who was beside him, said, "Yu-boy, hurry up and give me the spiritual root. I want to try, too."

After the True Spiritual Root was withdrawn, Zhang Yu felt his breathing exercise speed plummet by thirty or forty percent, and a wave of disappointment washed over him.

_It seems Zhen and I will have to come separately from now on…_

So, Zhang Yu let Bai Zhenzhen remain to cultivate, deciding he would come back next time.

On the way out, Zhang Yu curiously asked Xiong Wenwu, "The money you asked us for—you're planning to use it to help An'an, aren't you?"

Xiong Wenwu was silent for a moment before replying, "I want to help her pay off her breeding debt so she can leave this place. That way, she won't have to worry about being sold to the Oasis Group in the future."

In the days that followed, the cultivation of Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen advanced by leaps and bounds, with both their physical strength and mana climbing steadily.

Although their Dao hearts didn't experience the same explosive growth, they too were improving at a stable pace.

Zhang Yu's only regret was that there was still no news from Yu Xinghan about the Spirit Realm. He had said they would have to wait until after the university entrance exams, when a large number of third-year students graduated, before any spots would become available.

…

In the blink of an eye, time had flown to early June.

The university entrance exam was tomorrow.

This also meant that the day of Zhang Pianpian's departure was drawing ever closer.

As the exam approached, the atmosphere within Songyang High School grew increasingly tense. The status of the third-year students soared; a single glance from them was enough to make first and second-year students give them a wide berth.

Even the normally stern teachers now spoke to the third-years with gentle words, fearing any mishap before the crucial exam.

During this period, although the effectiveness of any training method would inevitably diminish as his stats increased, Zhang Yu had still made progress.

By the time June arrived, his physical strength had risen to 5.99, his mana had grown to 60.2, and his Dao heart had reached level 5 (25%).

However, with his increased food and alchemical enhancer consumption, on top of his expenses at the conservation area, his savings were dwindling faster than ever. Even with the income from tutoring and sparring, his funds had now dropped to just over 120,000.

And as far as he knew, Bai Zhenzhen's income was even lower than his; her savings were on the verge of being depleted.

These days, Zhang Yu often found himself sighing inwardly, _The path of the Immortal Dao is truly a drain on one's finances._

_But thankfully, the money hasn't been wasted. I'm getting closer and closer to the standards of a new White Dragon third-year: a level six Dao heart, over seventy units of mana, and a physical strength of over 7.5._

_I should be able to reach all of those within the next two months._

But Zhang Yu also knew that with Zhang Pianpian's departure, he would soon have to face even greater challenges.

…

Three days later, not long after the university entrance exam concluded, Zhang Yu received a call from Zhang Pianpian.

"I'll be leaving soon."

"After I'm gone, the safest thing for you two to do is stay in the city and at the school."

"But you and I both know that's impossible."

Zhang Yu nodded slightly. Since they had to take the Foundation Establishment exam, they couldn't possibly remain in Songyang City or at the school indefinitely.

Zhang Pianpian continued, "The other wealthy individuals pose no immediate threat. For now, the ones with the deepest animosity toward you are Zhou Chechen and Lan Ling."

"You two must be careful after I'm gone."

# Chapter 138: Farewell to Zhang Pianpian, Registration Begins

Zhang Yu listened to the various instructions coming from Zhang Pianpian on the other end of the line.

He would nod from time to time, murmuring his assent.

"The Ten Great Sects have established an ironclad rule: To maintain order and the business environment on each level, travel between the various levels of Kunxu is forbidden."

"To return, one must either be like True Monarch Xinghuo, returning in disgrace with greatly diminished cultivation and shrunken assets after countless setbacks."

"Or one must have a specially assigned mission or job, like the Immortal Resonance Group's Songyang Director, relegated to this level to warm the bench."

"But both of those are merely the outcomes of being eliminated while climbing higher… I refuse to accept that."

"Brother, I want to climb. I want to ascend to the highest reaches of Kunxu and see the scenery from above."

"Therefore, my gaze will only be fixed upward; I will not look back."

"If we are to meet again in the future, it can only be up there, never on the first level of Kunxu."

Zhang Yu clenched his fist and said to Zhang Pianpian on the other end of the line, "Sis, I will definitely catch up to you!"

Zhang Pianpian laughed. "Then I will wait for you at Myriad Laws University."

Zhang Yu then asked, "Since moving between levels is so difficult, do you have anything you won't need that you can leave for me?"

Zhang Pianpian replied, "I still have over twenty million in debt…"

"Let's forget about that," Zhang Yu said righteously. "Something so personal, you had better keep it with you."

"I mean, do you have anything you can't take with you? Like a house, a car, or anything else of value?"

Pfft! Bai Zhenzhen, standing nearby, couldn't help but laugh. It felt like she was listening to a dutiful grandson asking his ascending grandmother for his inheritance.

"I've left three talismans for you."

Zhang Yu looked at the three images she had sent. Each was a screenshot of a talisman, but the contents were so complex that he couldn't decipher what kind of talismans they were.

A question also arose in his mind, "Can screenshots even be used?"

Zhang Pianpian explained, "These three are a Freezing Talisman, which can freeze someone's bank account, though the higher their faith level, the shorter the duration of the freeze."

"There is also a Thunderclap Talisman, which sounds a thunderous alarm and summons an armed patrol team to enforce the law within one minute. But remember, the minimum charge for using this is ten thousand, so make sure you have the funds in your account before you use it."

"And finally, there is a Godspeed Talisman. It can summon a minor earth god to serve as your transport, allowing you to escape in an instant up to a maximum distance of ten kilometers. But remember, this one charges three thousand per kilometer, deducted directly from your account, so calculate the cost before using it."

Zhang Yu's eyes lit up as he listened; these three talismans sounded incredibly useful.

Zhang Pianpian said coolly, "I will also send you the phone number of a captain in the Songyang City patrol team. I have entrusted the talismans to her."

"Add her as a friend. When you need to use one of the talismans, just send the image to her, and she will activate it for you."

"Also, if you run into a problem you can't solve on your own, you can go to her for help."

Here, Zhang Pianpian paused as if considering something, before finally adding, "If you need a slightly higher-level identity in the divine ministries for cover, she can help arrange a promotion. You can discuss the specifics with her."

"But if she offers you a promotion, remember to go no higher than a special assistant."

"Also, you must remember never to meet her alone at night."

"And continue to work as an external contractor. Do not, under any circumstances, sign a formal contract."

"Don't worry about the loan, either. Just continue to make payments slowly according to the contract."

"You should still focus on using your money for self-improvement. It's fine to be a little more in debt; often, the amount of debt one carries is a reflection of their strength."
