"As for the Foundation Establishment exam registration, you have to be in the Immortal Capital to open the registration website. I've never taken it, so you'll have to adapt to the situation as it unfolds…"

And so, Zhang Pianpian patiently went over various matters with Zhang Yu, one by one, and he listened with great concentration.

Only at the very end did she say slowly, "We have no foundation on the first level of Kunxu. Remember, never go around causing trouble and invoking my name."

"After I'm gone, be as tolerant as you can. If you manage to earn your Foundation Establishment qualification, you must be even more discreet."

Zhang Yu felt a bead of sweat form on his forehead.

_Really, sis? Do I look like the kind of person who throws his weight around and stirs up trouble?_

"Don't worry, sis. Just wait for me at Myriad Laws University. I'll come find you in two years."

After hanging up, Zhang Yu suddenly felt a sense of emptiness, as if a guardian who had always protected him was ascending to the heavens, leaving him to face the world alone.

_Sigh, I should first prepare for the Foundation Establishment exam registration._

Zhang Yu picked up his phone and called his class advisor, Su Haifeng, directly.

"Hey? Old Su, Bai Zhenzhen and I need to request two days of leave."

"This is something Senior Zhang Pianpian asked me and Bai Zhenzhen to help her with before she left."

"We can't even take this leave?"

"Then my only choice is to tell her, and let Senior Zhang go to the ascension platform with regrets."

"Mm, thanks, Old Su."

…

Time flew by, and soon it was the day before the Foundation Establishment exam registration.

Today was also the day Zhang Pianpian would step onto the ascension platform and officially depart.

Night.

Songyang City, Intercity Train Station.

Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen were sitting together in the waiting hall, anticipating the high-speed train to Tiantai City.

The reason they had booked a train to Tiantai City, rather than one directly to the Immortal Capital, was simply because they did not wish to reveal their final destination.

At that moment, Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen were continuing to seize every moment to perform their breathing exercises.

Over the past few days, Zhang Yu's stats had improved once again; his mana had increased to 61.4, and his physical strength had reached level 6.08.

But his funds had also dwindled further.

This was especially true during the university entrance exam period, when controls throughout Songyang City had become exceedingly strict, and patrol officers were a common sight on the streets near the high schools.

Not only were outsiders barred from entering the major high schools, but even the Dark Learning Gang had suspended their tutoring activities, causing Zhang Yu to lose a significant source of income.

Zhang Yu could only sigh. The university entrance exam was tied to university admissions, to the quotas for ascending to the second level, and to the futures of countless individuals and families. It was indeed a matter of the utmost importance, putting the entire city of Songyang on high alert.

Consequently, his savings had dropped to 50,000 in just a few days.

_I still need to find a way to earn money. After I get back from registration… perhaps I can expand my business in the dark world of tutoring?_

A little over an hour later, Zhang Yu's phone vibrated faintly. He had received a message from Zhang Pianpian.

Zhang Pianpian: I'm off.

Immediately after, her profile picture turned gray. Zhang Yu knew that, aside from a few special methods of communication, he would be unable to contact his sister again until he ascended to the second level of Kunxu.

At this thought, threads of loss once again welled up in his heart.

_The next time we meet will probably be in two years._

_Good thing I still have Zhen._

He turned to look at Bai Zhenzhen, who was beside him, shoveling down a bucket of synthetic food.

"Zhen? Why did you eat my portion too?"

"You were just staring at your phone in a daze. I thought you weren't going to eat it."

Zhang Yu grumbled, "You little…"

Not long after, upon arriving in Tiantai City, Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen boarded another train bound for a different city.

More than ten hours passed in a flash.

…

The train sped across the land.

Zhang Yu glanced at Zhen beside him and saw her pressed against the window, exclaiming, "Yu-boy, look at that!"

In the distance, a dense, endless cityscape stretched from the earth to the sky.

That was their destination: the Immortal Capital.

High above the Immortal Capital, white and golden auspicious clouds spread out like continents and islands. Upon them, one could see countless immortal palaces and divine halls, as well as innumerable skyscrapers piercing the cloud layer, resembling a city in the sky.

And beneath this celestial metropolis lay the earth, perpetually shrouded in shadow, with its dense clusters of buildings and the constant flicker of neon lights in the darkness.

A young man sat not far from Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen. He pointed to the city in the sky and asked, "Uncle, have you ever been to the Upper City?"

The old man sitting next to the youth, his face a roadmap of wrinkles, glanced at the spectacle of the Immortal Capital with an air of indifference.

"Aye, I worked up there when I was young. Back then, the Upper City was just a few floating islands. Later, it got bigger and bigger, the clouds got thicker and thicker, and now the rich folk call it Kunxu's one-and-a-half level."

"It gets more and more prosperous up there, while down here in the Lower City… the cloudy days just kept getting more frequent, until it ended up like this, night all day long."

The young man said, "With no daylight at all, isn't it miserable to stay here?"

The old man scoffed, "As long as there's money to be made, what difference does day or night make? Kid, let me tell you, in the Immortal Capital, even begging is better than working in a factory in any other city."

As the train slowly came to a halt at a station in the Lower City, Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen felt a wave of damp coldness wash over them the moment they disembarked.

Looking up, they could only see the roiling sea of clouds that was the ceiling of the Upper City.

But what appeared as white and golden auspicious clouds from the outside was, from below, nothing but a pitch-black mass, like dark storm clouds in constant, turbulent motion.

_Is it because the undersides of the clouds are completely blocked from the sun by the Upper City's buildings and roads?_

_This is seriously oppressive,_ Zhang Yu thought to himself. _If I had to stay here for long, it would be inconvenient to cultivate the Great Sun Sea of Qi._

The two didn't wander far. They remained in the station, found an empty corner, and opened the registration website as Zhang Pianpian had instructed.

They had tried to open this website in the past, but it had always been a blank page, devoid of information.

Now, standing within the Immortal Capital, the website finally displayed something, but it was merely a countdown timer.

"It hasn't started yet?"

The two decided to wander around the station. Seeing lunch boxes for a hundred yuan, water for ten yuan a bottle, and a pair of stockings priced at fifty million, they both lamented the exorbitant cost of living.

Suddenly, Bai Zhenzhen pointed at the fifty-million-yuan white stockings and said, "Yu-boy, that's actually an external spiritual root."

"Mm."

Bai Zhenzhen continued, "If you wore those, you would have a spiritual root too."

Zhang Yu rolled his eyes. "If anyone's wearing them, it'll be you. Then you can give the True Spiritual Root to me."

"Fine by me. Just remember to buy them for me in the future."

Zhang Yu had no illusions that he could ever afford such an expensive external spiritual root, but he replied casually, "When I'm rich, I'll buy you seven pairs in seven different colors, one for each day of the week…"

As the two continued their idle wandering, the countdown for the registration finally reached zero.

They looked at the instructions that appeared: "Find a space with no surveillance, no outsiders, and where you are completely alone. Then, click confirm."

# Chapter 139: Exam Reforms, the Foundation Establishment Test

A moment later, Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen had each found their way into a stall in the men's and women's restrooms. They took out their phones and tapped the confirmation button on the webpage.

The screen flickered, and a "Kunxu First Level High School Student Foundation Establishment Exam Registration Form" appeared.

Zhang Yu silently filled in his details and clicked "Register."

_Registration fee: 1,000. Please confirm._

Zhang Yu cursed under his breath but tapped "Confirm" anyway.

As one thousand yuan was instantly deducted from his bank account, ripples of divine power permeated the air.

The next moment, Zhang Yu felt the ground beneath him vanish. A large hole had appeared in the restroom floor, and he was falling through it.

_What the hell!_

Once Zhang Yu's figure had completely disappeared, the floor returned to normal, leaving no trace that he had ever been there.

…

Zhang Yu felt his body pass through countless strange and indescribable dimensions.

When he came to his senses, he found himself standing in an office. A middle-aged woman sat before him, looking at him calmly.

"Here to register for the Foundation Establishment exam?"

Zhang Yu sensed a faint trace of divine power emanating from her. 

_Is she human? Or a god?_

After Zhang Yu nodded, the woman handed him a contract.

"The registration fee is thirty thousand. And here are the rules you must abide by for the exam."

"Once you've paid the fee and signed this contract under the witness of the Heavenly Covenant God, you cannot violate any of the exam rules. If you do, you will be barred from ever taking the Foundation Establishment exam again."

The middle-aged woman added, "And once you've signed the contract, no outsider will be able to discover that you have participated in this exam."

"Also, if you withdraw midway through, the registration fee will not be refunded."

The thought of a thirty-thousand-yuan registration fee made Zhang Yu's heart ache.

Including the train tickets and the initial registration fee, his remaining balance was now just over ten thousand.

_I wonder if Zhen has enough money. If not, she'll probably have to take out a loan just to register,_ he thought with an inward sigh, lowering his head to carefully read the contract.

The contract was filled with regulations, such as prohibitions on disclosing any specific details about the exam, revealing information about other candidates, or recording or photographing the exam site.

In addition, there was a warning in the contract, which the woman before him reiterated.

"The Foundation Establishment exam is held in high regard by the Heavenly Court and is organized by the Ten Great Sects to select talented individuals capable of achieving Foundation Establishment."

"Don't even think about any tricks or underhanded schemes."

"If you are discovered by the Eight Ministries of Righteous Gods, both the candidate and any related parties will be severely punished. The lightest penalty is financial ruin; the most severe is the severing of one's path to immortality and the stripping of all cultivation potential…"

Zhang Yu nodded slightly. He understood this was a warning against cheating or attempting to eliminate competitors through external means.

After meticulously reading through all the rules and asking a few clarifying questions, Zhang Yu signed the contract under the watchful gaze of the Heavenly Covenant God and, with a heavy heart, paid the thirty thousand yuan registration fee.

Once she confirmed there were no issues with the contract, the middle-aged woman continued, "Alright, registration is complete. Next up is the placement test."

"We need to test your basic abilities to screen out some of the weaker contestants and avoid wasting exam resources."

With that, she affixed candidate number 55 to Zhang Yu's shirt.

Hearing her words, however, Zhang Yu's heart sank. Zhang Pianpian had never mentioned anything about a test during registration.

Zhang Yu asked, "I thought today was just for registration?"

The woman replied casually, "There are reforms to the Foundation Establishment exam this year. This is a new addition."

Zhang Yu complained, "But didn't they say the first round wouldn't start until August?"

"There are still two months left. I have a lot of room for growth. A test now can't possibly measure my true strength."

The woman said impatiently, "Are you going or not? If not, I can send you away right now, but the registration fee is non-refundable."

Zhang Yu sighed in resignation. "Where is the test?"

The woman pointed to a large door behind Zhang Yu. "The testing area is through that door."

Zhang Yu opened the door and walked through. When he turned back, he saw that the doorway had vanished, leaving only a seamless white wall in its place.

He proceeded down the corridor and soon arrived in a large hall.

At the far end of the hall stood a massive metal door, in front of which a group of people had gathered, seemingly observing something.

As Zhang Yu drew closer, he spotted a familiar face engrossed in his phone.

Yu Xinghan was replying to a message from Li Xuelian: 'Transfer me 100,000.'

Li Xuelian: 'Are you sure you need 100,000?'

Yu Xinghan: 'I can't disclose the specifics of the expenses, you understand, but I need 100,000 to proceed.'

Li Xuelian: 'I understand. A non-disclosure agreement, right?'

Seeing the 100,000 yuan transfer from Li Xuelian, Yu Xinghan couldn't help but smile. "The Foundation Establishment exam is truly wonderful."

He thought to himself, _Besides the Dao of saving money, the most crucial thing for advancing on the path of immortality is the Dao of acquiring money. One cannot go far without mastering it._

Yu Xinghan suddenly thought of Zhang Yu. _A pity, Zhang Yu. Although I taught you the Dao of saving money, I cannot teach you the Dao of acquiring money._

_After all, you don't have a Golden Core master like I do._

_If anyone is to blame, it's our master for being too poor. He can't afford to raise us both, so he can only choose to cultivate the stronger one…_

Just then, Yu Xinghan looked up and saw the familiar figure who had suddenly appeared before him, and he froze for a moment.

He rubbed his eyes and looked again, saying in astonishment, "Zhang Yu? What are you doing here?"

Zhang Yu glanced at the candidate number on the other's chest and smiled faintly.

"I'm here to take the Foundation Establishment exam. Aren't you?" 

Having read the rules and confirmed them on the spot, Zhang Yu knew that the regulations restricted disclosure to the outside world and prevented external forces from interfering with the exam. However, just like in any other competition, it didn't prohibit the contestants from getting to know each other.

In fact, judging by the current setup, Zhang Yu strongly suspected that this exam encouraged interaction among contestants to heighten the competition.

"You!" Yu Xinghan stared at Zhang Yu in disbelief. He was initially startled, worried that an acquaintance had discovered his participation in the exam. But he quickly realized that Zhang Yu was also a candidate, and he relaxed. Still, he couldn't comprehend how the other boy was here. How could he possibly be here?

This was a gathering of the most elite high school students from the first level, a competition among the strongest. It was a channel that only a disciple of a Golden Core True Monarch like himself should know about. How had this pauper gotten in?

_His talent is good, and his grades are good… but he's still a pauper! A pauper whose backer, Zhang Pianpian, has already left, no less._

Just then, Bai Zhenzhen also walked up to Zhang Yu's side. She patted him on the shoulder, then looked at Yu Xinghan in surprise.

"Oh? You're here too?"

_How is Bai Zhenzhen here as well?_ Yu Xinghan was beginning to suspect he had come to the wrong place.

At that moment, a red envelope suddenly came fluttering down, landing at the feet of the three.

Yu Xinghan had hesitated for a mere tenth of a second, but in that instant, Zhang Yu had already stomped on the envelope, crouched down, and reached for it…

But the envelope was like a phantom, dissipating as soon as Zhang Yu touched it.

Yu Xinghan chuckled. "That envelope was obviously fake…"

Zhang Yu pulled out his vibrating phone, his eyes wide with surprise. "A thousand yuan was just deposited into my account! These envelopes transfer money directly?"

Yu Xinghan's face stiffened, and he instantly regretted his momentary hesitation.

Bai Zhenzhen gestured with her chin toward the front of the hall. 

"That guy over there is the one sending out the envelopes."

Ahead of them, a bare-chested young man was continuously practicing with talismans.

And as he practiced, red envelopes would occasionally leap from his Talisman Tome and land in the surrounding area.

The man's name was Ye Lingxiao. For the past half-month, he had neglected the cultivation of his physical body, the refinement of his mana, and the tempering of his Dao heart. Instead, he had been quietly engrossed in the study of talismans.

The reason he had focused most of his energy on talismans was twofold. First, after witnessing a certain woman's skill with them, he had developed a profound interest in the art.

Second, his body, mana, and Dao heart had all reached a point where they could advance no further, so he felt no need to spend time cultivating them. He was absolutely confident he would pass the Foundation Establishment exam.

Ye Lingxiao was considered to possess the most perfect physique and the most flawless bloodline among all the high school students on the first level of Kunxu.

This was both his own self-assessment and the evaluation given to him by the Oasis Group.

The talisman he was currently practicing was a 'Red Envelope Talisman,' which a woman had guided him to learn. Only by mastering this talisman could he advance to learning the more complex 'Favorability Talisman.'

As he was concentrating intently on his practice, a figure suddenly appeared beside him and said, "I've collected all of your red envelopes."

Ye Lingxiao looked up at Zhang Yu, a quizzical expression on his face. "Hm?"

Zhang Yu asked, "Are you just scattering money around? Why not just transfer it directly to my bank account?"

Hearing this, Ye Lingxiao shook his head. "I'm practicing the Red Envelope Talisman. Unfortunately, I have yet to achieve a breakthrough. The envelopes contain a maximum of one thousand yuan."

Zhang Yu's eyes lit up as he looked at Ye Lingxiao. _Is this what a scion of Kunxu's upper echelon is like? He even practices talismans by throwing money around?_

_Forget Yu Xinghan and Song Hailong… this good brother, whose name I don't even know yet, is a true friend._

Zhang Yu quickly patted his chest. "No problem. Just use me for your practice. Feel free!"

Watching this scene from the side, Yu Xinghan felt a flicker of admiration.

_It seems I was mistaken. Zhang Yu's Dao of acquiring money is already masterful, in no way inferior to my own._

With that thought, Yu Xinghan also walked up with a smile. "A'Yu, who is this good friend? You haven't introduced us."

"I hear you're practicing talismans? You can just use me."

Ye Lingxiao looked at the two before him strangely. "Are you sure?"

Zhang Yu exclaimed, "Absolutely sure!"

Yu Xinghan tried to push Zhang Yu aside, whispering, "You've already picked up a few thousand, haven't you? It's my turn now!"

Ye Lingxiao said nonchalantly, "You two are quite strange. No one has ever been willing to accept my Red Envelope Talisman. You're actually fighting over it. Don't you think the interest rate is a bit high?"

Hearing the ominous words 'interest rate,' Yu Xinghan's movements gradually slowed.

Zhang Yu was confused. "Interest rate?"

Ye Lingxiao explained, "The Red Envelope Talisman is a prerequisite for the Favorability Talisman."

"Those who accept this talisman are borrowing from their standby funds at the Ministry of Finance's bank."

"You son of a…" Zhang Yu roared, "Why are you throwing this garbage around? Have you no sense of public decency? Practicing such a malicious technique in public? What if it hits someone poor?"

"Oh? There are poor people here?" Ye Lingxiao asked in surprise. "I assumed no one here would bother to pick up money off the ground."

Zhang Yu was furious. He felt he had been insulted yet again.

Bai Zhenzhen reminded him from the side, "Yu-boy, hurry up and pay it back! You'll be charged interest if you're late!"

Zhang Yu quickly stepped aside, took out his phone, and logged in to the Ministry of Finance's bank website to repay the money.

Following Ye Lingxiao's explanation, the other candidates, who had been largely indifferent before, now silently distanced themselves from him, instantly creating a large empty circle around him.

Ye Lingxiao, however, remained unconcerned and continued to draw his talismans. A moment later, another red envelope leaped out and landed on the ground nearby.

But at that moment, another hand gently picked up the envelope. Yet, no matter how hard the hand squeezed or rubbed it, the envelope did not disappear.

This time, a look of genuine surprise appeared in Ye Lingxiao's eyes.

"The Red Envelope Talisman has no effect on you?"

(End of Chapter)

# Chapter 140: The Strongest Level

Ye Lingxiao looked toward the person who had taken his Red Envelope Talisman completely unscathed.

The newcomer was a slender man who, upon first glance, appeared surprisingly frail.

Beyond his frailness, what drew the most attention were his eyes, which shone like brilliant stars, as if one could see countless resplendent starbursts surging within them.

Watching this unfold from the side, a thought suddenly struck Zhang Yu. _Is that... an Arcane Frame?_

An Arcane Frame. He still remembered the first time he had seen one was on a Foundation Establishment expert, the director of Immortal Resonance's Group Songyang division. Zhao Tianxing had told him back then that implanting an Arcane Frame required at least 100 points of mana.

Among all the high school students he had met before, Zhang Yu had never seen a single one with an Arcane Frame.

Just then, Ye Lingxiao asked, "Yun Jing, why was my Red Envelope Talisman ineffective against you?"

This man before them, frail to an abnormal degree and with an Arcane Frame implanted in his eyes, was named Yun Jing.

As the top second-year at 'Immortal Cloud High,' the strongest high school in the Immortal Capital, a prodigy living on the one-and-a-half layer of Kunxu, Yun Jing had long since defeated everyone in his school, and was even unmatched throughout the entire Immortal Capital high school scene.

"The strongest high school student on the first layer of Kunxu."

Was this his own self-assessment?

It was not.

This was the objective judgment rendered by Purple Cloud Supplements' first-layer headquarters after they had tested him.

Hearing Ye Lingxiao's question now, Yun Jing smiled faintly and said, "Because I've already been placed under an Anti-Fraud Talisman."

"Your Red Envelope Talisman hitting me is like a moth to a flame—utterly useless."

He spread his hands wide and laughed heartily, "In other words, I am now immune to this type of talisman."

At that moment, everyone felt as if a wave of Yun Jing's hand had summoned rivers of divine power to flow before him, shielding him from all manner of harassment, traps, and scams.

Ye Lingxiao nodded slightly, "The Red Envelope Talisman is still too limited. Only the Favorability Talisman is truly unstoppable."

Yun Jing shook his head. "A Favorability Talisman is unstoppable for a righteous god, but it's useless against people."

Ye Lingxiao shook his head again but said nothing more.

But a thought secretly formed in his mind. _Favorability Talismans can work on people. I've seen someone use one like that before._

After witnessing that, Ye Lingxiao had even faintly sensed that a great secret might be hidden within it.

This secret made him incredibly curious and, at the same time, filled him with a trace of shock, further fueling his desire to study talismans.

But Ye Lingxiao had no intention of sharing such important and valuable information with Yun Jing and the others for free.

At the scene now, high school students from the Immortal Capital like Ye Lingxiao and Yun Jing stood almost in a single bloc, making up ninety percent of the crowd.

Meanwhile, examinees from other cities like Zhang Yu, Bai Zhenzhen, and Yu Xinghan stood in small, scattered groups in the distance, far outnumbered by the natives of the Immortal Capital.

Zhang Yu lamented, "These Immortal Capital natives really have it good; I bet they've dominated the Foundation Establishment exam in previous years, haven't they?"

Yu Xinghan nodded slightly. "I've heard that the best high schools here can invite the heads of major corporations to lecture, that the teachers for Daoist art classes are righteous gods, and that every student gets their own Yellow Turban Strongman for sparring practice..."

Zhang Yu was stunned to hear this; the disparity in Immortal Dao educational resources was simply too vast.

Bai Zhenzhen, listening from the side, was also filled with envy. The natives of the Immortal Capital were in a different league than the people of Songyang.

Just then, the metal gate before them shuddered violently, and lines of text appeared on a nearby light screen.

Zhang Yu looked over and saw that it was the rules for the upcoming test.

Simply put, the metal gate required the fulfillment of three criteria—physical body, mana, and martial arts—to be opened.

One needed enough physical strength to push the metal gate.

For martial arts and mana, one had to strike different positions on the gate with nine different palm forces in a specific sequence, all within three seconds.

Only then could the metal gate be pushed open, allowing one to enter and complete the Dao heart test.

In other words, once you pushed open the metal gate and passed the Dao heart test within, you had officially completed the registration process and earned the qualification to participate in the Foundation Establishment exam.

Zhang Yu thought to himself, _The specific details of these nine palm forces, and the order of impact, are like a combination lock. Only the correct combination will open the door._

_According to the wall, this combination changes every time the door is opened..._

Just as Zhang Yu was still studying how to condense the nine palm forces, he noticed the text on the wall flicker and change—the sequence and nature of the nine palm forces had been altered.

At the same time, a time of 0.64 seconds displayed above the metal gate.

With a loud creak, the metal gate was forcefully pushed open by Yun Jing, revealing a bottomless darkness.

Yun Jing then stepped forward nonchalantly, and as the metal gate closed once more, he vanished into the darkness in an instant.

After Yun Jing left, Ye Lingxiao's figure flashed like lightning. Zhang Yu couldn't even clearly see all his movements as a series of nine loud bangs merged into what sounded like a single collision.

The time displayed above the metal gate read 0.65 seconds.

In the next moment, Ye Lingxiao was already standing before the gate, pushing it open with ease.

_They finished striking with nine different palm forces in less than a second? And that probably wasn't even their full strength._

Watching Yun Jing and Ye Lingxiao push open the metal gate one after another, Zhang Yu felt an unprecedented pressure.

_Those two are probably second-years... about to become third-years, right?_

_Just one more year of cultivation than me, and they're already this much stronger?_

_Is this the strongest level of high school students on the first layer of Kunxu?_

Zhang Yu recognized one thing very clearly: at this moment, he was far inferior to those two.

If he wanted to pass the Foundation Establishment qualification exam, he would need to catch up to their level in the future.

Standing beside him, Bai Zhenzhen also took a deep breath, feeling the spiritual root within her stir restlessly.

_They're all so strong,_ Bai Zhenzhen thought. _Can I really pass the Foundation Establishment exam this year?_

Although she had been constantly encouraging herself and cultivating with all her might.

But now, having truly arrived in the Immortal Capital, whether it was the massive floating city, the prices at the train station, or the performance of these Immortal Capital natives before her... it all felt like a series of punches, slowly forcing her straight back to bend, making her feel the gap between herself and the people here, bit by bit.

It was enough to make a sliver of an escapist thought rise in Bai Zhenzhen's mind. _It's okay if I lose this year, there's still a chance next year, right?_

But in the next moment, she immediately suppressed this distracting thought. _No matter what, I'll give it my all._

Although Yu Xinghan, standing to the side, also felt the pressure, it wasn't as intense as what Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen were experiencing.

He thought to himself, _This time, I'm just here to experience the atmosphere of the Foundation Establishment exam in advance and take the opportunity to get my expenses reimbursed. My real chance is next year._

In the time that followed, the contestants went up one by one, gradually pushing open the gate.

Zhang Yu wasn't in a hurry; instead, he stayed where he was, observing these potential rivals.

_The vast majority should be second-years. Aside from the first two who finished in under a second, most of the rest finished within two seconds._

_Those who are weaker than me... must be freshmen, taking between two to four seconds to push open the metal gate._

The contestants who took more than three seconds to open the gate failed to meet the test requirements and were promptly dispatched by a large hole that suddenly appeared beneath their feet, clearly eliminated.

Seeing that no one else was going up for the moment, Zhang Yu walked forward. He glanced at the nine palm forces recorded on the wall and began to strike the metal gate, palm after palm.

Relying on his superb mana control and physical control, he moved like a whirlwind, circling the metal gate. In 2.3 seconds, he had struck nine different locations on the gate with the nine distinct palm forces.

He then stood firm before the metal gate, and with a powerful push of both hands, he swung it wide open and stepped into the darkness.

...

Countless roars of beasts and monsters seemed to echo from within the darkness.

In the next moment, a flash of fire illuminated the scene as hundreds, even thousands, of monsters charged forward.

Zombies, fox demons, ghosts... they all rushed him at once, as if to tear him to shreds.

However, when Zhang Yu mustered the courage to fight the monsters, he found them to be surprisingly weak. He quickly carved a path through them three times over, pushed open the exit gate at the end of the passage, and found himself back in a stall in the train station's restroom.

_The final test of the Dao heart was courage?_

Zhang Yu took out his phone, logged into the registration website, and confirmed that he had successfully registered and passed the test, only then breathing a sigh of relief.

However, his mind felt fuzzy, and he had a nagging feeling he had overlooked something.

But just as he tried to think about it, the feeling was already gone.

Zhang Yu shook his head and had just stepped out of the restroom when a hand slapped him from behind, knocking him unconscious.

...

At the same time.

In the office where Zhang Yu had just registered.

The middle-aged woman who had registered Zhang Yu sat behind her desk. On four light screens beside her were the figures of four other individuals.

The middle-aged woman's name was Deng Bingding.

Although as a Sifang Youshen, she was already a sixth-rank divine spirit, a major figure compared to a ninth-rank minor Duty God.

But Deng Bingding had never felt any reason to be arrogant.

Everyone thought being a god was great, that divine power was immense, but so what if you actually became one?

Deng Bingding had been to the Heavenly Court; she knew how high its steps were, how far she was from the great gods of the various ministries, how insignificant her authority was in this Kunxu, and understood even more clearly that in the eyes of the immortals, she was nothing more than a useful tool.

Just like right now; because of a sudden order from above, she could only slow down what she was originally working on and devote a large amount of energy and divine power to participate in temporary overtime for the Foundation Establishment exam, maintaining order and protecting student information from being leaked.

She glanced at the other four figures on the light screens, who were the four minor gods assigned to assist her this time.

Deng Bingding said, "This reform of the Foundation Establishment exam comes as a verbal edict from a High Immortal and has been approved by the Divine Lord. I'll have to trouble you all to keep a close watch."

"Not at all, not at all, we will follow your orders, Lady Deng..."

Amid the exchange of pleasantries, Deng Bingding had already received Favorability Talismans from the four minor gods.

It was originally the practice of a few individual divine spirits for a lower-ranking god to send a Favorability Talisman to a higher-ranking one to increase favorability, but it had now unwittingly become widespread throughout the entire divine world of Kunxu.

Deng Bingding was quite disdainful of this, and in her heart, she deeply loathed such pointless formalities.

She glanced at the amounts sent by the four minor gods and her brow furrowed. _The others all sent over ten thousand, yet you send me 5,000? What is the meaning of this?_

Deng Bingding immediately made a mental note of the minor god who had sent the smallest amount on his Favorability Talisman.

"Huang Zichou."

_To turn a perfectly good Favorability Talisman into a Disfavor Talisman, you're truly one of a kind. No wonder you're still a ninth-rank god._

Deng Bingding lamented inwardly, which was why she detested these pointless formalities. They hadn't even started working together, and ill feelings had already been created. How were they supposed to serve the great gods properly like this?

She still missed the old days when you could state the amount and transfer it face-to-face without anyone investigating.

She formed a Daoist seal with her hands, and as waves of divine power surged, light screens materialized before her, displaying the experiences of each student after they stepped through the metal gate.

Deng Bingding said lightly, "You four are also aware that with so many mouths to feed throughout the Eight Ministries, life has never been easy."

"The sudden addition of this registration test this year is, on one hand, to use the physical, mana, and martial arts requirements to screen out some of the freshmen and save some budget for the exam."

"On the other hand, and this is the main point from above, is to use the Dao heart test to identify truly useful talents and weed out the types who become weak-kneed shrimps the moment they climb up..."

# Chapter 141: Arrange Ten For Him

Right at this moment.

Deng Bingding and the other four minor gods were watching the performance of each examinee in the Dao heart test.

"Having made it this far, all four of you have gone through countless assessments, big and small. You should know that often, the most important part of an exam is to fathom the examiner's intent, to understand the main purpose of the test."

"This point is just as true for us as examiners now; only by grasping the intentions of our superiors can we select worthy talents who will serve the Ten Great Sects and the Heavenly Court in the future."

Deng Bingding continued, "Our superiors are very dissatisfied with the weak-kneed shrimps who have been selected in recent years. The results of various assessments have been declining year after year."

"The purpose of this reform is to ensure that those who climb up from the lower levels of Kunxu are ambitious, desirous, and daring individuals who can withstand temptation and pressure, and who can walk further on the path of the Immortal Dao."

"And among these, withstanding temptation is the key to this round of testing."

Looking at the examinees on the screen, Deng Bingding went on, "For instance, in the illusionary landscape of this Dao heart test, the wealthy will face the temptation of even greater wealth. If one layer of temptation isn't enough, then it will be temptation from the second layer."

"It can be said that among these people, whoever ultimately passes the Foundation Establishment exam will inevitably experience similar things."

"Therefore, our scoring criteria should be clear to you all. One of the key factors is how much monetary temptation the examinees can resist."

"If any particularly outstanding candidates emerge, reporting them will be a meritorious deed."

Just as Deng Bingding finished speaking, the minor Duty God Huang Zichou looked at Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen in the illusionary landscape and said in surprise, "There are actually two poor students in this year's exam?"

Upon hearing the word 'poor,' the other minor gods also looked over.

After all, seeing poor people in the Foundation Establishment exam was truly a rare sight.

Deng Bingding also looked over and saw that it was the student she had registered earlier. She remembered his name was Zhang Yu, likely a freshman from Songyang.

"An ant with a debt of seven hundred thousand and a five-figure bank balance."

An ant, that was Deng Bingding's assessment of Zhang Yu.

This wasn't a derogatory term, but rather one derived from her own internal evaluation system.

Just as gods had nine ranks and the Immortal Dao had ten realms, in Deng Bingding's view, people could naturally be divided into different classes.

Those who didn't even have a high school education were dust.

Those with a high school education and a bank balance that was perennially in the five or six figures were ants.

Those who graduated high school, were at the peak of Qi Refinement, and could find a job were beasts of burden.

Only those who graduated from a university and could find a corporate job were barely considered human in Deng Bingding's eyes.

Looking at Zhang Yu's savings at that moment, Deng Bingding had already mentally stamped him as a failure.

This wasn't because Deng Bingding discriminated against the poor, but based on her many years of experience as a god...

"Although the rich already far surpass the poor in terms of mana, physical body, martial arts, and talismans, they often triumph even more decisively when it comes to the Dao heart."

This was Deng Bingding's conclusion drawn from experience. From the performances she had seen in various exams and tests, the poor were simply inferior to the rich in every aspect.

Even if a few rare individuals from poor backgrounds did manage to climb up, their most prominent characteristic was often their low buyout price; they demanded the least money and worked the most overtime.

On the contrary, the rich received training and tempering from a young age, and thus...

"The richer they are, the stronger, the more resilient, the broader their horizons, the greater their ambition, and the more they can resist temptation. They are precisely the kind of cultivators that our superiors need most."

"As for the ants... sigh, if you have no money in the first place, what's the point of cultivating immortality?"

"If not for the corporations controlling the channels of public opinion and desperately tricking people into this rat race, they would have been unsuitable for cultivation to begin with."

...

Just then, Zhang Yu, in the light screen, had woken up.

The air he breathed was exceptionally fresh; every breath felt as if countless tiny hands were massaging him from the inside, nourishing every piece of his flesh and blood.

He found himself lying on a very, very soft bed, a sense of indescribable relaxation spreading through his entire body.

He observed his surroundings and found himself in a room with exceptionally good sunlight, surrounded by all sorts of furniture that looked valuable at a glance, though he had no idea how to use them.

Beyond the massive floor-to-ceiling glass window was a roiling sea of clouds.

Zhang Yu walked over and saw that within the sea of clouds, there were forests and lakes... and even a giant dragon exhaling mist as it soared into the sky from the clouds.

And surrounding the sea of clouds were dense, endless skyscrapers, pavilions, and towers.

...

Huang Zichou said, "In the illusionary landscape, a rich person claims to admire him and wants to host him."

"Mm, he refused, as expected."

"They're all like this at the beginning—very guarded and decisive."

Another minor god analyzed, "Although their cultivation and Dao heart aren't strong enough to detect that it's an illusionary landscape, being suddenly taken to a rich person's house would naturally make them very wary."

Huang Zichou said, "But this house has a free spirit vein, boosters, and dietary supplements. A poor person like him will definitely stay to take advantage of it..."

"Huh? He actually requested to lower the spiritual energy concentration?"

Another minor god was also surprised, "He won't eat the dietary supplement of dragon meat and instead asks for synthetic food?"

"What on earth is this poor person thinking?"

...

In the illusionary landscape.

Zhang Yu didn't even glance at the grand feast before him.

Especially after the servant beside him introduced that the dishes were almost entirely made from various powerful demonic beasts, and even flood dragons.

This made Zhang Yu even more afraid to eat. He only asked for some synthetic food, which he ate with peace of mind and reassurance.

Zhang Yu was terrified that if he ate, they would demand payment later and bankrupt him.

After all, he only had a little over ten thousand in his pocket, yet he was in the Upper City of the Immortal Capital.

How to describe this feeling... it was like appearing in the enemy's jungle with a sliver of health. He felt that every step was fraught with peril, that he could go bankrupt at any moment.

Thinking of this, he immediately had them lower the spiritual energy as much as possible; turning it off would be best.

...

Listening to the discussion of the minor gods around her, Deng Bingding spoke, "All of you have been dealing with the rich for too long and know too little about these bottom-tier poor people."

"He's just scared."

"He's scared that if he takes one extra breath or eats one extra piece of meat, he'll be bankrupted when it's time to pay."

Bankrupted by taking one extra breath or eating one extra piece of meat?

The Duty Gods were slightly stunned to hear this; it had indeed been a long time since they had seen such a thing.

After all, people this poor were generally not worthy of interacting with them, nor were they worthy of appearing in such a high-consumption area.

Deng Bingding continued, "But this is only temporary. The poorer a person is, the more easily they fall once they start satisfying their desires."

"A long time ago, a poor farmer climbed to the second layer. He was reluctant to eat, reluctant to wear nice clothes, afraid to buy this, afraid to use that."

"And in the end? Heh, a mere second-layer city resident status was enough to make him lose his determination to press forward on the path of the Immortal Dao."

"It can't be helped. The lives of these poor people are too cheap, too easily satisfied. It's far, far easier to stop them from climbing higher than it is to stop the rich."

Meanwhile, Zhang Yu in the light screen was encountering more temptations.

...

In the illusionary landscape.

The pharmacy had all kinds of top-tier boosters available for open use.

The spiritual root room contained three types of Heavenly Spiritual Roots for cultivation, said to be for Zhang Yu's unrestricted use.

The training room had a Yellow Turban Strongman ready to serve as a sparring partner.

The same went for the twelve flying swords nearby; he was told he could play with them as he pleased.

Zhang Yu took a deep breath, trying hard to suppress his constantly surging desires.

...

In the office.

The minor god Huang Zichou remarked, "He's about to lose control."

"Over the past few days in the illusion, he has been repeatedly confirming if it's truly free."

"Once he confirms that it's really being given to him for free, he'll definitely be unable to resist and will start using these cultivation resources."

"Mm, they're about to sign a contract, confirming that he can use everything for free for two months."

As Huang Zichou spoke, they saw Zhang Yu in the illusionary landscape increase the concentration of spiritual energy in the room.

...

In the illusionary landscape.

Another day passed. Zhang Yu took a bite of the dragon steak, and as he felt the juices explode in his mouth, a satisfied smile gradually appeared on his face.

He grabbed a syringe from the side and plunged the needle into his arm.

Then he had them increase the spiritual energy concentration even further.

...

In the office.

Watching Zhang Yu's performance in the illusion, the minor gods present all sighed.

"Too easily bought," Huang Zichou said. "Doesn't he know that nothing free is ever truly free? The deeper he falls into this trap, the more he'll be unable to leave these things behind."

Deng Bingding remained silent. To her, this was perfectly normal. An ant-level poor person like him had such a shallow perspective; it was only natural for him to fall for temptation so easily.

Watching the time in the illusionary landscape pass day by day, seeing Zhang Yu eat meat more ferociously and inject alchemical enhancers more fiercely, and playing with the various flying swords and spiritual roots with great delight, Deng Bingding knew he had completely fallen.

Just then, Huang Zichou beside her said in surprise, "Hey, this kid hasn't been sterilized? Isn't he just making things harder for himself now?"

...

In the illusionary landscape.

Zhang Yu, his spiritual energy absorption excessive and his meridians blocked, fell to the ground, momentarily unable to move.

"Sir, you've absorbed too much spiritual energy recently. Your meridians are blocked and your muscles are out of control."

Rigid and unable to move, Zhang Yu thought to himself that this was a classic case of a poor man suddenly coming into wealth, unable to even adapt to the breathing environment of the rich.

But in the next moment, a slick, soft sensation startled him awake.

He saw a young woman's mouth sucking on his finger as if it were being held, her soft tongue coiling around his fingertip like a nimble snake.

"You..."

A female voice came from the girl, "Sir, please relax and let me help you expel the blocked spiritual energy."

Through the girl's tongue, Zhang Yu felt as if some special medicine was being injected into his fingertip. As it coiled around him, his body gradually relaxed, making him feel light and weightless.

The girl said, "As a part-time cultivation-cauldron partner, I have just absorbed the excess spiritual energy for you, established a mana cycle, and completed your breathing exercise."

...

In the office.

Huang Zichou shook his head and sighed, "He's a lost cause. How could he not be completely ensnared by this? This is why high school students are so useless; they should just be sterilized."

"If he continues to sink like this, once he can't live without these things, and the two-month free period ends, if they offer to let him continue using this house and everything in it for free, or even give him a little more, he'll probably agree to withdraw from the Foundation Establishment exam on the spot."

Another minor god said, "Even if he doesn't agree at first, adding a few more bargaining chips should do the trick."

Huang Zichou looked at Zhang Yu's basic information and said, "He's a first year, after all. His determination to take the exam is naturally not as firm as a second years's. Coupled with his poor background, he's bound to fall more easily."

"I reckon the most temptation he can withstand is one or two hundred million at most."

Meanwhile, Deng Bingding had long since lost interest in watching the poor student's performance and had turned her attention to the other second years examinees.

After all, in the Foundation Establishment exam, second years were often the final winners, while freshmen were merely extras.

Especially the two top students from the Immortal Capital in this test, Ye Lingxiao and Yun Jing. Not only were they from prestigious families and extremely wealthy, but their talent was also exceptional. She had high hopes for both of them this time, thinking that if their results were particularly outstanding, reporting it would be a meritorious deed.

"Yun Jing has already withstood a temptation of the one-billion level."

Deng Bingding nodded slightly. "Ye Lingxiao is not bad either. Faced with the temptation of 1.2 billion in assets, he still insists on taking the Foundation Establishment exam and walking further on the path of the Immortal Dao."

Huang Zichou analyzed from the side, "After all, both of them know that the treatment for high school students with and without a Foundation Establishment certificate is worlds apart after reaching the second layer."

"For anyone who wants to go further on the Immortal Dao, or even enter a sect rather than a corporation after university, this high school Foundation Establishment certificate is an excellent stepping stone."

"Besides, this is their last chance to take the high school Foundation Establishment exam, so they're definitely more resistant than the freshmen."

At the same time, another minor god looked at the illusionary landscape on Zhang Yu's side and chuckled, "Is this kid about to give in?"

...

In the illusionary landscape.

Zhang Yu walked into the cauldron room he hadn't visited yet.

He saw six stunningly beautiful female bodies—some petite, some buxom, some slender, and some with demonic beast features... each with a different style, all looking at him at the same time.

The girl from before introduced from the side, "Her name is Linglü. Her body has been modified so that during your use, she can stimulate all the muscles in your body to complete body tempering exercises..."

"This is Yunxiao. She can draw out and absorb the alchemical toxins in your body, helping you mitigate the side effects of taking enhancers..."

"This is Xianluo. She can secrete a calming hormone, relieving your psychological stress through stroking and licking..."

"Master, as long as you agree to withdraw from the Foundation Establishment exam, we will all be your property from now on."

Hearing that he would have to give up the Foundation Establishment certificate, Zhang Yu seemed to imagine that familiar chill and the power of the ritual, and he quickly waved his hands in refusal, "Get lost, all of you!"

"Do not disturb my Dao heart!"

"The Foundation Establishment certificate! I would rather die than give it up."

...

In the office.

Huang Zichou was surprised, "I can understand him refusing, but to refuse so decisively?"

"High school students are so full of vigor, their vitality so strong, and he hasn't been sterilized. He's at the peak of his desires, yet he can refuse the opportunity to get stronger while having fun without a moment's hesitation?"

Another minor god at his side said, "I know! Is he a natural eunuch? That's why he doesn't need to be sterilized? Or perhaps he's naturally not into women, which is why he could refuse so readily?"

Huang Zichou waved his hand grandly, "That's simple. Arrange ten handsome male cauldrons for him, and we'll find out."

# Chapter 142: Zhang Yu, Valuation???

In the office.

Not long after Deng Bingding recorded Yun Jing’s valuation.

A minor god to the side said, “Lord Deng, this Ye Lingxiao is proving to be a bit of a problem.”

Deng Bingding looked over and saw that the Ye Lingxiao in the illusion was unmoved by nearly every temptation.

Whether it was superior cultivation conditions or the success and honor of his family… nothing seemed to deter him from his goal of obtaining the Foundation Establishment qualification certificate for high school.

If Deng Bingding were to evaluate him, she would say he was sufficiently selfish, singularly focused on his own advancement, and possessed the courage to continuously climb the path of the Immortal Dao.

But Deng Bingding also believed that if they just kept raising the price, he would eventually agree.

After all, as long as someone was human, they had a price.

But what Ye Lingxiao demanded was beyond Deng Bingding’s expectations.

Within the illusionary landscape, Ye Lingxiao said, “Since you are so powerful, do you know how to use a Favorability Talisman on a person?”

Deng Bingding’s brow furrowed. “How would Ye Lingxiao know about something like that?”

The minor god at her side said, “Lord Deng, what do we do now?”

“The secret of using a Favorability Talisman on a person is a matter of great importance; it cannot be revealed lightly.”

“Although it’s only an illusionary landscape and we could just lie to him.”

“But all memories and records from the Foundation Establishment exam’s illusion must be preserved.”

“In that case… if the valuation is too low, wouldn’t it seem like we’re deliberately giving the student a low score? And if the valuation is too high, won’t that let Ye Lingxiao know there’s a great secret involved?”

“This is truly… difficult to manage.”

Deng Bingding felt a headache coming on, and she realized something.

“For this person to make such a request amidst so many temptations in the illusion… it means he has subconsciously realized the high value of this secret, and has perhaps even understood what it truly represents.”

“Hmph, but this Ye Lingxiao’s curiosity is far too strong, and his appetite is far too large.”

“Then again, being selfish, audacious, and insatiably greedy… isn’t that also the mark of a seed of the Immortal Dao?”

The thought flashed through her mind, and Deng Bingding decided to take a different approach, asking, “Where did he learn of this? Was it hearsay, or did he witness it himself?”

The minor god replied, “He said he saw it with his own eyes, used by a high school student named Zhang Pianpian. I’ve already looked at that student’s file. She is very outstanding, but she doesn’t seem like someone who would know such a technique. Could she have been deceiving Ye Lingxiao?”

Deng Bingding closed her eyes, and countless scenes from the Spirit Realm appeared before her.

Arriving before a row of massive bookshelves, she casually opened Zhang Pianpian’s file, her divine power sweeping across it as the girl’s life story unfolded before her.

This was a Level One archive of the Department of the People, which theoretically recorded the information of everyone on the first level.

As Deng Bingding rapidly scanned Zhang Pianpian’s information with her divine power, a strange feeling crept into her heart.

“This Zhang Pianpian is indeed outstanding, even serving as the deputy captain of the Songyang City patrol team. She’s almost excessively excellent.”

“From Songyang City again…” Deng Bingding frowned. “Why is it that every student from Songyang City seems a little strange?”

As she was pondering, this sixth-rank Sifang Youshen suddenly noticed something amiss.

“Zhang Pianpian’s file… has someone tampered with it?”

The thought that someone had meddled with the archives sent a jolt of alarm through Deng Bingding, and when she tried to uncover the truth hidden behind the file, an unprecedented sense of crisis stopped her.

“This has nothing to do with me. I don’t want to know anything.”

After a moment's thought, she immediately retreated and reported Ye Lingxiao’s situation, making no mention of the issue with Zhang Pianpian’s file, pretending she had never seen it.

What surprised her even more was the swiftness of the response from above.

“A directive sent directly from the Department of the People?” Deng Bingding’s heart skipped a beat.

_So Zhang Pianpian really is involved in something,_ she thought, _I wonder what plan or scheme of the higher-ups she’s caught up in._

The directive from the Department of the People was to suppress Ye Lingxiao’s valuation directly to 5.5 billion.

Witnessing this, Deng Bingding felt a wave of emotion.

Many people in Kunxu, especially the poor… all believed the rules of the Ten Great Sects, the regulations of the Eight Ministries of Righteous Gods… were heavenly edicts, inviolable celestial laws.

But Deng Bingding knew very well… that was not always the case.

Take the Foundation Establishment exam before her; it wasn’t as if no one had ever dared to try and cheat it from the very beginning.

It was just that all the people and gods who had dared to try were sent to the Spirit Realm to 'enjoy a blissful retirement,' and gradually, no one dared to try anymore.

But even for an event like the high school Foundation Establishment exam, which no one on the first level of Kunxu dared to interfere with, if a powerful figure from above wanted to make a move—like suppressing Ye Lingxiao’s evaluation at this very moment—then it was done.

“Everyone has a price, and the rules of Kunxu have a price too.”

“As long as one can pay the cost, many things are not impossible.”

“It’s just that for some, that cost is their entire clan. And for others, perhaps all it takes is a single directive…”

Deng Bingding cleared the stray thoughts from her mind, burying the matter deep in her heart, resolving never to think of it again.

She turned her gaze to the last person remaining in the Dao heart test—Zhang Yu.

In fact, at this moment in the office, whether it was her, the Sifang Youshen, or the other four minor Duty Gods, all eyes were now focused on Zhang Yu’s illusion.

Deng Bingding asked in confusion, “This Zhang Yu has actually managed to last until now.”

Huang Zichou, however, sounded both nervous and excited as he said, “Lord Deng, if this continues, Zhang Yu’s illusion is going to collapse.”

“What did you say?” With a surge of intense curiosity, Deng Bingding swept her divine power over, checking his illusionary landscape records.

…

Within the illusionary landscape.

Without realizing it, more and more things had been piled up before Zhang Yu.

A Heavenly Spiritual Root, an Arcane Frame, citizenship in the Immortal Capital…

All sorts of valuable items were presented to Zhang Yu, yet he steadfastly refused to abandon the Foundation Establishment exam.

Even when the other party offered company shares, although a flicker of desire crossed Zhang Yu’s face, he still gritted his teeth and did not give up on the exam.

Because the moment that thought arose, a chilling sensation would creep up from the depths of his heart.

_This stupid ritual, can’t it just let me accept the conditions and take the test next year?_

_No, the ritual may be stupid, but it wouldn't be like this. Where is the problem?_

And as the illusion constantly probed and raised its offers, Zhang Yu’s consciousness gradually began to feel that something was wrong.

_Wait… this has to be worth over ten billion now, right?_

_Aren’t you guys offering a bit too much?_

_Is the simple act of me giving up the Foundation Establishment exam really worth such a price?_

As Zhang Yu began to ponder these questions, everything before him seemed to grow stranger, giving him the feeling that he was in a dream.

…

In the office.

Deng Bingding frowned. “How did the price get so high? What are you doing?”

She was already suspecting Huang Zichou of recklessly raising the offers.

Huang Zichou said, “Lord Deng, you can look at the records! I really didn’t raise the price randomly. The illusion operated according to the rules, increasing it bit by bit. I’ve tried everything, but he just refuses to give in.”

Deng Bingding frowned as she repeatedly reviewed the records, discovering that Zhang Yu was truly incorruptible.

Deng Bingding knew that while the illusion could make a student subconsciously ignore many of its incongruities, this disregard was not without its limits.

As a student continued to refuse and the offered price climbed higher and higher, the entire illusion would become increasingly illogical, making the test subject feel a growing sense of dissonance.

And when that sense of dissonance reached its peak, it signified the collapse of the illusion.

In the cases of Ye Lingxiao and Yun Jing just now, because they were wealthy and powerful to begin with and were strong candidates to win the qualification certificate, the price could climb steadily under the illusion’s effect, and they could subconsciously ignore the inconsistencies.

But Zhang Yu’s level was far from that of a winning candidate, and he was poor, so the skyrocketing prices would make him notice that something was wrong much more easily.

Watching this scene, a thought that had never occurred to Deng Bingding before suddenly surfaced. _The poor actually have an advantage in this test. If they can just hold on, it’s easier for them to see through the illusion and break the limit than it is for the rich?_

Shaking her head, she temporarily set aside the extraneous thought and asked again, “Did you not ask him what he actually wants?”

Huang Zichou quickly replied, “I did, I did! Look further ahead!”

…

Within the illusionary landscape.

Zhang Yu felt that everything before him was becoming more and more like a dream.

How could anyone offer so much money just to have him withdraw from the Foundation Establishment exam?

The ritual’s reaction, in particular, made him feel that everything was very wrong.

_Could it be that right now, I’m…_

Just then, the other party’s question interrupted his train of thought.

Upon hearing it, Zhang Yu asked curiously, “What do I want?”

He thought about how, under the duress of the ritual he carried, what he wanted most was to remove its power and grant himself true freedom.

But he would never dare to speak of matters related to the evil god; even now, with the feeling that he was in a dream, he still wouldn't dare.

So the only thing left to say was his other goal, which was to enter one of the Ten Greats, join a sect, and complete this path of his wish.

And combining that with the current condition of giving up the Foundation Establishment exam…

Zhang Yu organized his words in his mind for a moment, feeling that the request he was about to make would be one the other party could never agree to.

But the dreamlike sensation made him suddenly smile, and he spoke his thoughts with a hint of abandon, “I want to climb the Immortal Dao, all the way up.”

“So if you want me to give up, then you’d better be able to give me a better opportunity.”

“An opportunity better than passing the Foundation Establishment exam on the first try, a better chance to get into a university, a chance for better treatment after entering the Ten Greats, a greater chance to be accepted into a sect… only then will I give up the qualification certificate.”

“Oh, and this has to include Bai Zhenzhen as well.”

…

In the office.

“Everyone has a price.”

This was something Deng Bingding had confirmed countless times.

But this time, hearing Zhang Yu’s demand—even if it was a price exaggerated by the illusion—Deng Bingding was still stunned.

“This guy… does he even know what he’s asking for?”

“A poor wretch from the first level of Kunxu is actually demanding such an absurd price?”

“Is this something that can even be found on the first level? Treatment better than successfully passing the first-year high school Foundation Establishment exam?”

“Forget the first level; even the wealthy on the second or even third level might not be able to seize the kind of opportunity he’s asking for.”

“And he wants to bring someone else along…”

Looking at the Zhang Yu in the illusion, Deng Bingding was momentarily unsure whether to say his ambition to climb the Immortal Dao was overblown, or if the illusion had simply unleashed his insatiably greedy side.

Huang Zichou, standing beside her, said, “Lord Deng, what do we do? This kind of demand, even he must know it’s impossible, right? He clearly has no intention of giving up the Foundation Establishment exam.”

Deng Bingding said, “Continuing the test is meaningless. The temptation offered to him has long surpassed the limit of any temptation he could possibly face.”

“If the illusion were to actually fulfill such an unreasonable request, Zhang Yu would likely wake up from it completely, and the illusion would collapse.”

“Or perhaps…” Deng Bingding said faintly, “he may already be on the verge of waking.”

“End this Dao heart test.”

Huang Zichou said, “Then what about Zhang Yu’s score?”

“What else can be done?” Deng Bingding sighed. “At the very least, this illusion was unable to find his limit.”

With that, she made a note: “Zhang Yu, valuation unknown???, Dao heart test failed to determine limit.”

# Chapter 143: Let's Do It, Yu-boy! Let's Completely Unleash Our Immortal Dao Potential!

With the conclusion of the Dao heart test, Deng Bingding reported the results to her superiors.

Although Zhang Yu's valuation was unknown, Deng Bingding believed it was primarily because this particular Dao heart test had been relatively simple.

The same was true for the inflated results of the other students.

“If this were reality, with genuine threats and inducements, they would never be able to command such a high price.”

“But it is, after all, just a test. It is sufficient for weeding out the weak-willed and identifying students with potential.”

In the test results Deng Bingding submitted, besides the outstanding performances of Zhang Yu, Ye Lingxiao, and Yun Jing, the rather unique performance of Bai Zhenzhen was also specially noted.

Several other students whose foundational data was lacking and who had also fallen behind in the Dao heart test were likewise flagged, awaiting a decision from above on whether they should be eliminated.

A short while later, the gods in attendance saw the reply from their superiors.

A thumbs-up.

This signified that their work had been approved, and the faint tension in the gods' hearts immediately eased.

Then, they received a more detailed response.

For instance, there were commendations for Zhang Yu, Ye Lingxiao, Yun Jing, and Bai Zhenzhen, as a form of encouragement.

Seeing this, Deng Bingding was slightly taken aback; she had anticipated the commendations for the first three, but the one for Bai Zhenzhen was somewhat unexpected.

After all, in her view, while Bai Zhenzhen's performance had been unique, it was far from being as outstanding as the other three.

_Could it be that someone from above… appreciated this Bai Zhenzhen’s performance?_

Deng Bingding continued reading the reply. “Hmm, and several other students are to be eliminated?”

…

When Zhang Yu opened his eyes again, he found himself back in the registration office.

The middle-aged woman who had registered him was sitting behind her desk, watching him.

Deng Bingding spoke, “You should still remember the contents of the Dao heart test, correct?”

After all, the Eight Ministries of Righteous Gods now emphasized keeping a paper trail for all work, to facilitate reviews after the fact. All the data from the Foundation Establishment exam and the Dao heart test, right down to the memories the students experienced in the illusion, were preserved.

Zhang Yu nodded, the suspicion in his heart finally confirmed. 

_So everything I just experienced was some kind of illusion?_

Deng Bingding looked at Zhang Yu with an appreciative expression and said, “You performed very well in this Dao heart test.”

“Your heart is set on the Immortal Dao, your goals are lofty, and your resolve is unshakable. Both I and the leadership above are very impressed with you.”

“Therefore, to encourage you, the higher-ups have specially approved a bonus.”

At the word 'bonus,' Zhang Yu’s eyes instantly lit up. Money was the one thing he needed most on his path along the Immortal Dao.

But when he saw Deng Bingding flick a Red Envelope Talisman from her fingertip, Zhang Yu’s expression changed abruptly.

_The damn bonus is a high-interest loan?_

_Are these devil incarnates really this adept at scamming students?_

Zhang Yu couldn’t help but curse silently in his heart.

Deng Bingding spoke again, “Here is a 300,000 interest-free loan. Once you receive it, you will just need to repay 5,000 each month for a total of 60 months.”

Seeing the Red Envelope Talisman fly toward him, Zhang Yu immediately realized how shallow his previous thoughts had been.

He hurriedly and respectfully accepted the envelope.

“Thank you, examiner. May I ask how I should address you?”

Deng Bingding said coolly, “You may call me Sifang Youshen Deng. I am the examiner for this year’s Foundation Establishment exam.”

“Your performance this time has caught the eye of the higher-ups. Cultivate well over the next year and strive to pass the Foundation Establishment exam next time. Once you reach the second level, a great future will surely await you.”

Evidently, based on the data from Zhang Yu’s mana, physique, and martial arts, Deng Bingding did not believe he could pass this year’s Foundation Establishment exam.

Zhang Yu understood that this was indeed the case for the vast majority of first-year high school students, and he couldn’t possibly argue the point.

At present, Zhang Yu said respectfully, “Thank you for your guidance, Sifang Youshen Deng.”

Deng Bingding nodded. “You may go.”

The next moment, Zhang Yu felt a large hole open up beneath his feet, and his entire body fell into it.

…

When Zhang Yu came to his senses again, he had returned to the bathroom stall in the station.

Carefully opening the stall door, he stepped out into the main restroom and looked at the crowds of people coming and going outside.

_This time, it’s really over, isn’t it?_

A moment later, Bai Zhenzhen emerged from the women’s restroom. After exchanging a few words, they finally confirmed that the Dao heart test was truly finished.

Bai Zhenzhen had also received a bonus: a 150,000 interest-free loan.

Bai Zhenzhen let out a light sigh of relief. “I didn’t think the test would come with a bonus. This exam reform is really great.”

This bonus was a huge relief for both Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen, whose savings had been nearly depleted.

However, they didn’t dare to linger in the high-priced Immortal Capital, and the two were soon seated on a train for their return journey.

While Bai Zhenzhen went to the restroom, Zhang Yu pinched the bead on his chest.

The next moment, Fu Ji’s voice, as if waking from a dream, echoed in his mind. “Hm? Is it over?”

…

Before coming to the Immortal Capital to participate in the Foundation Establishment exam.

Zhang Yu had been somewhat hesitant about whether or not to bring Fu Ji with him.

On one hand, although Fu Ji currently seemed completely harmless to him, Zhang Yu vividly remembered her identity as an evil god and the process of their wish-making, and he didn’t dare leave her by herself, which might give her an opportunity to escape his control.

But on the other hand, by participating in a competition that was being watched by righteous gods, he couldn’t help but worry about the possibility of Fu Ji being discovered, or even the ritual’s power within his body being detected.

However, just as Zhang Yu was hesitating, Fu Ji had suggested that he could bring her along, saying, “If I were to speak and communicate with you, or probe the outside world, then my presence might indeed be discovered.”

“But if I retract my consciousness and thoughts, voluntarily giving up all attempts to probe the outside world, I would be equivalent to an inanimate object, which would be more than enough to deceive a mere Foundation Establishment exam.”

“We are in the same boat now. If something happens to you, I’m finished too. I definitely wouldn't lie to you.”

“The so-called righteous gods have their talismans; we evil gods have our rituals.”

“When it comes to the ability to make money, we may not be as skilled as the righteous gods, but when it comes to concealing our tracks and evading detection, how could the righteous gods possibly compare to us evil gods?”

“If that weren’t the case, wouldn’t all of us evil gods who have infiltrated Kunxu have been captured long ago…”

This was the reason Fu Ji had been willing to speak to Zhang Yu in this way.

On one hand, she knew that even now, Zhang Yu did not truly trust her. Trying to persuade him to leave her outside would only deepen his suspicions and destroy the small amount of trust they had managed to build during this time.

On the other hand, Fu Ji now regarded Zhang Yu as a blue-chip stock with immense potential.

_Based on my many years of investment experience, trying to deal with Zhang Yu now and causing internal strife… would be like buying a blue-chip stock and selling it before it has a chance to rise. That is a major taboo in investing._

_For this kind of stock, one must have patience and hold on to it tightly… Just like with this Zhang Yu, now is the perfect opportunity to lend him a hand, further gain his trust, and work together to make the pie bigger._

_Only when he has truly matured will it be time to consider reaping the rewards._

_Besides, he and I have already completed the ritual. I have every advantage in this regard, so why start an internal conflict with him so early? The days ahead are long…_

…

At this very moment on the train.

The awakened Fu Ji said, “Although I wasn’t discovered this time, there was a period where I felt my sea of consciousness tremble, and it seemed as if divine power was surging in the outside world.”

“The Foundation Establishment exam you participated in was of a rather high caliber.”

Fu Ji sighed. “If you truly manage to obtain the Foundation Establishment qualification certificate, you will inevitably attract even more attention from the righteous gods.”

“To ensure our safety and to hide myself and the ritual even more deeply, you must help me hunt my colleagues sooner rather than later. When I recover a portion of my power, my ability to hide will be stronger, and your potential can be further stimulated.”

“That boss behind Mo Tianyi is definitely connected to my colleague. You can start by taking him down.”

This was Fu Ji’s other objective: to use this opportunity to once again urge Zhang Yu to hunt evil gods.

Although Zhang Yu did not reply, he was already quite moved by the idea.

Of course, it wasn’t just because of Fu Ji’s persuasion, but also because of the gap in power he had felt from the second-year students in the Immortal Capital this time.

“In this year’s Foundation Establishment exam, the strongest of the second-year students are already approaching the limits of Qi Refinement.”

“In another half a year, there will likely be even more students in this exam who have cultivated their Dao heart, mana, and physique to the limits of Qi Refinement.”

Zhang Yu knew that if he wanted to contend with these students who had reached the pinnacle of high school cultivation, he too would have to push his own stats toward the peak of Qi Refinement.

_Stimulate my potential, upgrade the Feathered Tome… how could I not want to do such a thing?_

However, that poor student’s boss was most likely a second-year at White Dragon High. Yet, being backed by an evil god and having won a competition, his strength was probably already at the level of a third-year.

To even confront him, Zhang Yu would have to ensure his own strength reached a third-year level first.

_Strength… In the end, I still need more strength._

_And to get stronger, besides upgrading the Feathered Tome, the only other way is with money._

_Do I have to spend time working again?_

Zhang Yu hesitated; he had already sacrificed too much of his cultivation time for the sake of working part-time jobs.

And although he now had a 300,000 interest-free loan, it still wouldn’t last long when compared to his various cultivation expenses.

Just then, Bai Zhenzhen returned from the restroom and looked at Zhang Yu, asking curiously, “Yu-boy, what are you doing spacing out while holding your phone?”

Zhang Yu said, “Zhen, the more I work, the more I’ve come to understand one thing.”

“You can’t get rich by working.”

“Especially if we want to pass the exam, the money we earn from working is far too slow.”

Bai Zhenzhen said, “Isn’t that obvious? If you could get rich from working, there wouldn’t be any jobs left for us to work.”

Zhang Yu continued, “To earn big money, you have to rely on loans.”

“Borrowing money is the fastest way for young people in Kunxu to make money.”

If Zhang Yu had previously wanted to accumulate strength without relying on loans, then after witnessing the level of the Immortal Capital’s elites on this trip, he felt an even greater sense of pressure.

There was also the pressing need to hunt the evil god.

All of this required him to increase his strength significantly over the next six months, and he needed to further accelerate his cultivation.

And the first method that came to his mind, which was also the most common method in Kunxu, was to take out a loan.

Bai Zhenzhen looked at Zhang Yu earnestly and said, “Yu-boy, what you said really struck a chord with me.”

“After seeing so many of the Immortal Capital’s chosen ones at the exam this time, I’ve realized that we haven’t been pushing ourselves hard enough.”

“If we continue this 24-hour cycle of work and cultivation, if we continue to slack off like this, how can we possibly compete with the elites of the Immortal Capital?”

“Let’s do it, Yu-boy!”

“Our credit ratings must have increased over these past few months, so our loan limits should have gone up as well.”

Bai Zhenzhen also took out her phone, opened the app, and took a deep breath. “Let’s take out a loan for the full extent of our Immortal Dao potential!”

The next moment, as the two of them tapped away at their phones, the numbers in their bank accounts changed dramatically.

In that instant, Zhang Yu felt as if he could see rivers of gold crossing vast distances to pour into his body, frantically fueling his Immortal Dao potential.

(End of Chapter)

# Chapter 144: Gradually Taking the Shape of an Insider

Regarding the matter of taking out loans, Zhang Yu had been quite wary when he first arrived in Kunxu.

This was partly due to the influence of his original body's experiences and memories, and partly due to the caution toward debt from his own past life.

But after being tempered by life in Kunxu for more than half a year and seeing many others take out loans, his mindset had gradually begun to change.

_Using alchemical enhancers for body tempering, borrowing money to make money…_ Zhang Yu lamented inwardly, _I am being assimilated by Kunxu more and more, becoming just like a local._

But Zhang Yu didn't think there was anything wrong with it; a person ultimately had to adapt to their environment. To climb the ladder in Kunxu, one had to adapt to Kunxu's rules.
