Body tempering required enhancers! Immortal cultivation required loans!

In the blink of an eye, Zhang Yu had successively borrowed money from multiple platforms.

Now, Zhang Yu repaid his loans on time every month, his bank transactions surged, and his grades improved dramatically. The various credit lines he could borrow from, when added together, had already increased by another 1 million.

And so, in an instant, 1 million was credited to Zhang Yu's account.

"Including the original 15,000 per month, I'll be paying 40,000 in interest each month from now on. By the time I'm a third-year, I'll have to pay off the 1.7 million in principal from all platforms as well."

"Adding the 5,000 from the interest-free loan, that's a total of 45,000 in monthly repayments."

Staring at the cold balance of over 1.3 million in his account, Zhang Yu slowly exhaled, feeling both the weight of a heavy pressure on his shoulders and a rush of motivation to go back and give it his all.

Beside him, Bai Zhenzhen, who had previously borrowed less than Zhang Yu, had now gone all out, taking out another 900,000 in loans in one go. She too wore an expression of eager determination, just waiting to get back and merge that 900,000 into her own flesh to advance her cultivation.

More than ten hours later, after a series of transfers, the two finally returned to Songyang City and began another charge on the path of the Immortal Dao.

And time flowed by rapidly with their charge.

…

Inside the apartment.

Zhang Yu took off the weighted clothes he usually wore for exercise and took out the newly purchased 'training skin'.

It was unknown what kind of Immortal Dao technology was used for this training skin; it looked like a thin layer of human skin, and even the touch felt similar to that of real human skin.

Seeing its lifelike appearance, Zhang Yu said, "This couldn't have been made from the actual skin of some master, could it?"

With Zhang Yu's understanding of Kunxu, such a thing was not impossible.

Fu Ji, however, scoffed, "For the pittance you spent, you expect real leather?"

"This is obviously synthetic. It won't achieve 100% compatibility when you use it, 99% at most."

But as Zhang Yu put it on, he felt the training skin naturally adhere to his body, as if it had become a new layer of his own skin.

At the same time, this new skin brought a strong sense of restraint to his physical body, forcing him to constantly exert his strength to counteract it, as if he were continuously exercising every muscle and tendon in his body.

He, however, couldn't feel any lack of compatibility and only felt it was much better to use than his original weighted clothing.

A moment later, Zhang Yu opened his phone, clicked on the training skin's management software, and chose to turn it off.

The feeling of restraint all over his body vanished abruptly, making it so Zhang Yu couldn't even feel the presence of the training skin.

"It doesn't affect my breathing, sweating, or breathing exercises either."

"Worthy of a 100,000-yuan training skin. This way, I can add another layer of exercise at all times."

"And I can turn it off whenever I don't need it."

…

The conservation area, incubation room.

The little panda An'an was hugging her large tail, watching Bai Zhenzhen perform her breathing exercises, and thinking to herself that Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen had at least doubled their time here these past few days.

_I wonder if the time they spend tutoring Wenwu has also doubled?_

Although seeing them freeload off the spiritual energy of the Red Pagoda still caused An'an a pang of heartache for the loss of company assets.

But she tried hard not to let it show.

After all, for someone like her who hadn't even finished elementary school, high school students were already heaven's favored children.

And when faced with competition-level students from a key high school like Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen, especially after learning about their grades, An'an felt a sense of inferiority, a feeling of unworthiness, every time she stood before them.

Because she understood deeply that compared to Bai Zhenzhen and Zhang Yu, she was a complete illiterate.

Bai Zhenzhen's perpetually cold demeanor in particular made An'an feel that she probably looked down on her quite a bit.

However, when Bai Zhenzhen was leaving this time, An'an still quickly waved her short limbs, hopping over to block Bai Zhenzhen's path.

"This is for you."

Bai Zhenzhen looked at the piece of demonic beast meat tied with a ribbon and asked curiously, "For me?"

An'an said, "Thank you for tutoring Xiong Wenwu."

Seeing An'an's slightly nervous gaze, Bai Zhenzhen accepted the demonic beast meat and said, "You often have leftover demonic beast meat here that you can't sell, right?"

"Why don't you sell it to me privately for a cheaper price? It just so happens I'm planning to purchase more demonic beast meat for a dietary supplement recently."

An'an said anxiously, "You want me to sell out the company's interests?"

Bai Zhenzhen chuckled and rubbed An'an's ears. "You don't want Xiong Wenwu's grades to slip, do you? Just sell it to me for a little cheaper."

"If you don't feel right using the money you earn, you can subsidize Xiong Wenwu with it."

An'an sighed internally, feeling that she was gradually transforming from the best employee into a company mole, unworthy of her 2,000-yuan salary.

…

Inside the apartment.

As Zhang Yu switched on the newly bought spotlights one by one, the entire room went from bright to incandescent white, until finally it was so bright that almost nothing could be seen, and even Zhang Yu's figure was completely swallowed.

Feeling the frantic passive operation of his Great Sun Sea of Qi and the Great Sun mana churning violently like magma inside him, Zhang Yu cultivated the Crimson Marrow Primordial Qi in this environment.

…

Late June.

Inside the apartment.

In a cardboard box placed in a corner of the room were all sorts of potions that Le Mulan had brought for Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen.

Le Mulan casually tossed her tattered clothes into a nearby trash can.

Because she had sweated so much today, her skin had become a little dry.

As she changed her clothes, she said, "You've gotten much stronger recently."

Zhang Yu smiled. "I have your alchemical enhancers to thank. I'm always full of energy after using them."

Le Mulan's gaze swept over slightly. Seeing Zhang Yu staring at the potion on the floor, she reminded him, "The Bone and Muscle Enhancement Agent is most effective when taken orally."

Ultimately, Zhang Yu couldn't bring himself to do such a thing. He shot to his feet and seized the time to absorb the potion and cultivate the Crimson Marrow Primordial Qi.

A trace of surprise flashed through Le Mulan's eyes. As she walked out of the room, she couldn't help but say, "Next time, you can tell me in advance what alchemical enhancer you want me to use before I come."

After returning to Purple Cloud High School, Le Mulan drank several glasses of water in a row because she had just sweated so profusely.

Having just finished another glass, Le Mulan spoke to Lian Tianji who was beside her, "Go get me another glass of water."

"Next time, before I leave the school, remember to prepare a bucket of water for me too."

Lian Tianji nodded slightly, thinking to himself, _What kind of combat training could possibly cause so much sweating?_

…

Songyang High School.

The office for renting spiritual roots.

The administrator, Wei Xin, looked at Zhang Yu in astonishment and said, "How long did you say you want to rent it for?"

Zhang Yu said heroically, "If I get a monthly package, what kind of discount can you give me?"

Although he could take turns using Bai Zhenzhen's True Spiritual Root, and even though the True Spiritual Root had some residual effects, it was still being shared between two people.

With a huge sum of money on hand, Zhang Yu's first thought was to rent a Muscle-Growth Spiritual Root. While Bai Zhenzhen was using her spiritual root, he would use the Muscle-Growth Spiritual Root, allowing both of them to use a spiritual root for cultivation 24 hours a day.

The administrator, Wei Xin, nodded repeatedly, her eyes shining. 

"Of course, we can offer a discount. For the Muscle-Growth Spiritual Root, a monthly package can be discounted to 2 million a month."

For a moment, Zhang Yu fell silent, feeling that he had been a bit presumptuous just now.

"Never mind, let's just go by the hour. It feels more flexible that way."

…

The end of June.

White Dragon High School.

Yu Xinghan and Zhang Yu created a swathe of afterimages as they engaged in a fierce battle.

Sensing the ferocious power in the other's moves, Yu Xinghan asked, "You've learned the Dragon-Elephant Mountain-Shattering Palm?"

Zhang Yu's palm strike was accompanied by the roar of a dragon and the trumpet of an elephant as he shouted, "Because of you, I had to spend a full 200,000 to buy this cultivation technique. Shouldn't you sponsor some of it?"

Yu Xinghan returned a palm strike of his own, laughing heartily. 

"You can only blame your own martial arts talent for being too strong and too expensive."

Yu Xinghan, who had looked into Zhang Yu's background... had actually already guessed this point: that when he used a purely physical martial art like the Dragon-Elephant Mountain-Shattering Palm, it was very likely to be learned by Zhang Yu.

But this was precisely his goal.

Because when his opponent used the same martial art as him, it was more convenient for him to use his third eye to absorb and replicate Zhang Yu's physical strength and techniques.

But he didn't want to explicitly tell Zhang Yu to do so, as Zhang Yu would surely ask him for more money.

_Good... good, he learned this technique on his own during our training and then had no choice but to buy it._

_Hehe, saved another sum of money._

However, thinking that Zhang Yu had spent 200,000 despite his impoverished state, a flash of embarrassment crossed Yu Xinghan's heart.

_My apologies, Zhang Yu, but in the struggle for the immortal path, if you don't spend more, I have to._

_To go further on the path of the Immortal Dao, I cannot yield a single inch._

_I must pass next year's Foundation Establishment exam! For this goal, I will save—and make—money by any means necessary!_

As for Zhang Yu participating in the Foundation Establishment exam, Yu Xinghan paid it no mind at all.

After all, in Yu Xinghan's view, constrained by his finances, the gap between them would only grow larger next year. He was no competition for him in the exam whatsoever.

On the other side, Zhang Yu, while executing a level 1 Dragon-Elephant Mountain-Shattering Palm, glanced at the Feathered Tome which showed 'Dragon-Elephant Mountain-Shattering Palm Level 3 (5/30)' and felt the new benefits this martial art brought to his techniques.

Because his usual cultivation time was already completely occupied by the Crimson Marrow Primordial Qi, he could only practice other martial arts during combat training.

So Zhang Yu simply bought the usage rights for the Dragon-Elephant Mountain-Shattering Palm to practice it while conducting combat training with Yu Xinghan.

He thought to himself, _My apologies, Yu Xinghan... for me, the training effect is about the same whether I use a level 1 Dragon-Elephant Mountain-Shattering Palm or my highest-level one._

_But I cannot expose my terrifying talent._

_I can only practice with you using the level 1 Dragon-Elephant Mountain-Shattering Palm and sacrifice the quality of your training a little._

_After all, to pass the Foundation Establishment qualification exam this year, I must seize every opportunity to become stronger, by any means necessary._

…

Time flowed on as Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen spent money and cultivated like mad.

In a flash, it was already the beginning of July.

There was only a month and a half left until the first round of the Foundation Establishment exam in mid-August.

And on this day, within Songyang High School.

Lan Ling led a group of second-year students toward the first-year campus area.

He thought to himself, _Zhang Pianpian has been gone for half a month, and it seems she hasn't transferred the contracts for Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen to anyone else._

_Did she just leave them on the first floor?_

_Let's test the waters, see if Zhang Pianpian made any arrangements for these two paupers._

Lan Ling planned to teach the two a little lesson during the combat class, just like he did a few months ago.

And at the thought of their past unruly behavior, how they, as paupers and juniors, had dared to challenge him, a wealthy senior, Lan Ling felt a wave of displeasure.

Of course, his actions this time did not stem solely from his own thoughts.

Lan Ling thought of Zhou Chechen and Purple Cloud's Le Jingchen, who had contacted him this morning.

Lan Ling mused inwardly, _After all, letting two paupers who can't even get into the Ten Greats occupy spots in the competition... has drawn the ire of many people._

# Chapter 145: Zhang Yu's Meteoric Rise

Inside the training grounds.

The students of the first-year model class were engaged in one-on-one combat training.

The martial arts teacher, Lei Jun, shouted at the crowd, "Daoist arts are a battle of wealth, martial arts a battle of life! If you want to spend less money, you have to risk your life more."

"Every bit of hard work you put in now is one less expense you'll have at tutoring classes."

"In two more months, you will officially be second-year students. Think about it, is your current level worthy of the second year?"

While urging everyone to cultivate diligently, Lei Jun looked at the purple people, beastmen, and black people in the class and sighed internally, _For this year's high school admission interviews, a willingness to undergo the new body tempering surgery after enrollment will probably be a major bonus._

_In another five or ten years, it will likely become a standard requirement for admission, just like sterilization surgery._

Lei Jun could already imagine the situation then would probably be... What? You want to cultivate immortality with a regular human body like that? Go complete the modification surgery first.

But Lei Jun was also somewhat fortunate. _Good thing I'm not a physical education teacher; this has little to do with me._

With the advancement of new body tempering technologies, Lei Jun knew that the physical education teachers were having meetings almost every day, constantly researching new teaching plans.

"So it's still better to be a martial arts teacher; the teaching duties are the most relaxed."

"But only for first-year martial arts teachers."

Lei Jun knew that the pressure on third-year martial arts teachers was truly immense.

After all, facing those third-year students who had already stepped into late-stage Qi Refinement and were at an age most obsessed with grades required real combat experience.

"A teacher like me, who is only proficient in basic combat experiences like sneak attacks, insults, and provocations, can only handle arena fights."

But to be a third-year teacher just by being a good fighter?

Lei Jun knew that was a pipe dream.

"How could a third-year teacher be competent without studying insurance contracts, injury assessment, medical compensation, and organ appraisal for a few years? If not, they wouldn't even be able to figure out how their students were killed or injured in class."

However, with high risk came high reward, and Lei Jun sometimes envied the income of third-year martial arts teachers as insurance and medical intermediaries.

Just then, a sound of footsteps came from outside. Seeing the rows of second-year students walking over, especially the one leading them, Lan Ling, Lei Jun's brows furrowed.

At the same time, the first-year students who had been practicing individually all stopped and bowed to the approaching second-year students.

"Greetings, seniors!"

Seeing the respectful gestures of the first-year students, Lan Ling nodded slightly. "Carry on."

He then walked toward Lei Jun and smiled faintly. "Teacher, a combat exchange between the second and first years has been arranged for today. You've received the notice, haven't you?"

Lei Jun checked and found that this matter had indeed just been arranged, and his displeasure grew.

Because it reminded him of the scene a few months ago when Lan Ling had 'guided' Bai Zhenzhen.

But he knew there was nothing he could do about it.

Lei Jun sighed in his heart, _So it's finally here?_

Lei Jun knew that the Student Council of Songyang High School, and indeed the 16 prominent families of Songyang City, would not sit idly by and watch two paupers like Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen snatch competition rankings time and time again.

Because for the wealthy people of Songyang City, every competition ranking was a crucial achievement for interviews with the Ten Greats. How could they be given to paupers who were destined never to get in?

Even at the peak of Qi Refinement, Lei Jun dared not go against such a tide at this moment and could only say reluctantly, "Don't hurt anyone."

Lan Ling said, "Rest assured, teacher. I've told all the students that when they have combat training with their juniors, they must be careful and must not injure them."

"By the way..." Lan Ling's gaze swept around but didn't see Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen, so he said casually, "Are all the students here? If not, please call them over."

In a corner of the training room, Zhao Tianxing, who was purple all over like a human-shaped eggplant, secretly took out his phone and began sending a message to Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen: "The bullies are looking for trouble with you, don't come over."

But just as he sent the message, a hand gently patted him on the shoulder, scaring him so much he almost threw his phone.

"Junior, let this senior guide you a bit."

Zhao Tianxing turned his head to see a senior, a full circle wider than himself, smiling at him.

Lan Ling said coolly, "Zhou Ke, remember, you must not injure our junior."

"Don't worry." Zhou Ke pulled Zhao Tianxing out and said gently, "I guarantee I won't harm a single hair on his head."

…

In the small garden of the school.

Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen were hiding here, cultivating silently.

As Zhang Yu circulated the Crimson Marrow Primordial Qi, accompanied by the intense movement of his muscles, organs, and bones, his entire body was steaming, as if he had turned into a radiator, constantly emitting heat into the surroundings.

Since returning from the Immortal Capital, Zhang Yu had charged full-speed ahead on the path of the Immortal Dao by throwing money at it, and his strength had naturally advanced by leaps and bounds.

As of today, his mana had reached 69.4, and his physical strength was at level 6.81, drawing ever closer to the average level of a new third-year at White Dragon High.

Only the progress of his Dao heart had been slower during this period, having only advanced to level 5 (37%).

_That guy Yu Xinghan, he said he'd introduce me to a channel in the Spirit Realm to cultivate my Dao heart after this year's college entrance exams were over. How come it hasn't happened yet?_

Besides the improvements in his Dao heart, mana, and physical body, Zhang Yu's other gain was advancing the Dragon-Elephant Mountain-Shattering Palm to level 10 through his combat training with Yu Xinghan.

And ever since the Dragon-Elephant Mountain-Shattering Palm reached level 10, Zhang Yu could feel subtle changes in the structure of his muscles and bones day by day. It was his body undergoing a transformation with each day's nourishment and exercise.

Zhang Yu understood that this was the level 10 effect of the Dragon-Elephant Mountain-Shattering Palm, also known as Dragon Tendons and Elephant Bones, which gave the physical body a more immortal and powerful carrying capacity, able to withstand and transmit higher bursts of power.

_Worthy of a 200,000-yuan martial art. No wonder Yu Xinghan practices this technique._

_If I had this level 10 Dragon-Elephant Mountain-Shattering Palm during the athletics meet, maybe I could have lifted 13,000 kilograms? No, maybe even 14,000 kilograms of the Sky Pillar._

Just then, Bai Zhenzhen, who was beside him, suddenly spoke, "Yu-boy, did you see the message Old Zhao sent us?"

Hearing this, Zhang Yu opened his phone, looked at Old Zhao's message, then looked at Bai Zhenzhen and asked, "Zhen, what do you say?"

Bai Zhenzhen laughed. "If we don't even dare to fight students from our own Songyang High School like Lan Ling, how can we ever compete with the young masters of the Immortal Capital?"

As she spoke, Bai Zhenzhen had already shot off toward the training room like a flash of lightning.

"Yu-boy, I'm going ahead. If you're late, you might not get a chance to fight."

Seeing Bai Zhenzhen disappear in an instant, Zhang Yu thought to himself, _Zhen's speed is getting faster and faster._

He knew that he wasn't the only one who had been improving rapidly during this time; Bai Zhenzhen had also made swift progress.

_Zhen's martial arts talent was already formidable with the support of the True Spiritual Root to begin with._

Zhang Yu still remembered Bai Zhenzhen's performance when she learned the high school's basic martial arts, comprehended the Martial Ascension Heart-Tempering Art, and grasped the external moves of the Limitless Cloud Hand; she had succeeded in almost no time at all.

And now...

_While the True Spiritual Root boosted my cultivation speed, I also stimulated the True Spiritual Root's evolution._

Zhang Yu had too many cultivation techniques trained to level 10, far exceeding the level of a high school student.

As the True Spiritual Root continuously adapted to Zhang Yu, it was as if it absorbed more traces of the techniques from the circulation of his physical body and mana, and then brought them back into Bai Zhenzhen's body.

This made it so that if Bai Zhenzhen cultivated the techniques Zhang Yu had practiced, it would be as natural as water flowing into a channel, allowing her to advance by leaps and bounds.

This was especially true for purely external arts like the Dragonback Mountain Toppler Hand and the Dragon-Elephant Mountain-Shattering Palm, which Bai Zhenzhen could master with ease.

However, Zhang Yu knew that Bai Zhenzhen couldn't afford the usage rights for the techniques he had, so she secretly practiced them on her own and didn't plan to use them openly, only as a means to improve her own strength.

…

Inside the training grounds.

The eggplant-like Zhao Tianxing had just climbed up when he was kicked in the buttocks by Zhou Ke again, falling to the ground like a dog eating dirt, which drew a round of laughter from the second-year students.

Zhao Tianxing struggled to his feet again, but no matter how he dodged or counterattacked, Zhou Ke could always appear behind him as if from nowhere and deliver a kick to his rear.

The force used was not great, just enough to knock Zhao Tianxing down.

This represented complete dominance in terms of strength, speed, and control.

So Zhao Tianxing was not injured.

Nor did he feel disheartened by the huge gap between them.

After all, he was facing a senior from a higher grade. Zhao Tianxing knew that any first-year student in this situation could only bow their head obediently.

_After all, it's a one-year gap. It's perfectly normal that I'm no match for a senior._

At this moment, most of his thoughts were no longer on the fight, but on his current disgraceful state.

_Good thing I had the super-metabolism surgery and my whole body is purple. They probably can't see me blushing, right?_

_Purple is my best camouflage right now._

Climbing up once more, Zhao Tianxing quickly fastened his slightly loose pants, afraid they might be knocked off later.

He knew that at this moment, he had certainly become a laughingstock in the eyes of everyone present.

And the only thing Zhao Tianxing could think of doing was to pretend not to care as much as possible. After they had their laugh, they would naturally stop laughing over time.

This was the experience he had gained from being a clown time and time again.

As for resisting?

_First-year students like us are definitely no match for second-year seniors._

_And the one leading them is from the Student Council..._

Thinking of the prominent families behind Lan Ling and the others, Zhao Tianxing silently told himself not to cause trouble for his parents.

Just then, a voice was heard. "Isn't that enough? What's the point of this kind of combat training?"

Zhou Ke stopped and looked at Qian Shen who had spoken, tilting his head.

"This junior has an opinion on his senior's guidance?"

Beside them, Zhao Tianxing, while getting up, looked at Qian Shen with some gratitude. "Old Qian..."

Qian Shen, however, frowned. "In the college entrance exam's combat test, the Yellow Turban Strongmen will simulate the examinee's stats to fight."

"To improve our scores, we should be fighting against opponents with similar data."

"Aren't you just wasting everyone's cultivation time and dragging down our scores by doing this?"

"Besides, Zhao Tianxing and most of the people here don't have high scores to begin with. Won't this mess-up delay them even more?"

(End of Chapter)

# Chapter 146: True Combat Techniques

Zhao Tianxing’s lips twitched at the words, thinking to himself, _Qian-boy, you really didn't need to say that last part. Now I look like an even bigger clown._

Lan Ling’s gaze turned cold as he looked at Qian Shen, this junior who dared to talk back to a senior.

“Zhou Ke,” he said flatly, “why don’t you instruct this junior as well.”

Just as Zhou Ke was about to walk toward Qian Shen, a flash of lightning streaked through the air.

To the astonishment of the crowd, Bai Zhenzhen had appeared before Zhou Ke, trailing a gust of wind.

“Didn’t I tell them not to come?” Zhao Tianxing said in a panic. “Why are they here again?”

He seemed to recall the sight of Bai Zhenzhen being flung away by Lan Ling several months ago.

Although Bai Zhenzhen’s strength had advanced by leaps and bounds these past few months, the second-year students had also been cultivating and improving. In Zhao Tianxing’s eyes, the one-year gap in cultivation time was simply insurmountable.

“You want a fight, is that it?” Bai Zhenzhen, however, just snorted coldly and looked at Zhou Ke. “I’ll be your opponent.”

But Lan Ling spoke up. “Zhou Ke, you should rest for a bit and recover your stamina.”

Lan Ling said this because, based on Bai Zhenzhen's performance in the athletics meet, he felt Zhou Ke was likely not her match.

And of course, Lan Ling couldn’t allow a first-year student like Bai Zhenzhen to school a second-year senior in front of so many people.

So he used a casual excuse to send Zhou Ke away and stepped forward himself to meet Bai Zhenzhen’s gaze.

Lan Ling smiled slightly and said casually, “Junior, it’s been a few months. Allow me to instruct you again—”

Boom!

Without giving Lan Ling a chance to finish, Bai Zhenzhen’s right leg seemed to vanish from the air, exploding in a wave of qi against his abdomen.

It was just like their spar several months ago—Bai Zhenzhen landing a kick on Lan Ling—but the result was completely different.

Lan Ling’s expression changed slightly, and his body, once as steady as a mountain, stumbled back two steps.

“Senior, it seems you’ve underestimated me.”

As Bai Zhenzhen spoke, she had already vanished from Lan Ling’s sight.

Off to the side, Lei Jun’s eyes lit up. _It’s been a while since I’ve seen Bai Zhenzhen go all out. How did she get this much stronger?_

“A fine sneak attack,” Lei Jun praised sincerely. “Remember this, all of you. In a real battle, the sneak attack is a profound art, the best choice for the weak to defeat the strong.”

The next moment, it was as if flashes of lightning were flickering back and forth through the air.

Bai Zhenzhen’s blurry figure darted about like a phantom.

Before the shocked eyes of the first and second-year students, Bai Zhenzhen transformed into a raging tempest, completely engulfing Lan Ling.

Flashes of lightning accompanied by waves of qi exploded against Lan Ling’s body, striking him like a barrage of cannonballs and forcing him back step by step.

Lan Ling protected his vital points with his hands, watching the scene with equal surprise. _How does this Bai Zhenzhen already possess this kind of power?_

_In just a few short months, she… she’s already at a level where she can fight me?_

At this thought, an intense jealousy surged through Lan Ling’s heart.

How much money had he spent? How much effort? How much time had it taken for him to reach this stage?

And this pauper, she had spent less money and less time, yet she was already approaching his level?

With a resounding boom, the qi and blood throughout Lan Ling’s body suddenly surged. The palm of his right hand began to throb violently as it swelled, turning a deep red and doubling in size in an instant.

This was the expert-level cultivation technique Lan Ling practiced, a level-five activation of the Primeval Heart Grand Seal!

It wasn't just the expansion of muscle providing power; it was the gathered force of his entire body's circulating vital energy, all focused into that single palm.

With a light push of his palm, Bai Zhenzhen felt the very air press down on her like a wall, its suffocating pressure threatening to choke her.

_I can't match him in a direct contest of strength._ Bai Zhenzhen’s figure retreated swiftly, already evading the palm strike.

In an instant, the two on the field looked as if they were fighting at a distance; Lan Ling couldn't catch Bai Zhenzhen, and Bai Zhenzhen wouldn't clash with him head-on.

Just then, Lan Ling shouted, “Junior, don’t you even dare to take one of my palm strikes?”

“A classic provocation to start,” Lei Jun analyzed. “Remember this. Provoking an opponent, disrupting their state of mind, even making them give up their advantage to fight your strength with their weakness—this is all part of the profound art of provocation. It will be on your theory exams.”

The many first-year students nodded repeatedly at his words.

Lan Ling, however, frowned and couldn't help but glance at Lei Jun.

Just then, a cold laugh came from the rapidly moving Bai Zhenzhen. 

“Lan Ling, with your level of skill, you can’t even handle a first-year like me. I’d say you’ve already got one foot in a vocational school. All those years of study were truly wasted.”

Lan Ling gritted his teeth, the vital energy in his body seeming to roil even more furiously.

“A fine insult!” Lei Jun commented from the side. “Listen to how Bai Zhenzhen's few words are not only full of aggression but are also tailor-made for her opponent, immediately causing him to become flustered.”

“Sneak attacks, provocations, insults—these are all fundamentals of real combat and key topics for the theory exams. Watch closely and remember well…”

Lan Ling grew even more furious upon hearing this. Wasn't this implying he was destined for a vocational school?

To Lan Ling, this was an utter humiliation. He had studied diligently since childhood and had never been spoken to with such filth, being told he was bound for a vocational school.

Roar!

Seeing Bai Zhenzhen approach him again, Lan Ling let out a furious roar, and a surge of mana mixed with airflow erupted from his mouth.

Visible ripples spread out in all directions.

It was another expert-level cultivation technique, a level-five activation of the Lion’s Roar!

The surging sound waves swept out in all directions, launching an all-out attack on the space surrounding Lan Ling.

Just as Lan Ling felt his attack was certain to hit Bai Zhenzhen.

He saw Bai Zhenzhen, as if she had anticipated it, flicker with lightning. The very instant he activated the Lion’s Roar, she had already changed direction in advance, flashing far away.

In Bai Zhenzhen’s eyes, the expression on Lan Ling’s face as he lost his temper and prepared to unleash a major technique was far too obvious.

And the power of the Lion’s Roar’s sound waves diminished greatly with distance. Bai Zhenzhen easily withstood it and charged toward Lan Ling once more.

At this moment, after retracting the Primeval Heart Grand Seal to unleash the Lion’s Roar, Lan Ling, in Bai Zhenzhen’s eyes, was no longer at his peak in either stamina or mana. Every single one of his moves was now full of openings.

Amidst a series of explosive bangs, Bai Zhenzhen and Lan Ling were locked in fierce combat.

Their palms and fingers clashed, setting off thunderous booms of wind and lightning.

With a whoosh, Bai Zhenzhen broke off her attack and retreated, looking at Lan Ling with a faint smile. “Still want to fight?”

Lan Ling snorted, suppressing the Lion’s Roar that was about to erupt from his throat. “Scared, junior?”

Just then, Lei Jun’s voice rang out. “Beautiful!”

“That insult was a direct slap to the face, a strike straight to the heart. Remember it well.”

Lan Ling frowned slightly, then, as if realizing something, looked down at his chest. He saw that the clothes there were shredded, revealing a wound marked with faint traces of blood.

The wound had been inflicted just now when they clashed, by Bai Zhenzhen using her Body-Piercing Sword Qi in concert with the Formless Sword Art, further augmented by her True Spiritual Root.

It wasn't particularly powerful; it had only broken Lan Ling's skin and drawn a trickle of blood.

But the wound had formed several characters: Vocational Student.

Rage!

It surged up from the depths of Lan Ling’s heart.

Meanwhile, Lei Jun was still speaking. “You see? Wasn't the effect excellent?”

“I’ve told you all before, the college entrance exam is about fighting Yellow Turban Strongmen, so you just go all out and hit them as hard as you can. I don’t require you to use real combat techniques during the exam.”

“But a real fight in the real world is different from an exam. You absolutely cannot just think about how to injure or kill the opponent. Even if you win that way, you’ll have to pay compensation. The more you win, the more you lose.”

“Truly formidable masters of combat wound the heart, not the person. They destroy the spirit, not the body.”

“Take the art of the insult, for instance. You might think it’s useless during your usual exams, but it has great utility in a real fight.”

“A true master of insults can leave an opponent without a single scratch, yet after one battle, cause their Dao heart to collapse, even leading them to die from depression.”

Lan Ling glared fiercely at Lei Jun and barked, “Teacher, haven’t you said a bit too much?”

Lei Jun smiled. “It’s a rare opportunity for a second-year to instruct a first-year. I certainly can’t waste this chance to analyze it for everyone.”

Lan Ling took several deep breaths, glared at Bai Zhenzhen, and said, “Petty tricks. Let’s continue.”

“Still want to fight?” Bai Zhenzhen said flatly. “Let’s not. I don’t want to carve any more words on you.”

Hearing this, blood rushed to Lan Ling’s face.

“Bai Zhenzhen!” he roared. “You just managed to scratch my skin while I wasn't paying attention! How could you possibly be my opponent in terms of true strength?”

_He’s triggered._ Watching from the sidelines, Zhao Tianxing shook his head. _Once you get triggered, you’ve truly become the clown._

Drawing from his past experiences of being made a fool, Zhao Tianxing understood deeply that when one was at a disadvantage, one had to act nonchalant.

If, on the contrary, one got triggered, then in the eyes of the crowd, you had lost even if you hadn’t, and you were a fool even if you hadn’t been one before.

_Oh well. Now the role of the clown has shifted to Lan Ling, so what happened to me earlier doesn't matter anymore._

On the other side.

“Let it go, senior,” Bai Zhenzhen said, shaking her head. “Look, your defense is broken.”

Just as Lan Ling lost his composure.

Outside the training hall’s main doors, Zhou Chechen leaned against the wall and sighed with a look of helplessness.

“Sigh, look at you, getting triggered again.”

Then, Zhou Chechen smiled faintly and spoke to Zhang Yu, who stood before him.

“Junior, the look in your eyes is making me very uncomfortable.”

Zhang Yu, who had arrived at the training hall just a step behind Bai Zhenzhen, now stared at Zhou Chechen and said, “Senior, you wish to instruct me?”

Radiating a sky-full of chilling air, Zhou Chechen walked toward Zhang Yu step by step. He looked down on him from his superior height and said slowly,

“Compared to you, I’m actually more interested in your master, Zhang Pianpian.”

“Junior, don’t think too highly of yourself.”

“Even if I were to do something… it would be like dealing with a barking dog. A casual kick to shut it up, and then see whether it’s a stray or a pet.”

# Chapter 147: Humiliating Lan Ling

Outside the training hall’s main doors.

“Here’s another warning for you. The rankings in the competitions are not something your and Bai Zhenzhen’s status can occupy forever.”

“You will not participate in the upcoming first-year Dao heart competition.”

After speaking, Zhou Chechen walked into the training hall, seemingly giving Zhang Yu no chance to retort.

Or perhaps he was saying… _If you want to resist, then come inside and tell me. If you have that kind of confidence, and that kind of courage._

With Zhou Chechen’s arrival, the entire training hall felt as if it had been plunged into a harsh winter.

It wasn't just the chilling air he brought with him that physically lowered the temperature.

It was the accumulated authority of this Student Council vice president, pressing down like dark clouds over a city, making everyone present, whether first or second-year students, feel as if they couldn’t even breathe.

The first-year students all bowed in unison. “Greetings, senior.”

The second-years on the other side did the same. “Greetings, President.”

Even Lan Ling, who had been on the verge of losing his temper just moments ago, was shocked into calmness by the chill emanating from Zhou Chechen. He no longer argued with Bai Zhenzhen.

He flexed his chest muscles slightly, then wiped a hand over the area, and the broken skin and muscle sealed shut, completely erasing the words 'Vocational Student.'

Zhou Chechen’s eyes swept over the crowd, finally landing on Bai Zhenzhen.

“Bai Zhenzhen,” he said flatly, “Senior Lan Ling was kind enough to instruct you in combat techniques, yet you used tricks to humiliate him. This is a true violation of the spirit of our Songyang High School…”

Watching this unfold, Zhao Tianxing was struck by a sense of familiarity. _Here we go again. It was the same way a few months ago._

_Once Zhou Chechen arrives, no one can stand against him._

_If Zhang Pianpian hadn't put him in his place at the end, Yu-boy and Zhen would have probably been bullied to death back then._

A flash of insight seemed to strike Zhao Tianxing’s mind. _It’s the same now._

_With just a few moves and a few words, Zhou Chechen has completely changed the atmosphere of the entire scene._

_I can feel it… with Zhou Chechen’s next move… the role of the clown is about to shift again._

Zhao Tianxing looked nervously and worriedly at Bai Zhenzhen, then at himself. No matter how he thought about it, he felt that the clown role was heading straight for the two of them.

Just then, Zhang Yu also walked into the training hall. He looked at Zhou Chechen and smiled.

“The spirit of our Songyang High School? When did that ever include not being able to humiliate other students?”

“Students with high scores can insult students with low scores. Good grades are everything. Isn't that the true spirit of our Songyang High School?”

The students present, whether first or second-year, all nodded inwardly upon hearing this, strongly agreeing with Zhang Yu's logic.

Zhou Chechen also looked at Zhang Yu with a scrutinizing gaze.

_You dare to come in? Then let me see what gives you such confidence._

Zhang Yu continued, “With Lan Ling's skill level, how many competition rankings did he get when he was a first-year? Did he ever spar with students from the three major high schools?”

“Bai Zhenzhen took fourth in the martial arts competition and fifth in the athletics competition. Why can’t she insult Lan Ling?”

Bai Zhenzhen added coolly from the side, “When Zhang Yu and I went to White Dragon High School to exchange martial knowledge with their year’s top students, Yu Xinghan and Song Hailong, students like this who’ve never placed in a competition had to kneel outside the door to listen.”

Qian Shen couldn’t help but chime in, “That’s right. For us high school students, grades are king. Based on Bai Zhenzhen’s competition results, her level of evolution is far beyond Lan Ling’s. What’s wrong with her insulting him a little?”

Indeed, was it even an issue for a student with good grades to insult one with poor grades? Wasn’t that just a casual, everyday occurrence at Songyang High School? The students present had either experience insulting others, being insulted, or both. At these words, all of them nodded in silent agreement.

Even among the second-year students, the way many of them looked at Lan Ling had subtly changed.

Listening to them speak one after another, the vital energy in Lan Ling’s body surged more violently, his breathing grew heavier, his face turned redder, and the veins on his forehead looked as if they were about to pop. Yet, he couldn’t utter a single word.

This was because every sentence they spoke was grounded in the principle of scores being paramount, of grades being king. It made Lan Ling want to lash out, but at the same time feel that he couldn’t. In the end, all he could do was glare fixedly at Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen.

At that moment, Lan Ling even had the feeling that he was being bullied by students with better grades.

Zhao Tianxing watched this scene, his eyes shining with a strange light. _When Zhou Chechen said those few words, I thought the clown role was about to shift. Who knew that as soon as A'Yu came in, he would instantly turn the situation around and nail the clown role firmly onto Lan Ling._

But just as everyone’s emotions were following the narrative spun by Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen.

Zhou Chechen took a step forward, and the chill from his body erupted, sending waves of bone-piercing cold wind sweeping through the entire training hall.

Zhou Chechen said coldly, “Lan Ling is a member of the Student Council. He represents the Student Council.”

“He came here with good intentions to instruct his juniors, yet was ambushed and humiliated by Bai Zhenzhen. This is a disruption of the school's instructional order and has nothing to do with who has higher or lower scores.”

Accompanying the cold wind that burst forth from Zhou Chechen was a form of spiritual pressure.

A strong sense of fear welled up in the hearts of many, making them inexplicably tense, their hearts race, and they dared not offer any rebuttal to Zhou Chechen’s words.

Zhang Yu, standing not far in front of Zhou Chechen, bore the brunt of it. As the cold wind rushed toward him, a wave of fear was stirred up in his heart as well.

Fu Ji reminded him, _Be careful. It’s the effect of a heart art._

Zhang Yu immediately activated the Martial Ascension Heart-Tempering Art. A martial will that could battle heaven and earth instantly erupted in his mind, completely suppressing the fear that had just risen.

...

Information about Zhou Chechen surfaced in Zhang Yu's mind.

Before Zhang Pianpian left, she had instructed Zhang Yu on many things and naturally gave him a lot of useful intelligence.

Among them, Zhou Chechen and Lan Ling were two individuals with extreme hostility towards Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen, so Zhang Pianpian had of course detailed their situations.

“That frosty qi on Zhou Chechen comes from an expert-level cultivation technique called the Frost Heaven Freezing Qi Field. The heart art is the Frost Prison Art, which complements it.”

“These two cultivation techniques form a set, complementing and enhancing each other.”

Zhang Yu also knew that unlike the cultivation techniques most people bought, the Frost Heaven Freezing Qi Field and the Frost Prison Art were not purchased by Zhou Chechen, but were techniques passed down in his family for many years.

The Zhou family's first fortune was made by selling the exclusive rights to these two cultivation techniques to the Myriad Stars Education Group.

However, despite selling the copyrights, for a long time within Songyang City, the only ones who could truly master this set of techniques were members of the Zhou family.

The reason for this was related to the cultivation method of these two techniques.

Cultivating the Frost Heaven Freezing Qi Field required refining the yin-cold baleful qi and the death-resentment from corpses, then suppressing it with the Frost Prison Art heart art.

Once mastered, not only would every move carry a sky of freezing qi, but it could also unleash the residual resentment from countless corpses, forming a fear-based attack.

And in Songyang City, corpses naturally cost money.

Not only did purchasing corpses cost money, but processing them cost even more.

Whether it was wall burial, box burial, cremation, or water burial, each had different fee standards.

If the family intended to sell the body directly, they also had to go to a professional institution for processing and appraisal, paying a handling fee and a corpse transaction tax.

And thinking of just tossing one into a ditch or a small river would result in a hefty fine.

The Zhou family behind Zhou Chechen had long been in the corpse disposal business in Songyang City, possessing a large reserve of fresh corpses, allowing them to make money and cultivate at the same time.

...

At this moment, Fu Ji reminded him, _Fighting this Zhou Chechen… will be troublesome._

_The Frost Heaven Freezing Qi Field has a huge attack range. Just getting close to him means you’ll be invaded by the freezing qi. Your muscles will stiffen, and even your mana circulation will slow down. The longer you fight him, the worse your condition will get. There’s no way to dodge this all-encompassing freezing qi._

_Paired with his Frost Prison Art, it can also weaken an opponent's mental state._

_If you can't finish him in one go, you'll be continuously weakened by him, and eventually, the freezing qi accumulated in your body will erupt, causing severe injuries._

_Moreover, as the number one student of the second year, all his stats are definitely still above yours right now. It will be very difficult to overwhelm him in a short amount of time._

_So, to deal with this guy, we have to use the method we discussed before._

Of course, Zhang Yu knew what Fu Ji meant. _A public spar like this isn’t like the exam of fighting Yellow Turban Strongmen, where you can just put your head down and go all out. You have to use various combat techniques, with psychological attacks being paramount…_

On the other side, Zhou Chechen, circulating the Frost Prison Art, looked at Zhang Yu. A strong, fear-inducing pressure radiated from his eyes as he said coldly, “Bai Zhenzhen disrupted the instructional order. Are you going to as well?”

“Zhang Yu, are you also going to disrupt the instructional order?”

Facing Zhou Chechen’s pressure, Zhang Yu, however, activated the Martial Ascension Heart-Tempering Art and said without a trace of fear,

“Senior, you can use your heart art cultivation to silence others, but you can’t suppress my and Bai Zhenzhen’s grades.”

“I will stand right here today. I won’t attack, I won’t block, I won’t dodge. I will take ten of your moves head-on.”

“If, within ten moves, senior can knock me down, I will naturally accept the Student Council’s guidance willingly.”

“If not, then I ask that senior abide by the spirit of Songyang High School and allow an outstanding student like Bai Zhenzhen to freely insult an underachiever like Lan Ling.”

“Ridiculous,” Lan Ling snorted angrily. “Kid, you’re not trying to scam some medical fees, are you?”

Zhou Chechen placed a hand on Lan Ling, whose chest was about to explode with rage.

Zhou Chechen looked at Zhang Yu, the coldness in his eyes intensifying.

“Very good. What you said is very good indeed.”

“Don’t worry. It won’t take ten moves, and you won’t need to go to the medical room.”

“Within three moves, I will press you to the ground.”

As he spoke, Zhou Chechen’s figure, trailing a sky of freezing qi, shot a palm strike toward Zhang Yu from across the distance.

# Chapter 148: Battle with Zhou Chechen

In that instant, the very air seemed to freeze under Zhou Chechen's palm. A biting cold wind blasted toward Zhang Yu, rapidly stripping the heat from his flesh and blood.

Seeing this, Lei Jun thought to himself, _A fine provocation._

This time, however, Lei Jun didn't speak his analysis aloud for everyone to hear, instead pondering it himself, simply because he didn't want to alert Zhou Chechen.

He thought, _If Zhou Chechen were allowed to act freely, his freezing qi field would be too difficult to deal with. He could just keep moving around and slowly wear down his opponent._

_But Zhang Yu's words have forced Zhou Chechen to attack him head-on._

_The ten-move agreement, in particular, has put Zhou Chechen on the spot. As the vice president of the Student Council, how could he possibly agree to such a large number in front of so many people? He was bound to counter with a lower number._

_Thus, what was originally Zhou Chechen's favored battle of attrition has been transformed into an all-out assault within three moves._

_Who would have thought Zhang Yu's combat experience was so rich?_

_The only question is… can Zhang Yu really take three of Zhou Chechen’s moves?_

At the same time.

A terrifying cold qi slammed into Zhang Yu's body like a long dragon.

Zhou Chechen said flatly, “First move. Just to get you acquainted with my Frost Heaven Freezing Qi Field.”

As he spoke, Zhou Chechen began to walk slowly toward Zhang Yu.

With each step he took, the mana fluctuations from his body grew more alarming. A sky-piercing cold qi spread out in all directions, gradually condensing a layer of frost on the floor, ceiling, and walls.

Zhao Tianxing and the other first-year students, even from a great distance, felt themselves shivering uncontrollably. They exhaled puffs of white air as they backed away repeatedly, their faces filled with horror as they looked in Zhou Chechen's direction.

“Second move.”

Zhou Chechen made a gentle pinching motion toward Zhang Yu. The vast, spreading cold qi, as if receiving a command from an emperor, converged into a giant hand of ice and crushed down on Zhang Yu.

With a series of soft crackling sounds, a layer of frost seemed to form all over Zhang Yu's body, and his skin lost its color at a visible rate.

Zhou Chechen said flatly, “Zhang Yu, I know you’re very tough, very good at taking a beating.”

“But after being rapidly cooled by my Frost Heaven Freezing Qi Field, your blood vessels will gradually freeze, your body will become deprived of oxygen, and every single one of your cells will be damaged…”

Simultaneously, the mana circulation within Zhang Yu’s body was roaring. Great Sun mana, like molten lava, surged throughout his body, emitting scorching heat.

The Crimson Marrow Primordial Qi was also activated, causing his muscles to radiate waves of heat.

The Subcutaneous Astral Qi, formed from the Formless Cloud-Astral Qi, worked in concert with the Imperishable Seal Art, continuously resisting the encroaching cold qi and keeping it all at bay outside his body.

But Zhang Yu could feel that Zhou Chechen's current attack contained not only the Frost Heaven Freezing Qi Field he spoke of, but also the power of the Frost Prison Art, which was subtly affecting his spirit.

At this moment, he felt as if his ears were filled with the dying groans of countless wraiths. Powerful waves of resentment were assaulting his sea of consciousness, shaking his Dao heart.

Although the Martial Ascension Heart-Tempering Art was active, and the Martial Ascension Will continuously crushed and suppressed these resentments.

Zhang Yu felt his Martial Ascension Will was like a soldier on a battlefield, killing and killing and killing again. After waves of slaughter, it too was gradually growing fatigued, entangled by the resentments like fine threads.

As the circulation of his heart art became sluggish, Zhang Yu felt a layer of resistance in the execution of his martial arts and the flow of his mana.

_This won't do. The Martial Ascension Heart-Tempering Art isn't well-suited for dealing with this Frost Prison Art…_

Realizing this, Zhang Yu, as if by a stroke of genius, switched his heart art to the Crippled Ox Body-Sacrifice Heart Art.

This was an almost instinctual reaction for him, having cultivated both techniques to the tenth level.

As he switched heart arts, he felt the encroaching death-resentment wrap around the crippled ox in his mind, yet it failed to cause any ripples in the heart art.

The crippled ox seemed as if it had long grown accustomed to crawling along a road paved with corpses, its mind feeling nothing but profound peace.

Meanwhile, Zhou Chechen coldly watched Zhang Yu, who was now covered in frost and completely motionless. He slowly walked up to him and said flatly, “It’s over, junior.”

“By now, your entire body should be frozen solid.”

“But don’t worry, this bit of frostbite won’t require a trip to the medical room. It will just make it impossible for you to cultivate and study properly for the next day or two.”

“Consider this a small punishment for disrespecting your senior.”

Just as he was about to poke Zhang Yu over with a finger, he felt a wave of heat wash over his face.

The frost covering Zhang Yu’s body continuously disappeared. Apart from some minor skin damage, he appeared to be in high spirits, showing no signs of any problems.

Zhang Yu said, “Senior, there’s one move left.”

Zhou Chechen’s eyes narrowed slightly as he looked at Zhang Yu in earnest. “Then allow me to instruct you with one more move.”

With that, Zhou Chechen spread his five fingers, and the vast freezing qi gathered toward his palm as his entire body’s mana was converted into threads of frosty palm power and infused into it.

“Kneel for me!”

Zhou Chechen’s full-powered palm strike slammed down toward Zhang Yu, landing heavily on his shoulder.

The wind howled, and frost shuddered.

As a wave of air exploded from the point of contact, it was as if an ice storm had swept through the training hall, causing the temperature to plummet.

Zhou Chechen and Zhang Yu stood face-to-face, their gazes seeming to clash with sparks.

The muscles of a third-year senior were brought to their full potential in Zhou Chechen's body. A terrifying force, like the Sky Pillar itself, sought to press Zhang Yu down inch by inch.

At the same time, bone-chilling frost continuously enveloped Zhang Yu’s body, seeking to strip away his vital energy and destroy the foundation of his strength.

Zhou Chechen intended to press Zhang Yu to the ground and freeze him there in a kneeling position.

He wanted to humiliate him on behalf of all seniors, establish the authority of the Student Council, and after beating this dog, see who its current master was…

But to his surprise, an unexpectedly strong resistance erupted from within Zhang Yu's body. It was like a spring, pushing back with greater force the more he pressed down.

The heat radiating from beneath the surface of that body was preventing his freezing qi from penetrating in a short amount of time.

Fu Ji laughed. _This guy’s instantaneous explosive power really is lacking. If he had competed with you in mana, moved around the field, and dragged it into a battle of attrition, it would have been troublesome. But now that he’s willingly walked right up to you, it’s much easier…_

Just then, Zhang Yu spoke. “Senior, three moves have passed.”

“Why don’t you try taking a move from me?”

Zhou Chechen’s expression changed. Seeing his opponent’s outstretched hands, he immediately moved to block.

He had seen Zhang Yu’s close-quarters combat skills before and was naturally wary, unwilling to be caught off guard.

But in the next moment, he found that his opponent's hands were not exerting much force.

Then, a boom exploded in his abdomen.

In that instant, as Zhang Yu repelled Zhou Chechen’s palm, he gathered all of his own strength and, taking advantage of Zhou Chechen’s divided attention, slammed a knee viciously into his stomach.

Seeing this, Lei Jun slapped his thigh in admiration. “Unexpected! A brilliant sneak attack!”

Terrifying force squeezed Zhou Chechen’s skin, muscles, stomach…

Zhou Chechen felt as if his stomach was being viciously kneaded, deformed, and compressed by a giant hand, as if it was about to force out everything inside him…

Zhou Chechen’s mouth flew open, and then he clamped it shut just as quickly.

“Senior, let me help you.”

As Zhang Yu gave Zhou Chechen’s arm a gentle tug, his center of gravity was pulled and shifted. The urge to vomit that he had just suppressed finally became unbearable, and with a retch, he threw up all over the floor.

Fu Ji laughed heartily. _See, I told you! These rich kids eat ten meals a day. Instead of giving him a minor injury, it’s much better to make him vomit in public!_

After just one heave, Zhou Chechen quickly suppressed it, flung Zhang Yu's hand away, and glared at him. “You…”

Zhang Yu quickly backed away. “My apologies, senior. I wouldn’t have retaliated if I’d known. I didn’t expect one move would be enough to make you vomit.”

From the side, Lei Jun sighed with emotion. “Did you all see that clearly? Just now, Zhou Chechen wanted to force Zhang Yu to his knees, to viciously insult his dignity and damage his Dao heart.”

“But not only did Zhang Yu withstand it, he took advantage of Zhou Chechen’s distraction to make him vomit on the spot, causing him to lose all face.”

“Both sides were treading the line between incurring medical fees and shaming the opponent’s spirit.”

“A slight misstep, and you either pay money or lose face.”

Lei Jun’s voice boomed like thunder across the training hall, causing Zhou Chechen’s brow to furrow tightly and the heart art in his mind to falter.

Boom! With another eruption of freezing qi, the temperature in the entire training hall dropped once more.

This was the terrifying aspect of the Frost Heaven Freezing Qi Field; with continuous use, the ambient temperature would keep dropping, and its power would grow stronger and stronger.

It could be said that having only used three moves, Zhou Chechen was far from unleashing his full combat potential.

But just then, a large hand gently pressed down on his shoulder.

“Student Zhou, the three-move agreement is over,” Lei Jun said with a smile. “If you keep fighting, the other students are going to get hurt.”

“You don’t want to end up paying for all their frostbite medical fees, losing face and money at the same time, do you?”

Zhou Chechen’s gaze hardened. He glanced at Lei Jun, then at the other students who were already turning purple from the cold.

Taking a deep breath, Zhou Chechen understood that today, this was as far as it would go.

Because anything he did from this point on would only lead to further humiliation, and possibly extra expenses. So, he simply gave Zhang Yu a deep look, said nothing, and turned to leave.

Lan Ling followed behind Zhou Chechen, pointing at everyone present. “Put your phones away! No pictures allowed!”

He then hurried after Zhou Chechen, saying irritably, “We should just cancel all of Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen’s competition spots and benefits…”

Zhao Tianxing jumped in fright and quickly put his phone away. A moment later, he couldn’t resist taking it out again to look at the clip of Zhou Chechen being made to vomit.

He thought to himself, _He actually managed to make Zhou Chechen lose face? A'Yu is incredible!_

Zhao Tianxing could already imagine how the group chats would blow up in a moment: First-year Zhang Yu takes three moves from Student Council President Zhou Chechen head-on, then makes him vomit with a single counter-attack.

Just then, notifications were sent out to many group chats, demanding that students be forbidden from disclosing what happened between Zhang Yu and Zhou Chechen, and especially from posting any related videos or photos online…

As the second-year students left, the many first-years looked at Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen with sparkling eyes. This was the first time they had ever seen first-year students who could stand up to the top students of the second year.

Zhang Yu, however, paid no mind to the students’ reactions. He took out his phone and immediately contacted Le Mulan.

“Do you have the contact information for the person in charge of your Purple Cloud Student Council?”

Le Mulan was puzzled. “What are you going to do?”

Zhang Yu recalled the words Zhou Chechen had said to him outside the training hall.

Zhang Yu: “Tell the person in charge at Purple Cloud that as long as they pay, Bai Zhenzhen and I can skip the upcoming competitions.”

“Coming to us directly will definitely be cheaper than them contacting Songyang High School.”

(End of chapter)

# Chapter 149: Zhang Yu's Connections

Without waiting for Le Mulan’s reply, Zhang Yu sent the same message to Xiong Wenwu and Yu Xinghan.

The content was more or less the same: he wanted to contact someone with authority at their respective schools to negotiate a price for him and Bai Zhenzhen to sit out the upcoming competitions.

Meanwhile, at Purple Cloud High School.

Le Jingchen looked at the message from his sister and said with a smile, "He came to negotiate the price himself?"

"It seems Zhou Chechen can no longer control him."

After some thought, Le Jingchen didn't contact Zhang Yu immediately but instead asked Le Mulan, "What do you think of Zhang Yu?"

Le Mulan was slightly taken aback by her brother's message and replied, "In what respect?"

Le Jingchen: After the athletics meet, how has his strength improved?

Le Jingchen: If he participates in the upcoming Dao heart competition, can he secure a ranking?

Le Jingchen: I know you've been hiring him as a sparring partner recently, so you should have a feel for his condition, right?

Reading Le Jingchen's messages, Le Mulan recalled her training sessions with Zhang Yu.

A strong physique, powerful muscles, and skilled techniques… each session made Le Mulan feel her money was well spent.

But she knew that wasn't what her brother was asking about.

After all, the next event was the Dao heart competition.

_The Dao heart, huh…_

Le Mulan immediately thought of how, after every training session, Zhang Yu would squat down and stare at the pools of alchemical enhancers on the floor.

She thought to herself, _If it were any other high school student, they probably would have drunk their fill of the enhancers by now, right?_

So, Le Mulan replied: Zhang Yu is someone who can steadfastly resist expensive temptations.

Le Jingchen asked: Do you have a specific example?

Le Mulan: He can resist the urge to lick up the sweat I drip on the floor…

After hearing what Le Mulan had to say about their training, Le Jingchen replied: How could you do something like that?!

Le Jingchen: You've taken many experimental drugs from the lab. What if Zhang Yu collects your sweat and sells it to another pharmaceutical company for analysis?

Le Mulan: That was my oversight. Next time, I'll make him clean up all the sweat on the floor in front of me.

Le Jingchen: That's more like it.

Le Mulan: Anyway, my point is that Zhang Yu's willpower is indeed very strong, and Bai Zhenzhen's can't be much weaker, even if she's a bit less formidable.

Le Mulan: If they participate in the Dao heart competition, they'll likely get a good ranking. If we can pay a little money to have them sit out, it's a worthwhile deal.

Putting her phone away, Le Mulan suddenly recalled how she had offered Zhang Yu 400,000 to withdraw from the martial arts competition, only to be rejected.

She thought to herself, _So in the end, you were changed after all?_

…

Inside Red Pagoda's conservation area.

A massive demonic beast lay on the ground, a hole in its head as if bored out by some gigantic creature.

A burly, bare-chested man was sitting on the ground, tearing at the demonic beast's flesh with his mouth.

He opened his blood-stained mouth and looked at Xiong Wenwu nearby, saying, "What do you want from me?"

Xiong Wenwu explained the matter Zhang Yu had raised.

The man gnawing on the demonic beast asked, "I remember this Zhang Yu… you competed against him, didn't you? What do you think? Can he still place in the upcoming Dao heart competition?"

Xiong Wenwu thought about Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen's situation. The first thing that came to mind was their recent incubation rooms rental transactions with him, and how Bai Zhenzhen had asked An'an to buy demonic beast meat for her dietary supplements, with An'an then giving the money back to him as a subsidy.

Before coming here, Xiong Wenwu had actually already considered this matter.

_Selling their competition slots? Those two must be short on money too, huh?_

_But given their status, it's indeed better for them to just take the money now rather than competing._

Another thought occurred to Xiong Wenwu… was their lack of money because they were spending so much at his place?

He had especially heard from An'an that those two had been spending more and more time cultivating in the incubation rooms recently.

_If they had a bit more money, they'd probably give me more business, right?_

Many thoughts flashed through his mind, but in reality, it was only an instant before Xiong Wenwu answered respectfully, "Although I haven't interacted with them much, I could tell on the field that their wills are like iron and their Dao hearts are like steel."

"After all, anyone who clawed their way out of poverty couldn't possibly have a weak will."

"Judging from the control they displayed in the martial arts and athletics meets, their Dao hearts can't possibly be weak."

"If those two were to participate in the Dao heart competition, they would indeed have a high chance of placing."

"If we can spend seven or eight hundred thousand to keep them from competing, I think it's very worthwhile."

…

White Dragon High School.

Yu Xinghan knocked on a door and said, "Senior, why aren't you replying to my messages?"

A voice came from within, "Stop bothering me!"

"I've had enough of this damn Student Council!"

"The most important tasks for us high schoolers are studying, grades, and competitions!"

"Damn it… how am I supposed to study properly when people keep bothering me with all this petty squabbling and sordid politics?!"

Yu Xinghan said, "But aren't you supposed to be in charge of these things?"

The person inside retorted angrily, "That's because the former president used to dump all sorts of miscellaneous crap on me."

"But the previous year's council has all graduated now, and I'm the top dog in this school!"

"I'm not staying in this Student Council for one more day."

"From now until the university interviews, I will be completely focused on my own cultivation."

"If you need anything, go find Song Hailong of the Song family."

"He has already taken over as the Student Council vice president."

So, Yu Xinghan then called Song Hailong over and explained the situation to him.

Yu Xinghan: "Little Song, that's the situation."

After hearing this, Song Hailong said calmly, "It's not just for the upcoming Dao heart competition, is it? Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen will probably do this for all future competitions."

"They're different from us, after all. Since they have no chance of getting into the Ten Greats, what's the use of getting more competition rankings or having a prettier resume? It's better to exchange it for some money."

As the ace son of the Song family, Song Hailong was not unaware of the dissatisfaction some wealthy people had with Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen taking up competition spots.

Song Hailong merely said calmly, "I just find it a pity that there will be no more opportunities to defeat them in a competition."

Yu Xinghan: "Cut the chatter. Just tell me how much you plan to approve for them."

"You know the strength of those two. If they participate in the Dao heart competition, they'll definitely get a ranking."

"I think paying 1 million to keep them both out of the competition is a very good price."

Song Hailong gave Yu Xinghan a strange look, feeling that the latter was a bit too enthusiastic about this matter.

Yu Xinghan coughed and said, "I'm also doing this for the sake of our White Dragon High School's results. Among the three great high schools, we are the strongest. If Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen withdraw, it's highly probable that our people will snatch the rankings."

Song Hailong frowned. As the new vice president of the Student Council, this was his first time handling such a matter.

"Isn't 1 million a bit too much?"

Yu Xinghan quickly said, "Too much? How is it too much? After they're gone, your competition ranking will go up by at least one or two spots, won't it? Do you think spending 1 million to move up that much is too much?"

"Besides, it's not our money; it's all from the school committee's fund."

Yu Xinghan placed a hand on Song Hailong's shoulder and said with a pressuring tone, "We've fought against Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen for so long. Who in the school understands them better than we do?"

"This is my opinion as the number one student of the first year. I hope you'll consider it carefully."

Seeing Yu Xinghan's demeanor, Song Hailong thought to himself, _With Zhang Yu out of the competition, Yu Xinghan will probably secure first place, won't he? He really cares about his competition ranking._

But on second thought, this was related to university interviews, so it was normal for Yu Xinghan to be so invested.

And after seeing Song Hailong nod, Yu Xinghan finally smiled faintly and departed gracefully.

Once around the corner, Yu Xinghan took out his phone and replied to Zhang Yu: 1 million. It's a deal.

Zhang Yu: [Thumbs Up] Don't worry, I'll make it worth your while.

…

Songyang High School.

Fu Ji looked at Yu Xinghan's reply and laughed. "Didn't I tell you this kid would take a kickback? With my years of experience roaming Kunxu, how could I be wrong about people?"

Zhang Yu looked at the replies from the others. "Purple Cloud agreed to pay 600,000 after taxes, Red Pagoda is 700,000 after taxes, and White Dragon is 1 million after taxes. As expected of the three great high schools, so generous, they even paid my taxes for me in advance."

"That's 2.3 million in total. After deducting Yu Xinghan's 100,000 kickback, that's 2.2 million."

"If Zhen and I split it evenly, that's 1.1 million each, after taxes."

Thinking of this number, Zhang Yu felt a sense of relief.

He had been throwing money at the Immortal Dao all this time, and his bank balance had been dwindling, leaving him with just over 300,000.

With this supplement of 1.1 million, he would be set for a while longer.

"At least until the first round of Foundation Establishment exams next month, there shouldn't be any problem."

Then, Zhang Yu sighed with some regret, "Unfortunately, we definitely won't be able to sell our spots in the upcoming Daoist art competition."

"And after that, the new competitions won't be until next year."

Although Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen wanted to sell off all their high school competition spots at once, the three great high schools were unwilling to buy.

On one hand, the total amount was too large and the process too long; on the other, many people did not believe that the Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen of the next year or the year after would still be as competitive as they were now.

Zhang Yu then opened a contact on his phone.

Bai Zhenzhen said from the side, "Yu-boy, are you going to use the talisman our godmother left you?"

Zhang Yu nodded. "Those two, Zhou Chechen and Lan Ling, took a hit this time. They definitely won't let it go."

Bai Zhenzhen nodded. "In terms of true strength, we are indeed still a bit weaker than them."

"Even if they come to fight us for combat practice every day, it would be very troublesome and would disrupt our studies."

Zhang Yu said, "That's why I was thinking we could try to bluff them again."

Recalling what Zhou Chechen had said that day, Zhang Yu continued, "That guy seems to suspect we have someone else backing us, and he's very cautious."

"Scaring him a little might buy us some more time."

The next moment, Zhang Yu had already pulled up the screenshot of the Freezing Talisman on his phone.

The Freezing Talisman was one of the talismans Zhang Pianpian had left for Zhang Yu. It could freeze someone's bank account; the higher the target's faith level, the shorter the duration of the freeze.

(End of Chapter)

--

# Chapter 150: Zhen, Why Has Your Stomach Gotten Bigger?

Just as Zhang Yu was contacting the three great high schools.

Inside an office at Songyang High School.

Lan Ling said, full of resentment, "...If we just let this matter go, the Student Council will lose all its authority. How will we be able to do our work in the future?"

Zhou Chechen didn't speak, instead contemplating the day's events and the performance of Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen.

_What gives those two the confidence to act so fearlessly?_

_Is it simple audacity? Or is there someone else besides Zhang Pianpian behind them?_

Listening to Lan Ling, he thought that perhaps he could cancel some of their benefits, like their eligibility for competitions, to probe them further.

And just as Zhou Chechen was thinking this, his phone suddenly vibrated.

Zhou Chechen opened it to find a message from Le Jingchen.

Seeing the strange look on Zhou Chechen's face, Lan Ling asked from the side, "What's wrong?"

Zhou Chechen frowned and said, "The thing Le Jingchen asked us to do, he says he's already handled it himself."

Lan Ling was puzzled. "Handled it?"

Zhou Chechen continued, "Zhang Yu personally went to talk to him, took his money, and will not be participating in the first year's upcoming Dao heart competition."

Lan Ling was shocked. "What? He went to talk to Le Jingchen personally?"

"How did he get in touch with Le Jingchen?"

Just then, Zhou Chechen's phone vibrated again, and his expression changed even more drastically upon seeing the new message.

He said in disbelief, "My bank account has been frozen?"

"For a tax audit?"

Zhou Chechen was extremely confident that there were absolutely no problems with his taxes, so why would he suddenly be audited?

Connecting this to the fact that he had just moved against Zhang Yu, then Le Jingchen and Zhang Yu's private deal, and now his bank account being temporarily frozen…

Lan Ling said from the side, "President, was there a problem with one of the company's procedures? It should be fine once you pay the back taxes…"

"Back taxes? Pay your head." Zhou Chechen's face was grim. "This is clearly a warning from someone. I knew there was more to Zhang Yu than meets the eye."

Lan Ling said, "Could it be the tax bureau…"

Zhou Chechen analyzed, "How could it be the tax bureau, acting so secretively?"

"And they made a move right after we did, contacting Le Jingchen on one hand and freezing my bank account on the other… I'm afraid we've been on their radar for a while now."

Lan Ling's eyes hardened. "Isn't this a threat against us? I'll go find Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen right now…"

"Did you temper your brain into muscle? What's the rush?" Zhou Chechen said irritably. "Zhang Yu is just a dog. What's the use in pinning him down? Besides, the enemy is in the dark while we are in the light. The fact that they dare to warn us like this means they aren't afraid of us at all."

"The top priority is to first investigate who is backing Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen. Once we've figured that out, we can decide whether to endure or to fight back."

"I will tell my father about this and personally arrange for our family's people to investigate."

"Before that, don't be rash. Just act as if nothing happened."

…

Within Songyang High School.

Zhang Yu looked at the message on his phone and let out a small sigh of relief.

It was from the contact Zhang Pianpian had left him, the captain of the Songyang City Patrol Team: The talisman has been sent, and the account has been successfully frozen.

Zhang Yu: Thanks.

The other party replied: It's a small matter. You can come visit me sometime.

Over the next few days, the Student Council, the second-year students, and Zhou Chechen and Lan Ling all remained quiet, as if the incident on the training grounds had never happened.

Zhang Yu also breathed a sigh of relief, thinking that he shouldn't have to worry about them for the time being.

"What I need to do next is simple."

"Continue to cultivate with all my might and refine all this liquid cash into true strength."

And so, in the days that followed, Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen continued to advance furiously on the path of the Immortal Dao, consuming the balance in their accounts at an unprecedented rate.

…

The conservation area.

Inside the incubation room.

Zhang Yu was performing a breathing exercise for spiritual energy.

Streams of Great Sun mana circulated within his body.

The next moment, the magma-like mana suddenly broke through several fine meridians in his body. Zhang Yu had just broken through another bottleneck in his mana cultivation.

His mana had surpassed 70 units.

Feeling the flow of his mana after the breakthrough, Zhang Yu revealed a satisfied smile.

Across from him, Xiong Wenwu was also circulating his own breathing exercise.

Zhang Yu said, "Thanks for your help a few days ago."

Xiong Wenwu said faintly, "It was nothing. You two have spent so much money here, it's no big deal for me to help a little."

"Besides, I was just telling the truth. If you and Bai Zhenzhen don't compete, a few of my brothers will have a better chance of getting into the Ten Greats."

Zhang Yu then asked curiously, "Why haven't I seen An'an today? Where is she?"

Xiong Wenwu shook his head and sighed. "An'an is consoling the others."

"Because she took a pay cut."

Zhang Yu was puzzled. "Huh? She got a pay cut, so why is she consoling others?"

Xiong Wenwu said slowly, "Because she's the best employee in the conservation area, she was asked to take the lead in accepting a pay cut, which means everyone else will have their salaries cut one after another."

"The manager told her to do ideological work with the other employees, to understand the company's difficulties, and to share in its hardships."

Zhang Yu could only offer some comfort, "Companies… they're all like that."

Xiong Wenwu said angrily, "She's clearly the most dedicated employee with the most company spirit in the entire conservation area, so why does she earn the least and eat the worst? And when the company's profits decline, she's asked to take the lead in cutting pay?"

"How is that any different from the top student in the class having their benefits cut?"

Hearing this, Zhang Yu fell silent for a moment, not knowing what to say to comfort him.

Xiong Wenwu continued, "This all proves… there's something wrong with the company. It's failing to reward its truly outstanding employees."
