Xiong Wenwu could sense that there was definitely a problem with the company. Not only were various bases and factories being acquired, but there was also some chaos in the upper management.

_But it's soon…_ Xiong Wenwu thought to himself. _I've almost saved up enough money to help An'an pay off her breeding debt._

_Then she'll be able to leave this place._

…

White Dragon High School.

Song Hailong was sparring with Bai Zhenzhen.

But faced with Bai Zhenzhen's ghostly movement technique, he found it increasingly difficult to land a hit.

Song Hailong could only counter the unchanging with the ever-changing, standing like a reef against Bai Zhenzhen's stormy assault, trying his best to find an opening.

But Bai Zhenzhen was like a bolt of lightning, always darting into his blind spots, forcing him to constantly adjust his posture and try to catch her figure.

Just then, Bai Zhenzhen's figure flashed, and she retreated more than ten meters away, coming to a stop.

Song Hailong frowned. "What's wrong?"

Bai Zhenzhen glanced at the White Dragon students outside the door and said, "I say, you guys have been watching us train for a long time, haven't you?"

Chu Qiuhe and the others quickly knelt on the ground, indicating that they would definitely watch from their knees from now on.

Bai Zhenzhen said, "That's not what I meant."

"I meant that watching our training… costs money."

Song Hailong was about to say they should forget it.

But then he heard Zhang Yu from not far away add, "That's right. Can you watch people of our caliber for free? We should be charging money."

Yu Xinghan nodded and said, "Then let's charge an admission fee."

A moment later, the training room was packed with people.

A large group of White Dragon students stood on the periphery, craning their necks to watch the four people fighting.

As for the kneeling spots further in the front, which offered a clearer view, those required an extra fee.

Before leaving White Dragon High School that day, Yu Xinghan said to Zhang Yu, "There's a lead on the Spirit Realm matter. I'll help you two arrange it in a few days."

…

Late July.

Less than half a month remained before the first round of the Foundation Establishment qualification exam.

Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen continued their brave, money-fueled advance on the path of the Immortal Dao. As money flowed away rapidly and large quantities of various resources were consumed, their progress was unprecedented.

Zhang Yu's mana broke through to 81.5, and his physical strength reached 7.52. These two fundamentals had completely surpassed the average level of a White Dragon student just entering their third year.

Only the progress of his Dao heart was very slow, currently at level 5 (85%).

And Zhang Yu's bank balance had also dropped to just over 200,000.

In the apartment that night.

Just as Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen were continuing their diligent cultivation.

Bai Zhenzhen suddenly said, "Yu-boy, do you feel like my stomach has gotten bigger?"

Zhang Yu looked up and said, "It seems a little bigger?"

Bai Zhenzhen patted her lower abdomen. "I feel like it's protruding a bit. Can't you see?"

Zhang Yu looked closely, and a look of shock suddenly appeared in his eyes as he saw faint cyan patterns appearing on Bai Zhenzhen's lower abdomen.

And Bai Zhenzhen also said in surprise, "Why has my spiritual root gotten smaller?"

In Bai Zhenzhen's perception, the True Spiritual Root that had been steadily established in her dantian's sea of qi, which one moment was performing breathing exercises and nourishing her flesh and blood.

The next moment, it gradually contracted, turning into a cyan seed in her perception.

When Bai Zhenzhen told Zhang Yu about this change, Fu Ji said, "It's evolved."

Fu Ji explained, "I told you long ago, this spiritual root of Bai Zhenzhen's is an evolutionary spiritual root."

"It's just that… in the past years, before Bai Zhenzhen embarked on the path of the Immortal Dao, this spiritual root was still in its infancy, only changing slightly with Bai Zhenzhen's choices."

"But ever since she enrolled in her first year and truly stepped onto the Immortal Dao, her spiritual root has been frequently stimulated, changing more than it had in all the previous years combined."

"Especially after you started exchanging its use with her, every one of your level 10 cultivation techniques has given this spiritual root an even stronger stimulus, and today, it has finally evolved."

Hearing this, Zhang Yu also told Bai Zhenzhen his speculation about the spiritual root's evolution.

Then Zhang Yu said, "Try to sense what the evolved True Spiritual Root can do. Does it have any new abilities?"

Hearing this, Bai Zhenzhen immediately focused all her attention on the True Spiritual Root.

As her mind invested in it, an ethereal feeling gradually spread throughout her entire body.

(End of Chapter)

# Chapter 151: The First Evolution of the True Spiritual Root

The True Spiritual Root, having adapted within Bai Zhenzhen’s belly for so many years, had extended tendrils that acted like a second nervous system, spreading to every part of her body to provide all manner of support and enhancement.

But at this very moment, Bai Zhenzhen felt that all the tendrils extending from the True Spiritual Root had vanished, or rather, had retracted back into the spiritual root itself.

The True Spiritual Root was once again like a seed, yet its connection to her body had not been severed.

On the contrary, Bai Zhenzhen felt that… although the True Spiritual Root now lacked tendrils, its connection with her was even closer.

It was not only connected to her muscles, nerves, organs, and bones, but had even linked to her brain, creating an inexplicable resonance in her mind.

Bodily control, the circulation of power, the mana circuit… all of this churned in her mind, and Bai Zhenzhen felt her comprehension of various cultivation techniques rapidly increasing.

At the same time, Zhang Yu looked at Bai Zhenzhen and saw that her abdomen had become flat and toned once more.

However, the cyan mark that had just appeared on her lower abdomen was now growing increasingly distinct, resembling a budding cyan lotus exuding a unique charm.

And Bai Zhenzhen, who typically appeared cold and aloof, now radiated a sacred aura that secretly amazed Zhang Yu.

After a short wait, Bai Zhenzhen opened her eyes, a sharp light flashing through them for an instant.

Zhang Yu quickly asked, “How is it?”

Bai Zhenzhen remarked with a sigh, “My True Spiritual Root really has evolved.”

“The True Spiritual Root can now enhance my understanding of martial arts cultivation techniques, allowing me to enter a state of self-forgetfulness.”

“In that state, I feel my understanding of martial arts has advanced even further, and I even have a sense that…”

Bai Zhenzhen thought for a moment before saying with some uncertainty, “…the cultivation techniques I originally practiced have certain flaws that aren’t suited to me, and it seems I might be able to improve them?”

Zhang Yu was startled and said, “You can improve cultivation techniques? You can deduce them?”

Seeing Bai Zhenzhen nod slightly, Zhang Yu asked again, “Doesn’t that mean you can learn cultivation techniques even faster now?”

He reminded her, “You have to remember to tell yourself every day that you must not reveal any techniques you haven't bought the usage rights for!”

Before Zhang Yu had arrived in Kunxu, Bai Zhenzhen already possessed an incredible talent for martial arts, enhanced by her spiritual root.

She could often master the various basic cultivation techniques taught in high school in a very short time, and she had shown astonishing performance when comprehending the Celestial Paragon’s Martial Demonstration Scroll and the mana flow chart for the Limitless Cloud Hand from the Mana Competition.

Over the past six months, as her spiritual root continued to adapt, her martial arts talent had grown by the day.

For instance, with the Dragonback Mountain Toppler Hand and the Dragon-Elephant Mountain-Shattering Palm that Zhang Yu practiced in front of her, Bai Zhenzhen had learned both of these external arts and reached Level 1 just by watching him repeatedly.

However, because these two techniques did not suit her style and would cost money to purchase the usage rights, she had not pursued them further.

*Zhen’s martial arts aptitude is too dangerous,* Zhang Yu thought. *She learns new techniques at the drop of a hat. Where would we find the money to buy all the usage rights?*

*The key is that this kind of aptitude is like a passive skill you can’t turn off. She can only hide it by practicing and using new arts less.*

*But it’s far better than being born a martial arts prodigy…*

Ever since he had learned the Dragonback Mountain Toppler Hand on the spot during the martial arts competition, Zhang Yu had searched online for news of similar cases.

After reading about them, he was left with a single thought… tragic, absolutely tragic.

People who were martial arts prodigies from a young age often developed the talent to learn techniques at a glance and master them with a single practice.

And to avoid violating the rules that minors and those not yet in high school could not cultivate, they were often heavily restricted by their parents, forbidden from contact with the internet, television, or news, and even when going out, their parents would only dare take them to places filled entirely with mortals.

Some extreme cases even resulted in them being under house arrest twenty-four hours a day…

*It’s troublesome even after entering high school. They’re practically congenital fine magnets, easily set up and tricked into owing massive debts.*

Zhang Yu shook his head, grateful that his Feathered Tome was not so uncontrollable; if he did not want to learn something, he definitely would not, free from the worry of accidentally learning someone else’s martial arts.

Hearing Zhang Yu’s reminder, Bai Zhenzhen seemed to be off in her own world, murmuring, “I know, Yu-boy.”

“It used to be very difficult for me.”

“Especially at school, whenever I saw classmates using martial arts I hadn’t learned, I couldn't stop myself from learning the external forms of the techniques.”

“Those martial arts were like a spread of prepared dishes, laid out undefended before me, just waiting for me to pick them up…”

“It was always so hard to resist.”

“But now…” A sword art was continuously being deduced in Bai Zhenzhen’s mind. “I’ve found something far more delicious.”

…

The next evening.

Under the bridge.

By the small river.

Two streaks of sword-light collided, like twin meteors streaking across the night sky again and again, leaving brilliant trails in their wake.

It was Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen, practicing the Basic High School Swordplay.

Each held an arm-length branch, and infused with sword qi, the straight branches cut through the air like sharp-edged swords, thrusting toward one another along deadly trajectories.

Since he would be starting his second year in September, Zhang Yu had taken the time today to learn the Basic High School Swordplay required at the end of the first year, pushing it all the way to Level 10 in one go.

The Level 10 effect of this Basic High School Swordplay was also simple: the ability to infuse sword qi.

Through this infusion, even a branch in Zhang Yu’s hand could be temporarily wielded as a sword.

But at this moment, Bai Zhenzhen was also sparring with Zhang Yu using the Basic High School Swordplay. As the branch in her hand danced, her sword qi suddenly erupted with sparks of electricity, forcefully increasing its speed by a third.

As Bai Zhenzhen’s sword-shadows danced, she forced Zhang Yu into a steady retreat until finally, the branches in their hands could no longer withstand the clash of sword qi and shattered simultaneously, dissolving into a cloud of wood splinters.

Zhang Yu asked with curiosity, “You succeeded in your deduction?”

Bai Zhenzhen nodded and, recalling the process of the past day, slowly said, “Yes. After my deduction, the Level 10 effect of the Basic High School Swordplay has changed.”

“Besides the simple infusion of sword qi, it can now also accelerate…”

Bai Zhenzhen casually picked up a blade of grass. As she infused it with sword qi, the once-limp blade instantly stiffened, then traced afterimages through the air in a flash of electrical light.

After a day of experimentation, Bai Zhenzhen had a much clearer understanding of the new function of her evolved True Spiritual Root.

“My technique deduction can only deduce martial arts that I have already mastered to Level 10.”

“The result of the deduction is a change to the martial art’s Level 10 effect, making it more suitable for me.”

“A relatively simple one like the Basic High School Swordplay can be deduced in a day.”

“An expert-grade body tempering cultivation technique like the Thunderclap True Body would probably take three to four days to deduce completely.”

Bai Zhenzhen made a quick calculation; if she were to share the use of the True Spiritual Root with Zhang Yu, taking turns, it would likely take a week.

“But that’s fine. I can cultivate and deduce at the same time, so I won’t have to waste too much extra time.”

Speaking of which, Bai Zhenzhen looked at Zhang Yu and said, “Yu-boy, I have you to thank for the True Spiritual Root evolving so quickly.”

“I can feel that as the True Spiritual Root was adapting to you, it absorbed the Level 10 martial arts you’ve mastered as nourishment, which accelerated its growth.”

Fu Ji sighed with emotion at this moment. “I told you so. Bai Zhenzhen’s evolutionary spiritual root was definitely stimulated by all your techniques. It seems the evolutionary path for this spiritual root is toward martial arts. In the future, as the two of you master more and more martial arts that are absorbed as nourishment, this spiritual root should be able to continue evolving.”

Zhang Yu, however, noticed that Bai Zhenzhen’s eyes were sparkling as she spoke, seemingly full of hope for the future and a keen interest in technique deduction.

The next moment, Bai Zhenzhen flickered behind Zhang Yu like the wind and hugged him, saying with an eagerness to share, “Yu-boy, you should try it too! This technique deduction is really interesting.”

But Zhang Yu glanced at the time and said, “Next time. It’s almost time for tutoring; we have to get to class.”

As he spoke, Zhang Yu’s form had already changed, transforming into his disguise as the dark world tutoring teacher, Ma Yunteng.

“You can try it on the way. It’s seriously super interesting, super useful…”

As Bai Zhenzhen spoke, she had already donned a blonde wig, applied a temporary tattoo, and put on mature makeup, taking on the appearance of a gang member—the dark world tutoring teacher, Le Mulan.

After finishing her transformation, Bai Zhenzhen squatted directly in front of Zhang Yu and said, “Worst case, I’ll carry you to class today. You can try deducing a martial art on the way, how about it?”

Zhang Yu felt that Bai Zhenzhen was like a child trying to show off a beloved toy, insistent that he play with this new gadget of hers.

And since it was a rare opportunity to get a ride from his good brother, Zhang Yu naturally wouldn’t refuse, leaping lightly to hug Bai Zhenzhen from behind.

A moment later, Bai Zhenzhen shot off in a cascade of electric flashes, carrying Zhang Yu on her back as she sped toward the highway.

Zhang Yu focused his senses on the True Spiritual Root, trying to use it to deduce one of his mastered Level 10 techniques, but he felt the progress was incredibly slow.

He murmured, “At this rate, for any given expert-grade technique, and considering I have to take turns with Zhen using the spiritual root, it would probably take me two or three months to successfully deduce it.”

“If it takes that long to deduce a single technique, then I’ll have to choose very carefully.”

At this thought, Zhang Yu mentally reviewed all the techniques he had mastered, finally settling on the Dragon-Elephant Mountain-Shattering Palm.

“My body tempering efficiency is already very high, and as my physical strength continues to increase, the ability to effectively muster and unleash the power within my body will become crucial.”

“Besides, this two-hundred-thousand-credit Dragon-Elephant Mountain-Shattering Palm is the most expensive technique I’ve learned so far…”

With this in mind, Zhang Yu decided to focus his deduction on the Dragon-Elephant Mountain-Shattering Palm.

# Chapter 152: Spirit Realm Cultivation, the Paupers' Alliance Appears

Just as Zhang Yu was halfway through his deduction, his face suddenly flushed, and he said, “Zhen, if you’re going to run, then just run properly. Can you not jiggle so much?”

Bai Zhenzhen replied impatiently, “Nag! How am I supposed to run fast otherwise? It’s not like I have shock absorbers installed.”

Zhang Yu added, “Then can you retract the electricity? It’s making me uncomfortable.”

Bai Zhenzhen said with disdain, “What’s an Electric Flash Step without the electricity? Your physical body is so strong; a few shocks won’t hurt you.”

After waiting a moment and hearing nothing more from Zhang Yu, Bai Zhenzhen assumed he had no further complaints.

But the next moment, a look of disgust flashed across her face.

“You little bastard… you really should be neutered.”

Bai Zhenzhen felt the current situation was like taking her good buddy for a spin in a brand-new car, only for him to announce he couldn’t hold it in and was about to crap all over the seats.

“I’m warning you, if you try anything funny on my back, I’ll perform the surgery myself today!”

“You think I want to?” Zhang Yu said, uncomfortable. “I told you not to jiggle and not to use electricity. Isn’t this your fault?”

Watching the two of them, Fu Ji thought to herself, *For Bai Zhenzhen to meet Zhang Yu, allowing her spiritual root to evolve so quickly under the nourishment of his many Level 10 techniques, is a form of luck.*

*But conversely, for Zhang Yu to meet Bai Zhenzhen and gain the support and deduction ability of this True Spiritual Root… that too is a form of luck.*

*Zhang Yu accelerated Bai Zhenzhen’s growth, and Bai Zhenzhen, in turn, nurtures Zhang Yu, making him stronger.*

*And for the two of them to have met me is luck upon luck.*

*Fate is truly a damn mysterious thing sometimes.*

*I have a feeling.*

*This time, it might be the most important investment of my life.*

*This time I might… really strike it rich.*

…

In the blink of an eye, it was after school the next day.

Today was also the day Zhang Yu, Bai Zhenzhen, and Yu Xinghan had agreed to go to the Spirit Realm for their Dao heart tutoring session.

Inside the Songyang High School cafeteria.

Zhang Yu, Bai Zhenzhen, Qian Shen, and Zhao Tianxing were eating together.

The surrounding students cast glances at the four of them, their eyes filled with awe.

“Did you hear? The monthly exam results are out. A teacher said some of Zhang Yu’s and Bai Zhenzhen’s stats have already reached third-year levels.”

“They’re monsters. No wonder they could beat the Student Council President until he knelt on the ground.”

“Knealt on the ground? He was forced to eat his own vomit on the spot! Look, I even have a GIF of it.”

“Isn’t that GIF just playing in reverse?”

“Well, I also have this picture. Look, the words ‘Vocational Student’ were carved on a Student Council officer’s chest…”

“I used to think Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen were friendly, but I never expected them to be so ruthless.”

“All these high-scorers are the same…”

“What’s the big deal? If I were them, I’d be even more ruthless. Otherwise, what’s the point of scoring so high? Top students are supposed to viciously humiliate the slackers! If anyone’s to blame, it’s the Student Council members for not having good enough grades…”

As various rumors spread, Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen had become akin to school tyrants in the eyes of many students, existences who stood at the apex of Songyang High School’s pecking order, who could be called the Emperors of Songyang.

And the third-ranked Qian Shen and eighth-ranked Zhao Tianxing were also viewed by other students as formidable top students, like great generals under the command of the Songyang Emperors, often flanking Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen.

Their dining table was the banquet of the first-year titans, radiating a pressure so tangible it made other students feel ashamed of their own inadequacy and dare not approach.

Just then, another group of people entered the cafeteria, led by the fourth-ranked first-year, He Dayou.

Although He Dayou had also become a Purple Person, due to the previous transplant surgery from the special training program, the muscles all over his body were adapting to the super metabolism at different rates.

As a result, some parts were dark purple and others light purple, giving him a segmented appearance.

According to Zhang Yu, He Dayou now looked like a purple mantis shrimp.

But the increase in his strength was undeniable; the Son of the School Director now maintained his fourth-place rank in their year and had become the new vice president of the Student Council.

When he saw Zhang Yu’s table, He Dayou’s steps faltered slightly.

As the Son of the School Director, his first difficult task after becoming vice president was figuring out how to face Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen.

*By dropping out of the competition, they’ve shown they have completely given up on getting into the Ten Greats.*

*In that case, we are no longer in competition.*

*As for conflicts of interest or old grudges… if there are any, they’re with Zhou Chechen and Lan Ling, not with me.*

*I don’t need to compete with these two paupers. We’re not on the same track anymore. If I get into the Ten Greats, they will seem like ants looking up at the heavens when they see me.*

He Dayou gave an order to a student beside him. A moment later, that student delivered four plates of dietary supplement demonic beast meat to Zhang Yu’s table.

After nodding in acknowledgment to Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen, He Dayou turned and went up to the second floor of the cafeteria.

But in his heart, he began to fret over his next problem.

*Can I still get into the Ten Greats?*

*The gap between Songyang High School and the three major high schools is growing wider and wider.*

*For my year, is there still any chance to snatch a spot in the Ten Greats?*

Meanwhile, after Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen had eaten their fill, they returned to their apartment, put on their spiritual interface masks, and prepared to attend the tutoring session with Yu Xinghan.

As for these spiritual interface masks, they had also borrowed them from Yu Xinghan.

Now, putting on the masks and entering the URL, the two felt their vision blur, and in the next moment, they had arrived in another world.

…

The Spirit Realm.

Appearing before Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen was a building that seemed infinitely tall.

Standing before the building, they saw countless people entering and exiting the main doors at every moment.

However, those people were like phantoms; even when they overlapped or passed through each other, it had no effect whatsoever.

Bai Zhenzhen said, “So this is a public area of the Spirit Realm. It’s my first time here.”

Zhang Yu nodded, thinking to himself that this was becoming more and more like a virtual world.

Although they had participated in illusionary landscapes constructed by the Spirit Realm before, those were mostly singular examination environments, like a game that ended once you cleared it.

But the place Yu Xinghan had invited them to was a public area of the Spirit Realm.

It was like a website on the internet, existing perpetually and receiving countless visitors.

But even a place like this wasn't accessible to just anyone; they had paid Yu Xinghan to get temporary access, which was how they were able to come here.

Just then, Yu Xinghan’s figure flickered and appeared beside them. 

“You’re here? Let’s go in together.”

“This is the Immortal Resonance Group’s Dao-Querying Hall, a tutoring institution established in the Spirit Realm.”

“However, the fees in the Spirit Realm are high, and the access requirements are not low. This place has always operated on an appointment and referral basis.”

“But even so, since it caters to the wealthy clients of the entire first layer of Kunxu, the foot traffic has always been considerable.”

Hearing Yu Xinghan’s introduction, Bai Zhenzhen asked in surprise, “The entire first layer of Kunxu?”

Yu Xinghan nodded. “The entire first layer of Kunxu can come here for tutoring through the Spirit Realm.”

As he spoke, the two had already walked inside.

As they stepped through the gate, the light and shadows before their eyes flickered, and they seemed to have been teleported to a certain floor of the building.

Yu Xinghan continued, “This place mainly offers tutoring for the Dao heart and martial arts.”

“After all, the Dao heart can be tempered in the Spirit Realm, and practicing martial arts in the different scenarios here also provides various kinds of experience, but mana and the physical body ultimately need to be accumulated bit by bit in the material world.”

“There are many methods for Dao heart tutoring.”

“For example, experiencing the lives of the powerful—walking the paths they walked—allows one to constantly approach the Dao hearts that those powerful individuals possessed.”

“There are also things like various extreme forms of suffering, which can also stimulate the growth of the Dao heart.”

“But these either have significant side effects or are slow to take effect.”

“The best method is still to set up various corresponding scenarios for cultivation based on the different heart arts the cultivator practices…”

As he spoke, Yu Xinghan had already skillfully led the two of them into a classroom.

“I’ve rented a Dao heart tempering venue here. We can use it together this time.”

“By the way, what are the heart arts you two need to temper? We need to configure it in advance…”

…

Just as Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen followed Yu Xinghan into the building.

Outside the Dao-Querying Hall, a blurry figure was constantly monitoring the people entering and leaving.

Suddenly, Mo Tianyi’s voice sounded in his ear. “Boss, Zhang Yu and the others are in.”

The figure asked, “Can you see what they’re doing?”

Mo Tianyi replied, “I haven’t been working here for long. Give me some time…”

A moment later, Mo Tianyi said, “Found them. They’re sharing a classroom with Yu Xinghan, tempering their Dao hearts together.”

The figure asked curiously, “Can a Dao heart tempering classroom be used by three people at once?”

Mo Tianyi explained, “Theoretically, there’s no problem.”

“After all, a Dao heart tempering classroom is essentially a scenario that fits the requirements of a heart art, allowing cultivators to train their heart art with high intensity and strengthen their Dao heart.”

“If three people use it together, it should generate a scenario that simultaneously adapts to all three of their heart arts.”

The figure said flatly, “Show me their situation.”

Mo Tianyi replied, “One moment.”

A moment later, a scene appeared before the figure’s eyes.

Under a sky thick with dark clouds, a factory was operating at full capacity.

Striking workers were protesting outside the factory gates, while security guards formed a human wall, holding them back.

Suddenly, a security guard holding a long staff charged into the crowd and began fighting with the peak Qi Refinement workers.

“Yu Xinghan?” Seeing the security guard who looked like Yu Xinghan, the figure was puzzled. “What technique is he cultivating this time?”

Mo Tianyi said, “The Martial Ascension Heart-Tempering Art, so they’ve arranged an extremely intense battlefield for him, having him, as part of the company’s security team, represent a corporation that refuses to earn a single cent less and fight fiercely against the bankrupt workers.”

The figure nodded slightly. “Indeed, an extremely intense battlefield. A matter of life and death.”

# Chapter 153: Zhen Opens a Factory, Zhang Yu Becomes a Worker

Song Xu was a top student at White Dragon High School.

He was also the "boss" Mo Tianyi spoke of, the founder of the Paupers Alliance.

At the same time, his family was a branch of the Song family, one of the sixteen great clans of Songyang City.

But Song Xu did not feel there was any contradiction between these two identities. After all, who said that someone with Song family blood could not be poor?

For instance, many members of the Song family were eliminated each generation and forced to work to pay off their debts. Their descendants naturally and gradually became poor after a few generations.

Song Xu's great-grandfather was supposedly still able to kneel before the main Song family, but by his generation, he didn't even have Song Hailong as a friend.

And in the eyes of most outsiders, they were not even aware that Song Xu's ancestors were from the great Song family, assuming they merely shared the same surname.

But thankfully, his family line ultimately knew to leverage the power of their bloodline ties. Every generation squeezed their parents for every coin they had, investing in themselves to bravely scale the peaks of the Immortal Dao.

It was just as a famous saying from a certain Song family predecessor went: instead of complaining about the environment, complain about your family.

Song Xu's grandfather had urged his elders on in this way, leveraging their money all the way until he was admitted to a university, became a company employee, and supported his entire family on his own, becoming a role model in Song Xu's eyes.

Song Xu's father fell a little short. Although he also squeezed his parents for a great deal of money, he did not invest it in himself, but rather in gambling, completely draining the power of their family ties in one go.

Upon learning that the pension his grandfather had left behind was completely depleted, that the family home had been sold off by his father, and that all their assets had been gambled away…

Song Xu felt as if he were on a giant water slide, but his father, sliding down ahead of him, had left a disgusting mess in his wake, and all Song Xu could do was watch in despair as he slid down right into it.

The only fortunate thing was that, just as his father was about to mortgage Song Xu off to leverage their ties one more time, Song Xu mortgaged his father to the main Song family first, earning his first pot of gold.

Next, Song Xu sold off the final inheritance his grandfather had left.

"Grandpa, there's no time to wait for your grave and your body to appreciate in value."

"I need you to give off your last bit of warmth for me right now."

"Please, bless your grandson from the heavens; bless me to advance bravely on the path of the Immortal Dao and get into a good university."

Excavator Palm, level three activate! Grandpa! Come out of the ground for me!

After selling his grandfather's grave and body, Song Xu obtained his second pot of gold.

Unfortunately, this was the very last grave and body his family had left.

No matter how carefully Song Xu calculated, he knew the money he had would not last until his high school graduation.

Fortunately, he then encountered an opportunity that would change his life.

He encountered a being known as an evil god.

…

In the Spirit Realm, before the Dao-Querying Hall.

The disguised Song Xu had come here this time because of Zhang Yu.

_If this Zhang Yu really has an evil god behind him, then as long as I hunt it, I can increase my potential again…_

_Then getting into the Ten Greats in the future will be a sure thing._

As the thought flashed through Song Xu's mind, he heard Mo Tianyi speak again, "Boss, what is our purpose in seeking out Zhang Yu this time?"

Song Xu explained coolly, "According to my investigation, the rapid growth of these two over the past six months is due to a certain reason."

"If I can understand this reason, I will have more confidence in getting into the Ten Greats next year."

Hearing this, Mo Tianyi secretly nodded. Since it concerned whether his boss could get into the Ten Greats, he would naturally provide his full support, even if it meant working unpaid overtime in this Dao-Querying Hall, even if he was discovered by the company for leaking client information, he would see it through to the end.

Song Xu, for his part, continued to watch the video feed Mo Tianyi was sending him.

…

The security guards and a large group of workers were engaged in a fierce brawl. Yu Xinghan, caught in the middle of it, was as insignificant as a single drop of water in the ocean.

Fists, clubs, knives, and spears rushed toward him from all directions, and his martial arts skill could only guarantee that he barely avoided being overwhelmed.

But in this environment of battling heaven and earth, of ceaseless, intense struggle, the Martial Ascension Heart-Tempering Art began to circulate with increasing smoothness.

At the same time, a broadcast sound came from the factory's main gate.

A woman's voice was heard shouting, "Attack with all your might! The factory will compensate for any deaths or injuries! All medical expenses are fully covered!"

Hearing these words, Yu Xinghan felt a wave of exhilaration in his heart, and the heart art in his mind began to operate at full power. He unleashed the techniques of the Martial Ascension Heart-Tempering Art on the spot, one after another, pushing back several workers in a row.

_No need to consider holding back._

_No need to consider compensation._

_Even less need to consider medical bills… I only need to fight to my heart's content!_

At this moment, Yu Xinghan felt his spirit surge and his will to fight soar to the heavens; power continuously rushed out from his entire body, and he became more and more in his element on this battlefield.

…

Mo Tianyi explained, "The illusionary landscape makes them temporarily forget everything in the real world and throw themselves completely into the current situation; the more their own thoughts align with their heart art, the stronger the heart art's effect becomes."

"Take Yu Xinghan, for example; cultivating the Martial Ascension Heart-Tempering Art on the battlefield to enhance his Dao heart is many times more effective than cultivating in the real world…"

Song Xu nodded casually and said, "What about the other two?"

Mo Tianyi said apologetically, "The master of this illusionary landscape is Yu Xinghan, so I can't freely adjust the point of view."

"But as long as we keep watching, Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen are bound to appear."

Meanwhile, in the illusionary landscape, a major battle came to a temporary end.

Yu Xinghan seized the time to return to the factory to rest, only to see the boss personally come before them to offer some words of encouragement.

Bai Zhenzhen shook Yu Xinghan's hand and said, "You did very well; you'll get a raise next month."

"Come, accompany me on an inspection of the factory."

"There are still many workers in the factory who are outwardly obedient but inwardly defiant; in a little while, you will help me teach them a harsh lesson."

Watching this scene, Song Xu asked curiously, "This Bai Zhenzhen is the boss? What heart art does she cultivate?"

Mo Tianyi answered, "She is registered as practicing the Cold Soul Ice Heart Art, a heart art that is very suitable for investors to cultivate."

"It can strip away distracting thoughts, stabilize the spirit, and maintain a state of calm and composure at all times, allowing one to calculate gains and losses from a detached and coolly aloof perspective."

"Many stock market traders cultivate this heart art to aid their investments."

"It seems the goal here is for her, as the boss, to maintain an icy heart while facing all sorts of internal and external pressures, in order to deepen her understanding of the Cold Soul Ice Heart Art and strengthen her Dao heart…"

Song Xu nodded slightly as he listened, but he knew that when this Cold Soul Ice Heart Art was first created, it was not for any kind of investing or stocks.

_This is a heart art purely for combat, especially for assassination._

_The principle is to ensure that before and after striking, one's heart remains as pure as ice, unshaken even if the heavens were to fall, ignoring all the various disturbances of the outside world, and focusing one's entire mind on the battle at hand to calculate gains and losses from the perspective of a bystander._

_However, compared to combat and assassination, the various mists of confusion, the scams, the pressures from above and below, inside and out, and the emotional stimuli from changing situations encountered while running a factory, as well as calculating gains and losses amidst it all… that is all far more complex than battle._

_If one can maintain an icy heart in such a complex environment and still calmly calculate gains and losses, then their understanding of the Cold Soul Ice Heart Art will inevitably be more profound, and the effect of tempering their Dao heart will be outstanding._

Song Xu knew that the more profound a cultivator's understanding of a heart art and the more their thoughts aligned with it, the more effectively they could unleash its power, and the faster their Dao heart would improve.

"Heh, this cultivation scenario is rather fitting."

Meanwhile, Bai Zhenzhen in the factory was already making her rounds with Yu Xinghan, suppressing all defiant employees.

…

On the factory's assembly line.

Zhang Yu's face was pale and his body was weak as he listlessly performed his work on the line.

Due to years of laboring on the assembly line, he was not only physically frail but had also developed a lung disease; every breath he took felt like a piercing pain.

Under the circulation of the Crippled Ox Body-Sacrifice Heart Art, the physical pain was slightly masked, but it was still not enough…

"Why?"

_I… why am I working here?_

_I remember now, for the wages, to earn money to treat my illness…_

After thinking of this glimmer of hope, a bit of light seemed to return to Zhang Yu's eyes, and the circulation of the Crippled Ox Body-Sacrifice Heart Art became more fervent, gradually suppressing the pain in his body.

But just at that moment, a woman's voice was heard.

"The company's performance is poor, and this is a time when everyone needs to stand with the company through its trials; starting this month, salaries will be reduced by 20%..."

Zhang Yu turned his head to look; the one speaking was none other than the aloof boss, Bai Zhenzhen.

And with the announcement of this pay cut, Zhang Yu felt the hope that had just surged in his heart gradually die out, and the pain from his suppressed injuries flared up once again.

_Think… think if there's any other way?_

_At least let me rest for a few days to recover, take a few days off…_

Just as Zhang Yu was thinking this, a worker next to him said to Bai Zhenzhen, "Boss, the New Year is almost here; I haven't been home to see my parents in several years. Could I ask for a few days off…?"

Bai Zhenzhen's face was like frost, and her eyes seemed devoid of any emotion; within her calm mind, there were only calculations of various profits, data, and revenues.

She patted the shoulder of the employee requesting leave and said, "Your parents want to see you for the New Year? No problem, just call your parents and ask them to come over; it's a perfect time for everyone to work overtime together at the factory during the holiday."

Another employee said, "Boss, a relative in my family passed away…"

Bai Zhenzhen said coolly, "Even if someone in your family has died, let the body stink for a while; arrange your work properly, then deal with your personal matters."

Zhang Yu's heart darkened, and he wondered if he could get an advance on his wages.

Another worker beside him spoke up, "Boss, our wages have been delayed for several months; can we be paid this month?"

Bai Zhenzhen smiled, but her eyes were ice-cold as she said, "The factory has indeed encountered some trouble recently; it will be a bit difficult to pay wages on time."

"However, as the boss, I also understand that it's not easy for you all to work."

"So I have specifically used your identification cards to borrow some money; wages will definitely be paid on time this month, you just need to remember to make the loan repayments on schedule."

Zhang Yu's heart sank once more; the thing in his heart called hope seemed to be continuously marching toward annihilation, causing the pain throughout his body, which had been suppressed by the heart art, to intensify more and more.

As for Bai Zhenzhen, her thoughts flowed ever more smoothly; in this state, stripped of all emotion, she calmly calculated all gains and losses, squeezing out every bit of profit she could obtain, and felt the Cold Soul Ice Heart Art circulating with increasing fluency.

(End of Chapter)

# Chapter 154: A True Crippled Ox, a True Body-Sacrifice, a True Heart Art

Outside the illusionary landscape.

Song Xu looked at this scene with great surprise, "You said Zhang Yu cultivates the Crippled Ox Body-Sacrifice Heart Art?"

Mo Tianyi also felt it was very strange and said, "That is the heart art Zhang Yu registered, and boss, look at him now, transformed into a critically ill worker, persisting on the assembly line. Isn't that precisely the effect of the Crippled Ox Body-Sacrifice Heart Art?"

Song Xu stroked his chin, puzzled, "Isn't this cultivation technique just for the lowest class of poor people to practice? It lets them work a little more, get treated a little less, and ask for a little less compensation; it's a useless cultivation technique for useless people."

"Zhang Yu wants to use this heart art to improve his Dao heart?"

"Isn't he afraid that he'll train himself to become more and more aligned with this cultivation technique, eventually turning into a good-for-nothing who only knows how to take a beating and not fight back, swallowing his anger all day long?"

"On the other hand, this Bai Zhenzhen…" Song Xu commented, "Her understanding of the Cold Soul Ice Heart Art is growing more and more profound in this scenario; she will surely shine brightly in the future examinations."

Just as Song Xu and Mo Tianyi were making their assessments, the scene in the illusionary landscape had once again changed.

…

On the assembly line.

With Bai Zhenzhen in high spirits, after a series of maneuvers, all the workers were being squeezed to their absolute limits.

And in such a situation, Zhang Yu felt the hope in his heart gradually dissipate; the pain all over his body burned him like a flame, making it no longer possible for him to concentrate on his work.

_It hurts so much…_

Zhang Yu did not want to be in pain any longer.

And he knew that for the Crippled Ox Body-Sacrifice Heart Art to continue being effective, to continue suppressing the pain in his heart, he needed to have at least a sliver of hope.

Even the small hope of getting off work early would be enough.

So he stood up, looked at Bai Zhenzhen, and said, "Boss, I would like to request a day off today."

Bai Zhenzhen's gaze swept over, and when she saw Zhang Yu's face, a ripple of emotion suddenly flashed through her.

After hearing that Zhang Yu's reason for requesting leave was due to his pain, Bai Zhenzhen nodded slightly and remarked, "You are not willing to work overtime?"

Seeing Zhang Yu nod, Bai Zhenzhen said, "It seems you truly have worked hard."

Then Bai Zhenzhen looked at everyone present and asked, "Who else, like him, is unwilling to work overtime?"

Seeing everyone look tempted but not daring to speak up, Bai Zhenzhen asked again, "Look at you all, so timid and submissive; you listen to whatever is said, you do whatever you are told to do. I am hiring people, not machines."

"If you have a request, stand up and tell me; be a little bolder."

Looking at the employees, including Zhang Yu, who stood up one by one, not wanting to work overtime, Bai Zhenzhen smiled with satisfaction, "Very good. For refusing the work arrangements of the factory, you are all fired."

Bai Zhenzhen looked at the secretary beside her and said, "It just so happens that a new batch of graduates can be hired; replace this whole lot of old and sick ones, and don't pay them a single coin in compensation…"

Under the circulation of the Cold Soul Ice Heart Art, all the workers before Bai Zhenzhen's eyes were reduced to mere bargaining chips, waiting for her maneuvering to increase profits.

With her actions, the circulation of her heart art became even smoother, and her Dao heart became even more solid, like an unbreakable rock.

On the other side, Zhang Yu, upon hearing these words, felt his heart completely turn to darkness; all hope, along with the loss of his job… was completely gone.

When all hope had been taken away by others, what should he do?

How on earth could he find hope?

How could he continue to suppress the bone-piercing pain in his body?

…

Song Xu watched this scene and lamented, "The Crippled Ox Body-Sacrifice Heart Art is still too useless; why would he choose such a cultivation technique?"

"Letting one's mind understand and conform to this cultivation technique… what use is that?"

"It's a complete hindrance."

Mo Tianyi, however, remarked thoughtfully, "But enduring all the way like this does have the effect of tempering the Dao heart, doesn't it?"

"Zhang Yu is poor and doesn't have the qualifications to get into the Ten Greats; like us… much of the time, all we can do is endure."

He spoke with a sense of shared experience, "Compared to fighting, compared to resisting… endurance is the only choice the poor can make, right?"

Song Xu looked at Zhang Yu in the illusionary landscape and murmured, "Continue to endure? But when will this endurance ever come to an end?"

"No wonder he couldn't withstand the pressure in the end and signed on under a wealthy person."

"It's a good thing you all didn't invest too much in him back then."

"This kind of person is poor to his very core; even the heart art he chose is a coward's heart art. He is not worth investing in at all."

But just then, the change in the illusionary landscape made the two of them slightly surprised again.

…

Feeling his hope completely vanish, Zhang Yu stood rooted to the spot.

Besides the sounds of the workers' laments and Bai Zhenzhen's orders, he seemed to be able to faintly hear something else.

_Is that the sound of the protesting workers outside?_

_Protesting?_

Thinking of this, Zhang Yu's eyes seemed to brighten slightly.

At the same time, the heart art that had become difficult to circulate in his mind showed signs of circulating once again.

In the visualization within Zhang Yu's mind, the crippled ox had originally been deeply mired in mud, having stopped because it could see no hope.

But at this moment, accompanying the change in Zhang Yu's thoughts, a cold glint seemed to flash from the ox's broken horn.

_The only hope left is to fight._

_When all hope is completely extinguished, when everything before me is a sheet of darkness, when pleading also yields no hope… then I can only use this pair of broken horns to fight for justice, to create a sliver of hope for myself…_

At this moment, a flash of realization suddenly crossed Zhang Yu's mind.

"The Crippled Ox Body-Sacrifice Heart Art is not a martial art for suppressing pain to go to work."

"His original intention was to care for disabled cultivators, to alleviate the suffering of disabled cultivators."

"But the deeper ideology contained in this heart art is a kind of desperate resistance in a hopeless situation; one must fight to the death! One must fight for that last sliver of hope!"

"Crippled Ox Body-Sacrifice, Crippled Ox Body-Sacrifice… this is the true essence of 'body-sacrifice,' not something like harming one's health just to work."

At this moment, the level 10 Crippled Ox Body-Sacrifice Heart Art seemed to undergo a kind of subtle change, circulating more and more ferociously within Zhang Yu's mind.

Zhang Yu felt that his understanding of the Crippled Ox Body-Sacrifice Heart Art had deepened once again.

He let out a roar and charged toward Bai Zhenzhen before him, shouting loudly, "I'll risk it all!"

Bai Zhenzhen looked at Zhang Yu's familiar face, frowned, and retreated, while Yu Xinghan and the other security guards rushed toward Zhang Yu.

Zhang Yu and Yu Xinghan, along with the other security guards, were soon locked in battle.

Although Zhang Yu's strength was not as great as the others', he was exceptionally fearless of death, repeatedly launching desperate attacks, trading his life for theirs, forcing the many security guards to retreat step by step.

After all, medical expenses could be reimbursed, but if a person died, no amount of medical expenses would be of any use.

Especially since Zhang Yu felt that the more he faced such a desperate situation, the more his power surged.

Under the circulation of the Crippled Ox Body-Sacrifice Heart Art, a part of the potential hidden deep within his body seemed to be unleashed beyond its normal limits at this moment, making him stronger as he fought.

The efficacy of the Crippled Ox Body-Sacrifice Heart Art at this moment far surpassed that of the past.

Seeing the security guards being temporarily pushed back by Zhang Yu's life-for-life approach, the remaining workers also began to stir restlessly.

Beside them, Bai Zhenzhen, watching Zhang Yu fighting with others, felt her emotions fluctuate once again, and the Cold Soul Ice Heart Art seemed to have encountered a layer of resistance.

She felt that at this moment, a trace of reluctance flashed through her heart.

At this moment, a thought emerged in her mind; she did not want to see Zhang Yu being beaten like this anymore.

And as Bai Zhenzhen became unsuited to her heart art, the deduction of the Cold Soul Ice Heart Art by the True Spiritual Root in her dantian also began to change.

…

Watching this scene, Song Xu marveled, "What's going on? Under the circulation of the Crippled Ox Body-Sacrifice Heart Art, this Zhang Yu can actually fight desperately with people."

Mo Tianyi was puzzled, "Could it be that this Crippled Ox Body-Sacrifice Heart Art has some hidden mysteries?"

But soon, something that made Mo Tianyi feel even more amazed happened.

As Zhang Yu led the workers to fight fiercely with the security guards, Bai Zhenzhen eventually stopped the struggle between the two sides, announced increased benefits for the employees, and even raised their wages.

Mo Tianyi became even more confused, "Is this something the Cold Soul Ice Heart Art can achieve?"

Song Xu said, "A change in thought naturally leads to a change in the interpretation and understanding of a heart art."

"The more profound the understanding of the heart art, the stronger its effect will be."

"But in reality, for a person's thoughts to change, for their understanding of a heart art to deepen, it often requires a great deal of time to think and to experience."

"And the existence of the Spirit Realm's illusionary landscapes is to accelerate this process through various scenarios."

"From the performance of these two, their understanding of their respective heart arts has already become more profound."

"After this trip to the illusionary landscape, the Dao hearts of these two will surely be firmer, and the effects of their heart arts will also become stronger."

As he spoke, Song Xu saw that the situation in the illusionary landscape had changed again.

…

With the increase in wages and the improvement of benefits, the entire factory began to operate once again.

Although Bai Zhenzhen still calmly presided over everything in the factory, she could feel that her calmness at this moment was different from her previous calmness.

If the previous calmness was a kind of cold calculation that abandoned sensibility...

Then Bai Zhenzhen's current calmness had integrated her own humanity, and she was no longer blindly chasing success and victory.

_This is… knowing something is impossible but doing it anyway, doing what I want to do._

For example, at this moment, she did not want to be an enemy of Zhang Yu opposite her, so even if the profits decreased, even if she faced greater risks, she would calmly accept it and continue to carry it out.

At this moment, Bai Zhenzhen suddenly had a more profound understanding of the Cold Soul Ice Heart Art.

_Suppressing emotions, making all decisions based on gains and losses, success and failure, with everything oriented towards success, is not true calmness, but only a kind of suppression of humanity._

_Only by being able to accept failure with composure, to be able to fear nothing in order to carry out the beliefs in one's heart, is the true pursuit of the Cold Soul Ice Heart Art…_

At this moment, she felt as if she were an assassin holding a small dagger; even if the probability of success was slim, a nine-in-ten chance of death, she had to calmly thrust out that one sword strike.

Feeling the Cold Soul Ice Heart Art circulating in her heart with an unprecedented effect, Bai Zhenzhen felt a sense of exhilaration in her mind, and her heart also became more and more resolute.

She could feel that as her understanding of the Cold Soul Ice Heart Art deepened, the power of this heart art became stronger.

The greater the risk she faced, the lower the probability of success, the calmer she felt, and the more active her brain, body, and mana became.

Then she, Zhang Yu, and Yu Xinghan watched as the factory, due to excessively high wages and benefits, eventually saw its costs rise and, under the pressure of other factories, completely went bankrupt…

…

Watching this scene, Mo Tianyi felt a sense of connection and murmured, "Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen, their ideas are good."

"If they hadn't been forced by Zhang Pianpian to sign, and with your guidance, boss, they might have really had a sliver of hope of getting into the Ten Greats."

Song Xu said coolly, "But just like the situation all poor people encounter, no matter how good the ideas are, without the security of wealth, everything is but a flower in the mirror or the moon in the water, and will eventually be eliminated by this world."

Mo Tianyi said, "But from this illusionary landscape, Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen's way of thinking is very close to ours."

"Perhaps if we ask them directly, they will tell us the secret to their rapid strengthening, and help us poor people carve out a new world for ourselves…"

The poor helping each other, together breaking through the snares set by the rich—this had always been the philosophy that Song Xu had taught Mo Tianyi, and it was the belief that the members of the Paupers' Alliance firmly held.

It was under this philosophy that they gave all the support they could to Song Xu, hoping that he could become the first person to break the sky, and that in the future, he could lead them to rush up to the heavens together.

Song Xu, however, shook his head upon hearing this, "An illusion is an illusion, after all."

"No matter what they think in their hearts, in reality, they have ultimately become the dogs of the rich; we cannot trust them too much."

"It's better to use my method."

"They should continue to restart the illusionary landscape to temper their Dao hearts next, right?"

"Notify me when they come out."

After waiting for more than two hours, Zhang Yu, Bai Zhenzhen, and Yu Xinghan were finally about to come out.

And in a certain basement in the real world.

Song Xu was wearing a mask and kneeling in the middle of a strange ritual.

He thought to himself, _Zhang Yu is about to exit the illusionary landscape; it's time to prepare to activate the ritual and find his evil god._

(End of Chapter)

---

# Chapter 155: Zhang Yu Activates the Ritual

Ever since becoming a disciple of an evil god, Song Xu had begun to learn a skill known as rituals.

In Song Xu's view, this thing called a ritual had many similarities to talismans.

"Talismans can be cast successfully in various locations, mobilizing the power of the Eight Ministries of Righteous Gods, which relies on Kunxu's developed infrastructure, especially the network that permeates everywhere."

"And one point of similarity between rituals and talismans is that they can also be performed through the network."

"They can even steal divine power through the network, subverting it into evil god power for use…"

And compared to the wide range of uses for talismans, although the applications of rituals were not as broad, they had their own unique advantages.

For example, they could evade the supervision and records of the righteous gods, allowing one to do things outside the rules.

Just like the Shadowcurse Ritual that Song Xu was about to activate, which used evil god power to condense a shadow gu-insect, to parasitize the opponent's shadow and continuously steal all sorts of information from them.

However, the activation of the Shadowcurse Ritual had to be done through contact in the Spirit Realm.

After all, a normal network connection could not directly link to a person's consciousness in the way the Spirit Realm could.

Just at that moment, Song Xu's mind stirred slightly, and he had already spotted Zhang Yu's presence in the Spirit Realm.

"He's here!"

…

Spirit Realm.

At the main entrance of the Dao-Querying Hall.

Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen were following Yu Xinghan, walking out together.

However, the three of them did not speak along the way, instead silently digesting their respective gains from within the illusionary landscape.

Zhang Yu recalled his experiences in the illusion, working himself to death on the assembly line, rising up in resistance out of despair…

_It feels like I have lived through another kind of life._

_No wonder they all say the Spirit Realm is the best place to temper one's Dao heart._

Zhang Yu thought with emotion, _To experience these things in reality would probably come at a huge cost, right?_

At the same time, within Zhang Yu's sea of consciousness, he was visualizing a great ox with all four limbs broken, blind and deaf, crawling forward, never stopping.

However, compared to the Crippled Ox Body-Sacrifice Heart Art he had visualized in the past, the great ox in the visualization diagram now possessed a kind of artistic intent of being fearless of death and pressing forward with indomitable will.

Clearly, as his understanding of the Crippled Ox Body-Sacrifice Heart Art deepened, the effect of Zhang Yu circulating the heart art at this moment had also greatly improved.

In particular, the greater the pressure he faced, the stronger the effect of the heart art became.

The more desperate the situation, the more he could erupt with the potential within his body.

Just like after exiting the illusionary landscape, when Zhang Yu once again thought of the unpayable loans on his shoulders, and recalled the pressure brought by the bigwigs from the Immortal Capital during the Foundation Establishment examination.

Not only did his heart not shrink back, but he instead became even more motivated.

_Although this one trip cost nearly 100,000 yuan, the effect is truly amazing._

_This has deepened my understanding of the Crippled Ox Body-Sacrifice Heart Art; even if I don't have enough money to come here in the future, the effect of me circulating the heart art in my daily life to improve my Dao heart has already been greatly enhanced._

Beside him, Bai Zhenzhen was similarly immersed in her brand-new understanding of her heart art.

_The original effects of the Cold Soul Ice Heart Art were mainly calmness and composure; the level 10 effect could allow me to temporarily suppress my emotions, become cold and ruthless, and resort to any means for success._

_But now…_

Bai Zhenzhen could feel that the Cold Soul Ice Heart Art, following her new understanding and the deductions of her True Spiritual Root, was undergoing a transformation.

_After the deductions are completely finished in two days, the new level 10 effect will no longer make me cold and ruthless, only calculating gains and losses._

_Instead, it will allow me to carry out my own ideas, to be able to persist in doing as I please, to know something is impossible but do it anyway; and even, the greater the risk, the lower the success rate, the calmer I will become, and my brain, body, and mana will also become more active…_

If the Crippled Ox Body-Sacrifice Heart Art was a technique that originally contained deep meaning, and its effects improved as Zhang Yu's understanding deepened…

Then the Cold Soul Ice Heart Art was somewhat different; it was after Bai Zhenzhen's thoughts changed and she gained a different understanding of the heart art that the True Spiritual Root performed deductions on it.

It was making this heart art more suitable for Bai Zhenzhen's ideology, to the point that the level 10 effect had begun to change.

Just at that moment, Yu Xinghan, seeing the two of them in deep thought, smiled faintly and said, "You two, it seems your gains this time have been quite good; would you like to come again tomorrow?"

Hearing Yu Xinghan's suggestion, both Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen's faces darkened, and they said, "Your price is too expensive!"

Bai Zhenzhen said, "One trip costs nearly 100,000; it's practically robbery!"

Zhang Yu thought about how his current balance was only a little over 100,000; if he were to come again, he probably wouldn't even have money for food and the examinations.

Yu Xinghan, who had collected the money, did not care at all about their complaints and said cheerfully, "Well then, you two can come again whenever you have the money."

"You can contact me anytime, and I will arrange it for you as soon as possible."

A moment later, Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen disconnected from the Spirit Realm and woke up together in the real world.

But just as Zhang Yu took off his spiritual interface mask in the apartment, he heard Fu Ji say, "Eh, someone is targeting you?"

Zhang Yu walked into the bathroom without changing his expression, closed the door, and said, "What do you mean?"

Fu Ji said, "Someone has performed a ritual on you through the Spirit Realm and planted a shadow gu-insect on you."

"Hehe, this shadow gu-insect can parasitize your shadow day and night, probing your information, and then transmit it all to the other party."

"Over a long period of time, they would probably be able to get to the bottom of all the various pieces of information about you."

Hearing this, Zhang Yu's heart jumped in alarm, "Could it be that it's already…"

Fu Ji said, "Don't worry, the shadow gu-insect usually just secretly collects information and hides its own existence; it won't take any action."

"It's only when you connect to the Spirit Realm again that the shadow gu-insect will seize the opportunity to transmit information to the other party."

Zhang Yu frowned slightly; even so, this was something he absolutely could not tolerate.

After all, he and Bai Zhenzhen had quite a few secrets, and leaking any one of them would be a disaster.

Fu Ji laughed, "Hehe, but the person who performed this ritual must have never expected that you have an evil god following you around."

"And a high-level being who once stood at the pinnacle of evil gods, ranked just below the evil god kings, who immediately discovered this little trick."

Hearing this, Zhang Yu's heart stirred, and he thought to himself, _That's right; under normal circumstances, when an evil god wants to control the believers and disciples under them, remote control is certainly the safest way._

_The other party must think that I am also in this situation of being remotely controlled, which is why they want to use me… to probe for clues about the evil god behind me._

Zhang Yu said, "A follower of an evil god who can perform rituals must be related to the evil god behind Songyang High School or White Dragon High School, right?"

Zhang Yu still remembered that Fu Ji had once said that there were evil gods behind Songyang High School and White Dragon High School, and had also advised him to go and hunt these two evil gods.

He never expected that before he had even made a move, the other party had already set their sights on him.

Zhang Yu guessed, "It seems that someone among them already suspects that there is an evil god behind me."

"It's hard to say; it's also possible that they just suspect you and want to investigate you."

"But in any case, anyone who can perform a ritual to investigate you is undoubtedly a follower of an evil god."

"Let's go, kid."

Fu Ji's tone was relaxed, "Help me make preparations immediately; let me perform a ritual, and I can instantly help you control this shadow gu-insect."

"Then we will know exactly who is targeting you."

And in Fu Ji's heart, a trace of greedy desire surged up uncontrollably, _Haha, absorbing the power in this shadow gu-insect will allow me to recover a little._

A moment later, Zhang Yu said a word to Bai Zhenzhen and left the apartment alone.

Fu Ji had originally wanted to take the opportunity to test Zhang Yu, to see if he was willing to let Bai Zhenzhen know about the matter of evil gods, but after thinking about it, she decided against it.

_This kid will definitely think that I… want to find a chance to perform a wish ritual on Bai Zhenzhen as well, to stimulate her potential._

_Although that is indeed what I am thinking._

_But with his current level of trust in me, he does not trust me to the point where I can make a wish for Bai Zhenzhen; saying it out loud will only be counterproductive._

_Forget it, the time is not yet right; we can talk about it later._

…

An hour or so later.

Zhang Yu returned to the unfinished building where he used to practice, carrying large and small bags.

He had thought it over and over, and still felt that this place was relatively quiet and undisturbed, and it would not be easily discovered by others.

Then he began to set up the ritual under the guidance of the evil god.

Fu Ji said, "The network you use in your daily lives is essentially a kind of divine power network."

"This divine power network was initially only used by the Eight Ministries of Righteous Gods to facilitate their management of Kunxu, and it was only later gradually opened up to the common people."

"This is the foundation for the casting of talismans, and it is also the foundation upon which the Eight Ministries of Righteous Gods can manage Kunxu."

"You must know, the network of the righteous gods covers the vast majority of places in Kunxu, and therefore talismans are almost omnipotent."

"But this network can also be used as a thoroughfare by us evil gods, which is why I say that we evil gods are never weaker than the righteous gods."

Zhang Yu thought to himself that this sounded much weaker than the righteous gods, completely giving off the feeling of a stowaway.

Fu Ji continued, "Our ritual this time also needs to borrow a path on the divine power network, so we will need a catalyst for divine power."

"Things like those incense sticks, paper offerings, statues, and wooden puppets used to worship the righteous gods are all considered relatively simple and cheap methods; they can be called the offerings of the ritual."

Fu Ji sighed with emotion, "But now, online god worship is becoming more and more popular, and these kinds of things are gradually becoming harder to find."

Following Fu Ji's instructions, Zhang Yu took out a candle that had been burned halfway down.

This was a god-worshipping candle that someone else had used, which Zhang Yu had bought.

Fu Ji continued, "First is the altar; this is the point of intersection with the divine network in the ritual. The conditions are crude right now, so you will just have to make do with that stool for now."

"Then, on the altar, besides the offerings, there must also be a medium for communication between man and god, a divine object for the preservation of spiritual energy, and a symbol of the evil god's incarnation."

"Sigh, but the conditions are limited now, so we can only make do."

"For the medium of communication between man and god, just use a mobile phone; at any rate, it can barely connect to the divine power network."

"For the divine object for the preservation of spiritual energy, just use those two flashlights; remember to turn the light to its maximum brightness."

"You have practiced the Great Sun Sea of Qi, so you should know that there is also spiritual energy within light. And keeping the flashlights on during the ritual can symbolize abundant spiritual energy and reduce the dissipation of divine power in the ritual; this is called 'illuminating the Heavenly Court above, and probing the depths of hell below…'"

"For the symbol of the evil god, just use this teddy bear; we can't really get a statue of an evil god, can we? The ability to use a toy as a substitute is precisely the reason why we of the evil gods are so difficult to guard against."

"Finally, you must remember to use an electric wire to form the most basic circle of the ritual, because copper is an excellent conductor of divine power; placing it in the ritual can bind the divine power…"

(End of Chapter)

# Chapter 156: Taking the First Round of the Foundation Establishment Examination

Under Fu Ji's guidance, Zhang Yu placed a half-burnt candle in the middle of a stool, with a phone behind it flanked by two switched-on flashlights. He then took an electrical wire and wrapped it in a circle around the bench.

After setting up the ritual, Zhang Yu asked with some disbelief, "Are you sure this ritual is reliable?"

Fu Ji snorted coldly. "Across the entire first layer of Kunxu, no one understands rituals better than I do. What problem could there possibly be?"

"If there is a problem, it can only be a quality issue with the ritual materials you've prepared."

"Alright, now do as I say. Activate the ritual!"

Following Fu Ji's command, Zhang Yu paced along the circle formed by the wire, listening to the mysterious incantation she recited.

The next moment, as the half-stick of incense on the altar turned to ash, an incredibly fine strand of divine power materialized above the ritual.

Fu Ji shouted in a low voice, "Insect, insect, draw forth the shadow! Divine power of heaven and earth, heed my command with utmost urgency!"

That faint strand of divine power suddenly pulsed with a sinister aura, which Fu Ji had temporarily brought under her control.

Listening to Fu Ji's voice, Zhang Yu sensed a feeling of exhaustion from her.

It was clear that this exceedingly weak evil god was in a very poor state, just as she had said, so much so that even completing this simple ritual left her trembling.

In the next instant, that thread of divine power drilled into Zhang Yu's shadow.

A roar echoed from within the shadow.

Immediately after, a small black insect struggled to crawl out.

After a long stalemate between the divine power Fu Ji controlled and the black insect, she gave a soft cry, managing to shout, "Hmph, disperse for me!"

The next moment, after another struggle, the small black insect gradually exploded.

Countless black runes burst forth from the insect's body, appearing before Zhang Yu like plumes of thick smoke.

Zhang Yu asked, "What is this?"

"This is a Shadow Gu," Fu Ji said wearily. "The so-called Shadow Gu is essentially a tool condensed from the power of an evil god."

Fu Ji took a deep breath, and the sky full of runes surged into her body, absorbed completely.

Fu Ji continued her explanation, "The person who initiated the ritual wants to gather and transmit intelligence through the Shadow Gu."

"Naturally, they would have to leave instructions inside the Shadow Gu's body."

"These instructions not only include how to gather intelligence but also, of course, how to transmit it."

"With a little careful analysis, I can find out who is investigating you."

After a good while, Fu Ji smiled faintly. "The analysis is more or less done. I already know how the other party transmits information."

"The next time you cross into the Spirit Realm, I'll be able to disguise myself as the Shadow Gu to send them some false intelligence and, while I'm at it, figure out who they are."

Another thing that pleased Fu Ji was that after absorbing the evil god's power contained within the Shadow Gu, she had finally recovered a tiny bit of her strength.

_This way, when I go with Zhang Yu to the exam next time, my own safety will be greatly enhanced,_ Fu Ji thought to herself.

Zhang Yu said, "Among you evil gods, are there any unspoken rules? For example, what do you do after discovering one another? Is it an immediate fight to the death? Or can you sit down and talk?"

"We evil gods are very reasonable. We distinguish between right and wrong."

"Usually, if we meet a weak one, we just eat them in one bite."

"If we meet a strong one, we turn and flee."

"If we meet one of equal strength, we find their address and order them some takeout as a warning."

Zhang Yu's lips twitched as he said, "How reasonable indeed."

Zhang Yu continued, "Then next time we enter the Spirit Realm, don't alert them right away. Send some false intelligence over while you figure out their strength, location, manpower..."

"Do you even need to tell me that? Once you're a bit stronger and the time is right, we'll devour this colleague of mine alive."

...

In the basement.

Song Xu slowly took off his spiritual interface mask, thinking to himself, _The Shadow Gu has been successfully planted._

_Next is to wait for Zhang Yu and the others to log into the Spirit Realm again._

_When that time comes, I'll know what secrets you're hiding._

_If I can grasp the secret you carry, capture the evil god behind you, and stimulate my potential once more..._

A hint of anticipation appeared in Song Xu's eyes. "Then my chances of getting into the Ten Greats will be over ninety percent."

...

Early August.

In the following days, Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen threw themselves back into a frenzy of cultivation, making final preparations for the first round of exams in mid-August.

On this day, the two of them went to a live broadcast studio to promote the Immortal Resonance Group's new body tempering surgery alongside Yu Xinghan as spokespeople.

With a slap, the live-streaming host had already grabbed two pieces of muscle and thrown them in front of the camera.

"Two pectoral muscles!"

Then, several more large pieces of muscle were tossed out.

"And eight abdominal muscles!"

"And then the psoas, platysma, trapezius, latissimus dorsi..."

As the muscles piled up into a small mountain, the host shouted, "For this entire set of synthetic demonic muscle modifications, how much will it cost in our studio today?"

"Take it all for just 299,000!"

"This is all the latest technology from the Immortal Resonance Group. No hospitalization needed, I repeat, no hospitalization needed."

"Just go to a clinic, have your muscles removed, and send them to us. After we cultivate them, we'll send them back to you. Once you put them back in, you'll have the potential of a competition-level athlete!"

"And we have a 'tenfold compensation for fakes' policy. We absolutely do not use any demonic beast muscle to pass off as synthetic demonic muscle."

"If even one piece of muscle is fake, we will compensate you with ten!"

On the way out of the studio, Zhang Yu asked Yu Xinghan curiously, 

"Something seems off about this synthetic demonic muscle technology today?"

"A bit different, right? Isn't that obvious? For less than 300,000, how could it be the original technology? It's a degraded version of a degraded version, meant to give people who can't afford the original a taste. It's not like everyone can use the best stuff, right?"

Zhang Yu opened his mouth, thought of the 200,000 endorsement fee that had just arrived, then thought about his status as a spokesperson, and ultimately said nothing.

...

Inside the apartment.

Zhang Yu was wiping sweat off the floor.

This was something Zhang Yu had to do after every sparring session, at Le Mulan's insistence that none of her sweat be leaked.

In front of Zhang Yu, Le Mulan said flatly, "Last month's electricity bill was 80,000."

"What on earth are you two doing in this room? Growing herbs?"

Caught off guard by the question, Zhang Yu gave a perfunctory reply, "Uh, it's just that some of the training equipment uses a lot of power."

"Don't worry, it won't cost this much for long."

Zhang Yu felt the surging mana within him. Aided by the spirit vein and alchemical enhancers, his mana growth was incredibly rapid, already pushing towards 90 units.

_It won't be long before I won't have to do that light--based breathing exercise every day,_ Zhang Yu thought.

The next moment, Zhang Yu suddenly felt a sharp pain in his chest.

Noticing Zhang Yu clutching his chest, Le Mulan frowned and said, "A side effect of the alchemical enhancers?"

"From my observation, for someone without super-metabolism like you... your dosage over the last two months has indeed been a bit excessive."

"I suggest you take a break for a while."

"Anyway... there's no need for you to push yourself to such an extreme."

What Le Mulan meant, of course, was that since Zhang Yu wouldn't be participating in competitions or trying for the Ten Greats in the future, there was no need to cultivate so intensely.

Zhang Yu nodded and said slowly, "Don't worry, I know my own body. It's not at its limit yet."

He thought to himself, _Compared to my body, it's my wallet that's reaching its limit. In a few more days... I won't be able to afford these enhancers even if I wanted to._

...

Mid-August.

The day before the first round of the Foundation Establishment examination finally arrived.

On the train heading to the Immortal Capital.

Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen were silently performing their breathing exercises, accumulating mana, stamina, and mental energy.

After this half-month sprint, Zhang Yu's strength had once again advanced by leaps and bounds. His mana had reached a level of 87.75, and his physical strength had reached grade 8.06.

His Dao heart had also finally broken through to the 6th level, reaching Level 6 (18%).

_In another half a month, it will be September, and I'll officially be a second-year high school student._

_But by then, at my current level, I should have surpassed most of the new third-year White Dragon students, right?_ Zhang Yu mused.

Although he had reached the goal he had set for himself, there wasn't much joy on Zhang Yu's face. He knew his targets were no longer the ordinary White Dragon students, but those super high school students from the Immortal Capital.

And alongside the frantic progress in his strength, Zhang Yu's wallet had seen frantic spending, with his balance dropping all the way to 50,000.

It was clear that in order to pass the upcoming first round of the Foundation Establishment examination, he hadn't given any thought to making or saving money.

After all, in his view, if he didn't first seize the time to improve his strength and strive to pass the first round, saving a little money would be meaningless.

_But regardless of whether I pass this exam or not, I have to find a way to make some more money when I get back._

As the train sped along, the aerial city of the Immortal Capital once again came into Zhang Yu's and Bai Zhenzhen's view.

Stepping off the train and looking at the dark, heavy sky above, Bai Zhenzhen said, "Yu-boy, how much money do you have left in your account?"

"50,000."
