Bai Zhenzhen nodded. "I have 40,000. Do you know what that means?"

Zhang Yu was puzzled. "What does it mean?"

Bai Zhenzhen said, "It means we're so poor we'll soon be unable to even repay next month's loan."

"Also, we've been hitting the alchemical enhancers too hard lately, and the side effects are starting to show."

"Whether it's our health or finances, the pressure and risk have reached an unprecedented level."

Zhang Yu nodded slightly. Under the intense pressure from the loans, the exam, his bank balance, and the side effects of the enhancers, he could feel his blood accelerating and his body growing more and more excited as the Crippled Ox Body-Sacrifice Heart Art circulated.

Bai Zhenzhen continued, "...But it also means our Immortal Dao potential has been thoroughly unleashed."

"We are terrifyingly strong now, a world apart from who we were two months ago."

"We will definitely pass this first round of the exam."

Under the immense risk, the Cold Soul Ice Heart Art circulated furiously in Bai Zhenzhen's mind, and she too felt her muscles, nerves, and brain become increasingly active.

With that said, the two of them entered separate stalls in the men's and women's restrooms.

As they opened the webpage and clicked the button to enter, a large hole appeared beneath each of their feet, and they vanished together.

# Chapter 157: The Mysterious Zhang Yu

When Zhang Yu came to his senses again, he found himself in an underground passageway.

_Has the teleportation completed?_

He walked forward along the passage and soon saw a figure.

Zhang Yu quickly walked over, wanting to see if it was Bai Zhenzhen who had come down with him, but he found it was a boy wearing a school uniform.

Hearing the footsteps, the boy turned his head to look at Zhang Yu.

Zhang Yu nodded at him and greeted, "Hello, are you also here for the exam?"

The boy's name was Dai Xingzhi. He didn't immediately respond to Zhang Yu's greeting but instead looked him up and down, confirming one thing.

The person before him was not a student from the Immortal Capital.

Dai Xingzhi was certain of this for two main reasons.

On one hand, he was very unfamiliar with the other's appearance, and he remembered every outstanding and wealthy high school student in the Immortal Capital very clearly; this person was definitely not among them.

The second reason was that, judging from the other's accent, speech, clothing, and so on... this was an outsider.

As an old Immortal Capital native whose ancestors had lived in the city for ten generations, in Dai Xingzhi's eyes... people from the Immortal Capital and outsiders were completely different, practically two different species.

And he, Dai Xingzhi, could basically tell the difference at a glance.

_Outsiders are just outsiders, they lack the air of us Immortal Capital people._

Realizing that the person before him was most likely an outsider, he straightened his back, almost unconsciously.

Because he, Dai Xingzhi, was a staunch supporter of Immortal Capital supremacism.

The Immortal Capital was the center of Kunxu's first layer, a concentration of the strongest, smartest, and wealthiest people on the first layer. The Upper City of the Immortal Capital could even be called Kunxu's 1.5th layer.

_Theoretically, I'm not even from Kunxu's first layer; I should be considered a person from Kunxu's 1.5th layer._

As for the other cities on the first layer? In Dai Xingzhi's heart, weren't they all just the countryside?

Looking at Zhang Yu before him, Dai Xingzhi thought to himself, _You stinking outsider, coming to the Immortal Capital to snatch our Foundation Establishment certificates?_

So after glancing at Zhang Yu a couple of times, Dai Xingzhi said nothing and turned to leave. He walked briskly forward and soon saw the back of another person.

_Ye Lingxiao..._

Dai Xingzhi had long heard of this top student who had recently become obsessed with Red Envelope Talismans, as he was from within the second ring of the Upper City.

In Dai Xingzhi's understanding, the Immortal Capital was the center of Kunxu's first layer.

The floating city above the Immortal Capital, always known as the Upper City, was the center of the center.

And this Upper City was divided into ten rings from the outside in, with the area inside the second ring being the center of the center of the center.

Ye Lingxiao, born in the second ring, came from one of the wealthiest families in the Immortal Capital.

According to Dai Xingzhi's knowledge, people from the second ring only befriended other people from the second ring, only married people from the second ring, and would only have children with people from the second ring. Some second-ringers might not even come down their entire lives.

Seeing Ye Lingxiao at this moment, Dai Xingzhi's recently straightened back immediately bent again as he said fawningly, "Lingxiao, hello."

"Do you remember me? I'm Dai Xingzhi from your school. My family lives in the north sixth ring."

Then he added, "It's inside the sixth ring, not outside."

Ye Lingxiao nodded without lifting his head, continuing to practice with his Red Envelope Talismans single-mindedly.

After the last Dao heart test, his curiosity about the Red Envelope Talismans and Favorability Talismans had deepened, and he was now ninety percent certain that a tremendous benefit was hidden within them.

Unfortunately, because the secret involved was so great, he didn't dare tell anyone and could only study it slowly on his own.

Just then, a shout came from behind. "Hey! Why are you throwing Red Envelope Talismans around again, kid?"

Zhang Yu followed, dodging the Red Envelope Talismans on the ground, and said with dissatisfaction, "If you just toss this dirty stuff around, aren't you endangering public safety?"

Ye Lingxiao glanced at Zhang Yu with some surprise, as if he hadn't expected this student from the outside to have survived the last test.

Ye Lingxiao said flatly, "If no one picks up a Red Envelope Talisman, it will disappear after a while. Besides, if you don't want the money inside, you can just return it immediately..."

As the two spoke, Zhang Yu had followed him into a large underground hall.

From a distance, he could see Examiner Deng Bingding and others standing in the center of the hall, surrounded by a dozen or so contestants who had arrived earlier.

However, at the moment, these contestants seemed to be discussing something with the examiner.

One of the students was heard saying, "Examiner, please announce the rankings from the last test."

Another student said, "That's right, what kind of test doesn't announce the rankings?"

Someone loudly supported, "If you don't have rankings, can you even call it a test? Can it be considered a proper exam?"

After listening for a few moments, Zhang Yu understood. It was a group of Immortal Capital masters demanding the release of the rankings from the previous test.

And looking at their posture and the information revealed in their words, it seemed that if a local Immortal Capital school didn't announce rankings after an exam, it would be a scandalous breach of custom, and both the teachers and the school would be reported.

_Damn it, another bunch of ranking fiends..._ Zhang Yu thought to himself that no matter where you went in Kunxu, you couldn't escape these types who loved to rank everything, showing no regard for the privacy of the examinees.

Just then, Bai Zhenzhen also walked up to Zhang Yu's side and asked curiously, "What's all the commotion up ahead?"

Zhang Yu said disdainfully, "A bunch of score-obsessed fanatics are making a scene, demanding the release of the last test's rankings."

Bai Zhenzhen recalled her own performance in the last test. "Hmm, the strongest few Immortal Capital masters took half a second to open the door, while I took just under three seconds. My rank is definitely low."

Then thinking that her Dao heart test was also likely inferior to these Immortal Capital masters, she shook her head and sighed.

"It's just a pre-exam test. These people still care too much about empty fame."

Zhang Yu agreed, "How can the true Immortal Dao be defined by temporary scores and rankings?"

Hearing this, Ye Lingxiao, as a supporter of the exam-ranking theory, felt he could no longer pretend not to have heard.

But just as he was about to speak, Dai Xingzhi beside him couldn't hold back any longer and said, "What are you two outsiders spouting nonsense about? Scores are everything! Ranking is the standard for whether a person is qualified to continue on the path of the Immortal Dao!"

"If a person only cares about scores but not rankings... then what's the difference between them and a devil incarnate?"

Although Ye Lingxiao didn't speak, his frequent nodding showed that he very much supported this view.

Dai Xingzhi looked at Zhang Yu and Bai Zhenzhen, but there was another thought he left unsaid.

_Hmph, only those who know their ranking is low would be afraid of the rankings,_ he thought to himself.

And in his mind, how could these two outsiders possibly compare to the top students of the Immortal Capital? They were bound to be low-ranked.

_I've seen plenty of outsiders like you who lack score-virtue. If you two were ranked first and second, you'd probably be dying to have the rankings announced._

At this moment, facing the demands of so many students, Deng Bingding, standing at the forefront of the examiners, said, "I understand everyone's desire to know the rankings, and there's no rule here that forbids disclosing the previous rankings."

"It's just that we felt they weren't particularly meaningful for reference, so we didn't plan on announcing them."

"Now, since everyone wants to know, I will display the rankings for you."

The previous test was divided into two stages.

The first was pushing open the metal gate, and the second was the Dao heart test.

However, for the results of the first stage, pushing open the gate, the many students present weren't particularly concerned; they just glanced at it and set it aside.

After all, the requirement for this stage was not high, purely to eliminate first-year high school students with insufficient strength, and many contestants had not used their full power.

On the contrary, the second stage, the Dao heart test, was seen by everyone as not only a display of willpower but also a reflection of a contestant's wealth, and it was what the students present cared about the most.

So everyone was more concerned with the ranking of this Dao heart test.

First Place, No. 55, Valuation Unknown

Second Place, No. 23, Valuation 5.5 Billion

Third Place, No. 11, Valuation 5 Billion

...

Looking at the rankings above, everyone immediately fell silent, quietly searching for their own numbers, clarifying their position in the current group, much like finding their seats in a movie theater.

And after confirming their own ranking and their approximate level in this exam, the next step was naturally to check others' rankings.

Usually, they would first check their friends, or perhaps the people they disliked.

And for Dai Xingzhi, the first thing he confirmed was the top three.

When in a group of people, the first thing to do was to recognize who had the highest score and the most money; this had always been his habit, and it was one of his Dai family's ancestral teachings.

At the same time, Dai Xingzhi was recalling the content of the last Dao heart test.

_This valuation, does it refer to the value of the temptation one could resist in the end?_

_Then those who can be valued higher on this list are not only resolute in their Dao heart but are also absolutely wealthy._

_Number 11 is Yun Jing, third place, with a valuation of 5 billion?_

Dai Xingzhi looked towards the boy who was surrounded by several students from Immortal Cloud High.

The most eye-catching thing about him was his pair of eyes that shone like stars; Dai Xingzhi knew that was an Arcane Frame.

_Yun Jing... called 'the strongest high school student on Kunxu's first layer' by Purple Cloud Pharmaceuticals._

Dai Xingzhi had heard that a month ago, apart from his mana, even his Dao heart and physical strength had already reached the limits of Qi Refinement.

_Sigh, one of the four Foundation Establishment certificates this time should belong to Yun Jing._

Nearby, Ye Lingxiao also glanced at Yun Jing. He still remembered that the other person could pick up his Red Envelope Talismans without any loss last time.

Dai Xingzhi thought, _Second place, number 23, is Ye Lingxiao next to me, valuation 5.5 billion. Did he hold out until the 5.5 billion offer in the illusionary landscape? Truly worthy of being a rich kid from the 2nd ring._

_His various stats probably reached the Qi Refinement limit two or three months ago, right? After all, he was evaluated by the Oasis Group as having the most perfect physique and the most perfect bloodline among contemporary high school students._

_One of the four Foundation Establishment certificates should be his as well._

But then, seeing the first-place number 55, Dai Xingzhi found that he couldn't find the person even after looking around, and he grew increasingly puzzled.

_In this Foundation Establishment exam, is there actually someone stronger and wealthier than Yun Jing and Ye Lingxiao?_

# Chapter 158: The Clown's Summons

Just then, Dai Xingzhi heard Ye Lingxiao, who was standing beside him, say, "In the last Dao heart test, your valuation was actually unknown?"

Dai Xingzhi paused for a moment, then followed the direction of his voice to see Zhang Yu standing behind him... the number on his body was indeed 55.

And hearing Ye Lingxiao's question, Zhang Yu fell silent for a moment, not knowing what to say.

Dai Xingzhi, standing to the side, spoke up, "An unknown valuation, could it be that you held on until the very end, and even broke the illusionary landscape... so they gave you an unknown valuation?"

Zhang Yu said helplessly, "Yeah... something like that."

Hearing this, Ye Lingxiao's gaze sharpened, and he looked at Zhang Yu with a newfound sense of gravity.

_This person was actually able to break the illusionary landscape?_ Ye Lingxiao thought to himself.

_How strong is his will? Just how rich is he? Could he be even richer than Yun Jing, than me?_

On the other side, Dai Xingzhi's mind was also racing. _What is his background? Is he the descendant of some company director? Or the heir of some local tycoon?_

At the same time, more and more people noticed the number 55 on Zhang Yu, realizing that this student from out of town was the first place in the last Dao heart test.

Furthermore, due to the special nature of this Dao heart test, they realized that this first-place winner must be incredibly wealthy, possessing astonishing riches.

And with wealth being the most direct manifestation of Immortal Dao potential, the immensely rich No. 55 must also be powerful, a strong contender for a Foundation Establishment certificate.

Ye Lingxiao looked at Zhang Yu and thought, _Seeing him pick up the Red Envelope Talismans and hearing what he said, I originally thought he was poor._

_I never expected him to be so well-hidden... Is it because he's rich enough that he dares to pick up random envelopes from the ground?_

_He also seemed very concerned about what would happen if a poor person picked up a Red Envelope Talisman... Is he one of those rich people who are naive about the world?_

As he pondered, Ye Lingxiao turned around, his eyes growing even more serious as he looked at Zhang Yu.

"I look forward to competing with you later."

At this moment, the mysterious and unfathomably wealthy Zhang Yu had become one of his main future rivals in Ye Lingxiao's eyes.

Dai Xingzhi and the other students nearby watched the two face off, feeling as if they were witnessing two giant beasts, each breathing out billions in wealth, crashing violently into each other.

Bai Zhenzhen witnessed this scene, and as she looked at Zhang Yu, her heart tightened with anxiety.

_Yu-boy! You're putting on such a big act now. When the official competition starts and you're exposed, you'll become the kind of clown old Zhao was talking about!_

Bai Zhenzhen was confident that she and Zhang Yu had improved a lot in the past two months, definitely reaching the level of a third-year student.

But she also knew that even with so much improvement, there was still a gap between them and the top-tier Immortal Capital masters.

Facing the first round of the exam, Bai Zhenzhen was only aiming to pass.

As for catching up to or even surpassing the top-tier Immortal Capital masters, that was a goal for the coming months, for the second and third rounds of the exam.

Zhang Yu was well aware of all this, but once his number was posted as first in the Dao heart test, he knew he couldn't explain it.

He couldn't very well say it was because of the ritual's influence that he held on until the end in the illusionary landscape.

He certainly couldn't say that he was actually a poor wretch, still trying to figure out how to pay next month's loan interest.

So, facing Ye Lingxiao's intense gaze and feeling the curious, probing, or hostile looks from everyone in the hall, Zhang Yu felt as if he were being watched by a pack of hungry tigers, but he could only brace himself and endure it.

_Damn it, wasn't I supposed to be the one who, under the contempt or even disregard of the Immortal Capital masters, would catch up to them step by step and eventually seize a Foundation Establishment certificate? Why is everyone staring at me right from the start?_

_I told you they shouldn't have done this ranking thing! Why expose the contestants' privacy like that!_

Thinking about having to compete head-on with this group next, Zhang Yu felt that the so-called clown's position Zhao Tianxing mentioned was beckoning to him.

_Is there any way for me not to be too embarrassed later?_

_Forget it, if I have to lose a bit of face, so be it. It's my own fault for not being strong enough yet._

Not far away, Yu Xinghan had just arrived and witnessed this surprising scene.

"That kid Zhang Yu..." Yu Xinghan looked at Zhang Yu, feeling both curious and astonished. _How on earth did he do it?_

To think that he, with his status as a poor person, could hold on in that illusionary landscape to achieve an unknown valuation—Yu Xinghan couldn't figure it out no matter how he thought about it.

He even felt an impulse to ask Zhang Yu, but he knew that it was a secret the other would never reveal.

A short while later, as all the contestants arrived one by one, Deng Bingding, as the head examiner, began to announce the procedures for this examination.

In short, embodying the spirit of the Foundation Establishment examination reform, this time, besides the Dao heart, the students' mana, physical fitness, and martial arts would be tested in sequence.

As for why the Dao heart wasn't being tested, it was said that after the last test, all who were unqualified had been eliminated, so there was no need for another test.

Of course, Huang Zichou, the minor god standing to the side, knew that this was a budget-saving measure from above.

After all, compared to the other three subjects, testing the Dao heart involved the Spirit Realm environment and was the most expensive and resource-intensive.

Finally, Deng Bingding said, "...This round of the exam will only retain the top twenty contestants in total score. All contestants ranked after twentieth place will be eliminated. To encourage the students, each of the top twenty contestants will be rewarded with an expert-level cultivation technique..."

Hearing this, Zhang Yu's eyes lit up slightly. _An expert-level cultivation technique for each person? That generous?_

Zhang Yu still remembered that the last time Deng Bingding had approved a bonus for him, it was an interest-free loan.

But on second thought, he mused, _The Eight Ministries of Righteous Gods are backed by the Heavenly Court and the Ten Great Sects._

_For us, an expert-level cultivation technique would cost tens of thousands or even hundreds of thousands._

_But for them, it might just be a matter of granting permission._

_After all, they just need to approve our usage rights and then send us the content of the technique..._

...

Soon, the mana examination officially began.

All the students present lined up in the hall according to their numbers.

Then, several examiners distributed a set of detection equipment and a box of spiritual roots to everyone present.

Dai Xingzhi thought to himself, _This mana exam tests control, burst, and recovery of mana._

He picked up a detector patch and thought, _You have to output as much mana into this as possible within 30 minutes._

_The faster and more mana you output within 30 minutes, the higher your score will be._

_This requires both burst power and precise control over mana, as well as the ability to perform breathing exercises to recover mana while outputting it._

Dai Xingzhi knew that this kind of long-duration mana burst capability was an Immortal Dao course that, according to the high school curriculum, should only be taught in the third year.

But since this was the high school Foundation Establishment examination, it naturally wouldn't be constrained by a mere curriculum.

Dai Xingzhi then opened the small box containing the external spiritual root.

Inside, a circular ring was continuously emitting wisps of spiritual energy, breathing as if it were a living thing.

_External spiritual root, Limitless Sea of Qi._

_A mid-tier brand of external spiritual root?_

Dai Xingzhi recalled what the examiner had just said, knowing that using a standardized spiritual root like this was one of the reforms of this Foundation Establishment examination.

Dai Xingzhi was indifferent to this; wealth was a part of one's Immortal Dao potential. It was only right for the wealthy to have more advantages, so why use a standardized spiritual root?

Just then, Deng Bingding reminded them, "Before equipping the external spiritual root, everyone remember to deactivate the spiritual root inside your own body, otherwise you will be responsible for the consequences."

Just as Dai Xingzhi was about to put on the external spiritual root, Limitless Sea of Qi, he suddenly heard a male voice.

"How do you use this external spiritual root?"

Dai Xingzhi turned his head to look and saw that the speaker was surprisingly No. 55.

_They're actually providing standardized spiritual roots?_ Zhang Yu thought. _But this external spiritual root doesn't even come with an instruction manual. How the hell am I supposed to know how to use it?_

_And if I ask like this, the group of Immortal Capital masters around will probably guess that I'm not actually that rich, right?_

_It can also be considered laying some groundwork for myself..._

On the other side, Bai Zhenzhen heard this and thought, _Well done, Yu-boy. Now that you've asked, I don't have to._

_You're also starting to build a way out for yourself, slowly revealing the fact that you're not that rich. That way, even if your results aren't as good as everyone expects, you'll lose a little less face._

When Dai Xingzhi heard these words, he thought, _He's never even used a Limitless Sea of Qi?_

Thinking of the other party's 'unknown' valuation from the first-place Dao heart test, Dai Xingzhi mused, _Is it because the Limitless Sea of Qi is too low-end for him?_

_Damn it, for me, this is already a spiritual root for normal cultivation, but this guy usually doesn't even deign to use it? What kind of spiritual roots does he normally use?_

_Damn rich people. It's a good thing we're using standardized spiritual roots for the exam this time!_

On the other side, the strongest high school student, Yun Jing, his eyes flashing, looked at Zhang Yu and thought, _This outsider... is he showing off his wealth here? To say he's never used a Limitless Sea of Qi?_

Yun Jing snorted coldly in his heart and also spoke up, "I don't usually use this kind of spiritual root much either. Examiner, could you please teach us?"

_So even rich people don't use this spiritual root much?_ Zhang Yu thought. _Tsk, this is troublesome... Why do I feel like even more eyes are on me now?_

Following the method described by the examiners, he injected mana, stretched the ring larger, and slipped it onto his hand. Zhang Yu could feel the external spiritual root pulsing with his breathing exercises, as if it had become a part of his body. The surrounding spiritual energy immediately swarmed towards him.

Next, he put on the detection equipment and gripped the detector patch tightly.

With a countdown of 3, 2, 1, all the contestants present simultaneously began to output mana into the detector patches.

Boom!

A great roar seemed to resound through the air as everyone's mana began to circulate.

At the same time, on the light screen at the front of the hall, the mana output data representing each individual lit up.

It was a row of bar graphs, with a contestant's number at the bottom of each bar and a mana value at the top.

At this moment, as everyone frantically outputted mana, every bar was continuously growing and sorting itself according to the mana output.

However, because two of the bars were growing so ferociously, they not only shot to first and second place at once but also made the other contestants' bars seem to shrink in comparison due to their exaggerated growth.

These two bars represented contestant No. 11, Yun Jing, and No. 23, Ye Lingxiao.

One could see their mana values skyrocketing, and the two bars, like two giant dragons, intertwined and chased each other back and forth in the first and second positions.

At the same time, Dai Xingzhi looked at the bar for No. 55.

"Hmm? Why is it ranked so far behind?"

# Chapter 159: The Strongest High School Student

In the examination hall, Sifang Youshen Deng Bingding was stationed in the center while other minor gods like Huang Zichou patrolled the premises, monitoring the candidates and maintaining order.

In addition to the columnar data on the light screen before them, they were also monitoring the mana detection data from each contestant.

Through detection patches placed on the contestants, they could track the flow of mana throughout the students' bodies in real time, making it easy to discern their control over it and identify any cheating.

However… while the righteous gods appeared expressionless and said not a word, a thousand thoughts raced through their minds as they continued to multitask and handle various other matters.

After all, for the Eight Ministries of Righteous Gods, multitasking, working overtime, and telecommuting were all commonplace—as natural as breathing.

And besides multitasking, socializing was also an indispensable part of a god's existence.

After all, unlike mortals who required devices like phones and the internet to communicate, their consciousnesses were perpetually linked to the network, leaving no room for excuses like being unreachable, having communication issues, or only just seeing a message.

Just as now, while they monitored the exam hall, the thoughts of the gods present were also exchanging information over the network, constantly discussing the situation.

Deng Bingding said, “…This is the first Foundation Establishment exam on Kunxu’s first layer since the reforms. Let's all do our jobs diligently and uphold our responsibilities. When the exam is over, I will personally recommend you all for commendation.”

Huang Zichou was the first to reply, “Well said, Lord Deng. With you in charge again, it sets our minds at ease.”

And while the gods on site communicated as a group, Deng Bingding also received private messages from individual minor gods.

_Sigh, more Favorability Talismans. The tiresome formalities of these righteous gods…_

However, when she saw that the amount from Huang Zichou was actually twenty thousand, Deng Bingding couldn't help but glance his way. Noticing that he was also looking at her, Deng Bingding smiled and nodded.

_Lord Deng is smiling at me?_ Huang Zichou rejoiced inwardly. _So the amount on the last Favorability Talisman was the problem?_

Huang Zichou secretly committed the amount to memory, thinking to himself, _Among gods of our station, money is what matters most._

_They say to send money before talking business. Even though I haven't decided what to ask for this time, I can still send the money in advance…_

At the same time, one of the minor gods remarked, “Yun Jing and Ye Lingxiao are truly in a league of their own.”

“Judging from the mana monitoring data, the mana in their bodies flows like a great river, surging out endlessly. Their control and explosive power are indeed the strongest here.”

Another god added, “The investments made in these two alone would be enough to support all the students in some high schools.”

“In terms of power… they can no longer be viewed as ordinary Qi Refinement cultivators. I just wonder, in this clash of titans, which of the two is truly the strongest high school student on Kunxu's first layer.”

…

On the examination grounds.

With every breath Yun Jing took, he could feel mana surging wildly through his body, continuously pouring through his arms and into the detection patch on his palm.

But looking at Ye Lingxiao, who was neck and neck with him on the light screen, Yun Jing roared in his heart, _Mana! Faster!_

Under his frantic push, mana crashed through his meridians like a flood, recklessly charging onward again and again with almost no regard for the potential damage to his body.

This was only possible because every single one of Yun Jing’s meridians had been individually extracted and assigned to dozens of university graduates to be repeatedly cultivated and refined according to three hundred different project plans, enabling them to withstand the extreme limits of mana circulation at the Qi Refinement stage for extended periods.

One could say that each of his meridians was the culmination of months of painstaking labor from a university graduate.

The total man-hours invested in his network of meridians amounted to over ten thousand workdays, equivalent to twenty or thirty years of cultivation for an ordinary person in the Qi Refinement stage.

And besides his meridians, much of Yun Jing’s cultivation had been similarly broken down into project after project, completed by outstanding university graduates under his family’s precise planning.

_The warm-up is about over._

Feeling the increasingly turbulent mana within him, Yun Jing gave a low shout in his mind, _Second dantian, open!_

In addition to his lower dantian, a sea of qi in his chest suddenly activated, instantly doubling his mana flow as it rushed out like a stampede of roaring dragons.

On the light screen, the column representing Yun Jing abruptly shot up, instantly creating a gap between him and everyone else as it locked down the number one position.

Seeing this, however, Ye Lingxiao's expression remained unchanged, without the slightest hint of panic.

He thought to himself, _What a pain. This isn't even the final round, shouldn't we be holding back some of our strength?_

Ye Lingxiao knew that, theoretically, as long as he held second place, he would pass the exam. There was no need to expend extra effort or reveal his full strength to fight for the top spot.

But…

_First place._

For Ye Lingxiao, who had either scored perfectly on exams or ranked first in everything since childhood… taking first place was like eating and drinking, it had become a habit.

To inherit the perfect bloodline of the Immortal Capital’s Ye Clan, he was not carried by a mother but was placed in an immortal-essence womb from his embryonic stage, where he underwent Immortal Dao modulation.

The first time he opened his eyes, his meridians were already twice as wide as an ordinary person's. Now, they were more than ten times the average for a high school student.

Simultaneously, the density of his nerves was over a hundred times that of a normal person, and his entire nervous system was naturally able to channel mana.

Mana techniques that other students had to train diligently to master, he learned as soon as he entered his first year of high school.

He could master any cultivation technique just by seeing it, and he spent millions each month to purchase the usage rights for them.

Cultivation in the Qi Refinement stage had never presented any difficulty for him.

Many said that he and mortals were no longer the same species, that he was the true inheritor of an Immortal Dao bloodline.

Ye Lingxiao paid it no mind.

But there was one thing he had grown accustomed to.

First place belonged to him, and always would.

Million-Credit Expert Martial Art, Thunder-Rending Astral Qi—Level 10 activate!

As a martial art with usage rights costing over a million, and reputedly close to military-grade, the Thunder-Rending Astral Qi let out a clap of thunder the moment it was activated.

At that moment, Ye Lingxiao seemed to transform into a thunder god, his entire body crackling with electricity as every wisp of mana turned into lightning.

Yet under his control, these threads of lightning mana were as obedient as his own limbs. Not only did they not damage the environment or the detection equipment, but they shot out like lightning bolts, precisely passing through his arm and palm before finally being blasted into the detection patch.

Simultaneously, on the light screen, the column representing Ye Lingxiao—which had been gradually shrinking under Yun Jing's influence—suddenly magnified again, relentlessly chasing after the first-place position.

_Hmph,_ Yun Jing snorted coldly in his heart as he watched the bar graph change. _Trying to catch up? Go ahead and try. Let's see which of us is truly the strongest high school student in Kunxu right now._

As the commotion from their intense competition grew, the students ranked behind them also began to unleash their mana with all their might, vying for the remaining spots and making the entire exam increasingly fierce.

…

Huang Zichou looked at the rankings on the light screen, observing the dozen or so contestants trailing closely behind Yun Jing and Ye Lingxiao, and analyzed, “The students behind them are all keeping pace with one another.”

Another god remarked, “They are all students from the Immortal Capital, after all, the absolute top high schoolers on Kunxu’s first layer. Even those ranked outside the top ten have mana outputs of over ninety units.”

While the minor gods were discussing, Deng Bingding turned her gaze to the scores of numbers 55, 56, and 31—Zhang Yu, Bai Zhenzhen, and Yu Xinghan from Songyang.

Ever since the last Dao heart test, Deng Bingding had been paying some attention to these three students from Songyang and had subsequently reviewed their files.

As she watched their performance, information about the three flashed through her mind.

_Number 31, Yu Xinghan, is a Golden Core disciple. Although his mana hasn't reached ninety and he can't keep up with the top dozen, his mana control isn't bad. With his current burst, he's managed to rank 17th._

At that moment, the third eye in Yu Xinghan’s mind was wide open, continuously helping him force out the mana in his body. But no matter how he circulated his technique, he found he could only maintain his position at 17th place.

_The sixteen ahead of me are also constantly accelerating. It's too difficult to catch up, and that’s just to reach 16th place…_

Thinking of the mana control he had honed under True Monarch Xinghuo's personal guidance through countless clashes of palms and fists, only to now rank 17th even at his absolute limit, Yu Xinghan couldn't help but smile bitterly.

_It seems if I want to get the Foundation Establishment certificate, I'll have to wait until next time._

Meanwhile, Deng Bingding's gaze swept over to Bai Zhenzhen.

_Number 56, Bai Zhenzhen, a genius from a poor background who soared after receiving an investment._

_And the name of that investor, from what I learned from a local minor god in Songyang… is Zhang Pianpian._

_The same investor as Zhang Yu. Could these two from poor backgrounds also be involved with the powers from above?_

Deng Bingding didn't dare to think too deeply, only telling herself to act as if she knew nothing and treat them as ordinary candidates.

Coming back to her senses and looking at the mana detection data from Bai Zhenzhen, Deng Bingding could almost see the mana within her body surging outward like wave after wave, erupting with a torrential flow within her meridians.

Expert-Level Breathing Exercise—Surging Waves Nine Revolutions, Level 10 activate!

This expert-level breathing exercise emphasized a self-sustaining cycle; after nine revolutions, the mana could draw in even more mana. It was a technique whose effect grew stronger the longer it was maintained.

And after being enhanced through Bai Zhenzhen's True Spiritual Root, the level 10 effect of this Surging Waves Nine Revolutions gained an additional layer: during the nine revolutions, the speed of the mana's circulation would increase with each turn, becoming increasingly ferocious like a raging tempest.

Relying on this Surging Waves Nine Revolutions and its enhanced effect, Bai Zhenzhen managed to hold onto 19th place.

But after nine revolutions, the circulation speed was faintly beginning to exceed the limits of her control. She felt like a small boat in a raging storm, at risk of being capsized by her rampaging mana at any moment.

Yet the more dangerous it became, the clearer her mind felt under the circulation of the Cold Soul Ice Heart Art, and the deeper her grasp of her mana circulation became.

At this moment, her mind was free of distractions. She had almost no mental energy to spare on the outside world, focusing everything on operating the Surging Waves Nine Revolutions, which was teetering on the edge of losing control.

Deng Bingding looked at the monitoring data coming from Bai Zhenzhen and commented internally, _If her mana goes berserk, she'll be severely injured the moment she loses control. Another student who likes to take risks._

She was already used to seeing this.

After all, if a student in Kunxu didn't take out loans, get injured, or fall ill… that would be truly strange.

Which of the top-ranking students hadn't reached their current position by taking one risk after another?

Finally, Deng Bingding looked at Zhang Yu.

_21st place?_ Deng Bingding thought to herself. _He didn't even make it into the top 20?_

…

Zhang Yu, who was desperately circulating his mana, was also surprised—surprised that he hadn't even broken into the top 20.

Although today's exam would eliminate contestants ranked below 20th in total score, placing outside the top 20 in the mana exam didn't necessarily mean he was out.

But it was obvious that a rank below 20 was still a very unfavorable result.

_They're really strong, the high school students from the Immortal Capital…_

Zhang Yu still remembered how powerful his mana control had become after he cultivated the Celestial Cycle Qi-Gathering Method to level 10.

And when he later cultivated the Limitless Cloud Hand to level 10 as well, he believed his mana control was already comparable to that of a third-year high school student.

But now, looking at his rank, Zhang Yu suddenly realized something.

His mastery over mana… had not progressed for a very, very long time.

_After all, I've spent most of my energy these past few months on body tempering._

_It's true, my mana control is at a third-year level._

_But a third-year level of mana control alone, without the ability for a rapid burst, isn't enough to get into the top 20 in this exam…_

Pressure and a sense of crisis washed over him. Zhang Yu felt as if a crippled ox was roaring at the heavens in his mind, radiating an endless fighting spirit.

_Heh… pressure and desperation?_

_It’s still not enough._

# Chapter 160: The Unfathomable Zhang Yu

To the astonishment of many students and the gods present, Zhang Yu abruptly stopped circulating his mana.

The students had all been going at full tilt, and with the exception of first and second place, everyone’s outputs were clustered closely together.

And so… with Zhang Yu’s pause, the bar on the graph representing him was quickly left in the dust, plummeting toward last place in the blink of an eye.

Watching his rank fall, the fighting spirit in Zhang Yu’s eyes only burned brighter. The crippled ox he visualized in his mind propped itself up on its mangled limbs and roared at the heavens, its broken horn glinting with a cold light.

_Come on. Find life in the jaws of death!_

Under the pressure Zhang Yu intentionally placed on himself, the enhancement effect of the Crippled Ox Body-Sacrifice Heart Art, which thrived on pressure and desperation, was continuously amplified.

Zhang Yu felt the mana throughout his body come alive, as if it were oil on a roaring fire, radiating an unprecedented vitality.

His mind began to race, starting to control the mana to course throughout his entire body.

_My mana control is strong, but I've always lacked training in explosive mana output._

_If I want to break through in this exam, I must fully leverage the advantage of my control._

At this thought, a flash of inspiration struck Zhang Yu, and he recalled the Dragon-Elephant Mountain-Shattering Palm, a universal martial art that had cost him 200,000.

Just like the Dragonback Mountain Toppler Hand before it, this type of purely physical martial art was called a universal martial art because it could be enhanced by any type of mana to unleash tremendous power.

_The Dragon-Elephant Mountain-Shattering Palm should be my most explosive martial art. If I were to power this technique with mana…_

With a sudden explosive bang, the mana in Zhang Yu's body slammed into the detection patch on his palm.

At the same time, he felt a stabbing pain in his meridians.

_My meridians still aren't strong enough…_

_In that case, I'll just wrap my meridians with Formless Cloud-Astral Qi and use it as a new channel…_

_And then, I'll use the Dragon-Elephant Mountain-Shattering Palm to blast all of my damn mana out!_

Strands of Formless Cloud-Astral Qi rose from Zhang Yu's dantian, instantly transforming into layers of Subcutaneous Astral Qi that enveloped his meridians, constructing a channel leading from his dantian to his palm.

The next moment, a roar erupted from within Zhang Yu's body as an explosive surge of mana blasted out through the channel in an incredibly crude manner.

The pressure of a desperate situation, the amplification from the Crippled Ox Body-Sacrifice Heart Art, the Formless Cloud-Astral Qi serving as a conduit, and the mana being unleashed via the Dragon-Elephant Mountain-Shattering Palm—each strike sent a powerful shockwave through the Formless Cloud-Astral Qi in Zhang Yu’s body.

At this moment, Zhang Yu felt as if he had become a great cannon, using the Formless Cloud-Astral Qi as the barrel, the Dragon-Elephant Mountain-Shattering Palm as the gunpowder, and his mana as the cannonball, firing shot after shot from within his own body.

Boom!

Boom!

Boom!

But through this operation, with such a crude and ferocious push of mana, his rank also began to accelerate in an instant, charging forward like a madman.

30th place!

28th place!

21st place!

In the blink of an eye, Zhang Yu had not only charged back to 21st place but was now accelerating and closing in on 20th!

At that moment, the student holding the 20th position was named Li Tongyun.

When she saw the bar representing number 55 on the light screen relentlessly catching up to her, Li Tongyun felt an immense pressure.

_Damn it… why?_

_Why am I being pushed to this point?_

Recalling her past results in the top five of her grade at Immortal Cloud High, only to have them slide continuously over the past six months to her current state…

A strong sense of unwillingness welled up in Li Tongyun's heart.

Six months ago, her father had lost a power struggle at his company and became a scapegoat, ultimately being kicked out.

With his severance pay delayed indefinitely, her family faced the pressure of various loans, bills, and cultivation expenses.

At the time, her parents' savings were only enough to cover one month's expenses.

To preserve her status among her friends, classmates, and teachers, Li Tongyun dared not reveal any of this, resorting to taking out loans to desperately maintain her wealthy persona.

As the saying goes, when your bank account is empty, your loan account is full.

As of today, Li Tongyun's bank account was at negative 1.5 million.

Even so, without the support of wealth, her cultivation failed to keep up with her classmates' constant progress, and she fell behind in an instant.

After all, on the high school path of the Immortal Dao where everyone was rapidly improving, the moment your pace slowed, you would be left far behind.

_I can't lose…_

But if it were just that, though the fall was great and she was gradually being abandoned by her original circle of friends, she could at least still get into a university and find a good job in the future.

However, Li Tongyun knew it wasn't that simple, because she couldn't afford to lose now.

Back when her family's annual income was at its peak, when her grades reached the top five at Immortal Cloud High, when she was at the height of her life, proud and certain that getting into one of the Ten Greats was a given.

She and her father had signed a performance-betting agreement with the company.

_I must obtain the Foundation Establishment qualification certificate, otherwise… I will become a company asset._

Watching number 55 draw closer and closer, Li Tongyun felt as if he were an abyss of endless despair, advancing step by step beneath her feet, intent on swallowing her whole.

_I can't lose!_

With a roar in her heart, Li Tongyun pushed out one hundred and twenty percent of her mana, blasting it forth amidst the tearing pain in her meridians.

But no matter how hard she tried, no matter how desperately she fought, even to the point of bleeding from all seven orifices, she could only watch helplessly as Zhang Yu surpassed her number, pushing her down to 21st place.

The moment he hit 20th, Zhang Yu let out a huge sigh of relief. 

“Finally made it.”

As the pressure lessened, Zhang Yu also proactively slowed his mana output.

After all, his current crude methods were not without harm to his body. While maintaining a top-20 position, he also had to ensure his own physical well-being.

But soon, Zhang Yu discovered that number 21 was still chasing him.

As they drew closer, the pressure mounted, and Zhang Yu had no choice but to increase his mana output again, putting in the effort to shake them off once more.

Even with the protection of the Formless Cloud-Astral Qi, such a crude bombardment of mana gradually began to injure his body from the shock.

_Damn it, is this person really that persistent?_

Zhang Yu rubbed his slightly aching stomach and glanced at number 21, who was still in pursuit… he made a mental note of their number: 36.

Bleeding from her orifices, her meridians feeling as if they were being torn apart, Li Tongyun was also staring intently at number 55 on the light screen.

Every time she got close, number 55 would accelerate again, leaving her far behind.

But after pulling away, he would slow down slightly, as if waiting for her to catch up again.

Li Tongyun thought resentfully, _Number 55, is that the super-rich outsider?_

_Is he deliberately toying with me? Is he doing this to mock me?_

She could almost see him watching her with a malicious smile, observing her as she struggled repeatedly, yet never managed to catch up.

Meanwhile, Dai Xingzhi had also been observing number 55's performance.

When he saw number 55 deliberately stop his mana circulation and drop all the way to last place, he was utterly perplexed.

When he saw number 55 accelerate all the way back to 20th place, he thought he was about to make a run for the top three.

But when he saw number 55 just stop at 20th place, he was once again confused.

It wasn't until he watched number 55 remain fixed at 20th place, with number 36 repeatedly catching up only to be shaken off again, that…

A flash of understanding crossed Dai Xingzhi’s eyes. _He's… just playing around, isn't he?_

Seeing the other person steadily maintain the 20th rank until the end of the round, Dai Xingzhi became even more certain of his conclusion.

_Deliberately staying in 20th place, not surpassing the person ahead, yet controlling it so that no one can surpass him._

_He's intentionally manipulating his rank in the Foundation Establishment exam?_

_That's something only someone with absolute confidence in themselves would do._

Dai Xingzhi looked in Zhang Yu's direction and thought to himself, _This guy… just how rich is he?_

And he wasn't the only one on site who thought this way.

Yun Jing, who ultimately took second place, after staring at Ye Lingxiao for a long time, turned his head to glance at Zhang Yu.

“Hmph, so he's hiding in the back playing these kinds of tricks. Is he showing off his control? Or deliberately hiding his strength?”

After taking first place, Ye Lingxiao had a helpless look on his face, thinking to himself, _To think I got a little provoked and couldn't stop myself from going for first._

_It seems I'm still a bit too impatient._

He looked toward Zhang Yu and thought, _This fellow, on the other hand, actually has the playful mentality to do something like that in the middle of the exam._

At that moment, Zhang Yu became even more unfathomable in Ye Lingxiao's eyes.

Especially since, in Ye Lingxiao’s view, Zhang Yu had definitely been holding back his strength this round.

An opponent of unknown depth made him feel an even greater threat.

_This guy might be more dangerous than Yun Jing._

With that, Ye Lingxiao called out a greeting to Zhang Yu, “Nice game.”

“Huh?” Zhang Yu heard the greeting and looked back with a perplexed expression. _What game was nice?_

_Is this kid trying to provoke me?_

_Is he laughing at me for struggling on the brink at 20th place?_

How to describe this feeling… Zhang Yu decided that when he got back, he would never again praise Zhao Tianxing's boxing during class.

_Damn, so this is how unpleasant those words sound. They're just dripping with sarcasm._

Beside him, Bai Zhenzhen offered some comfort. “Yu-boy, there are advantages to being looked down upon. It makes it all the more impressive when you surpass them later.”

“Surpassing these rich people is a privilege reserved for us poor folk! These top-tier sons of the Immortal Capital have never had an experience like that in their entire lives!”

Clearly, in Bai Zhenzhen's view, Ye Lingxiao's words and actions were also filled with provocation, mockery, disdain, and contempt.

But Zhang Yu didn't feel comforted at all by Bai Zhenzhen’s words.

_Damn it, there are still two more parts to this exam. Is that guy going to keep taking sarcastic shots at me?_

_Isn't it just because I criticized him for carelessly throwing around red envelopes? Does he really need to hold such a grudge?_

With the conclusion of the mana exam, the students then faced the physical fitness exam.

Deng Bingding announced, “A person's level of body tempering can be reflected in many ways.”

“But there is one aspect that a person cannot live without daily, nor can they fake it.”

“And that is their appetite.”

“The stronger a person is, the more they eat, and the more a person eats, the stronger they become. Appetite is one of the signs of a person’s body tempering strength, testing an individual's overall metabolism, digestion, and gastrointestinal recruitment capacity.”

“Today's second exam is the Battle of Gluttony!”
